name: 90's Music Trivia
description:
Presented in a mini collectable 1990’s style Hi-Fi, this retro quiz will take you back to the golden days of music. Includes questions from artists such as Spice Girls, Tupac Shakur, Bryan Adams, Oasis, Aerosmith, Britney Spears,Vanilla Ice, The Fugees, Will Smith and many more!

Ask the question and the player who answers correctly first gets the card as a point. There are also 3 variants on some cards.

Player with the most cards at the end is the winner.

name: Giraffalaff Limbo
description: The Giraffalaff Limbo will have your preschoolers howling with laughter as they try to limbo alongside the ticklish Giraffalaff giraffe. A quick spin of the wheel reveals which silly animal's walk you'll have to do under the limbo bar--whether it's the bird walk or the crab walk. Just make sure not to knock down Giraffalaff or he'll go into a frenzy of giggles, and you'll be out of the game! Designed for children ages three and up, this limbo set is a fun and activity-filled game that will keep your child engaged.

name: Gesellschaftsspiel Hamburg
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Hamburg each player is given five companies (each divided in 4 pieces/tiles) to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.
remarks:
game approach is identical with the 'cityprogame' family; game production was financed by advertisements of locally based companies

name: Hannah Montana Music Game
description:
Card game for diehard Hannah Montana fans because you will need to know her songs very well.

Shuffle the deck and place one card face-up next to it. This is the start of the discard pile. Shuffle the Points cards (they vary from 1 to 10 points).

The main cards have a symbol on them. That is important. The symbols are;

Music note: name the title of a Hannah Montana song which includes the word on the card.
Flower: sing 2 lines from the chorus of a Hannah Montana song, which includes the words on the card.
Butterfly: say 3 things about the character on the card.
Star: this is the secret Joker card! Draw a point card without having to carry out an assignment. All other players are required to draw an action card!

The Play. If the player has an action card, of which the colour or symbol corresponds with the top card of the discard pile, he/she can discard it.
If the symbol is identical, then he/she can execute the assignment (see above) on the card he/she is discarding. The other players will judge whether the assignment is successful. If the assignment is successful, then the player can draw 1 points card. If both the symbol and the colour are the same, then the player can draw two points cards! If the assignment was unsuccessful, then the player does not get to draw a points card.
If the symbol is different, but the colour is the same, then he/she does not get to carry out an assignment.
If the player does not have a suitable action card (other symbol and other colour), then he/she has to draw another action card.

The player who has collected the most points when the Points cards have run out is the winner, the Secret Star of the Music Game!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music

name: PocketPlay Golf
description:
Just like in real golf, in PocketPlay Golf it's about choosing the right club at the right time to get around the holes with the least number of strokes.

Each club has one or two different dices. The player chooses the club and rolls the corresponding dices. Then the player looks in the result table to know how well the stroke went. This repeats itself until the ball lands on the green and the rolls to see how many putts are needed to hit the hole.

name: Bibi Blocksberg auf dem Martinshof
description:
Bibi Blocksberg and her friends know that their favourite horse Sabrina has had a foal so they leave the village of Martinshof to see the new arrival. But Sabrina and foal are missing.

Players move by a die roll although there are lots of choices (take this path or take that path, etc.). They must collect different pieces of equipment (Sugar, Hay, Reins and Saddle) which they will need if they are to take the missing pair with them. Certain spaces require the drawing of an Event card and the instructions must be followed (sometimes it could mean that all players are affected).

The first player to get Sabrina and the Foal back to Martinshof wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Drake: The Dragon Wargame
description:
Drake: The Dragon Wargame is a fantasy miniature wargame with a twist. Beautiful dragon generals lead your army, their deadly minions and subjugated troops complementing your initial force. Everything else is called forth as you need it.

Craft the skills and abilities of your leaders with a custom card deck. Each powerful dragon has its own separate deck of spell cards, which is chosen by the player. Do you wish for raw power and destructive energy, or will you use mystical spells of protection to create a small force of indestructible veterans? Force Cards hold the inborn abilities and stats of the dragon commanders and their minions. Creation & Construction Cards allow you to “Summon” warrior beasts, flying enchanted creatures, and powerful energy nexus. Enhancement Cards give you options to “Beef Up” your troops with deadly ability bonuses. Snap Cards enable you to affect your opponent’s turn, countering their magical abilities at a price. Fast paced and involving, Drake allows for quick responsive actions, especially on your opponents turn! Dragons are powerful, mystical, and highly intelligent beings, and they deserve a world where they are the dominant force of destiny. Welcome to our world.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Sock & Toss
description:
From the website:

Sock&Toss is a great game to be played by friends and families alike.
The main aim is to outwit your opponents and to create your own bean bag (hacky sack) before everyone else.
The way you play is by flipping the correct disc at the appropriate time. Only catch is that you’re not allowed to look at disc before flipping it!

Sock&Toss is a game of chance and strategy. The discs dictate all of the aspects, from what colour sock you get to which disc you flip and who you nominate to miss a turn or swap discs with or blocking them to fill their socks. 2-6 Players, age 6+.

﻿This game is 100% New Zealand made using local suppliers.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Chapter & Verse
description:
Chapter & Verse requires players to connect hexagonal tiles they have drawn to tiles in the play area in a manner similar to Dominos. To connect tiles players must match the numbers on the edge of the tiles played with the number on the tiles it will be connecting to. Some of the tiles have olive branches on their edges instead of numbers. Olive branches must connect to other olive branches. Since there are many olive branches, they make it easier to connect tiles. There are also wild tiles that have edges that may count as any number or an olive branch. One other way tiles can be matched is if the player is able to combine the tiles to create one of the three verses on the Message Card he was given at the beginning of the game. For example, a player may have the verse Matthew 5:16 on his message card. He could connect a tile with 16 on one of its edges to a tile that has Matthew in its center and 5 on one its edges to create Matthew 5:16.
The objective of the game is for the players to create all three verses on their message cards and use the clues in those verses to guess the secret word on the other side of the card. The first player to create all three verses and guess his secret word is the winner. Even if a player can guess the secret word before they complete all three of the verses he must complete the other verses to win.

The following is from the back of the box - An archeologist, Dr. S needs your help to decipher and uncover secret words. He needs assistance sifting through ancient tiles and linking them together to gain clues to a message. Dr. S has started a Log Book detailing the links between the tiles. According to the legend, when you recreate the messages using the ancient tiles you will uncover clues to a secret word(s). Find the tiles, build the links, read the writings and claim your reward of wisdom, one word at a time.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Amg! Ice Cream!
description:
Welcome to planet Dubious, home of the Dubious Blobs!

The most sacred currency here is ice cream and it is your job to hold onto yours whilst making your opponent lose theirs in this brand new card game.

The game itself is made up of 54 cards and can be played by both small kids and big kids alike; there really is no age limit when it comes to playing and there is also no limit of players that can join in depending on how many decks you have.

The rules are simple to understand and the game is very colorful and lighthearted; the main objective of it is for the player to enjoy themselves (or become glorious overlord of all the ice creams if you so prefer.)

Players play either attacks or defense once per turn. Some attacks steal ice cream, some destroy ice cream.

Players can choose to win the game by either removing, through destruction or theft the ice cream of the opponent, or they can achieve the highest honor of collecting all twenty ice cream, for maximum bragging rights.

name: Time: A Game About People, Places & Events Since 1923
description:
From the box:
The Time Magazine Game "A Game About People, Places & Events Since 1923"

The object of the game is build the biggest and best issue of his own TIME Magazine.

Each player attempts to fill in a "Make-up Panel" with game cards that have different values. Players also answer trivial style questions to earn advertising points.
The winner at the end of the game is the player with the TIME magazine with the most points.

name: Tansania-peli
description:
Players are doing development aid by founding projects (water, hospital, farming, school) in provinces of Tanzania. Winner is the player who has founded all his projects first.

Game consists of:
1 game board,
6 pawns (jeeps),
1 dice,
72 project chips,
6 flying tickets,
40 chance cards,
15 hazard cards,
and game money (Tanzanian shillings)

name: Dokodemo Doraemon Nihon Ryokou Game
description: Players tour a map of Japan (or on the other side of the board, the world) as one of the characters from the Doraemon anime series, competing to see who can finish the course first.

name: Melodifestivalen
description:
The game is named after the Swedish version of the Eurovision song contest. The players are divided into teams. Each teams playing piece advance along a track which determines their action on a turn. The track is shaped as as a spiral with the goal at the top.

The actions about the Eurovision song contest, are provided on a DVD, and can be Guess movie clip, Guess person, Sing song, Know the song text, Know facts. In case of correct answers you advance one or two steps on the track, and the aim is to reach the top first.

During the game your team can also be prompted to take a random event card. These cards can for instance double the points received.

Content:
1 Playing board
2 Playing pieces
9 Event cards
1 DVD
1 Rule booklet
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Jeu des Échanges: France – Colonies
description:
In this 1941 game, players had to administer France's overseas colonies. They drew cards representing colonies, then had to use the appropriate tools and resources, and manage local labor forces to gain exports from the colonies. A colony would go out of play once its major exports were fully exploited.

Can be played by 2, 4, or 8 players.

name: Maria Nyckelpiga
description: Maria Nyckelpiga is a domino game for kids. Every player has a number of tiles. On the tiles is a ladybug (nyckelpiga) with two wings. On each wing is a number of dots. The aim is to place the right wing pair next to each other. The player that first places all his/her cards is the winner.

name: Quer durch 15 Länder
description:
There are 4 starting points in this game: London, Lublin, Serajewo and Tarragona. From there the players have to travel to Rome. The city cards are dealt to the players and determine, which cities the player has to visit on his way to Rome. The players get a number of game coins, which they can lose on some spaces on the game board.

The first player to reach Rome gets the first prize. The second prize gets to the player with the most game coins.

The game was most likely published in the 1950s.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: Wow Brisbane Broncos Charity Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Brisbane Broncos, an Australian Footballcub; limited edition to raise money for McGuinness McDermott Foundation (now Little Heroes Foundation).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Gold Coast Australia
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Gold Coast, a city in Queensland, Australia.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Tavaratalopeli
description: This is old and pretty simple roll and move boardgame, where you are a customer in a department store. In Finnish Tavaratalo means department store. There is three departments in the store, Paper department, food department and household department. Players start from the lobby and throw the die to decide in which department they are going. After that you just roll and move throught chosen department. All the spaces in the departments sell one special thing and you just buy it. If you roll five or six, you take a random card and you either get money, or things or loose money. When you come back to Lobby you sell all the things you bought with random prize (from zero to two and half times the buying prize) decided by the dice. Game ends after certain amount of rounds and the player with most money wins.

name: Monopoly: Lëtzebuerg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Lëtzebuerg, a Luxembourgian language adaption of Luxembourg.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Marco's Polos
description: It's a race to pack all of Marco's Polos! Place the three trunk cards in the center of the playing area and divide the deck of polo shirts evenly. Someone yells "go!" and the race begins. To place a card in one of the trunks, the polo must have a similar color stripe to the one currently on the top of the trunk. If a blue and white polo is on the top, any polo with a blue or white stripe can be placed on that stack. The deck contains cards to lock trunks and unlock trunks, keeping players on their toes. First player to get rid of all of their polos wins!

name: Shut the F*** Up!
description:
Shut the F*** Up! is a simultaneously turned, fast paced matching game about yelling insults. The deck contains 50 cards each with 6 insults and one compliment on them. There are 30 different insults spread among the cards featuring some very strong language.

The rules contain several variants but the main mechanic of each is to find matching words between cards, shout it out and discard or add the cards to another pile faster than the other players. Variant rules include relay races, shouting out only the compliments, penalties for making mistakes and drinking games.

Other decks in the series, available separately, share the same rules but have insults with different themes such as Sci-Fi/Fantasy or Shakespearean.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Real-time

name: Strike Off!
description:
'From the game description:'

Strike off the list to pile on the points. A fun and challenging list game!
Packed with 80 entertaining Strike Off list cards, plus rules.

To play the game, you draw a card, read a question on it and the next player tries to list as many items that would answer the question as he/she can. I.e., if a card asks "There have been 6 James Bond actors - name them", the following player would earn a point for each correctly named actor, and additional STRIKE OFF bonus of one point if they name all 6. The first player to reach 15 points wins.

Alternatively, players can divide into teams or if they prefer longer or shorter game, they may agree on a different points total at the start of the game.

name: Baby Jesus: The Card Game
description:
The first to gain 42 followers is the winner! Gain Followers by sending Disciples on Mission Trips. Have a Preach-Off to take out an enemy. Defend against enemy Disciples with Agnostics. Beef up, slow down, or mess with the guys in play using Blessings, Curses, and Miracles. Baby Jesus, the scorekeeper, also has super powers.

How to Play:

All cards that you play or actions that you take happen on your own turn, in any order that you like.

Communion Wafers are the currency for this game. The number on the top left of a card is how many wafers it costs to play. On the first turn you can only spend one wafer. The second turn you have two to spend. By the time the third turn comes around… You guessed it! 3 wafers! And so on. Spend them wisely and you will dominate. As the game goes on, things get very exciting because you are able to play more powerful cards. If you lose track of how many wafers you have available: Smoke less weed or keep track with dice. Your choice but the author prefers the latter.

Each player starts with their Baby Jesus to the right of their deck, to help keep score. Slide a paper clip around Baby Jesus and when you get to 42 Followers, you become the winner, but more importantly - they become the loser. Baby Jesus' Super Powers help keep the game moving and are great for using up excess wafers. Only one Relic may be played on Baby Jesus at a time and may be used to damage an enemy once per turn. When it has been exhausted, it is sent to hell, a warm cozy place to the left of your deck.

Besides Baby Jesus and his Relics, there are two main types of cards:

1) Character cards

Characters have Attack and Defense. This is how they compete with each other. If their Defense reaches zero, they are sent straight to hell. During a Mission Trip, Followers are gained equal to the Disciple’s Attack number.

Agnostics - Defenders who keep your opponent from gathering Followers. If your enemy has an Agnostic in play, you must send it to hell before your Disciples can go on a Mission Trip or have a Preach-Off against a non-Agnostic.
Disciples - Offenders who may either be sent on a Mission Trip or have a Preach-Off once per turn. Without gaining Followers, you cannot win so it usually makes more sense to go on a Mission Trip. If you do elect to have a Preach-Off this is how it works: You choose the character you would like to Preach off against (remember, Agnostics must be targeted first). Defense points are deducted from both characters equal to the attack points of the opposing character. This happens at the same time. So, if a 1/5 (1 Attack, 5 Defense) dude attacks a 2/1 enemy, the enemy will perish and your Disciple is now a 1/3 [mark damage taken with pennies]. Moreover, it might be a smart move to sacrifice a 1/1 against an 8/1 to take him out of commision.

2) Manipulation cards

Unless otherwise stated, Blessings and Curses affect only one character. These cards may stay in play to help keep track of who they have an effect on. Whenever they become irrelevant, feel free to toss them into the fiery pit.

Blessings - Turn your dudes into badasses.
Curses - Mess with your enemies.
Miracles - Save these for when you could really use one.

Now let's begin:

The game starts with each player shuffling their own deck and drawing 4 cards. Good cards to start with cost 1 or 2 wafers; you will be able to use them sooner. If you aren't happy with your hand, you may shuffle the cards you don't like back into the deck and replace them. You may do this twice. If you still don't like your hand, too bad. You'll draw a new card every turn so don't make a big fuss about it. Now flip a coin. The winner chooses to either go first (starting with just the 4 cards they have) or draw first.

Alternative 4 player version (2-Headed-Jesus): Each team helps one Baby Jesus attract 84 followers. Each player has their own deck. Make your moves at the same time as your teammate. Help each other out. You may look at each other’s hands to help strategize.

Remember to have fun. Because if you're not having fun... What's the point?
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Der Denver-Clan
description:
The players move their pawns around the board. Movement is determined by a die. Each player controls two character cards (one male and one female) with different relation factors and special abilities. If the relation factors of the two cards complement each other, the player gets money, when he gets on a space "Beziehung". If not, he loses money.

On some spaces the players can buy or sell oil wells or draw event-cards. If a player gets on a space "Zentrum der Macht" he gets the corresponding card, which grants special advantages. The player keeps the card till he loses it or another player takes it. If a player gets on a character-space for a character he doesn't own, he has to swap the character for his own card of the same gender with the owner of that character.

The first player to own $ 3000000 wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Business Cards: The Card Game!
description:
In Business Cards, each player takes on the role of an employee of a struggling company. The branch is going to go through some significant downsizing and can only keep one employee on board. This can be accomplished through hard work, brown nosing the boss, sabotaging co-workers, or a combination of the three.

Each player starts out with three Idea cards which can be played for points or effects, and three Supplies cards which can be used to play Idea cards. The object of the game is to collect more points than your co-workers by the end of the game.

Each Idea card consists of an Employee side with an effect, a cost, and a point value; and a Boss side which contains a Boss effect. During a turn, an employee can take two actions. These actions may include playing an Idea card with Supplies card, discarding an Idea card to gain two more Supplies cards, or drawing a new Ideas card from the deck.

After each round of game play, however, the Boss decides to complicate things with an idea of his own. This is done by drawing an Idea card from the top of the deck. The Boss side action is then used as an effect for the subsequent round of game play. After the Boss action is applied to the new round, the boss moves to the right, and the player who started the last round begins the new round. The game ends when the Boss runs out of ideas (when an Idea card can no longer be drawn during the Boss's turn.)
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Gangsterville
description:
The town is full of corrupt politicians, snitches and stoolies. Something has to be done; it's time to take control of City Hall! Each player leads a crime syndicate of Capos, Muscle & Wiseguys in this fast paced game for 2-4 players. Laughter rises as bodies fall in the turf wars of Gangsterville.

Each player runs their own crime family with a set of cards. On your turn, you can recruit more gang member by drafting cards, exchange cards with other players, or start a turf war. Winning turf wars adsvances your gang towards the ultimate goal, capturing City Hall. The first player to reach city hall takes over Gangsterville and is the winner.

name: Kampen om Södertälje
description: This belongs to a series of promotional Monopoly clones featuring local businesses and trivia, published around 1988-1992. As in Monopoly you move around a board collecting "shares" and hope for others to land on your properties, although the specifics are slightly different. Obviously the trivia elements vary from game to game within the series, and there are also some small mechanical variations, e.g. in the composition of event cards and how rent is calculated.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Hopalong
description: It´s a Pachisi-Ludo variant where your pawn can land on a another piece and get a free ride if that other piece moves. If the double-stack lands on a piece or another piece moves on the the double-stack, then the lowest piece have to move back to that color's starting-space. A piece also has to move back to the starting-space if it moves along in another color's safety-line in the end of the road. The first player to get all four pawns in the center wins.

name: Box Quiz: TV
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'TV'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about TV. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: Werde der neue Zar
description:
A world map with 22 countries, each with different ressoruces.

Players strive for world domination starting with 2 small villages and 2 horses. With strategic retail one player will outperform the opponents and become the new Tsar.

AIM OF THE GAME
Players have to occupy countries with their horses, houses or castles to receive winning points. To win the game, 15 points have to be collected.

GAME PLAY:
Every player starts his journey with 2 horses and 2 huts which are placed in a certain order.

Then it is time to collect the resources of every country. From now on, every turn a player rolls 3 dice and adds up the numbers. The total determines which country receive resources. Every player who has one or more buildings in this country, receive the appropriate resource. If a player rolls a 3, 4, 16, 17, or 18 he must return half of his cards to the bank.

Using these resources, players can update their buildings and thus their influence on the different areas.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Worker Placement

name: Horrible Histories: Vile Villains
description:
A grandly gruesome card game!

Conventional playing cards but with the nasty bits left in. This pack comes with the rules to play a gruesomely ghastly game too.

Vile Villains: With an unspeakable villain on each and every card, this deck includes the rules to the perfectly loathsome game of 'Bloody Mary'.

Blood Mary is a dastardly trick-taking game for three or more players where the object is to avoid winning tricks with Hearts or the Queen of Spades in them.

Contents: 52 playing cards & rules

name: Greedy Porker
description:
Kids game in which players "feed the pig" by alternating turns in which they flip a card representing different kinds of food.
For each card flipped, the player flipping the card turns the dial a number of times according to the number on the card (the less healthy the food, the higher the number on the card).
Each turn of the dial increases the pressure on the pig's stomach (a balloon).
First player to make stomach/balloon pop looses the game.

name: Szyfr Pana Twardowskiego
description:
Szyfr Pana Twardowskiego is a simple roll and move racing game designed as promotional material by Bydgoszcz City Hall (Polish city).
Game apart from simple roll and move mechanic uses trivia card with questions related to Bydgoszcz (architecture, geography, history, etc).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Disney Die Eiskönigin Mein magisches Wettlaufspiel
description: In this race game you take control of one of the characters from Disney's Frozen and try to get to the Ice Palace first. You move by spinning a wheel and moving to the next spot of the shown colour. But if you spin a snowflake, you move to the next snowflake space, where a slide connects... Will that slide take you back where you came from or bring you you closer to the finish line?
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monster Boo
description:
Description from the publisher:

In your dreams, you are haunted by monsters. After some sleepless nights, you want to get rid of them. However, this is easier said than done. The monsters are always changing colors and shapes. Above this, when you think that you have gotten rid of them all, they suddenly reappear in numbers.

Monster Boo is a fun fast paced bluffing game, where you try to get rid of the monsters in your dreams by discarding cards from your hand. Will you be able to free your dreams first?
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Oranjepolder
description:
The gameboard shows a grid of Dutch fields. On many intersections, there are one, two or three houses. Two playing pieces and a blockade piece are randomly placed on three intersections, and a sand timer or stopwatch counts 60 seconds. In that time, players have to find a route from one playing piece to the other that goes through as many houses as possible, while making no more than four turns. They have to write down that number of houses before the time runs out.
The player with the highest number shows their path first - if successful, they get that number and everyone else gets whatever they wrote without being checked. If the highest player fails, they get two points less than the lowest player and the second highest shows their path, etc. So bluffing is encouraged, as long as you don't bid too high.
First player to reach 55 points is the winner.

name: European Diploma
description:
'Learn everything about our European family'

A trivia game about European Union. Questions are asked on four categories: Economy, Culture, Geography, and European Union.

Players are dealt control of countries such that whenever a question about that country is asked, controlling player will ask the question. Whoever answers correctly on all four categories first is the winner.

name: Mummy
description:
The intrepid explorers go in search of the mummy's treasure. The explorer who discovers the most treasures will be the winner, but watch out! The mummy's ghost is lurking and can take some of the treasure from you.

Los intrépidos exploradores van en busca del tesoro de la momia, el explorador que más tesoros consiga será el ganador, ¡pero cuidado!, el fantasma de la momia está presente y puede quitarte parte del tesoro.

name: Praying Mantis (fan expansion for Hive)
description:
The Mantis cannot ordinarily move.
piece on their last turn then the Mantis
can fly onto and remove tht piece. Both
the Mantis and the enemy piece are then
permanently removed from the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Kombat: Action Game
description:
From the back of the box:

The game will take you to a period 150 million years ago, to the time of the relentless battle among rabid predators, which defended their territory and attacked their enemies without remorse.
Become one of them for a while and conquer the other dinosaurs. The game includes a game board, 1 dice, 4 figures, 4 colored stands and an instruction book. It is intended for 2, 3 or 4 players.

Gameplay:

The player with the dinosaur on a red stand starts the game. The player roll the die and moves forward towards the middle square (crossroads) by the corresponding number of squares. The players take turns to throw the die in a clockwise direction.

When a player reaches the middle square, they must select which direction to go next. If a player's figure approaches an opponent during their move they must finish their roll by moving away from them.

A player is removed from the game if his throw ends up on any of the start squares or when their move end beyond this start square. If a figure of any of the players lands between two other figures during the game and there are no free squares, it is removed from the game.

The player whose dinosaur is the last to remain on the board wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: De Boer-de-reis
description:
A simple children's game of racing, using a spiral track with farming illustrations. The green growing spaces give you an extra roll, and the vegetable spaces give special action, both to your advantage or disadvantage. First one to reach the finish wins!

A promotional game from Supermarket Delhaize to promote healthy vegetables to kids. It comes with cute farm animal playing pawns that you can collect.

—user summary

name: Székely Gazdálkodó
description:
It is not the richest family, but you have to live something, so you want to manage it. To start your business, you have to have some animals, so you can compete with larger businesses.
The Székely Gazdálkodó tries to put you into situations that characterize the everyday life of the Székely people. Of course, there are some funny scenes that are just for fun. In Székely Gazdálkodó's board game, you can feel like a real host who is a master of your own farm and strives to get out of the ordinary people. We wish a good farming!

name: Fix och Foxi på äventyr i skogen
description: You have two playing pieces who you want to move as fast you can thru the forest. It is always the playing piece that is furthest away from goal that have to move every time. At 10 spaces it will happen special things in the forest. The player that lands on these spaces have to roll a color-dice with only red and green fields and do the outcome of the die.

name: Snövit och de sju dvärgarna
description:
The wicked queen is back! Now she has taken away Snow White and holds her captive at the castle. You and your fellow players are the seven dwarfs, and now you have to leave the mine on a dangerous trip through the woods and into the castle's dark halls to free Snow White. Whoever can find Snow White has won the game!

An easy dice game where you move and do what the place you go to shows. In the castle you go to different rooms and look for Snow White. This is done by lifting a card. The one who finds Snow White first wins.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Thomas die kleine Lokomotive und seine Freunde: Würfelpuzzle
description: This game is a combination of puzzling and rolling a dice. The player who manages to finish his puzzle at first wins.

name: Carrera de Mente: Décadas
description: An expansion with 6 new question books, organised by decades, to allow different generations to play together.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: Ediciones de Mente, Ruibal Hermanos S.A.

name: Battle Toons Trading Card Game
description:
Battle Toons Trading Card Game is a collectable card game with art inspired by the silent, golden, & renaissance age of animation! Who will be crowned the Ink King or Queen?

Players each have 30 Ink, and the player to drain the opponent's Ink first is declared the winner! Be careful however, as you yourself can be your very own downfall in this game. The Ink you try so hard to protect, is also your way to summon Toons, use CP(Cartoon Physics) cards, equip your Tune-Up cards, and use your Stratagem cards! Play recklessly and meet a quick end!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Player Elimination

name: Böbathüsa
description:
Böbathüsa is a promotional game of the EUREGIO EGRENSIS, a region spanning parts of Bohemia, Bavaria, Thuringia and Saxonia. The title is an abbreviation of the German words BÖhmen, BAyern, THÜringen and SAchsen.

The game consists of 4 Eurgiocards, plus a set of 10 cards for each region (9 numbered 1-9, 1 wild card).
Each player gets four cards, five are placed openly on the table. Each player is trying to collect four consecutive cards of the same region, ideally with high numbers. Players can mostly trade with the table, add a card from the draw pile to the table and discard one, place a hand card in front of them, or trade a hand card with a card in front of them.

The game ends when a player has four consecutive cards in front of them, places all four cards from their hand, or trades a Euregio card with the table. Players note the sum of their consecutive cards (hand cards or laid out cards). The first player to reach 100 points, wins.

—user summary

name: Treasonable Doubt
description:
In Treasonable Doubt, players take the role of factions fighting by night to gain control of the remote nation of Intrepigo.

On their turn, players send agents, each of whom have been trained to various levels, to key locations on the island. Once all agents have been dispatched, they are revealed, and the player with the highest value of agents on each location gets the first choice of the available actions at that location.

Actions include gaining and trading resources like documents, guns and luxuries, completing missions, training agents, and gaining intel in one of three research areas (Training, Combat and Politics.)

After the 6th round, the coup is won by the player who has gained the most Influence over the island - be that through missions, political influence, or completion of their secret agenda.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Secret Unit Deployment, Worker Placement

name: Toilet Trouble Flushdown
description:
Who will be the first player to get splashed with a spray of water? Toilet Trouble Flushdown game is a fast-paced kids' game in which players race to spin their rolls of toilet paper the fastest to spray their opponent. The player who didn't get sprayed with water wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Jurassic World Miniature Game: Domination Expansion
description: Adds the T-Rex & the Indominus Rex as playable dinosaurs and adds solo play.
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Phase Order

name: Woofy Whoops!
description:
Woofy Whoops! is a hybrid game. It comprises a red model of a fire hydrant, which also holds the smartphone that is used to operate the game. The hydrant is connected by a pipe to a model of a dog.

Players spin the dog then pat it a given number of times. At some point, the dog may or may not "pee" on the patting player. When it does, the phone app records the glorious moment.

The game continues until a player gets peed upon; that player loses the game.

—user summary

name: Skylanders Block'n'Blast Action Game
description: It's the Skylanders game where one player is Kaos and his Minions, trying to protect themselves. The other player uses a specially designed blaster that has different abilities based on the Skylander that's being used. When the blaster knocks down a minion the blasting player scores a point. Knock out Kaos and score 10. All players take turns playing Kaos and Skylanders and the player with the highest score wins.

name: Exit-Game Wochenkalender 2021: Der Gambler
description:
Face the 53 tricky challenges of the gambler!

- A must for all fans of escape games and challenging puzzles
- A new task is waiting for you every week
- Puzzle alone, with friends or family
Alarm in Dysturbia: The infamous extortionist Ludo "The Gambler" Mortinez has escaped from the maximum security prison and plans to make the residents his willless puppets through drugs in tap water! Your only chance is Mortinez’s mad offer: if you solve his puzzles for a year in the allotted time, he will spare Dysturbia.

Every week you get a new task from Ludo Mortinez and a time limit in which you have to solve it. Are you up to the gambler? The welfare of the whole city now depends on you ...
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: TAC-TICS: The football card game for children age 6 to 99!
description:
TAC-TICS is a quick play football card game where you are the manager of a football team and you score goals by completing your team's formation before your opponent does. With 8 different formations to choose from - take it in turns to REVEAL, SWAP and EXCHANGE your player cards on your way to experiencing the thrill of scoring a goal playing TAC-TICS. Intuitive and easy to learn TAC-TICS can be played solo, by 2 players or by more than 2 players, create your own mini league or knockout tournaments and challenge your family and friends. Play the Club, International or World Cup versions of the rules for a more complex game.

—description from the designer

name: Lachen, Lachen, Lachen
description:
Lachen, Lachen, Lachen is a party game, there are question cards and answer cards, both stacks are shuffled, the top question card is read aloud and then the top answer card is read, the fun lies in the comic of the combinations.

If the cards have the same color, they are put out of play, but if they have different colors, they are placed in a pile in front of the person who answered the question. The game continues until someone gets rid of all the cards.

—user summary

name: I Love Britain
description: Are you familiar with red telephone boxes, "Nessie" and crumpets? Go on a race around England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, visit different regions and answer questions about British culture, traditions, nature and more. Roll the die to see whether you're moving around by bicycle, by car or by plane. Correctly answer questions in each of the five different categories to win the game.

name: Puy du Fou: Le Jeu
description:
Discovering the Puy du Fou with the family is an opportunity for everyone to marvel and immerse themselves in the heart of the greatest eras in History.

The Puy du Fou is a high place where History and legend mingle which sometimes escapes the rules of time. An imbalance has been created.

To restore order, help the heroes find their equipment so they can save history!

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Avatar: The Last Airbender Uncle Iroh's Dream
description:
In Uncle Iroh's Dream, follow the wise firebender's sage advice and craft your own cartoon stories using characters, locations, events, animals and special item cards! Save your favorite written stories as mementos and use the White Lotus tile, Avatar state and Appa tokens to make your story more unique! Each game is designed for 3 to 10 players, and runs for 15 to 30 minutes.

Players take turns playing cards as story elements to Uncle Iroh's dream, all while the sand time trickles down, voting on the elements that will be included as the story moves forward.

The rules also contain variant game rules, including:
- King Bumi's "Mad Genius" Mode
- Tea From the Spirit World
- Uncle Iroh and Zuko Variant
- In My Opinion Variant
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Disney Tsum Tsum  Stacking Dice Game
description:
This is a stacking game with characters from the Disney franchise.

There are two versions of this game. The First version is aimed for kids who are 6+. Place all blue-edged cards face up. To play this version of the game the player rolls 3 dice (up to 3 times) until they get a pair and a star, or if you roll 3 stars; afterwards the player stacks the dice in the form of a triangle. The same player can then take 3 cards from the deck or another player.

The one with the most points wins!

The 8+ version is kind of similar except you use all the coloured cards.
there is also a card element

name: Not That Funny
description:
Not That Funny is a tabletop game designed to uncover the damaging truths behind everyday jokes and microaggressions directed at marginalized groups and individuals. A minimum of three players are needed to play this game.

Each player should select seven Response Cards to start, and should always have that amount before the start of each round. Each player selects one Time-Out Card at the start of the game, and keeps it handy in case the game gets a little too fiery.

The shortest person will start the game as the "selector." After each round, the person to the selector's right will take on that duty—and so on, until the game ends. The selector chooses one Situation Card from the top of the deck at the start of the round, and reads it out loud. Then, each player picks the Response Card they think fits best, and discreetly hands it over to the selector. The selector chooses "the best" Response Card, and that player is awarded one point.

If the chosen card is an NTF (Not That Funny) Response Card, another point is up for grabs. All players EXCEPT the player that laid the NTF card can attempt to explain to the selector why the phrase is harmful or problematic. The selector decides which of the explanations is the most accurate, and awards that player a bonus point. If the selector determines that none of the players were able to answer correctly, the player that laid the NTF Response Card will be awarded the extra point.

The best way to keep score is to return the winning Response Card and NTF Response Card to the player that earned the point. We suggest 10 points to win the game. However, you can choose a higher or lower point goal depending on how long you want to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Time Telling Game
description: Simple game that helps kids learn how to tell time. Players each get a clock and there are color coded cards with different difficulty levels. A time card is drawn and each player attempts to match their clock with the digital time shown on the card. Once everyone is ready the card is turned over to show how the analog clock should look. Every player that is correct gets a point. There are also rules for single players.

name: Yooka-Laylee
description:
Yooka-Laylee has been treated to its very own tabletop game courtesy of Limited Run Games' Game Decks series. Race your friends to collect 3 Pagies in this official Yooka-Laylee tabletop game!

This "chaotic" game has two to four players jumping into a new adventure with Yooka, Laylee, and a whole host of characters and collectables inspired by the video game series. It features a modular build-your-own-board system that can be different each time you play. You can even combine it with other Game Decks releases like the Mutant Mudds set.

Here's what to expect:


36 Modular Level Cards.
2 Bonus Mini Games.
Powerups & quills, quills, quills! Use quills to buy Glide, Reptile Roll and Honey Puddle powerups to give yourself an edge over your opponents.
Fun Ghost Writer Challenges. Have you got what it takes to beat their fiendish challenges and earn a bucket-load of points?
Characters you love (and hate)! You’ll find Blasto, Kartos, Trowzer and TONS more sprawled across the Game Decks board, brought to life with stunning hand-painted artwork.
Combine with other Game Decks to play with more people!


There are three options to choose from. A Standard Edition, a Special Edition and a Gold Edition. The Standard & Special Editions come with the "Standard" version of the game (orange bar across top of box), whereas the Gold Edition comes with the "Gold" version of the game (gold foil across the top of the box). The Special & Gold Editions come with additional items not included with the Standard Edition (such as a graphic novel, CD, art cards, etc.).

Race your friends to collect 3 Pagies in this official Yooka-Laylee tabletop game! Players must collect Pagie Token Cards by purchasing them with points they've earned during gameplay.

Designed for 2-4 players, the Yooka-Laylee board game uses a deck of cards to create a unique modular board. Players work alongside Yooka and Laylee to move around the board, using quills to buy Glide, Reptile Roll and Honey Puddle powerups to get an edge over their opponents. Points can also be earned by beating the challenges posed by The Ghost Writers. The board is covered in hand-painted by art that includes other characters, such as Blasto, Kartos, and Towzer.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Game Decks, Limited Run Games, Playtonic Games, You Lose I Win, LLC

name: Flushin' Frenzy Overflow
description:
In this kid's skill-and-action game, players attempt to be the last player standing by catching flying poop. Players take turns rolling the die and the flushing the toilet the number of times shown on the die. This causes the water level in the toilet to rise slowly. At some point it will "overflow", causing all the poops to go flying in the air. Players race to grab a poop. If you end up empty-handed, you're out of the game. Play continues until there is only one player left, who is declared the winner.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Real-time

name: The Legend of Zelda: Hyrule Light World Game
description:
A sugoroku game released on official Zelda merchandise. This was on the back of a pencil board and did not include any tokens, but did include a number of stickers.

It is just sugoroku and covers the first part of A Link to the Past up until the fight with Agahnim.

On your turn, you roll the dice and move your token. Occasionally, you must play rock-paper-scissors against opponents to proceed. The first to reach the end and defeat Agahnim wins.

Only the board, rules, and stickers were provided. User must provide dice and tokens.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Pop Chumps: Drag Edition 2
description:
Pop Chumps: Drag Edition 2 is a card game that allows you and your fishy friends to battle it out with some of your favourite queens from RuPaul's Drag Race.

Each Ru-Girl has been illustrated in their most iconic moments with categories such as Runway Rating and Lip-sync Level, the game puts you straight into the workroom to see if you can become America's Next Drag Superstar.

Drag Edition 2 can be played as a standalone game, or combined with Edition 1 for even more queens! Drag Edition 2 introduces Alaska, Chad Michaels, Sasha Velour, Violet Chachki, Courtney Act, Trixie Mattel, Willam, Peppermint, Jasmine Masters, Katya, Gia Gunn, Jinkx Monsoon and many more to the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Forest Run: Awesome Jungle Adventure
description:
Forest Run is an easy to learn, fun to play strategy game equally fun for kids, adults, and families. Below are the 5 quick steps to learn, master, and play this game


Shuffle the game cards thoroughly and form the draw pile. Set aside spell cards and resource tokens to be earned by the players. The youngest player goes first
On a player's turn, the player has two choices - either draw a game card from the draw pile and follow the instructions on the card or cast a spell card in possession and follow the instructions on the spell card
Spell cards are earned two ways - either by stepping on the Spell tile or buying spell cards using the resource tokens in possession at the end of the turn. Resource tokens are earned by stepping on the Resource tiles
The first player to cross the Victory tile wins
Cage , Diffuser, Serenity spells can be played out of turn when the player steps on a Monster tile, Diffuser tile, to counter a Rage spell from an Opponent respectively

name: Savonlinna
description:
"Get to know the history of Savonlinna and its environs through playing"

In this Afrikan Tähti-like Finnish game centered on the eastern Finland city of Savonlinna, players travel around the town both on land and on lake Saimaa, flipping tokens that can either help or hinder them on the way, in search of the one special Note Key token; whenever a player finds this, a race back to the town begins, and the one to get there first is the winner. Main differences to Afrikan Tähti besides the map are that some of the tokens have longer-lasting and more powerful effects, the lack of flight routes, and that there is no "Horseshoe" piece that would be required to win at the end instead of the "Star", it is a simple race.

Modern history of Savonlinna begins in 1475 when the Olavinlinna castle was built on a small island in the strategic Kyrönsalmi strait on lake Saimaa, guarding what was then the eastern border of the Swedish empire. The settlement that sprung up nearby got town rights in 1639. The Note Key is an obvious reference to what Savonlinna is internationally most famous for; the Savonlinna Opera Festival, held annually each July. The back of the rules sheet gives a short description of the major attractions and landmarks in and around the city.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Christmas Mystery
description:
Become a detective in this Christmas adventure, in which you will have to investigate the mysteries of Santa Claus’ secret Villa.

This year, things don’t seem as magical as usual, and you’ve just received a letter from Santa Claus himself asking for your help: “Bring back Christmas!”

Santa Claus’ town, Xmas Village, has lost its magic - it looks like someone has stolen it. Without the magic, the Christmas spirit will not reach millions of people throughout the world!

Search, investigate,and discover the mysteries of Santa Claus’ secret village and its surroundings in Lapland. We have generated a realistic environment with interesting elements that will immerse you in a great Christmas adventure without precedent.

name: Schetenjacht
description:
Every round, one player gets the opportunity to fart. But... they have to do it secretly, because the other players shouldn't find out it was you who farted. This is a game of paying attention to each other to figure who farted, because if you guess right, you get a point.

—user summary

Wie o wie heeft de scheet gelaten! In dit grappige spel gaat het er om wie kan raden welke speler, de vader speelfiguur in het midden op de tafel, een scheet heeft doen laten. Alle speler krijgen een scheetzak die verbonden is met de vader en houden deze onzichtbaar voor de anderen onder tafel vast. In willekeurige volgorde gaat er bij een van de spelers een rood lampje branden en deze speler drukt zonder dat de anderen het merken in zijn/haar scheetzak. Dan volgt er natuurlijk het geluid van een stevige scheet. Iedereen mag raden wie de scheet heeft gelaten. Met een beetje bluf en goed raden wordt je de winnaar van dit spel.

—description from the publisher

name: Mont-à-mots Dinos
description: Roll the die, answer questions and escape the volcano by jumping from one rock to the other. Beware dinosaurs that can make you move backwards.

name: Egg Rolling!
description:
In Egg Rolling! players race with their birds to finish first on top of the track which leads upword to the top of the slide.

During a turn a player roll a dice and as a consequence moves their bird pawn 1/2/3 spaces upwords or alternatively roll the egg from the top of the slide in hope to knock their opponents pawns. Knocked pawn starts from the bottom (beginning of the track).

The first player on top wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flying Tigers Leader
description:
In this game, you will be able to try to blunt the Japanese thrust into China and SE Asia. The campaigns will cover the fighting in Burma (particularly Rangoon), China and Indochina. There will be new pilots and targets, as well as new events and campaigns. The core game is based on the whole of the AVG with each squadron's pilots being identified by the squadron emblem.

There are also new rules governing starting skill levels and abilities of some pilots created. There are also rules for replacing the pilots or rotating the squadron out based on casualties. The event cards are based on actual events that the Tigers experienced in their short sojourn in defending SE Asia.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Monopoly Prizm: NBA Edition
description:
Collect, trade, and compete in Monopoly Prizm: NBA Edition, which allows players to compete and earn points by revealing the NBA player ratings and stats on the backs of their Panini NBA trading cards.

To start, you use the Panini cards to draft your own team of four NBA players, then instead of buying properties, you try to take control of NBA games and collect bonus points when opponents land on them. To earn points, you compare the stats on your Panini cards against others when competing in playmaker challenges and All-Star Contests. You can also use the Panini cards to trade NBA players or draft new ones. At the end of the game, whoever has the most points wins.

The game includes one 8-card Starter Pack and two 4-card Prizm Packs featuring Stephen Curry, Luka Doncic, Ja Morant, and other players. Additional cards are sold in booster packs.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hyperspace: Collectors
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The Collectors must gather copies of every different species, every ship type. They must
own them all, or as many as possible. As they improve their collection, the Collector
threat grows as well.
Their Athenaeum is not just a vessel, but a repository of valuables and wealth. It
transports relics that the Collectors hold dear, and as their collection grows, they
become more obsessed and more eager to see it progress. As a result, the larger their
museum’s assortment, the more fanatical and fixated become the Collectors about
these vessels.

name: Hyperspace: Glazaqtoq
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The Glazaqtoq start with an extra homeworld, their major advantage. Their sloth and laziness means they don’t benefit from salvaged items, but this also acts as a sort of protection, since they are less likely to be on an interesting continent. They make up for this with their huge baseline production. Their high-handed approach to secrets lets them deny rewards to other civs as they seek to maintain their ancient hegemony.

The Glazaqtoq ship was once the most powerful vessel in the universe and enforced their will on hapless minions. Now these ships are obsolescent, though still striking in appearance. The Glazaqtoq put great faith in them still.

name: Hyperspace: Mendeku
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

Deadly in battle, with an ever-growing economy, the Mendeku have the fascinating weakness that they cannot take any action they have not seen. Early in, this is a consideration even for other players. They think, “I want to attack, but if I do, the
Mendeku will, too.” Eventually the balloon goes up and the Mendeku horde is unleashed in its fury.

The super-ship Dromon is the apex of the Mendeku war machine. These vessels are partly organic, a giant Mendeku caste hatched for this purpose. The huge creatures are not complete, however, until they are attached to faster-than-light engines and an enormous railgun, firing straight down the being’s body, and aimed by unerring instinct.

name: Hyperspace: Nomia
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The disgusting Nomian pests are a difficult problem to solve. Other civs are forced willynilly to evacuate worlds when they arrive, and their ability to spread their infection even to
unit pools is aggravating and enervating. Their hand is against every man and every man’s hand against them.

Nomians, as an intelligent disease-based organism, gain effectiveness the better they understand their opponents’ defenses, biology, and technology. The Plagueship is the apogee of the Nomian infectious cycle. It carries within it acid spores, energy pods, and is equipped with blasters, plague-beams, and anti-metal virus casters. The real threat of the plagueship is that the more it battles, the more the Nomians learn about your weaknesses, and the stronger the ship gets. After a lengthy war, the plagueships become almost unstoppable in efficacy.

name: Hyperspace: Salps
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The Salps are cheap and cheerful. They spread like wildfire, and soon thrive throughout the star cluster, but their feeble ships are not difficult to destroy. Their bases and colonies are another matter.

Salps are mainly oriented towards reproduction and dispersal, so of course their superunit is not a ship, but a gigantic colony, designed to host trillions of salps. It is equipped
with machines to provide food, housing, and even funeral services. It is armed as well, for such a large concentration of the salp race needs protection from their many predators.

name: Hyperspace: Urumak
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

A species of gigantic kaiju-like monsters, only a few exist. They dominate entire parsecs of space, as well as the worlds they inhabit. Powerful in resources, they are few in numbers and obsessed with their complex reproductive cycle.

The Urumak have two different forms they can take. The most commonly-seen are the colossal planetary invaders. But they can also grow (or attach – the process is not clear to outsiders) gigantic cavorite crystals around their bodies and rise into space, orbiting worlds as defense bases and shipyards

name: Hyperspace: Valkar
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The Valkar are invaders from another dimension. Early, they are comparatively few and easy to push back. But in the later game, with techs prepared, and their defensive advantages manifest, they are a redoubtable foe.

The Valkar’s mightiest vessel, the Phantasm, perpetually fades in and out of existence. Its internal vibrations (it’s not even made of atoms) have two phases, and thus can either fuse enemy circuits, or alternatively intercept and nullify energy blasts and attacks. Thus, it has either a defensive or offensive value, and the Valkar can adjust the effects according to tactical needs

name: Hyperspace: XK-13
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The XK-13 are obsessed with war, as befits their ancestry as war machines. The more they fight, the more they benefit from fighting. They have only one real resource boost, their Heat Death tech, which is best to take opportunistically, probably 6-9 VPs into the game – don’t fall into the beginner trap of waiting till you have a lot of VPs, because you won’t need organics badly then.

The XK-1 is an earlier model of the Xk-13 war android, less sophisticated, less intelligent, but more powerful. It broadcasts a suppressive effect throughout its system
preventing other civs from building or even salvaging in the area, and in battle can convert its own ships into bolts of energy to wipe out the foe.

name: UNO Dare: Adults Only
description:
Adult fans of UNO card games will love this daring take on the classic game. It plays like regular UNO matching color and number, but if a Dare Card is played, the player must decide if they are willing to risk doing the dare versus the penalty of drawing cards. There are four levels of dares: mild, medium, spicy, and fuego! A chance roll of the die determines which dare players must perform. A card with a “reverse” icon on it forces the player who played the Dare Card to perform the dare! But the party doesn't end there, these cards are durable, waterproof plastic cards to make them completely spill-proof and comes with a handy clip to keep them together! Makes a great gift for fans and game lovers ages 18 years old and up.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Sinking City
description:
Prepare to put your thinking cap on and get tactical with this Sinking City Strategy Board Game.

It’s a beautiful day in sunny LA when suddenly reports on the TV and radio declare that a seismic event has occurred off the Californian coast. As the sea level rises, and the city begins to flood, strange creatures are seen swimming through the city’s streets. To make it out of the city, players will need to scavenge for supplies, craft items and use all their cunning to escape the rising waters and the creatures that lurk beneath the waves.

The board will flood as the game progresses and it's up to you to decide how the water spreads. Will you make alliances with other survivors or cut them off from escape? Work as a team or go it alone in this easy to master strategy game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Tile Placement

name: The Three Little Pigs Game
description:
The rules of the game are as states:
"The game may be played by three or more players. Shuffle and deal all the cards one at a time. The first player to the left of the dealer who has a card with number 1 starts by placing it on the table in front of himself. The player who has number 2, of the same suit places it in front of himself. Then the player with number 3, etc. until all twelve cards in that suit have been played. The cards are played end to end toward the market in the center of the table. The player who plays number 12 then starts a new suit with number 1 if he has it, if not the next player to his left who has number 1 starts by placing it beside the first card which he played. Then the player with number 2 of this suit plays etc., until some player gets rid of all of his cards.
The player who gets rids of his cards adds the numbers on the cards remaining in the other players hands for his score."

It's a part of the Mickey Mouse Library of Games collection. The spine shows it's volume 5 out of 6.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: F#%& Yer Sister Funny!!!
description:
From the publishers website:

It's a sister-f@#%&*n' redneck-bluffin' hootin'-hollerin' good time! Players take turns braggin' about their sisters. If you don't think someone's boast sounds convincing, you can f@#%* their sister to make sure!

Players have a hand of cards with different descriptors such as "...aint got no teeth" and "...can suck the chrome offa trailer hitch!" The starting player picks a saying and begins with "My sister...aint got no teeth." Each player in succession must repeat the previous players statements, then add one of their own: "My sister aint got no teeh and can suck the chrome offa trailer hitch." Play continues until someone calls "I'll f@#%* your sister!" at which point the last player to add to the chain must reveal cards from his hand that match each statement in the chain. Whoever wins the challenge discards a random card from their hand, and play continues. The first person to discard their hand wins!

name: Face to Face: A Cubist Strategy Game
description: Face to Face is an abstract cubist strategy game. Players place tiles representing either an eye, nose, or mouth in the right place at the right time in order to win the game. In the process the cubist inspired games pieces create a unique cubist composition.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Kakuro for Dummies
description: After SuDoKu for Dummies, now the Kakuro Game. Another game based on the popular Japanese puzzles.
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., University Games

name: Fake News / Real News: Washington Edition
description: Fake News / Real News is the fast-paced card game where players have to decide what's Fake News and what's Real News. Whether you politically lean left, lean right, or drive right down the middle, everyone can join in the fun. If you can decipher the real statements from the fake ones and determine which member of the administration said it then you will be the winner of Fake news / Real News, and have bragging rights through the next media cycle!
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Political

name: Star Wars Clone Wars: Das letzte Gefecht
description: The large, strategic board game Star Wars - Das letzte Gefecht features the ultimate last battle deciding on victory or defeat of the Jedis. Players not only need tactics, but also strong nerves. Face the ultimate final battle – save the world. In this game you have to choose the right allies in the solar system to stand the chance to win. The right combination of your ally’s strategy and your own tactics boost your chances to emerge victorious in the last battle.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Golem
description:
The ground of this game is to go through 3 rooms of your competitors, obtain 3 keys and with you piece reach the goal. The game with attendant voice effect.

Box content:
2 plugs
1 bipartite movable game board
1 voice equipment
1 dice
36 pieces
12 keys
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Circle Of Life: on the Savannah
description:
This game is about “eat or be eaten” and “live and let live”.

At the start 6 animals will be grazing on the savannah. Each player has always three cards in hand. Turn by turn players will need to add an animal from their hand to the savannah. The cards hold placement restrictions and hunting skills. The played animal will - based on its hunting skills and distance in the row -either kill animals, scare away animals or do nothing at all.

Animals killed will give you points at the end of the game as well as the animals still alive on the Savannah. Cards still in hand at the end of the game will give penalty points. The player at the end of the game (when all 62 cards have been played) with the most points wins the game.

Will you become the king of the savannah?

—description from the designer

name: MM-Jääkiekko -91 -Kisapeli
description:
Finland hosted the Ice Hockey World Championships in 1991, and this is the official promotional game of the event, licensed to use the various logos, mascot etc.

The game can be played as a 2-player game or as a tournament for 4 players; a second, identical game board is provided for this. Each team consists of 6 players (generic pawns); one pawn at a time is used to move the puck with 2d6, trying to get to one of the shooting positions in order to score - but the puck can only stay with the same pawn for one turn, after which it must be passed. Opposing pawns will naturally try to capture it on their own turn. Some points on the board will trigger an event card which can be good or bad; the designer suggests that this is an 'advanced variant' and the first few games should be played without.

The game ends when a pre-agreed number of goals have been scored; in a tournament game, the losing teams and the winning teams will meet each other, and the one to score the most goals wins.

name: "Tail": The Donkey Game
description:
Children's card game in which players take turns drawing a card, then placing as many cards from their hand as possible to form a picture of a donkey. The full picture takes 8 cards, however the tail card must be placed last.

If all the draw cards, known as the "stall," are taken, then players start passing cards one player to the left until someone completes the picture.

Packaged in a box the size of a standard deck of cards.

name: Secret Sound
description: Here’s a team game you’ll like the sound of! Pop in one of the CDs and try to guess the sound. Some are easy, like blowing a nose. Others are hard, like putting a magnet on the fridge. Luckily, your teammates can help you out. Maybe they’ll draw you a picture, or maybe they’ll act something out. But make sure you guess the sound before the timer runs out! With 750 sounds, you’ll never play the same game twice! Comes with a game board, eight CDs, eight tokens, a Track Guide booklet, an instruction die, a timer, a rules sheet and 55 Wizard cards.

name: Empatizate
description:
It all starts with EMPATHY, which is the ability to perceive, share and understand what another may feel. With Empatizate we are going to talk about bulliyng, gender equality, racism, beliefs, safety on social networks, substance abuse. We will learn to say YES, NO and I DON'T KNOW. This game allows us to anticipate and solve interpersonal conflicts and achieve a greater emotional connection with people. When you say "Empathize", it is to put yourself in the place, defending the cause, for 1 minute in both cases in a mandatory way.

The “YES”, “NO” and “DON'T KNOW” are placed in the center of the table and 5 cards are dealt to each player.

Each player reads his cards and strategically chooses one to pass to the player on his right saying "empathize". This action must be done by everyone at the same time. The youngest begins to answer and from there to the right of him one by one during 1 round. If you meet the slogan, score points, if not. The answered letters are left on one side.

The game ends when all the cards in hand are answered. Cards are scored at the top. Whoever scores the most points wins.

name: Keno
description:
Keno is a big game in most gambling houses in USA. Keno parlors have replaced Cocktail lounges in most of the resort Casinos.
Depending upon which historian you listen to Keno was either brought into this country by the Chinese in the early 1800's or it was developed from the Italian "Lotto" a descendant of the Italian National Lottery. Either way Keno became a fast and furious gambling game in the "dives" and "joints" that abounded in New Orleans around the mid 1800's. It soon made its way west to where money was to be won.
In the Classic Games' published version of Keno, each player choose from 1 to 15 numbers between 1-80. The points are awarded according to the number of hits made in a drawing of 20 numbers.

name: Project Mars: Moving Forward
description:
Project Mars—Moving Forward is the first expansion for Project Mars. It consists of 27 cards—15 are email (Events) and 12 are New Employees. A phase is added between the existing Pay Day and Place Module phases.

Also included are the Player Board Overlay cards. Place these on player boards when playing with this expansion to reflect the changes in turn phases.

The new email cards change things up by adding more player interaction and some unpredictable events, and now there's even more incentive to acquire a Test Flight card as it can protect you from Space Debris. The New Employees cards give you some powerful abilities and keep things Moving Forward.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Space Exploration

name: Spaceship Zoo
description:
The Spaceship Zoo has crashed into an asteroid and the creatures on display have broken free from their enclosures! With the only food being other creatures, it’s an alien eats alien card game... Will your creatures come out on top?

For 2-6 players, 5 and up, 15-20 minutes playtime, sure to be a fun hit with anyone's collection.

Each player starts with 7 cards and takes turns stacking creature cards from their hand on top of their opponent's cards. The creature must be hungrier than the car below it, in order to gobble them up. If no creatures are hungrier, you must pick up a new card or use special weapons or space anomalies that can turn the tide of the game!

The player who gets rid of their hand first, wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Rubicon
description:
Players roll a die to move towards Rome (26 spaces forward), when the last player crosses the river Rubicon (10 spaces from Rome) the round ends, and everybody in Rome shares the money in the pool.

Players can make deals that either forces them not to move next turn, or that forces them to move next turn. Players that have not entered a deal have to move.

Whenever a player crosses the Rubicon, they pick up a card that can; affect movement (of their own and/or of opponent pieces), end the round prematurely, negate other cards that might be played, or nullify deals.

The game does not mention if you can keep cards from round to round, and does not mention how many rounds a game lasts (or in fact how the game ends).

name: Kaiju: Giant Monster Boardgame
description:
Kaiju: the Giant Monster Boardgame is one of the games in the Empires of History, a series of Axis & Allies variant board games by Guild of Blades. It is the second game in the Alternate History game series.

In Kaiju players assume control of one of four different factions:
