Play Japan and try to defend your nation from giant Kaiju stomping through your cities, from the alien invaders trying to conquer your lands, and from the mythical Atlantean invaders.
Play the Kaiju from Monster Island and rampage through Japan's cities and battle against mechanized war machines and mecha kaiju, alien flying sourcers and other kaiju.
Play the alien invaders from Planet Z and try to conquer Japan while using your technology against the rampaging Kaiju and mysterious Atlanteans.
Play the Atlanteans from the underworld and come forth in the world to conquer Japan and battle Kaiju and aliens alike.


In Kaiju each faction must compete for dominion using cut throat diplomacy and tactics to achieve victory.

Contents:

17" x 22" 4 piece, full color, hard mounted game board
4 separate 8 1/2" x 11" hard mounted zone maps
126 large plastic playing tokens
216 small plastic playing tokens
Rule book
D10
Misc mounted chit counters
categories: Fantasy, Modern Warfare, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Lucky Race Game
description:
A horseracing themed game in which the first player to successfully avoid the obstacles and reach the finish space wins the game.

The game was published by Bennet of Birmingham, England, who registered the design in 1919. The folding gameboard was made of sheet metal. A metal container accompanying the board served both as a container for the pieces and as a dice cup. According to the Great Board Games book, it is not known whether the game was packaged in a box or a slip-case.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Invader
description: Invader is a boardgame adaptation of 'Space Invaders'.

name: Pipeline: The Game of Oily International Trade
description:
From the publisher:

Inspired by ancient stone-passing games like Mancala, Pipeline is a game of strategy and negotiation. Players choose from five evil megacorporations to rule over twenty comically named oil-bearing countries (Suxembourg, Liceland, Petropolis). All the corporations share a common oil trading route ("the pipeline") that runs through the countries, so the trick is to put as little good product into the pipeline while pulling out as much refined material as possible. Players export product, collect dividends and pillage to collect oil tokens which have negative and positive values. Once a corporation goes bankrupt, the game ends, and the player with the most valuable oil hoard wins. Optional rules adjust the length and style of the game from short and cutthroat to long and sneaky.
mechanics: Mancala, Modular Board, Set Collection, Trading

name: Fear Factor Game
description:
First saw this game at Universal Studios Florida and have now seen it showing up around the net stores.

You roll the dice to match the correct color combination on the stunt card faster than your opponent. Smash the spider (making it squeak) to win that round and move ahead! The first to make it from the Start space to the $50,000 winner space wins the game!

Cards have images taken directly from the TV show. Stunts are NOT performed, just read from cards. Game includes plastic bug shaped pieces and a black vinyl squeaking spider.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Sailor Moon: Web of the Negaverse
description:
From Box:

"Queen Beryl, and her wicked minions have banded together, casting a Negaverse power into our universe. They've managed to capture Sailor Moon. You, with the other Sailor Scouts must join together to rescue her...and save our universe."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Whipped!
description:
From the box copy:

In the game of Whipped!, you're a regular guy trying to hold onto your friends and the lady in your life. Your garage band may breakup when she throws out your guitar, or you may never hear from good old Chuck again after he sees you carrying her purse at the mall! Boost your male pride with an Iron John weekend, or flagellate yourself silly at the Relationship Counselor. Hilarious surprises and upsets abound in this light-hearted parody. If you haven't yet, it's time to get Whipped!

Game description:
Each player starts with three "friend" cards in play. The goal of the game is to be the last person with a friend in play. On a player's turn they draw their hand up to 7 cards and then play a card. Blue "Bond" cards are played on friends to "strengthen" the friendship. Pink "Whipped" cards are played to remove bond or friend cards from other players. Yellow special cards give you special actions (play all bonds in your hand, etc) and green special cards allow you to avoid or cancel a card played by another player.

name: Walt Disney'n Aku Ankka -noppapeli
description:
This game is a very simple and typical roll and move game, where players try to go from the beginning to the track which has 100 positions. In places where there's a red position instead of a yellow, players encounter different kinds of problems which may affect who's the winner.

Paletti game no. 2893
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hüttengaudi
description:
Objective: "Après-Ski" implicates party ==>
20 different party games, splitted into

Games using dice: "Herr Pes", "Mäxchen", "Schweinejagd", "Spaß im Glas", "Eisbär", "Crash Down".

Games using cards: "Mogeln", "Kartenblasen", "Kartenklopfen", "Mau Wau", "Pech gehabt", "Nummer 7", "Paare finden".

Games for groups: "Kommando Pümperle", "Rippl Dippl", "Handgemenge", "Peter und Paul".

Communication games: "Obacht"(caution ==> pantomime and describing - mini 'Activity'), "Gefragt" (questioned ==> associate words) a und "Wörter finden" (building words - 'Pass the Bomb' without bomb), equipped with 55 question cards.
If someone 'fails' during a game he/she is collecting a 'Gaudipunkt' (= penalty), which immidiately leads to prior defined consequences (addult game)

more or less all of these small games had been already published by Piatnik years/decades ago - they are muddled along
into a mini edition
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Mature / Adult, Racing, Trivia, Word Game

name: Spinner Challenge
description:
Master the spin!
Flip a card, spin the trick, win the card!

name: Avatar: The Last Airbender Oh, My Cabbages!
description:
Take Aang, Katara, Zuko and even the cabbage merchant around the world of Avatar: The Last Airbender while starting new cabbage stands, mastering the elements, looting coins from your opponents and sending security platypus bears to shut down the competition. Play as your favorite character and build your very own cabbage empire. Everyone else will be yelling, "Oh, my cabbages!"

Each round players take turns placing their merchant at different locations and performing corresponding actions: discovering locations, building cabbage stands, saving coins in the starting stand, looting other player's stands, hiring employees, hiring benders, hiring security platypus bears to attack other stands, visiting Uncle Iroh's tea shop to defend their stands, drawing messenger hawk cards, drawing defense cards, and claiming the 1st player token for next round.

Looting and attacking are resolved as they occur, and players may use benders to defend, and even counter to set up a bender duel. At the end of the round, players collect available income from their owned stands and begin the next round. In rounds 7-12, players are granted a 2nd merchant, taking turns in a "snake draft" order, and starting stand incomes increase.

At the end of the 12th round players count up their unspent coins plus hired employees (+2 coins), damage tokens (-2 coins), benders (+3 coins) and owned stands (+10 coins). The player with the most coins wins.
categories: Economic, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Income, Turn Order: Claim Action, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Rocky Horror Show
description:
Let's do the time warp again! Relive that first Rocky Horror Show moment or play this game and create that moment. Sing the song, finish the callouts, play a character. Be the first player to build Rocky in the Lab, then escape the Castle to win. It all starts with a jump to the left then a step to the right. Celebrate the 50th anniversary of the ground-breaking Rocky Horror Show with this raucous party game.

- Based on the Rocky Horror Show Play seen by 30 million people worldwide
- Build alliances, navigate the lab and escape the castle or to Transylvania as your favorite character from the show
- Celebrate 50 years of the Rocky Horror Show with this game
- Sing the songs, quote the famous one-liners and lyrics, and take part in the notorious call backs from live shows
- Will you play as Magenta and Riff Raff or Brad and Janet?

Contents: Game Board, 6 Character Pieces, 6 Character Cards, 30 Lips, 50 Rocky Horror Show Cards, 30 Lab Cards, 6 Time Warp Cards, 3 Game Cards (for Acts I, II and III), 6-piece Rocky Puzzle, Game Die, Instructions
categories: Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Acting, Alliances, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Singing, Variable Player Powers

name: Christopher Columbus
description:
A game of voyage and discovery.

The aim of the game is to travel across sea and land to reach all the destinations on your Discovery Cards. Once done, you must then be the first player back to America.

You start by picking a ship in England, then travel the great waves of the world avoiding the pitfalls before arriving in America. Players also need to watch out for the Columbus squares that could help or hinder their journey.

name: GoBots Game
description:
(From the back of the box)
Turbo, Leader-1, Cy-Kill, and Crasher travel through GoBotron space in a race to win control of the GoBotron Command Center. Using GoBot strategy, players vie for position as they flip playing pieces from robot to vehicle, in pursuit of the mobile target. The first player to travel the maze-like course and reach and control Command Center, wins the game.


GoBots game is a relatively simple spin & move game where players race around the board trying to reach the Command Center first. Players can transform their characters from robot to vehicle mode by laying them flat, which allows them to travel more quickly around the perimeter of the board using the larger spaces. Movement on the spinner ranges from 1-5, while the "6" space causes the Command Center to move instead of the player's character. This can be used to move it closer to their location and/or further from opponents.

The goal is to be the first to reach the Command Center.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: The Loving Game
description:
The game is meant for two but may be played with multiple couples in "teams". Players take turns rolling a single six-sided die and move around the rectangular board doing whatever the square that they landed on says. This is not an erotic or dirty game per say but is instead designed to promote communication by making the couple answer intimate questions about each other and themselves or promote caressing, kissing or otherwise non-sexual intimate contact.

Described as:

An exciting board game that can enhance or strengthen your present day relationship. "A romantic experience for two. Spend a night with your partner you will never forget". The LOVING GAME is a romantic board game that is ideal for two people, but would also be fun for 4 or more. It is an exciting game that is "romantic" in a unique and special way. The Loving Game can bring you closer to your partner than you've ever been before... Sit back, relax and enjoy!

name: Augen auf, Flecki!
description: This is a cooperative game for the very young who shall learn how to act in traffic. The kids roll dice and move forward. The rules have explanation as to what happens when you enter a given square on the game board. All players win when the last player crosses the finish line (which always happens, there is no losing).

name: TOTO-ravi
description:
This game has a lot in common with Totopoly but it's adapted to harness racing (popular in Finland) and is somewhat simpler. Up to six players can own a horse while an unlimited number may participate in the three types of betting; with less than six players the extra horses are auctioned off.

The game emphasizes the totalisator aspect heavily as each race is decided by a simple roll-and-move mechanic which is only affected by the red "gallop" spaces.

Finnish patent pending no. 2315
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: La boîte à énigmes mathématiques
description:
Another version of the La Scatola degli Enigmi. This time topic is math.

Players or teams compete in mathematical puzzle-solving (sometimes timed, sometimes not) in order to score points in different categories. The first team (or player) to score a point in 4 of the 6 categories wins the game.

Every turn, the current player/team draws a card and hands it to the Dealer, a non-competitive figure that reads it aloud and then manages the competition between the people trying to solve the riddle.

name: Alles lacht!
description:
A funny german Ask & Answer game for kids.

German description:
Man bildet eine gemischte Tischrunde, d.h. es sollen möglichst immer ein Mädchen und ein Junge nebeneinander sitzen.

Nun kann das Spiel, das aus Frage- und Antwortkarten besteht, beginnen. Die Kärtchen werden verdeckt, d.h. mit der Rückenseite nach oben in die Tischmitte gestreut und zwar die Frage- und Antwortkarten gesondert. Sodann zieht ein Kind eine Fragekarte und stellt an seinen linken Mitspieler die auf der Karte stehende Frage. Dieser Nachbar zieht nun eine Antwortkarte und liest die Antwort laut vor. (...)
So geht das im Kreis, bis alle Karten verlesen sind. Jede Karte wird nur einmal gelesen und dann weggelegt. Die Fragen können kreuz und weiter über den Tisch gestellt werden.
Und nun viel Spaß:
Ihr werdet viel zu lachen haben.

name: Dinosaur 1944
description:
CINCPAC has gotten reports of activity on Kyoryu Jima, so the US military has landed a reconnaissance force. But the Japanese aren’t here at all! It is something much worse ... something that threatens all humanity. Dinosaurs! Mad scientists are using Kyoryu Jima as a base for their time machine, bringing prehistoric monsters into the present day. Not content with unleashing this plague, they’ve gone even farther – they are training and enhancing the dinosaurs. It’s bad enough to fight giant reptiles – fighting drug-crazed giant reptiles is absolutely the worst.

Dinosaur: 1944 is a cooperative strategy game about army men vs. prehistoric monsters. In it, you and up to 3 other players control brave soldiers in a World War II setting, struggling to save the entire world from the threat of a Mesozoic rebirth. It is in part a battle game, as you maneuver around the map and fight the enemy. It is in part tower defense, as you place ambushes to help take out or slow down the incoming fiends. Each hero has unique strengths and weaknesses – your victory depends both in mastering your own hero and cooperating with your friends. As the game progresses, you face more numerous foes, and dinosaur bosses enter the field. Eventually, you face the final boss – defeating her wins the game. Beware: if the dinosaurs devastate your base camp, you’ll be stranded on Kyuryushima, prey to the horrors therein.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Prehistoric, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Først på månen
description:
"An exciting game about the space-race to the moon" Cover text

"A highly topical game. In the near future a lot of moon travels will begin, with new sensational discoveries." Intro rules book.

It is a simple roll and move game. The object of the game is to
be the first player to reach the moon and return back to earth.

You have to hit the correct space in order to leave earth, otherwise you have to circle the earth once more.
The same applies when you have to return to earth.
There is no options for the players involved, other than hitting the right number on your dice.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Romeo i Julia
description:
Romeo and Julia are an incredible pair. 4 villains are plotting to take over the world. Join the 2 heroes and enter the world of adventure. Take part in car chases and shootings. Browse databases. Collect and analyze clues. Use your intellect or stake your chances on luck.

Each player controls a pair of heroes. Each duet has a different villain to beat. But before the deciding encounter can take place Romeo and Julia need to find him. To do this they visit different places, looking for clues and taking part in breathtaking events. The first player to find the villain's hiding place and beat him wins the game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Kamelipeli
description:
Kamelipeli (The Camel Game) is an abstract tile placement game for the whole family published by the UNICEF association of Finland (maybe in the eighties or early nineties?). The rules recommend an even number of players.

The game includes a fairly large thin cardboard showing a two-colour drawing of the African continent filled with squares (135 of them). Some of the squares have names of African countries in them but this has no effect on gameplay. Similarly highlighted are some areas of severe drought (namely the Sahel area).

The game is played with event cards and two types of small squares of thin cardboard. One set of tiles is blue on the other side (water) and green of the other (vegetation). The second set is brown on the other side (drought) and on the reverse there can be one of three different pictures of a camel (or a note: pick up an event card).

Gameplay consists of placing a brown tile on the map, checking the size of the camel on the other side and either leaving it there, swapping it for a blue tile, flipping a blue tile green or picking up an event card and following its instructions.

An example of an event card: "Measles is a very serious disease among African children. You are vaccinating children against it. You may remove one brown tile from the board."

The goal of the game is to build a continuous green line of tiles across Africa. All players build this line together, but the winner is the one who places the last green tile to connect two opposing coasts. A slightly longer game has the players trying to fill at least half of the map with green tiles (the winner again placing the last one).

name: Unlikely Heroes: Vikings
description:
Unlikely Heroes: Vikings is a puzzling narrative adventure game in which the unlikely heroes must venture into the dreaded lands of pillaging and plunder with three unique quests to ensure your legacy: The Ruins, The Mead, and The Living Dead.

Unlikely heroes must explore the map, encounter challenges, and ultimately save the day. Start the game by flipping the first map tile and exploring each corner of the map. As more and more tiles are uncovered, your team will encounter puzzles, enemies, treasures, tools, weapons, and allies. Decipher the narrative and explore the map accordingly for victory.

Box contents
50+ page Adventure book
200+ Gamecards
20 x Acrylic cubes
4 x Meeples
Rulebook

name: Doctor Who: Race to the TARDIS
description:
Players take control of one of 6 recent incarnations of the Doctor, moving around the time vortex, in an attempt to collect the 3 missing TARDIS components. Along the way players will encounter some of the Doctors' companions and some well known enemies.

— user description

name: ReBoot Mainframe Game
description:
A simple game based on a popular 1990s kids' cartoon series called ReBoot, which had very high-quality computer graphics and characters themed on computer jargon. Players are either sprites or viruses trying to protect or infect the CPU where they all live. The board is a circle of paths. Players roll and move, collecting 6 chips to win their goal, with Quantum shakes as hit points, magnets, Vid-windows, modems, and so on. The graphic design is strong, the rules written in a very modern style, following the computing theme very heavily for a kids' game, down to having a whole flow-chart on the back page! The board in the English-only version is thin cardboard which fan-folds into a wedge. (The English/French version uses a more traditional gameboard, and has a longer box to accommodate it.)

There is a production error in the tokens in the English-only version; you'll need to add markings to some of the tokens if 5 or 6 people are playing. (The English/French version only supports up to 4 players, but the English-only version was intended to support up to 6.)
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
publishers: Canada Games Company Lmt., Crown Games

name: Derby
description: Card game about soccer. Players build a team and then the match starts. The name of the players on the cards are "ripped" from true existing players by altering one or more letters in the name...

name: The Johnny Bravo Catch Him If You Can Game
description:
Tagline: The game where you try to catch Johnny in action!

In this game based off the cartoon "Johnny Bravo", each player is dealt a hand of four cards (one each of Action, Friend, Location, and Quote). Players then race to deduce which cards other players hold. This is done by visiting the special cartoon squares that force an opponent to reveal a card to you, or by drawing Johnny Cards that are played immediately. These cards have a variety of effects, including directing another player to reveal a card to you (or vice-versa). Most of these cards also have an action that must be performed, such as "Show off one of your karate moves" or "Run around the board".

The first player to deduce someone else's hand and move to the appropriate T.V. set square on the board wins the game.

The game includes the board, 16 hint cards (four each of Action, Friend, Location, and Quote), 20 Johnny cards, 4 crayons, 4 erasable hint-tracking sheets, and one die.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Racing

name: Lollypop Game
description: Travel through lollypop land along gumdrop avenue and be the first little lollypop to reach the candy castle.

name: Box-It
description:
Invicta was a plastics company, which scored a massive success with the puzzle game Mastermind. This game, released as Box-It and as Territorie, used the same multi-coloured pegs from Mastermind to make the captured cells, as the basic version of the paper & Pencil game of Dot & Boxes. However in Dots and Boxes, the fence once played remained stationary. In The Invicta's releases it was permissible to either play a new fence onto the grid, or swing the fence along it's posts, thereby changing which boxes sides would be filled in.

The plastic board has large holes for the plastic pegs and little holes for plastic pennants. Place or turn pennants to secure areas, which are marked with different colored pegs for each player.

The grid of boxes is 8x8 boxes in size.

name: Footballer's Wives
description:
From "Toyasaurus":

In this game, Glamour and assets are everything!
If you are a fan of the hit television show, then you will absolutely love our Footballer's Wives board game.

Don't just watch the beautiful people with their fast cars and fat wallets, become one!

All of your favorites from the Footballer's Wives series are here in this board game, where money and power will win the day

In the Footballer's Wives board game you have to use your knowledge of the series to answer questions in order to own that fabulous house, the swimming pool, the designer wardrobe etc. The aim of the game is to get to the players lounge with all of your assets intact.

Along the way, you get rewarded for blowing £10,000 in Gucci or being voted the best looking celebrity couple - If you know the show, then you'll know what to expect!

name: Rainy Day Cricket
description:
'Rainy day cricket' is a game in the 'big fun in a little box' series by Tobar Ltd. Like other games in the series, it comes in a large matchbox-like container and has a nice miniature scoring pad and pencil. The main equipment are a green die bearing: bowled, run out, L.B.W., not out, no ball, caught; and a yellow die bearing: 1,2,3,4,6 and appeal.

From the instructions:

"Rainy day cricket (2 players)

Choose your teams and list their names on the scoresheet. Toss a coin and decide who will 'bat' first. The batting player uses the YELLOW die and will throw either 1,2,3,4,6 or APPEAL. If a number is thrown, record the score against the player in to bat.

If APPEAL is thrown, the bowling player uses the GREEN die and will throw LBW, CAUGHT, BOWLED, STUMPED (sic), NO BALL OR NOT OUT. If LBW, CAUGHT, BOWLED or STUMPED is thrown, the player batting is out and the next player on the list comes into bat.

If NO BALL or NOT OUT is thrown, the batting player carries on throwing the YELLOW dice as above.

If NO BALL is thrown, an 'extra' is also added to the batting team's score.

The batting team's innings is over when all eleven players are out.

The other team then bats.

The winning team is the one that scores the most runs in one innings.

A time/throws limit can be set if required. The game can also be varied to introduce more of the elements of a real cricket match if the players are enthusiastic enough!"

(Grammatical errors have been corrected)

name: Mortality
description:
From the publisher:

Mortality is an uplifting LDS board game about life rather than strictly a "church" game. It isn't made to teach a list of "facts" about the gospel. Instead, gospel principles are woven into the very fabric of the game. It doesn't give any advantage to the scriptorians or historians. Succeeding at the game requires cooperation, caring for other players, knowing how to build a solid foundation in one's youth, and an understanding of how faith and testimony help you endure trials, and any player who approaches the game in this manner can win.

The game is great at fostering friendly interaction among the players. Even the losers enjoy it, because they tend to end up being the focus of charitable efforts by the other players. Succeeding at the game requires strategy, luck, and advance planning. It teaches LDS values, including the importance of building a foundation that will withstand the adversities of life, the value that hardships can have in building testimony, and the benefits of selfless service. Yes, there is competition in Mortality, because there is a winner, and that's a big part of the entertainment value. But a great part of the fun is in the joking that surrounds the dealing together with experiences and trials in the game that are so much a part of life, but are presented in a somewhat humorous way.

Mortality takes about an hour to an hour-and-a-half to play, depending on the experience and luck of the players. It requires a minimum of three players and up to six can play. Young children can be helped to play the game, but truly understanding it requires an age of at least eight.

You start the game in the childhood section. Here you gain points or "Testimonies" as they are called, strictly by chance, based on what your family does. From there you enter the youth section. As a youth, you begin making decisions on your own that can help you later on or be a detriment to your later progress. You can serve as an LDS missionary, go on dates, and either get a civil marriage or a temple marriage. Avoiding a civil marriage may require some careful advance planning in order to avoid landing on the "civil marriage" square. From there you move into the adult section. One player gets to be the bishop. This assignment may pass from player to player depending on what happens in the game. As you move around in the adult section, you encounter trials of faith. Depending on how many Testimonies you already have, these trials can hurt you or help you. You also have an opportunity to help other players, for which you will gain even more Testimonies. The first player with 150 Testimonies "finishes mortality" and is the winner.

name: Pass The Booger
description:
Players try to collect a set of all five "booger cards", while avoiding the life size booger.

When someone has collected all five booger cards, does not have the life size booger, and lands on a certain board space, they scream "EAT THE BOOGER" at the player with the life size booger and win the game.

name: Seitsemän Päivää Julkkistietopeli
description: A Finnish trivia game about celebrities. To win you'll have to know all the latest rumors, gossip and scandals seen on the pages of a popular Finnish weekly scandal-magazine "Seitsemän Päivää". The name of the magazine would translate into English as "Seven Days"

name: Känkkäränkkä ja Artturi Robotti
description: A very simple spin-and-move game for kids, teaching mainly colour recognition. Using the spinner you either move forward to the next colour that you spin; or if the spinner tells you to be Artturi the good Robot you move another player forward, and if it tells you to be Känkkäränkkä the evil witch, you move someone back. First one to finish wins.

name: I.Q. Quiz
description:
From the box:
"A fascinating quiz game"
"An "I.Q." game for family parties"

Contents are 12 Quiz cards of four types, each appearing three times. Each card has five puzzles (number sequence, missing-letters, pattern-recognition, anagram and general knowledge).

Probably this game is from the 1950s, though there is no date on the box or answer sheet.

The box is marked 'Series 3' and it seems there were several editions containing different puzzles. Certainly the replay value seems small for this on its own.

name: Schmuggler & Co.
description: An interesting-looking game of collecting (smuggling) items of different kinds and deception to outdo your opponents. Very nice components~

name: Lotto-Zoo
description:
This game for children Ages 4 and up premiered at Essen 2000.

Equipment: 4 player boards, 10 number small cards, 24 wooden pieces (6 carrots, 6 bones, 6 pieces of cheese, 6 fish)

The boards show animals and the foods that they eat. Players turn up cards and if it matches a place that they have a vacancy, they get to place a piece. The player who can fill up their board first wins.

In addition there is a variant which makes the game more interesting.

This game is reviewed at Spielphase

http://sunsite.informatik.rwth-aachen.de/keirat/txt/L/LottoZ...

where it did receive an impressive 4 out of 6 pips.

name: Zombie Wars
description:
Zombie Wars is a quick tactical game for 2 to 4 players. Each player starts the game with a small horde of zombies. During the game you attack clusters of townspeople, adding those who die to your horde. Your goal is to build a zombie horde that’s large enough to annihilate the hordes of your rivals. If you have the most zombies on the board at the end of the game, you win.

Zombie Wars uses a custom board, tokens, and zombie horde tracker; a bunch of tokens; about 12 six-sided dice; at least two eight-sided dice; and a few ten-, twelve-, and twenty-sided dice. A four-player game takes about 90 minutes to play. Zombie Wars is appropriate for ages 15 and older.

Home Page: http://www.invisible-city.com/play/446/zombie-wars (free rules, board, and pieces)
categories: Dice, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Alphabet
description:
10 different games with lots of small cardboard letters (laying words, anagrams, guessing words, word puzzles and so on).
Quite old game (Jumbo no. 100).

name: Hollywood Casting
description:
'Hollywood Casting' is a face building game. The young lady in the frame is a drama student who dreams of becoming a hollywood starlet, so the story goes.
'Hollywood Casting' is about quick decision-making and risk taking. The aim of the game is to create the tallest possible face by selecting and assembling different face tiles. When it is their turn, players roll the dice and select a face tile corresponding to the colour or part of the face shown on the dice, and add it to their face under construction. When a player has completed a face, there may still be room to improve it before everyone else has finished theirs, and the game is over. However, the first player to complete a face on an entirely red background or a 'rainbow' face where each tile has a different background colour, wins immediately.

name: Island Embassy
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

"The Dutch and Russian Embassies recently opened up in the lovely new nation of Ha Van Teghi. Mr. Von Watley and Mr. Boris as the respective ambassadors."

"Your goal is to take on one of the peronas and attempt to gain the most influence within the new colony as possible before the end of the year."

Players take turns placing their 12 cubes on the board, seeking to establish positions that will garner the most victory points at the end of the game. The players can also seek to invoke the benefits of King Maki-Maki's assistance.

name: Rappe Knapper
description: In this childrens game the participants get one board with five areas each and four plastic buttons. To get points the players draw cards that show different combinations for the buttons and the players strive to complete as many card combos as they can.

name: Bal Masque
description:
The tag line on this game is "A Game to Catch a Thief".
The players control a couple of dozen characters at a masked ball, moving around the dance floor - one character is the 'thief'. Players gradually gain information through movement around the dance floor and into and out of the adjoining rooms, and through the actions proscribed by the large number of cards. One player is designated "One Who Knows" and has special powers (an extra card deck).
There are clear parallels with Clue/Cluedo here, but with quite different (and more complex) turn mechanics.
Although designated 2-6 players, it's really designed for 4 players, with variant rules provided for 2,3,5 and 6 players.
Contents: Average sized board with ballroom design; 24 character pieces (5cm high card-in-stand figures) and correspondingly 24 Suspect cards; 121 Harlequin cards (actions); 21 Clue cards; 5 Thief cards; 11 "One Who Knows" cards; and two dice. There are 60 plastic diamonds for use as currency.
The rules have a fantasy theme to them. To quote: "Bal Masque is a game, within a game, within a game, an elusive glimpse of far horizons. As Bal Masque unrolls it's magic carpet of pleasures, players find they have crossed the invisible threshold of NOW into the elegant and eerious, incredibly, fantastic world of Bal Masque".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Beach Head
description:
“Solo dice game simulating the actions on a small section of the Normandy Beach landings in WWII. Objective: The game ends when the Allies remove all German Bunkers and Trenches. Removed may mean ‘cleared of troops’ in the case of Bunkers and trenches or ‘Punching through gaps’ for Traps, wire, walls, mine-fields, & ditches. Scoring: Keep track of Allied Infantry casualties. A lower score is a better one.”

The game is played with paper, pencils, and six-sided dice. The rules include a game variation for Omaha Beach.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Knuckle Knipper
description:
Knuckle Knipper is a game of tension, memory, and frustration.

Each plastic 'Knipper' can be depressed from two sides. Press one side and 'Ouch' - it snaps shut around your finger. Press the other side and it refuses to snap.

Playing this game needs 'steady nerves', a good memory, and an element of bluff. Players make their way from the centre of the board to their home corner by throwing the dice. The route is of their choosing.

Each time a player stops he must depress the side of the Knuckle Knipper nearest his spot. If it's safe, he may rest easy - if it 'snaps' he loses a finger card. But he does get to re-set the 'Knipper' secretly so that no one else knows which side it will 'snap'. That's where the memory comes in. Players successfully reaching their own corner get a finger card back each time.

This fast and furious game of tension is for 2 to 4 players, the winner being the player who is the last with a finger or fingers intact.

name: Flips Snakes and Ladders
description: Flips adds strategy to Snakes and Ladders. Roll the dice for more fun. A coloured die indicates the choices of snakes or ladders you can flip for your next move, or flip to trap your opponent. Flips Snakes and Ladders includes 4 pawns, two dice, a game board and 5 extra strong reversible snakes and ladders.

name: På skattejakt med kaptein Sabeltann
description: Ruben, Synniva, Bessa and Pinky is searching for "grusomme Gabriels" gold coins in the island sand. You move by rolling the dice and search for treasure by flipping one of the four counters. But watch out for Kaptein Sabeltann as he will streal the gold for himself!

name: Hei me pelataan ulkopolitiikkaa!
description: A simple Trivial Pursuit clone. All the questions are from the areas of politics and political history.

name: Geisterpendel
description: The game board consists of a pendulum hanging from a kind of tower that stands in coffin. Through the tower, bones have been stuck. The pendulum is set in motion, then the players pull out the bones as fast as they can without being interrupted by the pendulum. When the last bone is removed, the coffin lid falls down to close the coffin and the game ends. The player with most bones is the winner.

name: Baccard
description:
This is a simple dice game, supposedly taking place in a Las Vegas casino.

There are 3 dice (green, blue, red) with corresponding rows on the game board; at the start of a turn, each player in turn places their pawn on one of the 18 possible results, and all the dice are rolled. A pawn on the right number of the right colour wins the bet times 2, a pawn on the right number but wrong colour gives wins the bet times 1, and a pawn on a completely wrong space wins nothing and loses the bet also. Multipliers are cumulative, so the maximum is 4, if all three dice show the same number and the player has his pawn on that very number.

The game includes 100 chips of three different denominations, for use in betting. Each player starts with 10 "marks", minimum bet is 1 mark, and the game ends when there are no more chips in the bank.

The rules actually suggest a gambling variant for adults, where the players "buy" the starting chips with real cash to form a bank which is then shared between the players in relation to the value of the chips they won during the game.

name: Bible Caravan New Testament
description:
Bible Caravan is a travel game that takes players on an imaginary trip through the Holy Land for the purpose of learning the location and significance of 30 places described in the Bible.

Each player gets a map board of the Holy Land depicting a caravan route. Players then select text filled tiles that match their caravan route cities, and play the tiles upon their board, matching the city tiles with Bible verses printed on the right side of the map board. Scoring is determined by locations filled and correct verse identifications.

name: Jimmy Savile's Pop Twenty
description:
"Now then, now then". This is a roll-and-move game. The objective is to reach No. 1 in the pop charts and win the golden disc. Pieces are moved around the board via throws of the dice. Various squares have instructions on which move you up and down the charts.

From the box: "Here's a great new game that captures all the excitement of today's pop scene. So join in the chart-topping race and head for the No. 1 spot with Pop Twenty! Yours groovily, Jimmy Savile."

name: Katalyka
description:
Katalyka is a board game for 1-4 players that focuses on what it feels like to live as a member of the Stellar Consciousness of a Galaxy. It all starts with one Star for each player, and the goal is to invest your Stellar resources in the smartest strategic ways to build planets, then cultures that help grow your consciousness across the Galaxy! This is not a "typical space opera shoot-em-up" type game. Katalyka's system uses 'by the turn' customisable visual reference chart for deployment of Stellar resources into a full range of different gameplay styles. To truly master the Galaxy, you have to do more than just build space ships and lasers, in fact... right now those are relatively unimportant advancements in this game.

The gameplay is similar to a cross between Risk and Magic The Gathering.

Play should only take a few minutes to learn how to play, but the complexity of the strategic possibility increases nearly exponentially as the gameplay deepens. There are 13 different types of interactions possible when interacting with an opponent, each of these pathways offers a different style of gameplay, and each one has been mastered by a different culture of the Galaxy. Each group has different weaknesses and strengths, and can be seen as a hero, or a villain... depending on your game strategy.

Learn trade and master transportation in The Circle of Life, master data archiving and planetary engineering in The Order of the Singularity, and befriend multidimensional predators or hire anarchist hackers in The Forgotten... as you try to build a culture rich enough to become a member of The Elite, mysterious beings with capabilities and resources spanning every level of life.

This is a game unlike most others. I agree with those who said that a good strategy game takes minutes to learn and a lifetime to master. There are elements of this system that I have been working on developing for over two decades.
I think that the loss of magic and mystery we experience with some of our scientific observations may be restored, and a more healthy balance of life can be found through respecting the Macro Organic life and finding new ways to interact with them... also learning to respect the old ways in a new light.

This manual is divided into two sections, the quick start section (for those who want to just dive right in and start playing), and the Galactic Primer (for those of you who enjoy learning about the deeper backstory of the Universe of Katalyka).
categories: Civilization, Economic, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Yakari: Das Kartenspiel
description:
Yakari and his friends have forgotten the time while playing, and the players have to help find them.

This game is played using five decks of 22 cards: one deck for each player and one tribal deck. Each deck contains two types of cards:
- Friend cards, which show one, two or three persons (Yakari or one of his friends)
- Special cards

The games is played in rounds. At the start of the game, player shuffle the decks. Each player draws two cards from his own player deck. At the start of each round, the top card of the tribal deck is revealed. If it is a special card, some event is triggered. Otherwise, each player selects one of his cards to play and scores points depending on how many friends the played card shares with the tribal card. A player can also play one of his own special cards, which will also trigger some special effect: no player scores points, the player may retrieve on of his played cards, etc.

The game ends when all players are out of cards, or when the tribal deck runs out of cards. The player who has scored the most points wins.
categories: American West, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Slapjack
description:
User Summary

Slapjack is a simple children's boardgame that appears to be related to, but distinct from, the Slap Jack card game...

At the beginning of the game all 44 cards are dealt face down to the players. (These are kept face down during the course of the game.) Players use a spinner to move cardboard pawns around a board. Each space has an instruction for the player to follow. Some spaces ask players to perform physical actions (which have no real effect on game play). Some spaces ask players to give or take cards from other players. This is significant because the object of the game is to collect all the cards. If you run out of cards you are eliminated.

There are a few strategically placed Slapjack spaces on the board. If someone lands on one of these spots, then each player takes a card at random (again all cards are kept face down at all times) and puts it in the center of the board. If someone puts down a Slapjack card, then the first player that slaps the card wins the hand.

There is a variant game listed in the rules where players use just the game cards and play a single card down one at a time. If a Slapjack card is played, then the first player to slap the card wins the hand. The last player with any cards wins. (This is essentially the Slap Jack card game, albeit with a smaller than standard deck.)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Matk mööda tuletorne
description:
Game made after local travel book about traveling from one light tower to another.
In the game you can play as one of the travelers: Mom, dog Jossi, cat Juppi or camper.
Game is simple roll and move game, where the goal is to visit most light towers. Different squares on the board have different kind of abilities. Like red square will stop you for few turn.

Winner is the player with the biggest score.

name: An den Ufern der Elbe
description:
Objective: be the first turning back to Dresden (field 100)

- moving by turn -
each player rolls the die and moves according the number; ending on a red or blue space draw a corresponding card & follow instructions of the card.
publishers: SPIKA GmbH, VEB Druck und Verpackung Dresden

name: Peppa Pig: Fairground Game
description:
Peppa Pig Fairground Ride Game is fun and exciting 3D game of musical air-swings – but with a fun and exciting twist for young children.

The game begins when each player chooses their Peppa Pig character to play with, and places it on a seat on the fairground ride. The youngest player begins by pressing down on the red button top and everyone watches the air swings spin round and around and listening to the fun musical tune that will be playing. The aim of the game is to be the last player sat on the air swings – but if you Peppa Pig figurine lands next to a red ‘Hop Off’ space, then they must hop off the ride and try to guess where the empty seat will land next. Did you guess it right? If not, don’t worry, you have until the winner is left on the swings to hop back on the ride.

name: Do Your Job
description:
Do Your Job is a fast, family fun game. It comes with two different variants. One is a collecting game (similar to Gin Rummy or Spoons) with a twist and the other is a mind-bender with a betting mechanic.

In the original game variant, each player will attempt to obtain all the elements needed in order to complete their job from the card piles at the center of the table; they will need to find a Job card and the necessary Job Item card(s) during the game. Each turn players will draw a card from the top of a deck, discard a card face up onto a deck, and move a card from one deck to another (you may do these actions in any order, but you must do them all). If you successfully have all the cards necessary to Do Your Job at any point on your turn, you win!

Jobs are not so easily done, though. The corporate world is a cruel mistress, and the player must try to figure out the other players' jobs in order to thwart jobs being done. If people realize what job you are trying to do, desired cards can be buried within one of the decks during other players' discard or move action since you can only draw from the top of a pile.

In the Treachery game variant, each player tries to win the most points. They will accomplish this by first betting for the round. Then players will play a job card (either the Pirate or the Dwarf) and a number card face down. The pirates will then flip their bet (positive to negative or negative to positive) and switch number cards with the other players according to the arrows. Whoever has the highest number will win all the bets and play will repeat in this fashion. Be wary though, for if each person plays the Pirate, the bets will be flipped, but everyone keeps their number card.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), The Game Crafter, LLC

name: John Deere: Go, Johnny, Go!
description:
A tractor-themed spin-and-move game.

Goal
Be the first to cross the finishing line with your tractor.

Setup
The circular board - showing a racing course - has a circular plastic panel in the middle, with a tractor in the center. Around the central tractor, there are 9 circular recesses into which the action disks are placed in random order. The action disks show the numbers 1-4, a "muddy puddle" symbol or "Johnny the tractor". Each player gets a cardboard token and places it on the starting line.

Game play
Players take turn placing the plastic Johnny toy at the center of the plastic panel and press it down. It rotates and turns until it lands in one of the recesses. The action disk in the recess Johnny landed in determines the action of the active player. On numbers 1-4, the player moves his/her token the corresponding number of spaces towards the finish line. "Muddy puddle" means you're stuck this turn and all other players get to move one space. If Johnny lands on the "Johnny the tractor" disk, the first player to call out "Go Johnny go!" gets to move one space forward.
The racing course also has special action spaces: shortcuts and spaces where you have to move back several spaces.

The player whose token crosses the finishing line first wins the game.

name: Anna & Elsa
description:
Very simple game based on Disney's Frozen. Main goal is to get to the castle of Elsa, princess who froze the whole kingdom of Arendelle. By throwing dice, you move your meeple, possibly stepping on fields with special effects such as "wait one turn" or "move four fields forward". The player who first reaches frozen castle wins.

From the back of the box:
Join the rescue expedition on behalf of Arendelle Kingdom. Princess Anna and her friends try to overcome many pitfalls and obstacles on the journey to safe [sic] her sister Elsa and whole Kingdom. What will win ice or live?

name: Välkommen till samhället
description: Välkommen till samhället is a board game there the players starts as a new born and walks thru lifes different events. The player roll dice and moves around board, coming in contact with agencies, feelings, standards, institutes and different problems. The aim is to try to stay alive as long a possible.

name: Monaco Grand Prix Formula 1
description:
This formula race takes place in Monaco, as it's name states. You drive one or more of 6 cars. Cars are moved on the track by throwing a dice and moving accordingly. When a player drives to a road segment with white borders, he has to pick up an action card. Action cards have good, bad and neutral effects.

The action cards are written so that they try to be funny.

name: Der Schuh des Manitu: Das Brettspiel
description:
Whether wadding blow on the Puder Rosa or mime with Abahachi. Or would you rather make a rhyme with Ranger about Santa Maria? Skill, creativity and wit will bring you nearer to coveted treasure map. And in between you are allowed laugh until the Shoshone come ...
With this communication and party game each round will get in mood!

name: Springo
description:
Springo is a classic roll-and-move game in which players race with their pawns to the middle of the board.

Each player controls 4 pawns. At the beginning of the game each pawn is on the outer ring. The goal of the game is to move the pawns to the inner rings and finally to the middle. Every turn a player throw a dice and choose which pawn to move clockwise around the circle that the pawns is currently. If the pawn ens its move in the same place as the other pawn, the other one goes back to the starting place. If a pawn finishes a move in a horse spot, then the next move that pawn will do is going to the inner circle. If it is the most inner circle then that pawn finishes his game in one of the six spots in the middle of the board.

When there are six spots in the middle occupied the game is over. The player that lead the most pawns to the middle is the winner. In case of a tie the values that pawns are standing on in the middle are sum up and whoever has the most is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Family Guy: Mouth full of BLANKS
description:
Description from the publisher:

Join the fun of Family Guy: Stewie’s Sexy Party Game with the Mouth Full of BLANKS Game Booster! Now you and your friends, along with your pets, your boss, that jerk at work who keeps going on and on about his fantasy team, your favorite bar, and that cool catchphrase you used to say all the time in high school but now looking back you realize it wasn’t that cool, can be a part of Stewie’s Sexy Party Game.

Mouth Full of Blanks is a set of Blank Word Cards featuring every category and character from Stewie’s Sexy Party Game. GF9 couldn’t “go there” but with a Mouth Full of Blanks Game Booster, you can absolutely “go there”. Go ahead, add your own People, Places, Actions, Descriptions, Things and Quotes to the game, we won’t tell!
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Karma Schnupperspiel
description:
This is a free trial version of the card game Karma, but with only 34 small cards (instead of the 60 large cards of the original game).

Each player is dealt three face-down cards that he cannot look at and that remain on the table in front of him. He is dealt six more cards, chooses three of those for his hand, and places the remaining three face-up onto his table cards in three separate stacks. One player begins by placing a card or cards of the same value from his hand onto the table face-up to create a discard pile. The other players in turn must place onto the discard stack a card or cards of the same value that match(es) or exceed(s) the value of the top card of the stack; or else, pick up the stack. Until the draw pile is gone, players must draw at the end of their turns to maintain a hand of at least three cards.

All of a player's hand cards must be played before any of his face-up table cards, which must in turn be played before any of his face-down table cards. A few cards allow players to break the foregoing rules. The last player with cards loses the game.

Karma is based on the public domain card game, Palace.

name: Lackadaisy: The Card Game
description:
With a unique cast of characters with special powers from the Eisner Award-nominated comic series, you and up to seven friends play as a gang of shifty shady felines trying to keep their speakeasy afloat.

The game is cooperative with all players loading into their car, the Fordor, and exploring a randomly arranged deck of location cards laid out face down on the table. Players must get enough of "The Good Stuff" back to the Lackadaisy Speakeasy before the time runs out and the speakeasy folds like a cheap suit. Players will need to arm themselves and use the special location powers to their best ability to win. With event cards that can help as much as harm, the tide of the game can turn at any moment.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Timo Taikuri Taikanoppapeli
description:
"Ananasa Käämä!" (= a version of 'Abraca dabra', if you like.)

This game is based on a popular Finnish children's show from the 80's. In this roll and move game your goal is to travel from start to finish making magic tricks and collecting magic wands along the way. Magic tricks are determined by dice rolls. The winner is the one who has the most magic wands.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jak żyć Panie Premierze?
description:
The game is based on a simple mechanism: the player rolls the dice and moves on the board for the number of rolls rolled, and then performs the action that was described in the field where he stopped (pulling the card, receiving a penalty or prize, lottery draw or rest) . Before making a move, each player must pay a mandatory fee (10 "pnż"), symbolizing daily living expenses. Before rolling the dice, you can take out a loan, buy a good or a lottery ticket, and send your resume.

The game begins as an unemployed with an allowance and three CVs, but each character has a variety of abilities, in addition, after the first day of each month, the right to sell their goods is acquired, and for each profession there are two levels of promotion.

The goal of the game is "survival" - getting a job, own home and living. The winner is the player who not only owns a job and own house, but is also not in debt and his home is not occupied by a tenant. In the event that more than one player meets these conditions, the victory is determined by better paid work, goods and money.

The instructions, like the content of the cards and fields on the board, are described in a humorous, or even satirical way. The authors of the game are detached from the decisions of state officials and various life situations.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Income, Loans, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Don't Upset the Llama
description:
Did you know that llamas don’t like loud noises or rude behaviour? After this game, you certainly will! On your turn, draw a card from your deck and try to be the first to spot the horn or spray. The first player to grab the Llama water gun can spray a player of their choice!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Enigma Box (vol.1) "Arcanum"
description:
Enigma Box (vol. 1) could make a great Christmas gift for you or your loved ones! Languages: English, Spanish, French and German.

This challenging campaign is based on historical events and is full of enigmas and mysteries that will test your wits. We call on all adventurers, gamers, mystery-seekers, puzzle-solvers, and curious minds to immerse themselves in one of the biggest collection of enigmas ever. Using the most advanced technology you will travel to incredible locations around the world without ever leaving your front room.

We would like to present to you, Enigma Box (vol. 1), which brings back the experiences, games and enigmas from our previous campaign “The Enigma Box” but in a new format that is compact (Five scenarios) and affordable.

You can play on your own, with friends, or with anyone fit to face the challenge. It is designed and supported by world-class experts in the fields of technology, history and entertainment.

Corrections and Improvements
We have learned from experience and have made several improvements based on feedback from our backers:

Improved the texts, translations and explanations.
Corrected errors throughout the game and improved the riddles.

Enjoy the ultimate gaming experience from the comfort of your home. Travel on an adventure across time and to far-off lands. This campaign uses the most advanced technology and delivers a collection of ancient riddles into the palm of your hand.
Your goal is to decipher the mystery of the “Arcanum Arcanorum”, the Secret of Secrets, the unique item that will change the destiny of humankind.
You will use the latest technology including virtual reality, augmented reality, 3D printing and more.
This challenge will boost your mental dexterity and intuition, increase your world knowledge, encourage next-level thinking and enhance your problem-solving skills. Most importantly, you’ll have a great time!
This is a game for people of all ages, genders and backgrounds. You do not need any prior skills or knowledge to fully enjoy the adventure.


Will history know your name?

The places, explorations and investigations in this game are based on real events.
Using our intuition, the latest technology, and a bit of luck, we uncovered hidden messages revealing the coordinates of a late 19th-century box buried in the French Pyrenees. What we found is part of an unprecedented discovery that allowed us to access knowledge, data and cryptograms belonging to a secret society.

name: Heroes & Gods: The Master of Dreams
description:
Heroes & Gods is a fantasy game based on PvPvE mechanics which opens the door for strategic partnerships during the gameplay, creating unexpected situations where interaction between players is both key and strategy. The player takes control of a Hero belonging to one of the four major races (Basharii, Elysar, Takan or Aedolas) as the adventure commences.

High replay value and custom builds : The entire game is built on concepts such as freedom of choice, versatility while strategizing and social interaction. You build your Hero the way it suits you best. Use custom skills, cast one-of-a-kind magic spells, arm yourself with ancient or legendary weapons and armors, use unique magical potions or forgotten scrolls, take companions to help you defeat your foes. The competitive spirit is re-triggered each time you start a new Heroes and Gods session as the Heroes may be different for your will choose a different strategy in accordance to the gameplay that is unique with each game start. Each time you start there will be a new path to follow, a new strategy to apply, a new hero that you can build.

Social component and diplomacy : Demand actions from other players, ask for items or simply take control of the game and dictate moves if you get yourself into the power position, but be careful how you do it... Your reputation is going to make you or break you! Aside from the basic set of rules, the game gives you the freedom to decide what to do, who to attack, what loot you want to take for yourself, which rewards you want to share with your allies, who is going to fight the epic monsters at your side and more. Whether you want to attack a legendary creature, start an in-game quest, trade or fight for map shards to solve Aenigmas you will almost always need allies. Diplomacy plays a key role in the development of the game.

URGH NASIR trader and free trade : The game is designed to offer as much freedom as possible and great rewards to those who emerge victorious from battles. Each defeated monster can be captured. The soul dealer in Urgh will revive companions and sell you weapons, armors, potions, spells quests and upgrade your items and skills. Any item can be freely traded between players. Each player can initiate a trade session before starting their turn. In addition to this each 7th turn brings with it an auction market which contains unique artifacts.

During the game, the Heroes will go up against unique monsters, solve Aenigmas to reach epic locations guarded by legendary keepers, complete quests to receive unique items, call upon forgotten Gods asking for their favors in battle, explore unique sites filled with otherworldly creatures. As the game evolves the Heroes will improve their backpacks with spell scrolls, potions, skills, weapons and armors with unique abilities while fighting all together, in separate teams or each for his own. At the end, the surviving Heroes will battle once more and they will have to defeat Darva, the keeper of the souls in order to ascend and become Gods themselves.

The game offers an unlimited number of strategies that you can apply in your gameplay. It can be played co-op until the end or you could focus on eliminating your opponents one by one.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Guess How Much I Love You Game
description:
Matching and pantomime game for young children based on the book of the same name.

"Find the matching cards for your game board, while imitating the motions on the cards. When all the boards are completed everyone wins!"

name: Matka Karjalaan
description: Matka Karjalaan (Journey to Karelia) is a slightly educational roll and move game. Players are dealt destination cards for cities in Karelia they have to visit. During the game they complete tasks in cities. Tasks are related to Karelian history and tradition. The game includes also chance cards that may send players to another city, or give them tasks similar to those appearing in cities. First player to visit all his destination cities and return is the winner.

name: Jason Donovan Straight From The Heart
description: A game where there are 4 jigsaw puzzles to complete in order to "win the heart of Jason". By answering questions about Jason Donovan and also about the other players, you win pieces, and also collect pieces from the board.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Fredi Ja Batonaator Loomaias
description:
Come and join Fredi and Batonator at the zoo.
Fredi and Batonator brought the inhabitants of the zoo eight sacks of masts that children had collected. Then they decided to find their old buddies Panda Bear and Marabou Bird. Let's see who's going to be the first to find Panda Bear and Marabou Bird!
You can start the journey by rolling 1 or 6 with the die.
It's the first game in the "Fredi ja Batonaatori seiklused" set out of the four!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Superman Returns: Kryptonite Crisis
description: Based on the 2006 film Superman Returns, this game challenges players to be the first to defeat Lex Luthor by reaching the top of New Krypton. A 3D board and rolling Kryptonite boulders add to the challenge. Each turn involves four phases: Draw a card; Roll the die and take the appropriate action; Play cards; Discard down to 5 cards. The recommended age is 6+ and this game is a notch above most licensed games designed for such young children.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: ESP
description: Using the symbols used in ESP tests, players have discs to secretly select a symbol, then bet on the collective outcome. You can bet on the color or shape and as the game progresses, you cash in your winnings, buying tokens to spell ESP to win.

name: Safari Builders
description:
This quick-action dice game has 24 sturdy cardboard pieces that player hurry to claim so they can build 4 complete 3-dimensional safari animals (lion, elephant, zebra, and giraffe). No reading or number skills required. Ages 3 - 7

Similar to Jumbolino, but Safari Builders is listed as 1-4 players.

name: Trivial Pursuit The Music Master Game: Film & TV Edition – Video Version
description:
Each player has a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes. The goal of the game is to collect a pie in each color. The colors correspond to different question categories.

The board consists of a circular track with spaces in seven different colors. Six of the colors correspond to question categories while the last color gives a new dice roll. Six spaces along the track are "pie spaces", and from these there are "spokes" of track leading to the middle of the board.

Players roll a die and move along the track in any direction they like. When a player stops on a color they get a question of the appropriate category. If the player answers a question correctly while on a pie space, they get a pie of that color (assuming they don't already have it). A correct answer on another square allows the player to roll again.

Once the player has one pie in each color, she can move along the spokes to the middle of the board to win the game.

Trivial puruit game played with a PAL VHS video tape with clips of popular movies and TV shows.
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: Horn Abbot Ltd., Telstar Video Entertainement

name: Shadow Sex & Fantasy Maze
description: Shadow Sex and the Fantasy Maze is a game in which players use a light source to project their shadows on a wall while fulfilling sexual commands indicated by directives on a game board. The players must position each other slowly and carefully to achieve the maximum effectiveness of their shadows on the wall. The end result of this is not only humorous, but leads to longer and more exciting foreplay.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Exploration, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: EastEnders
description:
This game is based upon the popular BBC television soap.

From the box:
"The characters down in Albert Square have seized the imagination of the country and here's your chance to share in the ups and downs of their lives by taking on the part of one of the residents of TV's most famous square."

The goal of the game is to obtain the money to buy two rings, and then reach their character's "objective" space. Each character also has certain spaces to avoid as they move around the board. Some spaces allow the character to wager money on the dice. There are other spaces which allow all of the players to vote on how a character would respond to a dilemma given on a card.

name: The Worst-Case Scenario Card Game: Work
description:
Based on the Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook "Work". Reading the book may be of some assistance in playing the game but is not necessary.

Example questions:

"How to Identify a Nightmare Workplace"

"How to combat Eye Strain from Fluorescent Lights"

"How to Survive if you're caught surfing the web instead of working"

"How to stop an overflowing toilet in the executive washroom"

May be used as a travel game or as a supplement to other games in the series like the original or Travel version.

Each one of the cards has a question and 3 alternative answers printed on front and back, 108 questions in all.

The current player has the question and all answers read to them. They then choose which of the answers is *most* appropriate.

The first person to get 5 questions correct is the winner.

The cards are printed different colours blue/white on their opposite faces which makes it easy to tell when you have gone through the first half of questions.

name: An Eccentric Excursion to the Chinese Empire
description:
The game is a race from England to China via Europe, North Africa, and India between four players travelling by steamboat, the railway, a flying machine, or on foot.

Players are randomly assigned to one of four possible methods/tracks to get to China: Steamboat, Walker, Aerial Machine and Railway. Those tracks cross each other permanently on their way to China. Players do not remain always on the same track but move according to the throw of a four sided tee-totum. As in many Victorian games, there's also a system of fines/rewards. The first player to reach the end of the track wins the pool.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Global Neighbors
description:
A Mennonite Central Committee (MCC) Game

The heart of the game is answering trivia about the MCC and its activities. Many of the answers are found in the information sheets included with the game. “The game was to be educational, fun to play and might even raise some dollars for MCC.”

Global Neighbors is played on a board of the world. At the start of the game, information sheets are divided amongst the players and each player is given responsibility for several different countries. In order to win, you must be the first to visit each of the countries you are responsible for. You move along the board by successfully answering trivia questions.

On your turn you must answer a question from one of the Question Cards. Each Card has four different numbers on it. If you answer the question correctly, you can move your marker a number of spaces equal to any one of the numbers on the card. If you fail to answer a question, you cannot move and you must share some information from one of your Information Cards.

Components:
- Mounted Game Board
- Location Tiles (one for each country on the game board)
- Player Markers (6)
- Information Sheets (25)
- Question Cards (270, double-sided)
- Rules

name: Bahcheck
description: The object of the game is to advance all of your stakes to the finish line before your opponent in order to win. The game can be played opposite each other or side-by-side. When playing opposite each other, the game cards must be placed in the card bay so that the green block is at the bottom and at the player’s right. Playing side-by-side, both cards must be placed with the green block at the bottom. Stakes must be advanced vertically only. There are three (3) versions to this game: RANDOM, MIX, and FIX. Random is the basic version and should be learned first....

name: Bible Tit Tat Toe
description:
Stimulating, entertaining, and educational with 1,000 questions and answers in regular and advanced format. Players answer questions about the Bible to win squares on the "Tit Tat Toe" board.

Contents: Tit Tat Toe board, 10 playing squares, 500 question cards, instructions.

name: Bible Land Adventure Game
description:
BibleLand is a fun and exciting game that takes youngsters on a journey through the Bible, from Creation to Heaven. With different play options for different ages, BibleLand is fun for all and a great tool to use for introducing your children to the Bible.

Recommended for Ages 3 - 6.

name: Histamiini-peli
description: Find the three Klip-klop-klop-tokens representing your color and get back home before anybody else in order to win.

name: Ice Frenzie Hockey Card Game
description:
All the action of a real hockey game!

Fast Paced Actions

100 cards of fierce hockey action.

(2) 50-card team decks
publishers: Anderson Family Games, Game Publishers Associaton

name: Abeltje het spel
description:
Game released in honor of the Dutch movie Abeltje (personal name of an elevator boy). On its turn the movie was based on a children's book by a famous Dutch writer: Annie M.G. Schmidt.

The game itself is a simple roll-and-move system, where some spots have a special meaning, sometimes requiring trivia questions about the movie.

Land on an elevator to move one floor up. Reach the top floor to win the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Transportation
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Piratitan
description:
From the press release:

Aarrr! Piratitans are back. In this fast-paced card game you pick your victims and seize their treasure! You can try to escape but beware... You can’t outrun Piratitans! Unpredictable fun for everyone! Kids won’t even know it’s educational when they battle each other with ships loaded with cannons

name: Maxwell: The Game
description:
A rather tongue-in-cheek game of amusement at the expense of Robert Maxwell!

The purpose is to become a tycoon and then become the administrator for the pension fund!

The aim is to land on the Maxwell Squares and collect the 5 different items that enable you to become a tycoon: Newspaper Owner, Yacht owner, Football Club director, Cigar smoker, and finally Pension Fund Administrator.

To win the game, you must have collected all 5 cards, and then be the first person to the pension fund. To do this you must first accept that you have died!!! You must then move along the 3 sets of coins before entering your kingdom of untold riches. The first to the riches wins.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Lustiges Topfspiel
description:
The components are one board, two six sided dice and a pot containing 100 gold coins (actually plastic chips).
On the board are ten circles numbered 2-11. In each circle there are spaces, two in circle 2, three in circle 3 and so on.
On her turn the player rolls the dice and places a gold coin from the pot on a free space in the circle corresponding to the total rolled. Should no free space be available the player takes all the coins in the circle. A 12 is wild and represents the number of the player's choice. The winner is the player who first accumulates a wealth of 20 gold coins.
publishers: Hugo Gräfe Verlag, Sala, Schmidt Spiele, SPIKA GmbH, Stockinger & Morsack

name: Der Herr der Ringe: Die zwei Türme – Ü-Ei Spiel
description:
A collectible game from the German "Kinder Überraschung" ("Kinder-Surprise"). It is "published" as a box with the rules and a board and also including 7 Kinder-surprises (only 2 of them have miniatures included).
The other 10 miniatures must be collected by buying further Kinder-surprises.
categories: Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Overclockers!
description:
(From back of box)

Your rig is your reputation what will you build?

In the world of Overclockers! the weekly LAN party isn't just about playing the games - it's about who can run them. Outbid your competitors for the best components then use them to play a hilarious selection of pirated PC games to increase your respect and be crowned king - or queen - of the Overclockers!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Video Game Theme

name: Star Talk
description:
You know the stars - but do you know their secrets? Gossip around celebrities and gamers rule the game.Star Talk is a fascinating mix of quiz and psychology. Answer questions from different categories about various celebrities.

From the back of the German version:

"Sie kennen die Stars - aber kennen Sie auch deren Geheimnisse? Klatsch und Tratsch rund um Berühmtheiten und auch rund um die Mitspieler bestimmen das Spiel. Star Talk ist eine faszinierende Mischung aus Quiz und Psychologie. So ganz nebenbei entdecken Sie Ihr eigenes Star Potential! Sichern Sie sich die begehrtesten Trophäen und Auszeichnungen beim Run auf die Position des ""Superstars""! Beantworten Sie einfach Fragen aus verschiedenen Kategorien auf Ihrem Weg .......

name: Ghoulash: Scenario Pack 2
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Features these three classic GHOULASH scenarios: "Door Jam," "Maze 1" and "Moving Target"

SCENARIO: DOOR JAM

There are dozens of doors, but not all of them will allow you passage!

SCENARIO: MAZE I

Just get from one corner to the other, if the Ghouls will let you.

SCENARIO: MOVING TARGET

Battle your way to the bulls-eye of this challenging grid.

name: Sateenvarjo-peli
description:
Players try to repair holes in their umbrella before rain.
Each umbrella has 5 different colours, player throws a dice, if the dice shows a colour that player doesn't already have he gets to put a counter on that colour, if the dice shows grey a rain cloud is put on the table. When there are five rain clouds, the game ends. Any player who has got five different colours before that wins the game.

name: YOLO
description:
