From the publisher's website:
YOLO is the addicting card game where the lowest score wins! Players are dealt four cards face down. Throughout the round you'll be swapping cards in and out trying to memorize which card is which number. The YOLO cards are the highest and lowest cards in the deck and can push your total into the stratosphere or save you! If you think your set of four cards is lower than everyone else's, then it is time to GO FOR IT! Why not? YOU ONLY LIVE ONCE!

name: Eestlaste ümberilmareisid
description: Roll the dice and move around the world with the modern estonian travelers. Who finishes first is the winner.

name: Connexio
description:
Publisher's Description:
How do you think a compass is related to fried eggs? What does a roller skate have to do with a ballerina? It’s up to you! This game (for both adults and kids) inspires you to come up with creative connections between seemingly unrelated things. Pluck objects from the bag and imagine an association—poetic, practical, serious, or silly—to reveal hidden webs of meaning and surprising details about how you perceive the world. There are no wrong answers—only intriguing ideas. Be pensive. Be spontaneous. The setup and rules are simple. The possibilities are infinite.

Contents:

1 Two Sided Game Board
1 Drawstring Bag
85 Object Chips


Setup:
Choose one side of the board to play on, the blue (easier) or green (harder). Provide slips of paper and writing instruments to the players. Each player draws 3 object chips, face up, from the draw bag. The youngest player chooses one object chip blindly from the bag and places it in the center of the board.

Game Play:
Each round, one player (the curator) places an object chip on the board, connected to a previously played object chip. Other players take three minutes to privately choose an association between the object and the others to which it is connected on the board, writing it on a slip of paper. When three minutes are up, the curator shuffles and reads the examples aloud. Each player, except the curator, votes on the best connection, drawing one object chip blindly for each vote received. The role of curator then moves to the next player counterclockwise. When all players have served as curator, the player with the most objects is the winner.

An alternate "cooperative" ruleset is provided for a puzzle activity experience, placing pieces on the board and attempting to make compelling associations.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Voting

name: Mathable Junior
description:
Like in Mathable players place the number tiles on the Scrabble-like board. Tile what is placed must be result of addition of subtraction of 2 adjacent tiles next to it horizontally or vertically. Some squares also have special symbols. Players have less tiles in hand than original Mathable. Each tile placed counts its value as points.

Game ends if any player plays his last tile or everybody passes.

Player with the most points is the winner.
publishers: Dino Toys s. r. o., Wooky Entertainment

name: BrainBox: My First Maths
description: The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Memory, Trivia
publishers: Brainbox Games Pty Ltd, Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft., Ludicus

name: Sentymentalna Gra Planszowa PRL
description:
Sentymentalna Gra Planszowa PRL (Sentimental Boardgame PRL) is a game about life in People's Republic of Poland. Players do their best to buy a car, but this is no small feat, requiring both money and more than a little luck.

Players in turn roll a pair of 6-sided dice, moving their pawns around the board according to the number rolled and following the printed instructions: drawing cards, earning and losing money, and trading various Communist-era commodities, such as a Washing Machine Frania.

The goal of the game is to buy a car (represented by a cardboard model of Fiat 125p), either directly from the sole producer, Polmozbyt, which requires a ration card, or at much higher expense from second hand.

The rectangular, Monopoly-style game board depicts the Communist-era Warsaw's skyline. Caricatures on game cards and money represent actual PRL-produced commodities and Polish currency from that period.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Pass The Tentacle
description:
Tentacles are cropping up all over the place and they're reaching for YOU! But you can trick the tentacles into going after someone else. Are you quick enough to rid yourself of all those grasping tentacles? Or are your friends quicker? Only one way to find out!

This game will accommodate 3 to 8 players (ages 8 and up).

OBJECT OF THE GAME: Be the person with the least number of Tentacles in your hand at the end of the 9th turn.

TO PLAY: Determine who the dealer is by whoever owns the most tentacles... or failing that, any manner that suits you. Each player will start with three cards in hand. During each turn, you and your fellow players will simultaneously pass cards to the left and right. After all cards have been passed, the players will then pick up the cards passed to them and draw a new card from the deck. Once everyone has drawn a new card, the turn is over, and it's time to move on to the next turn!

name: Chugopoly
description:
Chugopoly, can you Hang? will be your new favorite drinking game. With 40 fun Chugopoly cards, you can take a sobriety test, play truth or drink, or just drink leisurely with the rest of your parties. Contents include: game board, 6 pawns, die, instructions and one great time. Alcohol strongly recommended.

—description from the publisher

name: Addit
description: Addit is played with 2 dice on a game board surrounded by numbers. You can push the numbers from one side of the board to the other. The object of the game is to be the first to push all 10 numbers to the other side of the board, by calculating cleverly with the numbers on the dice you have rolled. The first player to press all the numbers wins!

name: The New Exciting Game of Golfo
description:
This is a straightforward 1–100 racing game, at least as present in Love's version, which features "adapted" rules (his term, unexplained). Players roll and move as expected, picking up 1 token if they are the first to reach or pass each of the 18 holes. (It is not clear if these successful players are supposed to pause at each hole and allow others to catch up, although "excess" rolls may be "counted against the next hole.")

Simple hazards are present in the form of hedges or bunkers, which cause players to lose 1 turn, or streams, which cause players to lose 1 turn and return to tee off from the start of the hole.

The winner is the first player to reach 100 exactly, claiming the remaining 3 tokens from the original 20-token pool.

(This information is extrapolated from Brian Love's 1978 book "Play the Game." Please modify with any expanded description or corrections that can be provided by the owner of a physical copy of the game.)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Ungame: Catholic Version
description:
The Ungame - Catholic Version is a redesign of the classic Ungame packaged with the updated standard Ungame board and two new decks of cards with questions specifically meant to start discussion on the Catholic faith of the game participants.

Players roll the dice and travel around the game board answering questions along the way. The journey's the thing, as there is no finish line and no losers.

Players will answer questions from one of two decks. Deck one is light hearted and meant to break the ice. Deck two is deeper and meant to be more thought provoking.

Examples of questions from the publisher:

If you could meet three famous Catholics from past or present, who would you choose? Why?

Do you have a patron saint? Who? Why did you choose that person?

What do you think HEAVEN is like?

How does your Catholic faith show in your actions?

name: Melanżeria
description:
Melanżeria (Melange) is a card game by Let's Play, intended for parties and social entertainment (usually involving 3 to 8 players), aimed at selecting the real Party Star from among you. Each player receives points at the beginning of the game (their number depends on the number of players), which he has to keep by completing orders. The orders are given by... the other players, who each time choose a person supposed to complete a task. The player who does not succeed, loses a point.

The tasks (presented on 64 cards) include pretending to be someone else, making faces, speaking in funny voices, telling stories, feeding other players with snacks, proposing toasts, drinking, etc.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: You Can't Check Me!: The Basketball Card Game
description: The You Can't Check Me Basketball Card Game captures the essence of B-ball, and evens the playing field no matter what age, height, weight or skill level. Each player or team is capable of such highlights as Reverse Dunks, 360 degree Slams, Three Pointers, Spin Moves, Fast Breaks, Hook Shots and other moves during game play that keep you on the edge of your seat. The game definitely comes with an attitude, so trash-talking or blurting out "You Can't Check Me" is authorized! This fun-filled, family oriented game includes: 1 coin, 100 Offense cards, 150 Defense cards, 2 Time Out cards, 4 Quarter cards, score sheets and instructions. The game is for 2 to 4 players.

name: Ahoy, Me Hearties
description:
"Ahoy, Me Hearties!" is advertised as a 'Pirate Counting Game'.

The aim of the game is to race around the island and be the first pirate to collect ten old coins.

Contents are:
- 1 island playing board
- 1 shipwreck and stands
- 2 palm trees and stands
- 4 treasure chest boards
- 4 pirate character counters
- 37 gold coins
- 1 spinner
- 1 colour spot die

The game is part of the Young Learner series by Clementoni.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Nautical, Number, Pirates

name: Vares: Etsiväpeli
description:
Your goal in this game is to solve a crime in the city of Turku. Solving crimes is done by finding plot cards and then revealing three cards with the same criminal's name and color as the crime card in a certain location on the board.

The game is based on the novels by Reijo Mäki and the films by Solar Films.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Global Networks
description:
From the Instructions for Play:
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Object of the Game:

"To construct a global communications network ... ... A Superhighway of the Future"

Players answer questions on world communications collecting nodes and points to build a worldwide network. In the course of the Game, Players will use communications technologies to build their global networks of the future.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

This trivia game appears to have been designed for Alcatel, which logo appears on the box and the board. The game is of the simple 'draw-a-card-answer-a-question' variety. Getting answers right allows one to draw lines connecting 'nodes' on the curious seven-sided folding board that depicts a map of the world. The first player to connect sufficient nodes in all the different regions wins.

The game comes with the unusual board, a deck of General Knowledge/Expert question cards (General Knowledge on one side, Expert on the other), a deck of Operations cards (like chance cards) and 4 erasable marker pens in different colors. The pens are used to mark the lines in one's network on the board, and also to write down your score.

The theme is on telecommunications networks and this is reflected in the questions asked. There are also options to use Submarine Cable and Satellite Systems on the board to help complete your network.

name: U.E.F.A.
description: A soccer game simulation. It uses flat cardboard microscopic tokens and mechanics similar to GW's Blood Bowl.

name: American Idol Board Game
description:
From the game box:
"Have you got what it takes to be an American Idol? Find out in this fast paced, fun packed game that will teach you all the highs and lows of becoming an Idol."

Idols is a game based on the popular TV show where unknown people can become idols by showing their singing skills. With Idols - The Game you can show others your true capacity.

Each player takes a couple of his cd's with him to play this game. The board has a track with 60 spaces. Each round the players move their pawn by using a roll & die mechanic. Several spaces trigger actions. There is a space when you can choose a song from a cd and the player if choice has to guess the title of this song; if he fails his pawn goes a determined number of spaces back. There are also spaces where you have to continue the lyrics of a song or where you have the sing a couple of lines. The player who is first to reach space nr. 60 on the board wins.

Each Idol game is based on the region of origin, with music reflective of the competitors on that show.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Singing
publishers: Crown & Andrews Ltd., Fremantle Media, Imagination Games, Jumbo, Tilsit

name: Pokémon Battle Disc Competition
description:
From the Rulebook:

Select and shuffle up to FOUR Battle Discs at a time. Place them into the plastic ball and shake it. Open it and "slam down" the ball-half containing the discs. The other players do the same. Once all the players have their pile of discs in front of them the battle begins.

Each player places the discs in a straight line in the order that they have come out of the plastic ball. Place the matching figure next to the disc.

Starting with the first disc, each player flips their disc into the air. How it lands determines who "wins the battle" and puts the other player's figures out of the competition. The disc with the greatest power rating (number of stars) wins. A tie of the highest numbers has to be flipped again until there is a winner.

Play continues until all the figures are defeated except for the remaining one who is the champion.

name: Old Maid Dice
description: A dice game played like the classic children's card Old Maid, except you don't use any cards, you roll 16 "old maid" dice.

name: Snakepit
description:
Snake Pit
Can you escape?
Board Game Ages 7 and up
2 - 4 players
Playing board 10½" x 10½"

Object of the game: Be the first to collect all five weapon tokens (rope, gun, stones, whip, and plank of wood) and escape from the snakepit.

This game comes in a small box. The board is 6 pieces that fit together like a jigsaw. Also included are one die, 12 stands, 12 cardboard figures (4 players and 8 snakes), and a perforated piece of cardboard with 4 each of rope, plank, whip, pistol, and pile of rocks.

Each player starts in the middle of the board with the 8 snakes around the outside at the top of the circular pit. As a player gains each weapon they get to move up one level until they get to the top and reach their colour-coded exit. Players have the option of moving themselves AND one of the snakes (split between the die roll). Opponents hit with a snake are knocked down a level.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mount Everest
description:
extrapolation from description in "Play the Game" by Brian Love;

Game for 2 to 6 players, divided into teams. Order of play is determined by a roll of the dice. Each team of two mountaineers move based on their choice of which mountaineer will use the die roll on each turn. Only one can move per turn. Different obstacles and hazards occur along the way making the climb difficult to finish. Both mountaineers must reach the summit by exact roll in order to win the race.

name: Christmas Party Gift Exchange Game
description:
Game comes with two very large soft dice, a plastic gameboard, and an electronic timer.

This is a party game where everyone brings wrapped gifts of about the same value to the game. Then you roll dice, in this case very large soft "Zunker Dice" as they are called, in order to determine what happens to those gifts.

The game has two different stages.

In the first stage you roll the dice and depending on what number you roll (a 7,11,Doubles) you either select one of the wrapped gifts, unwrap it and keep it in front of you, (roll a 5) pass an unopened gift from the pile of gifts in the center to the player to your right, (roll a 9) pass a gift to the player to your left or (roll any other number) proceed to the next player.

In the second stage, after all gifts have been opened, you have another round of dice rolling during which get to find out what gifts you will keep. Rolls of 5 or 9 force you to give one of your opened gifts to the player on your right or left just like in stage 1. The roll of a 7,11 or double allows you to yell the word ZUNKER and then take a gift from anyone and place it in front of you. If you don't say ZUNKER you get to take nothing! During this second stage you use the included timer which is set for 20 minutes. After the 20 minutes has expired the game is over and you keep whatever gift(s) that you have still in front of you.

name: Occupation Double: Le jeu
description:
All the remarkable elements of the popular tv show "Occupation Double" are gathered in this exciting board game that will surprise you. Guys, girls, eliminations, adventures, challenges and more! Make yourself heard during the eliminations, and be clever in your playing method so that one of your couple wins the "Occupation double" adventure.

Inspired by the television dating game show, you play "singles" that wants to match and win the game. To do so, you must answer questions do different kind of challenges.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Frenemy Dice
description:
Cards are on the table. Start rolling in 3, 2, 1, GO! Who’s got fives? I need two ones! Four cards are drawn from the draw pile and everyone gets six dice of their own color. Fill the card targets with the dice, but you can’t do it alone. Each card must contain dice from two players. Work together to round up the dice needed and collect the points from the card. Will you form an alliance or turn against each other? Find out who’s your friend and who’s your frenemy in this fast paced game of dice.

-description from the publisher

name: Select 11
description: You are the trainer of the national soccer team. Choose the players that you want in your "dream team" and your team's starting line-up. The winner is the one who first completes his team.

name: Justin Bieber: Always Be Mine
description:
The object of the game is to give Justin Bieber the most kisses.

Each player selects one of the four Justin Bieber game boards. After a player completes a task from a "Kiss & Dare" card selected randomly from the deck, the contestant might be able to place a vinyl "kiss" sticker on Justin's picture. Other cards require a player to switch boards, to give another contestant a free "kiss" sticker, or steal a kiss. The tasks printed on the cards include things like doing a chicken dance for 15 seconds.

The contestant with the most kisses when the entire deck has been played is declared the winner.

Designed for 2, 3, or 4 players age 8 and older.

Includes four game boards, 60 cards, 50 kiss stickers, a storage insert, and the rules.

name: Angel: The Board Game
description:
The City of Angels. Between pervasive evil and countless temptations lurking beneath the city's glittery facade, Los Angeles proves to be the ideal address for a fallen vampire looking to save a few lost souls.

There are souls to be saved during daylight hours and in the dead of night. You have to choose which to save, you cannot win this battle by tryng to save both!

As the night approaches you will turn into your alter ego... a vampire. You will have special powers to see what others are not able to see in the day. Make the most of this time, for come the dawn, you will lose these powers, and have more mortal weaknesses.

By day or night there are souls to be saved and dangers to overcome. But in this game, if you can call it that, you not only have to look out for yourself. But also try to discover what other players are doing.

Only by doing this will you be able to manipulate the game towards its conclusion. For you to be the winner and the saviour of souls!

This game uses a license from the Angel TV series which ran from 1999 to 2004. The series was a spin-off of the Buffy the Vampire Slayer TV series.

The game mixes Roll and Move, hand management and memory mechanics. Each player has two hands of cards from distinct day and night decks but has limited opportunities to look at them. During the game, players manipulate their decks and decks of their opponents using different actions which are triggered either by landing on action squares or by action cards.

The first player to reach his starting point with three souls in one hand and none in the other wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: JSCH
description:
[From the publisher's web site]

The JSCH (pronounced “Ish”) from faraway Planet Erra observe the struggle between Good and Evil Forces on Planet Earth. Which will gain influence over the Minds and Souls of Humans? JSCHWJSCH/JSCHRJSCH mean Kings and Queens of Wisdom in the Plejaran language.

The players help each other by clever laying of tiles to make Maps or Areas of Consciousness so the Forces of Light will be in the majority. Each player has an JSCH as a personal E.T. Contact whose spiritual help they can call upon to prevent the Evil Forces from ruling Earth.

THE MAPS that develop as tiles are laid are not geographical areas with territorial boundaries, but rather more fluid depictions of how cultures spread regardless of national boundaries.

THE EVIL FORCES, symbolized by Dark Shields with a drop of blood shaped like a bomb, represent such Forces as violence, greed, hate, confusion, political and religious conflicts... the destructive elements.

THE YELLOW SHIELDS with the UFO-like Eye represent the Forces of Light, which you can interpret as Goodness, Compassion, Living according to Creational Laws... all that is positive in humans.

WHITE SHIELDS represent the Uncommitted, who will convert to Dark or Light, depending on which Force is in the majority in that Area.

It will take all your strategic skills & the timely help of the JSCH to save Planet Earth from the destructive Forces that threaten us all.

name: Tour de france
description:
Yet another very simple TdF game, with a (more-or-less) 3D-board. No date provided, but must be somewhere in the sixties (after the Dutch Jan Janssen won the Tour in '68?). Distributed by a large Dutch warehouse chain.

Use the spinner to determine the number of spots to move forward. Landing on 20 is (for some reason) mandatory to proceed.

This game was released in the Netherlands by Hema and in Germany by Multiplay.

name: Roller Chase
description:
Roller Chase
The wildest race ever!
Get on for the Ride!
Board Game for ages 7 & up
2 - 4 players
Playing board 10½" x 10½"

Object of the game: Be the first to go around the track, collet all four flags and return to your starting point.

This game comes in a small box with all the components in a yellow ziplock baggie. The board is 6 pieces that fit together like a jigsaw. Also included are one die, 12 stands, 12 cardboard figures (4 players (green and red girls, blue and yellow boys, in roller coaster cars) and 8 grey wild cars), and 4 flags of each colour (blue, red, green, yellow) on a perforated piece of cardboard.

Each player starts in one of the four corner starting points according to the colour of the roller coaster car that they have chosen. Two wild cars (grey) per player are placed anywhere else on the track. Each player takes turns rolling the die and moving *BOTH* their playing piece *AND* any one of the wild cars the number of spaces indicated by the die. Wild cars bump player cars back 6 spaces. Reach all four corners, pick up one flag of each colour, and get back to the starting point before anyone else does.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Campus tietokilpailupeli
description: Campus takes players to the university world. Players are trying to get a degree and in order to achieve that goal they'll have to answer correctly. There are questions from 18 different areas of science. Players are moving around the campus trying to gain the needed knowledge. Giving right answers is actually as hard as finding the right questions.

name: Tasapeli
description:
The idea of this game is to teach children about the inequality of the world and the idea of development work in third world countries. The game takes place in a fantasy world of insects that is secretly ruled by the evil Tyrant and his sidekick Niljake (Slimy). In the beginning, the insect realms have different amounts of resources; some are poor while some have plenty. The poorest player, being the most desperate and thus also bravest, starts. The game is a mix of co-operative and individual play, as typically the players can only advance on the board by sharing their income. Likewise, the draconian measures of the Tyrant usually affect all the players and not just the intended victim. The idea is to expose the Tyrant and fill everyone's resources, and the winner is the player who accomplishes the second goal after the first one has already been accomplished.

The three types of resource are: Food & Water, Money & Wealth, Education & Rights.

The insect realms are:

1. Dunghill of the Beetles
2. Spiders' Webbery
3. Butterfly Valley
4. Beeland
5. Castle Ladybug
6. Mosquito Swamp

The game has been designed and published by the humanitarian organization UFF Finland with Tactic's help. The title translates literally as 'Draw' (as in a game with shared victory).
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Do Move Say
description:
Do Move Say is a party game for 10 - 40 players (more if one combines decks). The game takes place standing up in a moderately open space, enough for the players to move around freely.

Do Move Say has two main layers: The Mastermind and Detective game and the Townspeople game.

The Mastermind is trying to accomplish three tasks: Disable three players, find a secret key, and pass a secret note. The Detective must stand outside of the space and determine which player is the Mastermind before the tasks are complete.

The Mastermind must complete the tasks in the midst of the Townspeople game. Each Townsperson has instructions on how to behave in the space, including two "if / then" statements and two global statements. Their behavior makes it difficult for the Detective to determine which player is the Mastermind, while also making the Mastermind's tasks challenging.

Mod cards are also available in the deck, which give one or more of the townspeople goals other than satisfying both "if / then" statements. Mods include the Doctor, who can revive disabled players, the Mimic, who copies everything he sees, and the Pamphleteer, who must distribute three notes without being detected.

The game ends once the Mastermind has completed all three tasks, the Detective has made a guess, or when time expires.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Jogo da Vida: Cartas
description:
From rulebook: "In this game you should be able to build the story of a life with the cards! There are four types of cards: Job and Career, Family and Everyday Life, Activities and Leisure and Sustainable Actions. The player who can make complete sets of at least three of the four sets of cards is the winner."

It's another popular game reimplementation from brazilian publisher Estrela. It is slightly based on original game theme but the final rules are completely different from original.

Box contents:

110 Cards
1 Rule book

---

Neste jogo você deverá conseguir construir a história de uma vida com as cartas! São quatro tipos de cartas: Profissão e Carreira, Cotidiano e Família, Atividades e Lazer e Ações Sustentáveis. O jogador que conseguir formular conjuntos completos de pelo menos três destes quatro conjuntos de cartas será o vencedor.

Conteúdo da caixa:

110 cartas
1 Manual de instruções

name: Seikkailu Joella: Unicefin Vesipeli
description: This is educational childrens game about water. You roll and move and follow the instructions where you land. Basically you go forward, backward or just stay where you landed. On every space there is information about water and things you can do with the water. Winner is the first player to arrive in the end zone.

name: Tärningslotto
description:
Despite its name ("die lotto") this children's game may be considered more like a distant relative of Go Fish than regular Lotto.

Each player is a given a picture board with spaces for tiles, and the corresponding tiles are mixed and placed face down, displaying only a number from 1-6. Players roll the die and try to collect their own tiles by picking them first from the shared pool, and when this is exhausted, from tiles picked up by other players. The winner is the first player to obtain all their tiles and complete the picture on their board. The rules as printed actually contains several incongruities and ambiguities leaving important aspects up to extrapolation or guesswork.

There is no date of publication, but the 70s is a decent guess.

name: Candy Land Connect 4
description:
It's a Game Mashup: Two favorite brands come together to create one awesome game. This Connect 4 game has a Candy Land twist. Players take turns knocking out plastic candies from the bottom row of the Connect 4 frame. Each time one gets knocked out, a new disc must be placed in one of the slots at the top of the frame. The plastic candy tokens keep moving out and dropping down as players try to get sets of 2, 3, or 4 candies adjacent to each other on the bottom row, or vertically up from the bottom. The Game Mashups Candy Land Connect 4 Game is a great idea for a birthday or holiday gift for boys and girls ages 6 and up.

—description from description

name: Kemomimi Panic: Promo Cards
description:
A card set released by Japanime Games when they released Kemomimi Panic.

Contains three cards:

Detective Shamrock: This is just an alternate art version of Detective Shamrock in the base game.

Sonia, the Shadow Influencer: Allows you to discard your decoy once per game during the end of day phase to eliminate a person of your choice.

Fredrica, the Cowgirl: When there are 4 players left in the game and you are the leader you choose a player to reveal their role card. If they are a thief you win... otherwise you both are eliminated.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery

name: Kong: Skull Island Game
description: Features two game boards! Start out on Skull Island and try to be the first player to find King Kong. Then take a ship to New York City and get past the military planes to the skyscraper. Save Kong and win! Features 3-D game board and parts. For 2 to 4 players.

name: Rocket Darts
description:
A space skill game from the American Toy Works, Brooklyn. The game requires players to use suction cup darts to knock down two rockets that are balanced on a vertical stand that is decorated with a Bulls eye and space scenes.

Each player has two shots to score points either by hitting the Bulls eye target or knocking the rockets off the stand. Highest score wins.
A variation of the game requires players to knock down the left rocket first and hit specific space scenes on the stand before finally knocking the right rocket down to win. Players load the suction cup dart into a shooter that resembles a small wooden bat with a central hole. The shooter has a rubber band stretched over the dart end to fire the dart at the targets.

American Games (A. Malloy) lists the game as being published in 1939.

name: Lemonade Stand
description: In this game, you try to be the first player to sell all the lemonade at your stand. A deck of numbered "glasses" is dealt evenly to the players. On your turn, you spin the spinner and advance the number of spaces indicated. If you land on a Customer Space, you may place your top glass on it if it is empty, or if the number on your glass is exactly one number above or below the number of the top glass on that space. A Sun Space allows you to place a glass onto any customer space, while a Rain Space just ends your turn. If you land on another player's lemonade stand, you must take a glass from that opponent's pile. If you land on your own lemonade stand, you may give a glass to any player. The first player to run out of glasses is the winner.

name: Polowanie Na Trolla
description:
Two brave knights, Zbyszko and Gniewko rush to kill the troll in order to prove which one of them is the greater warrior (and to gain the hand of the princess). But when they finally meet the troll both of them take the run back home.

This game was published in the first (and last) issue of Polish magazine Gry Planszowe.
http://www.planszowe.com/

name: Ace in the Chains: A Disc Golf Game
description: Ace in the Chains: A Disc Golf Game is a light, fun print-and-play board game designed to simulate the tough decisions and tension of disc golf. Players plan their throws on a modular board; hazards including water, trees and hills are all that keep you from sinking an Ace in the Chains. Whoever has the lowest total number of throws at the end of three holes will be the winner!
mechanics: Memory, Modular Board, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: OMEGA: The Ritual
description:
OMEGA is a strategic game, revisiting in an original way the theme of secret societies.
You play as an apprentice who is trying to join a mysterious organization known as OOTO. For this, you will have to summon the Ancient Spirits to discover the Arcana of the Omega. So, when the ritual ends, the Disciples will decide which apprentice is worthy to join them...

In a Game of OMEGA, you engage in an occult ritual at the end of which will
be designated the new Initiate of the brotherhood. You will summon Spirits with Runes. These Spirits will guide your progress on the Ritual disc in order to access the Arcana.
The first candidate to reach the number 7 Arcana will end the Ritual. Spirits, Runes and Arcana have special powers. You will have to learn to handle them and combine them to hope to be chosen.
There will be many strategies that can lead you to victory, but when you appear before the judges, be sure to have by your side powerful Arcana and, if possible, enough runes to best satisfy each of your Spirits...
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting

name: Punderdome: Deluxe Edition
description:
Party game with the goal of coming up with the best (or is it worst?) puns.

Each round a Prompter will read a pun question that will give the first person to come up with the correct answer an extra 30 seconds to come up with their pun in the main part of the round. The prompter will then read from a Green (situation) card and a White (topic) card. Players then have 90 seconds to come up with a pun that fits both cards. The Prompter selects the best pun, gives that player the cards, and that player then becomes the Prompter for the next round. The game ends when one player has 10 pairs of green and white cards.

In addition to the items in the standard edition, the Deluxe Edition contains 10 extra white cards and 10 extra green cards (for 110 of each total,) 4 more small pads (for 6 total,) and 6 pencils.

name: Scouting
description:
Extrapolated from "Play the Game" by Brian Love;

One player plays a dispatch runner trying to break through a cordon of Boy Scout opponents. He begins at the top of the board and tries to get to the bottom. If he succeeds in avoiding being hemmed in by the enemy patrol the game is re-started by the dispatch runner setting off for home from the bottom of the board with the Scout Patrol once more trying to stop him. The game ends when either the Dispatch Runner has completed his double journey or when the scouts have captured him by hemming him in so he cannot move.

name: The Comic Game of the Great Exhibition of 1851
description:
An instructional race game from start to panel number 42, illustrating the Exhibition at Crystal Palace 1851.

This is a 2-6 player game. Order of play is determined by throwing a die. Each player is given a different colored counter and 4 tokens which he throws into the pool when required to do so. There are 22 country squares which are put in a pool. When a player reaches a space marked PRIZE, he draws from the pool the ticket with the same number and also the name of a nation. The game ends when a player arrives at spot number 76, which must be reached by exact roll. Players overshooting the end game spot pay 3 tokens to the pool and go back to number 50. Winner is player with the greatest number of tickets when the game ends.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Sandwiches
description:
Sandwiches is a card game for 2 to 4 players. Players compete to put the most Sandwiches in play, and the first player to have 7 Sandwiches in play or if there are no cards left to draw, then the player with the most Sandwiches wins.

How do you get Sandwiches? You set your opponent up. Every card has two abilities on it, when you play the card, you do both abilities in order. Every card also has a Sandwich on it, when your opponent does the action listed for the Sandwich, then you get to score that card as a Sandwich. The abilities on the card are about either drawing cards, or stealing cards, or replacing cards, or controlling what your opponent draws or has in their hand. In short, you are manipulating your opponent's situation so that they play what you want them to play, so you can score points or 'Sandwich' off of their play.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory

name: X-tra INNINGS
description:
The ultimate game of chance

A baseball fan’s game of choice

Game ncludes: Gameboard, player pieces, 1 set of die and score sheets (sample game included) with instructions

Ages 10 to adult for 1, 2 or more players

name: Highway Patrol
description:
"Enforce the Law and Race to become Chief Inspector".

"Highway Patrol" is a Children's Board Game in which each player, being a Patrol Officer, caries out specific Police Duties corresponding to which space they land on.

There are five moveable markers, being police cars and players progress along spaces by throwing the two dice and following the instructions on each space.

There is a set of Random cards, a set of Action cards and a Police Fund collection box. There are "Reward Point" token to be collected.

The winner of the game is the first Patrol Officer to accumulate 2000 Reward Points, which enables them to be promoted to Detective Sergeant.

(from the instructions)

Game is by Tod Games.

name: Gamer Tycoon
description:
"Take the reins of your very own game company and prove you have what it takes to make it big in this easy to learn and fast to play card game."

This is an ultra simple non-collectible card game where you play cards out of your hand that represent games you want to publish in several categories. You pay money to publish the games, and then collect money as long as you can keep them on the market. Random event cards and such are thrown in for added fun.

All of the cards are humorous parodies, such as "Galaxy Rules Battles (Who needs miniatures when we're just going to argue?)", "Custer's Greatest Triumphs", "Eighth Reich", and "Goths: The Wandering".

name: The Vampire Diaries
description:
The Vampire Diaries is a board game based on the Warner Brothers television show of the same name. Players take on the role of one of four characters from the show, Elena, Stefan, Damon or Bonnie, and begin the game in possession of a photo-frame portraying their character as a human. A switch in the back of the photo-frame can be used to transform the photo into that of a vampire, and the object of the game is to avoid receiving three bite marks, thereby being the last remaining human.

Game play occurs in turns with players moving a dry erase vampire marker/mover around a simple game board. In turn, each player rolls three dice marked with crows and moves the marker/mover zero to three spaces clockwise, depending on the number of crows rolled. The space the marker lands on allows the player to use the top portion of the vampire mover to apply a dry erase vampire bite stamp to another player's photo-frame, erase one of his or her own vampire bites with the supplied dry erase pad, swap photos with another player, or gain control of the Family Crest Ring which protects that player from vampire bites. A roll of zero crows does not move the marker, instead automatically gaining control of the Family Crest Ring for the player who rolled the zero.

When a player receives the third vampire bite on his photo-frame, he can no longer win the game, erase bites, swap photos or possess the Family Crest Ring. However, he can remain in the game, taking turns as normal, but only dealing out vampire bites as allowed. The last player without three vampire bites wins the game.
categories: Fantasy, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dicks & Krakens
description:
This game is a re-theming of Snakes and Ladders to the web comic Looking for Group: the snakes are replaced with the warlock Tiny Dick's fwooshes, and the ladders with the kraken Scooter's tentacles.

It is also an extension of Snakes and Ladders in two ways:

Characters: Each pawn stands for a different LFG character, with its own unique ability, such as rolling twice and choosing the higher number, or reversing the direction of the fwooshes and tentacles.
Hit Points: Each character has hit points, which can be lost by going down a fwoosh, or losing in a combat when one pawn passes another. They are gradually healed by skipping turns.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Corvette Trivia Quiz
description:
From the box...

"This game has been created with the Corvette enthusiast in mind. We have designed the game where one can broaden his knowledge about Corvette history in an atmosphere of competition.

A great deal of effort as been put forth to obtain the data for this game. Hundreds of sources and publications have been checked to ensure the proper answer for each question; including 30 combined years of working on the Corvette Assembly Line. But nothing is absolute in the world of auto production, especially Corvettes. All questions are for the enjoyment of the family."

The game is a trivia game but also a race around the board for a certain number of laps which are agreed upon by the players before starting(standard = 3 laps). Each turn you are asked a question (multiple choice). If you answer correctly you may roll the dice and move that number of spaces. If incorrect then you don't move. There are also some special spaces on the board for flat tire, pit stop, engine trouble, traffic jams, plant tours, etc. The first to finish the set number of laps wins the game.

There are three levels to the game:
1. Beginner: Roll the dice and advance WITHOUT answering questions. (I'm being serious, it's in the rules)
2. Enthusiast: Standard rules.
3. Corvette Buff: Ask questions without multiple choice options.

Contents:
Game Board
Set of 100 trivia cards (6 questions per card)
4 Corvette pawns
Rules

Some question examples(most are pretty tough):
- What was the first year forr AM/FM tape systems? 1963, 1977, or 1979.
- A soft top was available in 1962. True or false.
- How many interior colors were available in 1955? 3, 4, or 6.
- How may 1978 Corevettes were built? 32,966, 37,267, or 46,726.

name: Alias: Suklaaversio / Chokladutgåva
description:
The game is to be played in at least two teams, each team consisting of at least two players.

Each player gets two chocolates from the box, and the teams then take turns explaining ALL of the five words on one of the word cards. If the team manages to explain and guess all the words on the card, they get to take one chocolate from the box. If not, they return one chocolate to the box.
The team that collects the most chocolate gets to eat them in the end.

The box contains the rules, 40 game cards and 32 pieces of milk chocolate.
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Matheeno
description:
Described by the Publisher/Designer:

Fast action, highly competitive game can be played in several levels of difficulty. Good for teaching simple math to youngest children, but serious fun and challenge to college eduacted adults. The game is won by calculation of mathematical possibilities.

name: Ultimate Soccer of America
description:
Described by the Publisher/Designer:

Ultimate Soccer is a new and exciting soccer board game that allows you to be the player as well as the coach. You play against each other alternating as an attacker and a defender. The attacker can select either a Fate or an Action card from draw piles. Action cards map out actual plays with 2-6 passes and a shot on goal. Each Action card has a number on it 5v3 or 3v3. These numbers tell you how many dice you will be rolling against each other for each pass. The attacker is always the first number. If the attacker rolls a higher number it completes the pass and you go on to the next pass, if the defender rolls a higher number than the attacker the pass was not complete and the action card gets discarded and now the defender draws a Fate or Action card and becomes the attacker. If the attacker completes all of his passes and is now at the last line on the card this is the shot on goal. For the shot on goal the attacker and the defender only roll one die a piece to simulate the shooter and the goalkeeper.

Fate cards are things that can happen during a game like red card, injuries, goalkeeper saves. Fate cards can be used at any time to help you in your game. The game is complete when all the action cards have been used. Unless someone has an injury time fate card and wants to use it.

name: Mythrole: Merchants
description: Mythrole: Merchants is a board game of strategic trading set in a fantasy realm. Players take the part of powerful merchants attempting to gain economic prominence throughout the Known Lands. Gold is earned by using caravans to transport resources (wood, grain, fish, stone, ore, and precious metals) from source locations to demand locations which change dynamically during the game. Trading is not always peaceful, though, and merchants must hire mercenaries and build warehouses to protect their shipments. Diplomacy plays a key role as players are free to make all manner deals and treaties with other Merchants, including such things as setting up toll roads or extorting weak trade groups by threatening them. Mythrole: Merchants is suitable for 2-6 players working alone or in teams, and plays in 2-6 hours, with the length being customizable by choosing the appropriate victory conditions.

name: Scoop the Cash
description:
This is a simple gambling game where players roll three dice and add the stated amount of money on the dice to the kitty. If the player rolls three "Scoop the Cash!" (a 27-1 chance) they collect the money in the kitty.

An additional die can be added that is marked with Good Luck/Bad Luck and allows the player to pay or receive more money by selecting the appropriate card.

This game comes with a casino mat table cloth, play money, the set of dice and a dice shaker.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ion Glory
description:
Ion Glory is an interstellar confrontation simulation, a strategic card game set in the unforgiving realm of space. Maintain your planetary alliance, economics and keep the odd Kothian out of your parsec! Starships move vast stretches of space in the blink of an eye, making a board or playing pieces unnecessary. Players purchase ships made by all races, allowing for an interesting mix of weaponry in every fleet. Advanced rules allow for boarding parties, secret weapons, weapon refitting, planetary and ship capture, terrorism and sabotage.

The company truly deserves its name as the game comes unmounted and uncut --you must even supply the required pair of dice. This is crude desktop-publishing grade, but it looks like fun.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Exploration, Political, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Mount Everest
description:
Players must place tiles containing various rope positions on a board. They try to connect their ropes, avoiding the maze of trees and cliffs, to be the first to reach the top of the board. Once the first player climbs to the top, each player scores his/her route gaining points from the various tiles played. The person with the most points wins.

A solitaire game can be played by taking 30 tiles and using them all to reach the top.

name: Black Beauty Downs
description:
Black Beauty Downs - the Ultimate Party Game "King of Racing Games"
This is a pretty crazy drinking game. Players roll to move their horse around the track, often landing on spots causing many other players to drink. And remember, no one is allowed a pee break until the 'pee break' card is drawn.

name: PRO-GRIDIRON
description: PRO-GRIDIRON is played by two opponents on a rectangular field (board) consisting of sixty-four rectangular, half light color and half dark color. Each opponent has a team consisting of sixteen pieces. All the pieces of this game have their own value and power relative to the HEAD COACH. With his authority and strategy, the HEAD COACH’S ultimate desire is to beat the opponent’s HEAD COACH. When a piece can force the HEAD COACH to move, this is called a Down. If he stops the HEAD COACH’S movement, this is a Touchdown. The first team to get a Touchdown, therefore, wins the game.

name: Savana
description:
In this game players have to climb a mountain. The one who does that the first wins.

At the start all players take chance tokens and place them upside down on various board tiles. Later each player gets energy tokens. Then they roll the die and move as many tiles as the number they rolled. If a player wants, he/she could lose one (or more) of his energy tokens and go climb as many spaces as the number of energy tokens he/she gave up. If player steps on a chance token, he/she must take it and do whatever it says. There are various tokens - some orders to go some spaces up or down, some orders to roll die again. If player takes a card with a lion or aborigines, he must fight by placing any number of energy tokens between 1 and 5 and rolling die. If rolled number is higher than tokens placed, player will lose. If player loses to the aborigines, they will rob him/her and the player will lose all energy tokens. If player loses against the lion, he will have to fight again and again (each fight is one turn). If player loses all of his/her energy tokens, he/she loses the game. If player passes another player, he/she must give him/her one energy token. If player steps on tile occupied by other player, that other player must give him/her energy token. If player wins against lion, he must go back to the nearest village. If two players step on lion at the same time, they must fight against the lion together by placing energy tokens. They can place no more than 5 tokens as a group.
This game was released by Azar in Lithuania so it could be unknown in other parts of the world.

name: Networking
description:
"NETWORKING the game of success" is an unusual themed game, with pretty usual game mechanics (roll the dice, move the pawn, do what is written).

It seems that this game has been published to promote a buying club (like Amway). All the goals in the game are glorification of selling to contacts, buying cassettes and books about positive thinking, attending seminars and rallies and building finally the most effective network to distribute goods. The title of the game refers to this selling network. Not surprisingly, the winner is the one to accumulate the most "Life Style points".

The last section of the rulebook is dedicated to a sale speech, trying to convince the players to join the "EARTHRISE CLUB".

The production value of the game is above average, nice components and an impressive storage tray. It was published in Quebec, Canada in 1993. It exists in an English and a French version.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Seduction
description:
Best played with open-minded couples because of its adult theme, the game starts with each player being dealt six "Rendezvous" cards. These are the locations where they must perform a 'Seduction'.

Players roll dice and move around the board performing tasks and generating random events like "Kiss the player on your left", "Remove an article of clothing" or "Dance for 15 seconds". As a reward for performing some actions, points are scored.

The first player to accumulate 15 points and reach all six of his rendezvous locations wins the game.
publishers: Banco, CreaTek, Dynamic Games / Dynamic Design Industries, Paragon Reiss, Reiss Games

name: Conversation Cards
description:
On September 27, 1784 the following game ad appeared in the newspaper the Baltimore Intelligencer:

'Just published and for sale ... a new and elegant edition of the much admired Conversation Cards, containing a variety of amusing, entertaining and innocent questions and answers in the art of courtship. Each pack contains sixty-four cards, thirty-two questions in black and thirty-two answers in red.

Apparently one player would read a question and another of the opposite sex would follow with a randomly-drawn answer, to everyone's amusement.

While it may not sound like much of a game, it may well be the first American commercial game design ever.

name: Lakeedah
description:
Lakeedah is an exciting strategy game that's fast to learn and helps build critical thinking and planning skills while having fun. Both children and adults enjoy Lakeedah's varieties of play, which includes two-player, four-player, and team play variations that span the range from very strategic to fast and tactical.

Lakeedah is designed as an "Open Source" game, that is, players have the ability to create new game variations and submit them to this website and for possible inclusion in the Official Rulebook.

www.lakeedah.com (no longer available)

name: Troll Knuckles
description:
Troll Knuckles is a dice rolling game, consisting of three dice:

- The "Knuckle", a green die with even numbers (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12)
- The "Toe", a purple die with odd numbers (1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11)
- The "Eye", a red die with the troll-primes (1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 9)

A turn consists of three "slices", consisting of rolling particular dice. After the rolls, the player will have gathered three numbers, which are then matched up to particular "gut" (ie, combination). A couple are poker-like (two of a kind, three of a kind), while a few other guts are preset (for example, 6-9-2 is called Aphrodite's Smile).

The first slice consists of rolling all three dice, keeping two and throwing one away. You must remember the two numbers AND remember which number came from which die. As an example (to assist in describing the next slices), you roll green-2 purple-9 red-7 and decide to keep the purple and red dice.

The second slice consists of re-rolling the two kept dice. You must then throw out of of those two dice, and keep the two numbers from the kept die. To continue the example, you re-roll the purple and red dice and get purple-1 red-3. You decide to keep the purple, which means your two numbers are 9 (from the first slice) and 1 (from this slice).

The third slice consists of rerolling the die chosen for your third number. To continue the example, you reroll purple and get 5, making your three numbers 9, 1 and 5. These can now be arranged in any order and compared against the scoring table to determine poker-like ranking against other players in the same round. Highest gut wins.

One minor exception are "The Loads", which are guts that must be matched against all three dice in the first slice only. Rolling one of those is an automatic win.

name: The Amazing Dunninger Mind Reading Game
description:
This game isn't exactly played to "win", but instead players get a score in percentage points which determines their levels of telepathic powers. The percent ranges are as follows: 100% to 82%, Exceptional Telepathic Powers; 81% to 70%, Good Telepathic Powers; over 52%, Some Telepathic Powers. Points are earned by mentally reading images on game cards that other players send to you telepathically.

Players move game pawns around the board along a path that goes through the "Sky Temple," "Earth Temple," "Sun Temple," and "Moon Temple". After circling the board players arrive at the "Thought Plateau", which surrounds a picture of Mr. Dunninger, the game's creator and reputed "Man with the Miracle Mind" (according to the instruction sheet). Hints are included on the instruction sheet about how to concentrate and utilize your telepathic powers.

The game board is brightly colored and features Egyptian hieroglyphics throughout. Four sets of "Cycle" cards displaying letters, numbers, shapes, and colors, and four game pawns, as well as score sheets, the game board, and instructions sheet (one, double sided) complete the game.

The rules are a double sided 8.5 x 11 sheet of paper. On the bottom of page 2, it states the game was "created by Joseph Dunninger," 1967 Hassenfeld Bros., Inc., Pawtucket, RI USA.

The bgg data based listed Sid Sackson as the designer but this is not correct. Sid does reference it twice in his journals on 10/29/67 and 11/7/67. He writes that he thinks "The Amazing Dunninger Mind Reading Game" resembled "I Spy."

name: Hyper Battle
description:
2091 - On the fiftieth anniversary of the official establishment of the colony, New Terra declares itself independent of Earth's rule. Earth, her own resources exhausted, has no choice but to go to war. The Alpha Centaurian Revolution has begun... [A] fast-paced tactical game simulating ship to ship combat in hyperspace. Included in the rules are 5 scenarios from the Alpha Centaurian Revolution, with alternates allowing you to choose your own forces.

Counters represent individual ships. The following ship types are included: police, destroyer, light cruiser, heavy cruiser, space fortress, battleship, dreadnought, and freighter. Each turn equals one minute and each hex is (ahem) 11 million miles (not a typo).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Gosford Park
description:
You are invited to stay at Gosford Park – one of the great English country houses at the height of its fame. You’ll enter a vanished world of cut crystal and hushed voices where, in November 1933, Sir William McCordle and his wife Sylvia are gathering friends and relations for a country weekend lived in high style. A secret world, however, exists below stairs, where the servants see and hear far more than they should.

The object of the game is to be the last person alive or the first person to go all the way through the country house rooms and exit the front door.

name: Family Reunion: The Game
description:
Do you remember your first kiss? Can you recall how your grandparents met and fell in love? Family Reunion: The Game is an exciting new board game that comes complete with 240 photo cards that will inspire friends and family to recall memories, pass down traditions and reveal never-been-told stories and family secrets. Skeleton in the Closet, Snapshots, “You’re not telling the whole story” and Family Secret cards provide lively competition allowing players to challenge stories and thwart opponents. The first player to collect one photo from each category, (Traditions, Magic Moments, Happy Days and Hand Me Downs) wins. Losers tell all as the winner asks all players to reveal a family secret.

Family Reunion: The Game can be customized when players use their own photos in game play and trace their family history with the provided "Family Tree illustration". Reproducible invitations allow friends and family to personalize each Family Reunion occasion.

-- Source: USAopoly.com
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Storytelling

name: Die-Roll
description: Players start with four dice each at opposite ends of a small board. On a turn a die rolls one or two spaces, thereby changing the face showing. Landing on an opponent's die with a die showing a higher number captures it. The goal is to capture your opponent's dice or leave them with no legal move.

name: Gambo!
description: Gambo is played with a pack of 105 cards (4 sets of 1-26) and a joker). The object of the game is to get rid of one's cards by making or adding to combinations of cards on the table and forming sets and runs of cards. The player who first gets rid of all his ten cards wins the hand and is paid by each of the other players 3 chips for each card they have left in their hands.

name: Graduation Card Game
description: This is a card game based on the famous Japanese PC game "Graduation". The aim of the game is to provide proper guidance to 5 different girls and help them graduate.

name: Four Square
description: FOUR SQUARE is a fast-moving game that's easy to learn. It's sort of a combination of concentration and rummy. The three face card characters in the deck represent the qualities that help to win. They are LUCK, BRAINS, and COURAGE. It takes LUCK to draw the right card at the right time, BRAINS to remember cards you only see once, and COURAGE to save for a FOUR SQUARE call. The objective is to go out early and catch your opponents with big counts in their hands. There are two ways to go out. One is to KNOCK, betting that you have the lowest hand around the table. The other is to build a hand with four-of-a-kind. During the play, hands are kept face down on the table and arranged in a square, hence the name "FOUR SQUARE." In either case, the losing players' scores are increased by the number of the points in their hands, in some cases doubled or tripled, as later described. The game continues until at least one player has a total score of 100 or more. The player with the lowest score is the winner. In case of a tie, the winners share the honor.

name: The Barbie Game
description: Take Barbie on an exciting cross country personal appearance tour. Be the first player to reach the Barbie awards presentation at Finish with three personal appearance cards.

name: Track & Trap
description:
Players move their elephant mounted hunting parties about a jungle-hunt themed board by using a spinner that dictates their movement as well as special spaces on the board. Players are hunting a tiger that moves about randomly on the board through cards drawn by players on their turn. The player that captures the tiger wins.

An attractively painted hunting scene on the board makes the game a nice display piece, but gameplay leaves a great deal to be desired.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Little Engine That Could
description: Players try to obtain toy tokens that match their train car card. The first player to reach the Town space with a full toy train card wins.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Combat Tank Game
description: Each player spins for a color tank and a starting space. Players move in only one direction for each spin except diagonally. Only one tank per space and no tank can be jumped. If your tank lands on an enemy space, you must fight by spinning the spinner for the outcome. The first tank to reach H.Q. wins.
categories: Children's Game, Fighting, World War II
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Stone Protectors
description: Players try to reach the Evil Zok while collecting cool sounds and weapon cards.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Waffling
description: Waffling is a simple, fun to play activity game, similar to checkers or dominoes, involving both skill and luck.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Let's Help for Shabbos
description: A game where the player spins a spinner to move across the colorful playing board to get ready for Shabbos. When all the pre-Shabbos tasks have been completed, it's finally time to welcome Shabbos!

name: Aliyah
description: A question and answer game that increases your knowledge about Jewish history and culture. An advanced version was published in 1978.

name: Risky Roll
description: Collect the most points. Each card counts 5, 10 or 15 points. Players match marbles in the Risky Roll box to patterns on the cards. A correct match wins the card and thus the points.

name: Possibility Thinkers Game
description: Players move up the mountain trying to stay on the main path of Success. As they climb upward they may stray onto the paths of Doubts, Delays and Setbacks. During the course of the game, the players are invited to share their own real life experiences, and describe how they overcame their problems through possibility thinking.

name: Barney Picture Game
description:
Join in the fun as you travel around the neighborhood matching colors and collecting photos of your friends Barney and Baby Bop. you'll even take photos of one another with Barney's super camera spinner. If you're the first player to collect one each of all five sights, you win.

The object of the game is to move a stand-up playing piece along the pathway and take five pictures of Barney. Movement is determined by a spinner with a player moving forward to the color indicated by the result. The spinner is a clever representation of a camera. Players draw one or two cards when landing on designated areas. Some cards require a player to take a "pretend" picture of another contestant with the camera/spinner while that kid makes a certain facial expression. The Rainbow Picture cards are drawn randomly as player land on spaces that reward a lucky spin. Each player tries to assemble a complete set of five different Barney poses and win the game.

(description stolen from Pete Belli's review: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/496407/i-love-you-you-lo...-)
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: On the Right Track
description: The first player to complete 5 laps around the track wins. Collect as many of the virtue cards as you can in order to successfully pass Challenge spaces around the track. Collect equipment cards to avoid track hazards that would send you back to the pit stop. The gold faith cards are wild cards and may be used in place of equipment or virtue cards.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Alphabet Snap
description:
The traditional game of snap, with large letters on these large cards.

Alternatively, lay out 10 cards and see how many words can be made.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Touch and Feel
description:
From the box:
"Each player has 6 coloured stickers attached to their body. Turns are taken to throw the giant coloured dice, and a hand or foot is placed on another person's sticker of the colour thrown.
"Before long there is a mass of writhing bodies in the room!
"How embarrassing it gets depends on where people put their stickers!
"CONTENTS: 200 Touch and Feel Stickers, one giant wood dice"
Produced for C&A shops.

name: Choo Choo
description: Deal six cards to each player. Place deck in middle of table. First player must lay down an engine, or draw a card from the deck. Play continues with all players trying to place an engine on the board or drawing a card. Players add to the engine by laying down a car of the same color. Only one card may be played per turn. After 11 cars have been played on the engine, a caboose can be added to complete the train. During a turn, a player may play an engine of a different color and start a new train. Players may add cars of the same color to any train engine. The first player to get rid of all their cards is the winner.

name: The Web
description: The Web is a two man game played with twelve white pins and 12 green pins on the "webbed" area of the accompanying (cork) board. There are one hundred twelve small spaces and the pins never move outside the playing area. Green's objective is to keep White from scoring all twelve pins in the two hour time limit. If Green can keep even one White pin in that time, Green wins. White wins by getting all twelve pins into the first row.

name: The Mad Microbe
description:
A simple game about dental hygiene.

Two tracks are side-by-side on the board, one for the "dentist" player, and one for the "germ" player. Players try to get to the finish first by rolling a die, and trying to avoid spots on the track that will cause them to lose turns or have to move backwards.

name: Cup Final
description:
This game is very similar to the Palitoy "Striker" soccer game, but without the build quality or fun factor.

The pitch is made of a peculiar green material with a strange foam backing that sticks to the carpet; the goals are identical to the one in Striker, but with plastic netting. The game comes supplied with two teams - red and blue, but instead of 5 players per team of Striker, Cup Final only has 3 players on each side.

The two outfield players are plastic with a metal kicking leg, with one player having a bent leg, and one a straight leg. The straight legged player had a scooped foot for lobbing the ball, but this mechanism doesn't work very well. The kicking action is controlled by a button on the back of the base as opposed to the "bash 'em on the head" mechanism used in Striker. Additionally, the figures are very badly designed, and the slightest movement causes them to fall over (are they Christian Ronaldo in disguise?).

The goalkeepers are identical in design to the original Striker goalkeepers, as they swivel at the waist and have a crooked arm for throwing the ball out.

The ball is not round, but more of a honeycomb. One half of the ball is coloured red, the other half blue. The team whose colour is on the top face of the ball when it comes to rest has the right to play the ball, so the purpose of the game is always keep the top face of your colour visible while dribbling.

Basically it's a cheap reproduction of Striker by Palitoy. Avoid.

name: Counterpoint
description:
Counterpoint consists of a raised dark golden plastic board (two inches high and thirteen and a half inches in width and length... it fits rather precisely into the square box), four plastic player markers (green, red, blue, and yellow), and a single six-sided die.
There is no instruction manual; the instructions are printed on the back of the box's top.
The player markers are slightly oddly shaped for no apparent reason, and somewhat resemble modern art that's not supposed to look like anything in particular. Stand a rectangle up so it's tall, then cut a very wide and short triangle out of one side, and that's the basic shape.
The board has a number of odd features. The center of it is a square that sinks down slightly into a square piece of black foam. This is where the die and player pieces rest when the game isn't being played. Around the center of the board is a narrow track with black and white arrows that can be flipped horizontally to show an arrow pointing in the opposite direction. In one direction, the arrow is black and the background is white... in the other direction, the colors are reversed. Each corner of the board has a tiny colored slot for the appropriate player piece to rest just before start... however, the groove isn't very deep at all and it's easy for the tall pieces to get knocked out.
The game is very simple. Two players take a clockwise route along one side of the track, and two others take a counterclockwise route along the other side. A player rolls a die, and moves his piece the appropriate number of spaces. If the final resting place for his piece is on a spot where the arrow is turned the wrong way, he must move back to the closest arrow that points in the proper direction, and then flips any arrows he wishes on the board equal to the number rolled on the die. The first player that makes a full circle around the board and lands on or passes his starting point wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spin the Beetle Board Game
description: Spin the Beetle plays two different games that teach toddlers about listening to, and following directions. The first game is a classic "Simon Says" type of game. In the second game, players take turn spinning the beetle who then gives a command (such as "jump" or "touch your nose") in a sequence, and players have to remember the sequence to repeat the actions already given. Definitely a motor skill enhancer.

name: BBC Match Of The Day: Football Trivia
description: Players must roll a die and then answer the appropriate football related question. Correct answers mean they continue and the game ends when 1 player has successfully answered a question from each of the 6 categories.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Goofin' Around with Goofy
description: This memory game also teaches young children about colors and patterns. Goofy is a cardboard cutout in front of a color wheel. He is standing on his head and the contents of his pockets (the memory cards) have fallen onto the table. A player draws a "pose" card and tries to move Goofy's legs to the correct colors and position. If correct, the player may then turn over two pocket item cards (revealing things like cookies, yo-yos and rubber chickens) and keep them if they match. When all the pocket item cards are gone, the player with the most matches wins.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mystic Eye
description: Mystic Eye, as proclaimed by its inventors, "can be used for games, parties, self-analysis, psychoanalysis. . . as a Lie Detector [...]. [It] responds to the subconscious, the conscious, and the superconscious mind!!!" Unlike the Ouija board with its seance associations, Barker and Greene (the Mystic Eye designers) primarily claimed an association between the game equipment and the mind of the participant. In Mystic Eye, the querant suspends a pendulum over the board and asks his/her questions. The motion of the pendulum carries it over a dial containing "Yes", "No", numbers and months to provide an answer.

name: Guess-a-Doodle!
description:
Each player takes some paper and a pencil (four are provided). Chose any player to be the first Instructor. All other players are Doodlers for the first round and rotate for later rounds.

The Instructor takes the top card from the Doodle deck and tries to describe as best they can the object on the card using only "technical" terms. The Doodlers follow the directions of the Instructor, trying to recreate the object on their Doodle Sheet. No one can look at another's drawing. Once the Instructor announces the description is complete, each Doodler secretly writes down what they think the object on their sheet is.

Each correct identification is worth one point to the Instructor. Each correct Doodler gets one point. So, if 3 Doodlers guess correctly, they each get one point and the Instructor gets 3 points. The player with the most points at the end is the winner.
mechanics: Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Färgpass
description:
The playing board of Färgpass consists of a 5x5 grid.

During the first phase of the game, the players take turns filling the grid with black and white chits, one in each space except one.

In the second phase, the players take turns placing another type of chit that has a 1x2 shape, and that has two colored dots on it: white-white, white-black or black-black. Each chit must be placed so that it corresponds to the chits placed during the first phase.

The first player that can't legally place a chit in the second phase loses.

name: Strawberry Shortcake Fun Dough Tea Party Game
description:
From the box back:

Ages 4 and up

Join Strawberry Shortcake and her berry best friends in making strawberry scented Fun Dough desserts. The first friend to make 4 different desserts and bring them to the tea party in the middle of the game board wins. Be careful though as one wrong spin can make you drop a dessert.

Contents:

Gameboard
6 Containers of strawberry scented multi-color Fun Dough
4 Character play pieces
4 Dessert score cards
2 Dessert shaper molding trays
Fun Dough tool
Spinner

name: Simpsons:  3 Card Games in One
description:
Three card games using a deck with four colored suits of card numbers 1-13, the ones being Homer, the twos Marge, etc. Fun graphics!

The games are Crazy Eats (2-4 players, get rid of all one's cards), Cheat (3-8 players, get rid of all one's cards, with bluffing component), and Bad Memory (1-8 players, collect pairs).

Be sure to bring a magnifying glass to read the rules cards.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Trick-taking

name: Barney's Follow the Egg Game
description: This is a simple track game featuring an electronic Barney the Dinosaur. On your turn you spin the spinner and advance your pawn across the game board to the next open space of the color spun. When you reach an Egg Token Space you must stop and spin the dotted wheel next to the space. When it stops, you take the electronic Barney wand and press down on any one of the dots on the wheel. If Barney's light blinks and he makes a happy sound, you collect an Egg Token and can move on next turn. If Barney's light doesn't blink and he makes a sad sound, you don't collect a token and must try again next turn. The first player to reach the Finish Space with all his eggs and the Twinken Token wins.
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Wiggles Activity Game
description: What’s red, yellow, blue and purple and fun all over? It’s The Wiggles! Join Anthony, Greg, Murray, Jeff and their friends Dorothy the Dinosaur, Wags the Dog, Henry the Octopus, and Captain Feathersword in this unique activity game. Children will sing, dance, act, count, identify colors, shapes, and learn their ABC’s as they travel around the game board. If they can complete the activity or answer the question correctly, they move ahead as instructed by the card; Name something that has feathers? Move ahead 4 spaces or how many legs does Henry have? Move ahead 3 spaces. If they land on an activity space, they may have to sing like Dorothy or bark like Wags. First one to the finish space wins the game. Game comes with game board, 8 character pieces, 12 movement cards, 36 activity cards and 16 character cards. For 2 – 8 players.
