Why pull numbers out of a bag, when you can sit back and watch every draw 'live' on your home TV with family and friends. And there's no need to shout out the numbers anymore - not when Mike Vyse, National Bingo Caller of the Year, calls every game for you!"

The game is played using a DVD and TV (or PC) to run the game and announce the numbers. Players have wipe-clean bingo cards and mark off their numbers with pens provided. The first one to complete the card is supposed to say "Party Bingo" and then gets to sing and dance to 'The Winners Song', if they want.

name: Library Adventure, The Fun Way to Learn
description: Move about the library and visit the areas on the assignment card and answer questions from each area. The first player to leave after getting all four of the areas checked off their library card is the winner.

name: States & Capitals Card Game
description:
Pack up the car! Tour the United States....and boost your knowledge of states and capitals along the way!
- Match wits with you friends and earn points by pairing question and answer cards.
- The player with the most correct pairs wins!

The maps match when the answers are correct!

name: Soap Opera Challenge II:  General Hospital
description:
[From back of card deck:]

"Millions of women have taken the original Soap Opera Challenge: General Hospital.

Now ... the saga continues with Soap Opera Challenge II.

New questions and answers from the 1980's reveal it all about your favorite characters and twisting plots.

PLUS! Each deck contains Bonus Recipes to let you prepare delicious meals 'Soap Style.' "

This is a trivia game consisting of 46 cards and a standard 6-sided die. There are 6 questions on each card, numbered 1 through 6. The higher the number, the more difficult the question. The questions are about the soap opera General Hospital, covering the decade of the 1980s.

A player rolls a die and has the top card of the deck read to them, based on the number rolled. If the question is answered correctly, the person keeps the card and rolls again. If incorrect, the card goes on the bottom of the deck, and it's the next players turn.

The game is over when the draw deck is empty. The person with the most cards wins.

Note that due to the recycling of the cards, this can be a very lengthy game if the players are not experts on General Hospital of the 1980s.

There are also rules for solo play (go through the deck once, rolling the die for each one -- if you get 27 or more correct, you win).

Also, as mentioned on the back of the card deck, included as a bonus are 9 recipes inspired by the characters of General Hospital.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Blast-Off
description:
This is a space race game that uses a spinner for movement and has 3 types of cards for different spaces landed upon. The goal is to complete a race around the solar system and back to earth. Entering and leaving planets requires a special roll on the spinner.

It is patented - #3985361 and the text below is from the patent.

Abstract

A game device embodying a game board having a planar playing surface having a path of movement for game pieces delineated thereon, a control spinner and directional cards positioned on the game board for controlling movement of the game pieces. The path of movement is divided into a plurality of increments or areas some of which are provided with instructional indicia. The game pieces simulate rockets and the game board, spinner, control cards and indicia relate to and are simulative of space travel.

name: Black Americans of Achievement: The Game
description:
This question and answer style game is played by groups of two to six. Players/partners "bet" on the success of the answers with points. The objective: answer your question correctly or guess whether another landing player will answer his or her question correctly, winning or losing points accordingly.

This game presents very positive role models in a way that heightens one's awareness of the achievements of Black Americans. Be inspired by the triumphs and struggles of both celebrated and unheralded Black Achievers who are part of this heritage of American success.

The box states that the game is "Based on Chelsea House Publisher's critically acclaimed 'Black Americans of Achievement' series of books, drawing from the expertise of the W.E.B. DuBois Institute of Afro-American Research, Harvard University", and was "sponsored by Burger King and Grolier Books".
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dicey Dunces
description:
From the cover:
"A Pop-O-Matic game for younger children" (ages 4-9)

Dunce hats of four different colors square off by lining up along each edge of the square board with a Pop-O-Matic bubble in the middle.

name: Geist Junior
description:
From the Manufacturer:

GEIST Junior takes young players on a wild journey to meet the 13 adorable Pet Geists. It is the most fun and imaginative children's game yet! GEIST Junior is the first combination puzzle and board game, with 4 different puzzles for 4 times the fun!
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Horror, Humor, Puzzle

name: Farm Lotto
description:
From the box:

CONTENTS: 4 Playing Boards, 36 Cards.

HOW TO PLAY: Each player takes a playing board and the smaller cards are placed face down on the table. The youngest player starts by turning over one of the cards and matching it with one of the characters on his playing board. If he cannot, he leaves the card face upwards on the table. The next player may then take this card or selects another. Play continues; should a player turn over a card the he already has, play passes to the next player.

The winner is the first player to cover all his characters on his playing board.

FOR OLDER CHILDREN: If a player picks up a card he does not need he replaces the card face downwards on the table. The other players then have to remember where that card was replaced if they need that particular character.
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement
publishers: Damm / Egmont, The Boots Company, PLC

name: SnuggleBumms Family
description: For children 4 to 8 years old. Spin and move along a board to be the first to reach Momma and Pappa SnuggleBumms.

name: Godzilla Game
description:
Includes board with art graphics depicting Godzilla, four plastic conical game pieces, a small wooden red disc to represent a "radioactive missile", and a cardboard spinner.

"Object: To get your marker to the Rocket Launch Area in order to fire the missile at Godzilla's vital spots."

This was the very first Godzilla toy produced in the United States, and only the second Godzilla toy ever made (the first being a simple suction-cup dart gun set with Godzilla artwork on the cardboard backing made in Japan in 1955).

name: Forza
description: Two teams are formed between them the boardgame is put with a rope on top of it. Each team draws a card on their turn, on each card there are 3 questions or tasks. The person that has drawn the card poses the question or hands out the task to a person of the other group. For every successfull task or question solved that team may pull the rope. The team that is the first to pull the rope into the end space on the board wins the game.

name: Schuss the Skiing Boardgame
description:
Schuss looks like it is becoming the new choice of after-dinner board gamers, pushing Trivial Pursuit off the table.

The board itself is designed like a piste map, with blue runs throwing up easy Alpine-related questions, with tougher questions on the testing blacks. Mountain restaurant stops help you to change runs and wipe-outs can have 'hilarious consequences' - with dares (why not make up your own?) in order for fallers.

Box Contents:
Mountain shaped playing board (60 x 40cms)
6 wooden playing pieces + 1 die
1 wooden shaker +1 wooden card holder (inspired by the shape of a bobsleigh!)
Schuss question cards (120 blue, 120 red and 120 black questions)
30 Schuss mountain restaurant cards
40 Schuss wipe-out dare cards (including 5 blanks to add your own dares!)

http://www.schuss.co.uk/

name: Ciclismo de Mesa
description: Hard to find Spanish cycling game that appeared in the early '90s released by small independent Spanish sports game publisher Azul 4 Juegos. The game consists of a one-day race, but the rules offer the possibility of playing a five stage race (In fact, nothing prevents us from playing three or twenty stages...) Although the game is quite simple, there is some ambition in it. The riders are supposed to climb the Tourmalet, Lagos de Covadonga and the Mortirolo mountains. The teams are composed of four riders (well, counters colored in green, purple, yellow and red, each color for a team), one of them being the leader. The leader has the privilege of something called turbo, which is not more than throwing two dice instead of one. This can be done four times during the race.

name: De Pfaffs
description: This game is based upon the TV-series about the family (and the house) of ex-goalkeeper Jean-Marie Pfaff (ex-keeper of Bayern München & the Belgian National Team). All major characters of the series are in the game. The winner is the one who collects swimming gear first so he/she can take a dive in the family swimming pool.

name: Eco-Logica
description: Eco-Logica is a game for children ages 8 to 14 years old. It let's the child realize that there are certain problems with our environment that threaten the earth. The gameboard carries a drawing of a sad world. During the play the child is stimulated to find the right answers to ecological problems. The goal of the game is to get back a smile on the earth on the board. The game contains a board, a spinning device (with the image of a sad world), 1 die, 6 pawns, 6 cards with ecological issues, 16 chips, 16 cards with illustrations of ecological problems (like some animal species that are threatened to be distinguished), 55 solution cards and a manual of the game.

name: Toy Store
description: Toy Store - A first looking game, is a game for 1-2 players ages 2+. The game consists of a board with a picture of four shelves with toys on them and 24 tiles with matching toy pictures. The goal for each player is to pick a tile and find toy on a shelf that matches that tile. When a match is found the player places the tile in a picture of a basket next to each shelf.

name: Loose Connections
description: Loose Connections is billed as "The Game Where One Good Word Deserves Another." Players are given three words related to a fourth word which they must discern -- somewhat similar to Tribond. Players have a choice of 3 category levels -- easy, medium and difficult -- and can move on 3 different tracks -- long, medium and short -- to move on the board. The game has 500 cards for a total of 1,500 Loose Connections questions.

name: Kong Power Slam Battle Card Game
description:
Each player begins with a hand of five cards. The cards have either a number (from 2-8- some of which also have special powers) or a picture of Kong. In each round of the battle, players simultaneously selects a card and places it face down in front of him. The cards are then revealed and, in general, the card with the higher number wins the round (with some exceptions due to Kong cards and special powers.)
The winner of the round either moves the Kong figure to the first space on his side of the board if he did not win the last round or advances Kong a space if he won the last round. The loser gets to draw a card. In the case of a tie, both players draw two cards.
A player must win three rounds in a row in order to win the game. If the deck is exhausted before someone has won 3 in a row, the player who has won the most rounds (tallied by keeping the cards from won battles in front of him) wins. A player can also lose by running out of cards.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Travel 2 Games
description:
[Publisher]
Great on the road, at home, and every place in between. Travel fun for the whole family.
Play I Spy, Road Sign Challenge, and more with 54 colorful cards!

[Submitter]
A collection of simple kid games suitable for playing at travel.
(1) ROAD SIGN DOMINOES - a domino game using road sign paired cards.
(2) ROAD SIGN CHALLENGE - Looking around outside the car for the road sign pictured on card.
(3)I SPY - Looking around to spy the letter (from the drawn card) on license plates, billboards, signs or anywhere else.
(4) I SPY, TOO! - Looking for things that begin with the pictured letter.
(5) ALPHABET TRAVELER - Name a place that begins with the pictured letter.
(6) I'M GOING ON A TRIP... - Make a word chain using words that start with the pictured letter(s), and alternately repeating the word chain plus a new word.

name: SS: Third Reich
description:
Issue game of Simulator #33, 25 April 1991.

Republished as an issue game of Command Magazine Japan #72, 20 Dec 2006, along with First World War.

"SS" means "Sugoroku-Simulation".

A multi-player game in which players play German generals fighting for the honor to be the first to reach Moscow.
publishers: Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社), Sho-Kikaku

name: Dick Tracy Crime Stopper
description:
Twenty clue slides are randomly placed in the slots on the gameboard. One of the eight criminal portraits is chosen secretly and placed inside the gameboard. The portrait is now hidden by the clue slides.

Each player, in turn, spins the spinner. The spinner will tell the player which two clues may be removed from the gameboard. The player may then guess which of the eight portraits is concealed by the slides by pressing the appropriate button on the gameboard. If the word "guilty" lights up, then the player has solved the mystery and won the game.

The game uses one "D" battery and a standard flashlight's bulb.

name: Travel Time Spinner Game
description: Travel Time is a car themed spin-and-move game given as a toy with meal by Ruby's Diners. Players move their car down a twisty road, following the instructions on the spaces. Completely random and similar to Snakes and Ladders, though thankfully shorter.

name: The International Pro-Am Sailboard Game
description: Designed and published by the sailboarding community in 1988, Pro-Am pits players (sailboarders) against each other as they race around the board collecting sponsorships, forging a career, and testing their knowledge on sailboarding. The game can be played on three different levels, from the experienced sail boarder down to the first timers and non-sailboarders who play on the 'Learner' level. Nicely outfitted with plenty of sponsorship options, career directions, and 'sailboards' pieces, the game delves deep into the world of sailboard racing.

name: Joseph and His Coat of Many Colors
description:
Joseph And His Coat Of Many Colors is a variation on the popular game of UNO with uniquely illustrated cards depicting the biblical character of Joseph wearing his colored coats. Players are trying to empty their hands of cards by playing them to a common pile, matching cards by color, number, or action. The deck is made up of 4 sets of differently colored cards with numbers from 1 to 6. There are also Miracle cards (wild cards), cards that cause the next player to pick up 1 or 2 cards, and Skip cards.

Note: This game is different from UNO in the following ways:
- Instead of "Draw 4 wild cards", this game contains some "Draw 1" cards. This is in addition to the "Draw 2 cards" both games have.
- This game has only a 35-card deck.
- When a person has only one card left in their hand, they are to call out "Joseph".

name: Let's Dance
description:
The title and theme comes from the Swedish TV show, licensed from BBC. So far, the game has only been published in Sweden.

The idea of the show, which is also running in Germany and perhaps other countries, is to have celebrities learning to dance and compete against each other. In the game, players do the same thing, following instructions on the DVD. There are also 225 cards with 1275 trivia questions on dancing, music and movies.

3-5 players or teams, ages 12 and up.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Train Chess
description: Despite its name, this game bears no resemblance to chess whatsoever. It seems to be a roll and move of the same caliber of Chutes and Ladders.

name: Christmas Tree
description: Christmas-themed pattern matching. The object of play is to spot "three of a kind" matches of Christmas ornaments. As cards are turned over, one by one, into a three by three grid, players look for cards with something in common (either the color of the ornament or one of six Christmas symbols on the ornament). Three levels of play, with increasingly difficult matching conditions, will challenge players of varying ages.

name: Sternenschweif: Sprung in die Nacht
description:
One of a series of Kosmos games based on the My Secret Unicorn books by Linda Chapman.

In Germany, the series goes by the name, "Sternenschweif" (Star Tail) and the books are also published by Kosmos.

Sprung in die Nacht is based on the second book in the series, with the same title. It's a card game and the cards display one of three pictures: Silver, a pony; obstacles to jump; and fire. The player who gains the most cards wins.

name: St. Petersburg Express
description:
Business spirited railroad game for 2 to 4 players or teams. During play, players travel from location to location to make deals and deliver goods. Most movement happens in southeast Finland between Helsinki and St. Petersburg in Russia.

Heavy dice-fest during business actions and low player interaction in game. Account management and risk evaluation during business trades.
categories: Dice, Economic, Negotiation, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Photo Crime
description:
From the Box:
"The Crime Club Party Game"
"Test Your Power of Observation"
"Photographic Clues - for the solution of each problem"

12 cards are included, three copies of four types. Each card bears a photograph of a crime scene and a description of Inspector Cameron interviewing a suspect. Something in the picture reveals the suspect to be lying, and this is for the player (or team) to find.

Probably this game is from the 1950s, though there is no date on the box or answer sheet.

The box is marked 'Series 3' and it seems there were at least this number of editions containing different puzzles.

name: Ximo
description: The game of Ximo is a set of variants of the traditional game Nim, where you try to be the last player able to pick a marker up off the table. It comes with a cloth bag and a supply of wooden disks with various symbols on them. The symbols place restrictions on what disks may be picked up, allowing for strategic plays. There are several variations included.

name: Top of the Pops
description:
(From the box description)

"Can you survive the cut and thrust of the pop world and shop you've got what it takes to become 'No 1'?
Be the first to work your way up the charts collecting tokens for your singing and dancing ability and your knowledge of the pop world."

name: Habet, hoc habet!
description:
Habet, hoc habet! is a game of gladiatorial combat.

Each player controls a gladiator and has attack and defense cards. Each turn each player chooses simultaneously which attack and defense card to play. Cards are played face down and revealed when all cards have been chosen.

The effect of the attack depends on the defense the other player has chosen.

The wounds are represented by reducing hand size - this simulates the fact that the wounded gladiators have reduced possibilities.

All cards are in Latin. The game was developed by a teacher to use in his class.

The game appeared in Battlegames #3 as a free insert.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Fussball Management
description:
A German game.
Players are soccer managers who move their playing pieces around the board after rolling the die.
Goal is to make as much money as possible.
Playing time is agreed upon. Suggested time is in between 90 to 180 minutes.

Each one starts with 2500000 DM in paper money. This can be used to invest in players (national or international) and stadiums. These can only be bought/sold when landing on the appropriate space.

Landing on a ball or stadium space means your team is playing a game. If on a ball space or a stadium owned by nobody, the bank pays out the team, looking at the amount and type (national/international) of sportsmen purchased.
If someone does own the stadium 300.000 DM spectator entrance fees are paid by the bank. This is used to pay the visiting team and rent to the owner of the stadium. Some stadiums have a team color and are rented by the managers at the beginning of the game. Until purchased players pay rent to the bank when games are played there.

A fee must be paid every time the starting space is passed
(monthly expenses). Other spaces ("Draw card", "Pay bonuses",...) can also cause loss/gain of money.
When landing on a shortcut space you must use it. They get you faster to the starting space, where dues must be paid, but can generate more money.

name: Maze of Good & Bad
description:
An adventure card game that uses 40 cards and nothing else.

From the rules:
"The dreaded Purple Scale Dragon has been terrorizing near by villages. The monster has chosen to make The Maze of Death its lair. You are to intrude this maze and slay the Purple Scale Dragon. Hey tis easier to defeat it when it can't fly away, and you just may catch it when it's still asleep! The maze was created by an evil wizard who after his death didn't want his magical items and gold to be stolen, it's like his tomb. Rumor is that if you go deep in the maze, you just might encounter......"

Free download from: http://www.angelfire.com/bc3/battlecorona/
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: No Brainer
description:
No Brainer is a wacky game of “yes” and “no” questions. Strap the “brain” on your head, then wait for it to ask you questions. Then, nod yes or no and be amazed as it tells you if you’re right or not! Be careful, the questions keep coming faster as you play the game. You thought the questions were easy but are they really a No-Brainer?

--from the publisher

name: Spin the Bottle
description:
From the back of the box:

Spin the Bottle is a fast moving adult drinking game of fun, skill, and luck. You'll feel like you're young all over again in this modern board game variation of the classic party game! So Spin the Bottle, and move around the board. Collect a SMOOCH card and do what it tells you. Collect a BOTTLE card, lucky you! The first player to collect ten BOTTLE cards wins!

name: Snog
description:
The game of timid pecks and brazen smackers.
This light hearted kissing game will make any social gathering of 4 or more adults go with a bang!

The object of the game is to be the first player to score 50 points by successfully snogging other players in the game.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Following Directions
description:
Publisher:
"The object of the game is to be the first player to go from a start location on the map-like game board to a finish location while following the instructions on the Direction Card."

name: Context Clues
description:
Publisher:
"The object of the game is to be the first player to turn over the Golden Treasure Chip containing the word "Treasure" on its reverse side."

name: Getting the Main Idea: Around the World
description:
Publisher:
"The object of the game is to be the first player to travel around the world by starting at the airport and finishing at home."

name: Crayola Color Chase & Race
description:
For children Ages 3 - 5 .

Spin the spinner and when it stops on a color, race to be the first player to move to an object of the same color.

name: Flåklypa: Solan & Ludvig på Duppedittjakt
description: This is an updated and adjusted version of Diamon Hunt (Jakten på den forsvunnede diamant) and rethemed to fit Norway's only world wide movie success; Flåklypa Grand Prix.

name: Whac-a-Mole Tower
description: From the publisher: "Ring in the fun when you grab your mallet and give the mole a whack! Be quick and see if you can send this furry friend scurrying up-up-up the tower. WHAC-A-MOLE TOWER will keep kids entertained for hours! Four different games: HAMMER TIME: Race the clock to light the lights and ring the bell; LIGHTS OUT: Race to turn off the lights!; HIT 100: Be the first to get 100 points; 0-60: a head to head battle to be the first to win 60 points. Included with the game is a lightweight mallet, perfect for kid’s hands to grip."
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Potretti
description: The idea of the game is to create the family tree of a family together. Players get help from pictures of the members of family that have differing borders and background colors. With this information you are able to see how the genes transfer from generation to generation. In each family there are five generations and the player that first gets rid of his cards is the winner. The Finnish name of the game, Potretti, is an older word for a photo and refers to the pictures of the family members.

name: Juneau-Opoly
description: Juneau-Opoly was designed in 2006 as a fund-raising board game for the Juneau Douglas High School Band Program. It is played much like Monopoly in that players roll dice to advance around the board and purchase properties. Properties are named after Juneau, AK businesses and once a player acquires all the businesses in a set he/she may purchase customers to make the business collect more when other players land on them. There are also fate and foxfire spaces that force the player to draw a random event card when landed on. These cards have a variety of effects, such as giving or taking away money. The game is won when a player manages to bankrupt everyone else. A player becomes bankrupt when he lands on an owned property that he/she can't pay the owner for.

name: Minnesotaopoly
description:
From the back of the box:

"To Play: Buy campus properties and favorite area businesses as you make your way around the board. Collect credit hours and trade them for diplomas. Academic Probation sends you home...or make the Dean's list and collect a $200 scholarship."

This is a University of Minnesota Monopoly themed variant.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Sport Dice: Golf
description:
Simple dice game simulating a hole of golf.
A player first rolls the green die to try to get on the green (2 out of 6 chances). Once on the green the player rolls the white die until he sinks the ball (2 in 6 chance).
On the first roll of the green die only, the player has a 1 in 6 chance of hitting a hole in one.

The game comes with a sand timer, which is not used for the main game as described above - players just try to roll certain outcomes on the die as many times as they can in a fixed time.

Other games in this series - Tennis, Soccer and Cricket

name: Super Sale
description:
Components:
4-piece jigsaw style board
30 sale cards
4 pawns
1 die

The board represents a clothing store holding a sale. Players move their pawns around the store by rolling the die. Lift spaces allow short cuts between the 'floors'. There are eight types of item on sale in different areas of the board. Landing on a 'BUY' square allows a player to take an item represented by a price-ticket showing retail price / sale price / saving.

Players have a maximum of £30 to spend and may exit the store once they have spent £25. The player who exits first gets a £2 bonus for his parking fee and ends the game.

Players score the savings amounts made plus bonuses for suits - jacket and trousers or skirt and jumper - plus cash in hand. Player with the highest score is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Grandmama's Improved Game of Useful Knowledge
description:
From "The Games we Played".
Early McLoughlin Brothers game where players assume the role of Scholars and designate one participant to act as "preceptor". Scholars test their knowledge by answering questions posed on cards, and the preceptor confirms or corrects them after consulting companion book of answers.

name: I.S.P. Survivor
description:
Print-and-play game featured in the webcomic Userfriendly.org. Included in three consecutive Sunday comics from April 15-29, 2007.

Each player takes on the role of a character from the comic strip, attempting to collect the items listed on the player's character card and return them to the character's desk. Certain items with special powers and several non-player character tokens can aid or hinder the players.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Russia versus Turkey
description: Extrapolated from "Play the Game" by Brian Love; The game Russia versus Turkey is played by any even number of players who are either Russian or Turk. They sit in alternating seats around the board. Each player has a marker placed on the home port and two tokens placed in the pool. The Russian is the aggressor and moves first. Whoever starts rolls and then moves. Different squares have different instructions that must be followed when landed on. If you land on a space that an opponent is on you are repelled back to the space you started your move on and you lose your turn. Many spaces cause you to lose tokens to the pool, lose a turn, return to port etc. Victory is achieved by the side that has a majority of force in the enemies port at the end of the game.

name: Beany  & Cecil Ring Toss Game
description:
Simple Indoor ring toss game featuring Beany and Cecil the sea sick sea serpent cartoon characters.

The game has pictures of Captain Horatio Huffenpuff, Beany's kindly uncle and the Captain of the Leakin' Lena which takes the pals from one destination to the other. The Captain is always willing to instruct Beany and Cecil on their latest assignment, but refuses to put himself in any personal jeopardy, locking himself in the belowdecks for most of the episodes.
Crowy, the navigator of the Leakin' Lena. He is a crow, and unsurprisingly spends most of his time in the crow's nest. He speaks in a squawky voice and has a tendency to faint dead away whenever the ship encounters some sort of hazard.

Dishonest John, the villain of the piece. He is dressed like a Simon Legree character, and he is constantly scheming to foil Beany and Cecil's adventures. His catchphrase is a sinister "Nya ha ha!". Information Extrapolated from From the wikipedia free encyclopedia;
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: de Berend Boudewijn kwis
description:
"De Berend Boudewijn Kwis" was a very popular quiz-show on the Dutch television during the early seventies.
This game contains 100 cards with questions and three possible answers (A-B-C). If you got it right, you earn plus-points (1 for A, 2 for B, 3 for C). If you got it wrong, the points are subtracted of your total.
You can play against time, or to obtain a certain amount of points.
Questions like:
- When did the Titanic sink?
- In which country was gunpowder invented?
- What year was Kennedy shot?
- How fast can a pigeon fly?
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: The Rocky Mountain National Park Game: Tricky Trails
description:
This is a small roll and move game with multiple paths through Rocky Mountain National Park; first person to exit the park wins.

Special spaces on the board cause players to draw from either an event deck (moving their piece or causing lost turns), or from a "Tricky Trail" deck, which consists of three levels of trivia questions (Easy, Moderate, and Strenuous) which can give various levels of bonuses for a correct answer.

The game comes with a Rocky Mountain map gameboard, printed on a thin green cloth. The player pawns are detailed miniature animals; a mountain lion, Fox, Bear, and Long Horn Sheep.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Harpoon, The Real Whale Hunt Game
description: The gameboard is a thirty-six by thirty-six grid that represents a large body of water. The grid is divided into four quadrants. The players start with a small whale boat that is placed inside an individual’s factory ship. Each player places one’s own factory ship at an individual start space at the edge of one’s own quadrant. One of the whales is placed on one the four spaces in the center of the gameboard. Players, in turn, move their factory ships according to the number indicated on the spinner. If spinner points to a picture of a whale, then the whale moves according the number on its spinner. A player must separate the whale boat from the factory ship when the whale and the factory ship are in the same quadrant. Whale boats have their own spinner and they move slower that do the factory ships. When the whale boat and the whale are on the same space, the whale has been harpooned and the player scores a point for killing the whale. The whale boat must be moved back into the factory boat and another whale is brought into play. The last whale brought into play is white and it is worth two points. The player with the most points is the winner.

name: Zing It!
description: Card game involving bidding and trick taking. Card set includes four colors with numbers 1 through 15 plus a variety of special cards which invoke unusual rules.

name: Treasure Trek
description: Treasure Trek is a family trivia game aimed at members of the LDS (Mormon)faith. As players roll and move around board, they encounter Book of Mormon events, doctrines, and sites. Questions contained in each trek are from that particular area of the scriptures.

name: Buggy Bingo
description:
Spin, count and match! Children build counting skills for numbers 1-10 while learning about insects. Spin the numbered bug wheel. The first player to cover three leaves with bugs in a row, wins!

Includes four laminated game cards with fun bug facts on the back, spinner and 36 markers. For 2-4 players.

name: The Eton Game
description:
This is a roll and move game using the theme of students attending the very exclusive Eton College in England. Players begin with four "colour cards" representing a different facet of life at Eton - artistic, sporting, social and academic. They must then work their way round a stylised map of the college, getting rid of all their cards to become the winner. A variety of penalties can be imposed for bad behavior, including a "faux pas" for things such as hitting a teacher with a snowball, or allowing one's mother to turn up at school in an embarrassing hat.

The game was invented by an Eton housemaster and his assistant, both old boys of the school themselves.

name: Spider's Web
description:
Not to be confused with The Spiders Web from Otero Games.

Guide the spider around his web by tilting the board to control his scurrying movements. But beware ! If the spider passes over a hole he may stop in his tracks.

A tantalizing game teaching dexterity & co-ordination for any number of players from six years up !

name: El hundimiento del Titanic
description:
From The Publisher:

Be the first captain in sail your ship trough the icebergs. A funny game for the whole family

name: Arnold Palmer's Golf Card Game
description:
There are 110 playing cards with a Stroke, Bonus Stroke (eagles & birdies) and Penalty (hazard & OB) cards.

The object is to score as low as possible on each hole by exchanging Face Up and Face Down cards as soon as possible while avoiding a forced final putt.

Any game that you can play on the course, can be played with the Arnold Palmer Card Game.
If your game is heads up nine or eighteen holes, Skins, Match Play or 36 or 72 hole tournament play, this game is for you.

Each game contains 110 playing cards, rules, score pad, golf tee and scoring pencil and up to 6 players can play.

name: Terminated
description:
From the publisher's web site:
The board game Terminated was the brainchild of the experiences of its creator. After more than a decade of employment in different companies and industries, different departments and sectors of the businesses, from agriculture to software production, I realized that at the end of the day, one common factor was evident; the desire for career advancement and the fruits and privileges that accompanied the advancement. To me, everything seemed to revolve around this common factor, Advancement; the economy, lifestyle and life in general all seemed to be a game where the rules were already written and I had to follow them.

With this understanding in mind, I embarked on the arduous task of arranging it all on paper and it wasn’t long before I had a complete and playable game. The circular design of the game was chosen to emphasize the revolving aspect of the game. I had four gas stations to remind us of both the need for gas and the high gas prices. I included childcare; a common denominator in our families and most other successful and complete families. Since we all have to pay taxes, I included a slot for the IRS on the game. It was abundantly clear that since I got paid once every pay period, then one complete revolution around the board was equivalent to one complete pay period. Domestic utilities were also included in the game for this was an everyday necessity.

There were several things I could have included in the game such as food and health insurance but I ran out of room. However, I did include vacation, a common phenomenon at work, whether earned or incidental such as sick time or penalty (suspensions). The Superior Court was included to provide a platform for one to forward his/ her grievances and concerns and to provide a platform for one to mount their best defense whenever the circumstance arose.

For disciplinary purpose and as an instrument of the constant penalty awaiting the lawbreakers, I included the jail slot on the game. I also included the INS slot on the game due to the fact that there are numerous undocumented immigrants who masquerade as legal entities hence the need for consistently proving ones eligibility for employment. As much as I despise paying the high insurance premiums, the state law requires that we maintain auto insurance at all times. In an effort to keep the game fun and entertaining, I included the mailbox and email as tools to deliver messages, promotions, bonus, and even penalties.

The eight departments, Shipping and Receiving, Production, Assembly, Customer Service, Packaging, Maintenance, Quality Assurance and Management were chosen because I had personal experience in them and I felt that they were crucial to any manufacturing enterprise. Other departments such as accounting, advertising and marketing though important to a company were not included because I figured that some companies were able to operate profitably by either doubling or outsourcing these departments.

name: Hämä hämä häkki
description:
The game is based on the nursery rhyme "Incy Wincy Spider" (also known as Itsy Bitsy Spider).

Players takes the roles as spiders and build webs to climb and depend on the weather. If it's sunny they can climb up the web but if it rains they are washed down.

name: The Hunting Dogs
description: This is a game similar to Hungry, Hungry Hippos,although it is for only two players. Each player pushes a lever which moves the head of a plastic hound dog. The two dogs are at the end of a small playing field which holds rolling marbles. The winner is the player whose dog captured the most marbles.

name: Today's The Day
description: This is a trivia game based on the popular UK tv show. The game consists of 366 question cards which correspond to trivia questions for every day of the year.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Moto-Cross
description:
Several motorcyclists, or teams of motorcyclists, are driving a motocross competition. On the way, they will land on numbered event spaces which may help or hinder their race.

A very traditional, straightforward roll-and-move game.

name: Alphamino
description:
A domino game with letters and pictures. You play usually like dominoes but you can also : put a letter on a picture if you can spell a word beginning with this letter in the domain of the picture. For example, after a picture of a town, you can place a "T" as tower, a "S" as street, etc. But you can't place "P" for Paris or "S" for Santiago. You can only use words about the subject of the picture.

There are also attacks and parades.

Content: 2 x 72 dominoes, 2 bags, 5 supports, 1 rule.

Text from the back of the box:

"Double domino game: drawings, letters, trump, attacks, parades. Rid yourself of your dominoes and attack your opponents to bother them in their game.
Alphamino, the domino game using the alphabet.
Alphaminois the ultimate domino game that you have dreamed of!"

name: Electric Contact Quiz
description: Subtitled Lights Up Your Party, based on a 1950's tv show, players answer questions by connecting electric leads. When the answer is correct, a light turns on.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Carnevil Carnage
description: A humorous game published in InQuest #150, cover date October 2007. Players choose their team, which is really their pawn, all of which are based on classic gaming icons; example HeroKlutz referring to HeroClix. The player then works to overcome various challenges at the carnival, defeat other players, and collect three pieces that will make up the "Ultimate Weapon," which leads to victory.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: How to Host a Kids Party: Safari Adventure Party
description:
A children's party game (presumably a birthday party) with a unifying theme (safari) and a loose deduction element, a la adult How to Host a Murder parties. In this game, the children are attempting to rescue an animal by playing games and listening to a cassette tape.

Contents:
- cassette tape
- shopping/gathering list
- 16 activity (game) cards
- 12 safari postcard invitations
- animal footprint clues
- safari poster sticker game (stick-the-panda = pin-the-tail-on-the-donkey)
- 12 jumping frogs
- 48 safari cards
- small jungle animal
- party favors: 12 each of compasses, magnifying glasses, puzzles

This is one of three HtHaKP themed games.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Deduction, Exploration, Party Game

name: Spider-Man versus Doctor Octopus: Race to Rescue Board Game
description:
Doctor Octopus has captured Mary Jane. He has left her on the top of a tall New York building and returned to his lab. Spider-Man has set out to rescue Mary Jane, but Doctor Octopus is also on his way back. Who will get to Mary Jane first? The object is to be the first to get to Mary Jane.

To start the game, each player chooses a pawn (either Spider-Man or Doc Ock). The Spider-Man player takes the Spider-Man cards, and the Doc Ock player takes Doc Ock cards. The cards are used to move its player forward one or two spaces or to force the opponent to move back a space or lose a turn. Players take turns turning over cards with the goal of moving his/her pawn closer to Mary Jane.

name: Spell
description:
A word building card game from the Pepys card series.

Each card bears 2 letters (apart from 1 joker which bears the word "spell").
The cards are combined in pairs to form words which are changed constantly by covering the cards on the table with fresh cards.
This way you use always one half of the word (your choice)to build another new one.

Good to be played with adults and children together.

A variant allows to play this game as a patience.

3 editions known.

name: Whitetrash Roundup!
description:
Clearly described as a novelty game. A deck with 50 cards and rules for four sets of games. Each game has different strategies for either collecting or sticking other players with tacky hillbilly habits or collectibles, such as outhouses, double-wide trailers, CB radios, roadkill TV dinners, and mullets.


In Where's the Crap?, players compete to collect the most tacky knick-knacks.



You try to get rid of your trash in Ultimate Redneck.



In Trash Collector you win by accumulating the best garbage from your neighbors.



In Capture the Redneck, you try to become the biggest hillbilly.

name: Denver in a Box
description: Denver in a Box is a Monopoly clone focusing on the city of Denver. Squares and cards have information relevant to the city.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Bible Story Lotto
description:
Bible Story Lotto. For ages 3+
"Have fun matching the right pictures to the right game board."

Players take turns flipping tiles over. The visible tile is matched to the story on one of the player's game boards. The player who is first to fill his board wins. Contents: 24 tiles and 4 story cards with the tile collection spots on one side and the Bible story on the other side.

name: Prophets Card Game
description:
Prophets Card Game is an LDS variation on Go Fish. Cards are numbered 1-13, with each number representing an LDS prophet. (The cards only go through Ezra Taft Benson.) There are also four suits, Beehives, Buffalo Skulls, Seagulls, and Wagon Wheels. Players ask others for the cards they need to complete the "Books" by asking for the name of the prophet pictured on the card.

The rules make note that this deck of cards is appropriate for other standard card games as well.

name: Skittle Baseball
description: Another in the line of Skittle Games, this one produced by Aurora in 1971. The game features a picture of Don Adams of "Get Smart" Fame on the cover with this quote "Now this is how you throw the high hard one". Game comes with a swinging magnet and a ball.

name: Huckleberry Hound Tiddledy Winks Tennis
description:
The Huckleberry Hound Tiddledy Winks Tennis game is basically a tennis game played with tiddledy winks. This is Item #4933. The object of the game is to flip your winks over the paper "net" of the felt tennis court to your opponent's side of the court.

Listed in American Games, #4699. 1956, TV, Cartoon, Board game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Merry Circus Game
description: User review: Each player takes two matching pieces. In turn, each player will spin the spinner and move either of one’s own pieces towards the finish line. A player’s own pieces may share a space anytime during the game but different players may not share a space beyond the elephant space (about one-fifth of the way down the track). Landing on an opponent's piece sends the opponent back to the previous picture space where the instructions must be followed. The first player to get one’s own pieces to the finish line by exact count wins.

name: Pog Hockey
description:
From the publisher's website:

POG Hockey combines the Classic Game of POG with the real action of hockey. You can score a goal, make a save or get a penalty. You must outscore your opponent by flipping over the most POG. The player who scores more points wins the game! Includes 22 POG, 2 Slammers, 1 Game board, 1 Die, 1 Official Rule Sheet and 1 Score Pad.

Reimplements: Pogs

name: Fun with the Pepper Family
description: Fun with the Pepper Family was made by Chad Valley in the mid 1920's. The game consists of a story being read with players, on their turn, adding words in order to fill in the blanks so that the story is completed. Votes are taken on if the word fits the storyline.

name: Down and Out
description: Players take turns dropping marbles down the tower, one at a time. Player with the highest score wins.

name: Aristocats
description: A game created and sold as merchandise of the Walt Disney movie Aristocats. A game mostly for kids.

name: Panto
description: Panto is a game for 3 to 8 players in which the player is supposed to match the two halves of each of 8 pantomime characters or make up "crazy" characters, the rule being that the background must have the same color.

name: Spurs
description: The box states that this is "A classic dice game of the old west" and "A wild west game of dice". Players roll two 6-sided dice onto a board that is kept inside the box. The players score points for landing on the Fast Draw Badge in the center of the board, any of six dice squares around the badge, or on four triangles on the edge of the board. The first player to receive 300 points or more is the Fast Draw Marshal (winner).
publishers: Go Anywhere Games, Ikron, R. D. Retort Enterprises

name: På nya äventyr med Pippi Långstrump
description:
On new adventures with Pippi Longstocking.

Try to catch up with Pippi and her monkey Herr Nilsson on their adventures. If you are lucky to be in the same spot as Pippi you will receive 1 gold coin. The first who has 6 gold coins will win this game.

Childrens game Ages 5 and up.

Contents:

1 board game
1 dice
1 Pippi marker
1 Herr Nilsson marker
5 playing counter
30 gold coins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Viikinkiseikkailu
description:
Another game in Peliko's series of games illustrated by Mauri Kunnas.

Very simple spin-and-move fare: Move your ship to the next square matching the color shown on the spinner. The first player to reach the harbor wins. If you land on a special square and lose the challenge there, you have to retreat a few steps.

name: Plasma Duel
description:
Use warriors, dragons, catapults and cards to conquer and destroy opponent and win Plasma Duel.

This is a miniatures game included with Mega Bloks' Plasma Dragons construction toy line (a Canadian LEGO compatible toy). Players' soldiers pair off and fight using random draws from pre-constructed decks, plus players can use rubberband-powered catapults to try to hit enemy soldiers without resorting to hand-to-hand combat. Players can include dragons in their armies, which cost more but tend to have more powerful combat draws. The loser of each battle loses a piece, until all pieces from one army have been eliminated. Last man standing wins!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology

name: Casino in Space
description:
(From rules insert)
Brief Idea of the Game is to get the excitement of real Casino life without losing your shirt or your house.
Poor or rich all can have lots of excitement for long hours with this incredible Game.



Players move around a monopoly style board by rolling dice, and play the casino game that they land on. Goal is to reach $10,000 and land on the Finish Line.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: What's Up Doc? The Bugs Bunny Game
description:
Honey Bunny (TM) wants you to bring your friends along to Bugs Bugs Bunny's house, you will stop and pick up a birthday present from many of his Looney Tunes (TM) friends.

Object: To collect a present from all of Bugs Bunny's friends and bring them to his birthday party.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Sun Board Game
description:
"Play the game based on Britain's favourite newspaper."

This is a promo game for the UK tabloid, The Sun, and Virgin Mobile. Players are competing to edit the best version of the Sun, by first moving their journalist around the board to chase stories and then editing a version of the paper from the cards in their hands in a print run.

Stories fall in four categories (News, Sport, Features and Bizarre) and Editor's Choice (a kind of event/joker) and each edition must contain enough stories from each category. Categories are subdivided into sets of stories from the same news item. A few ads for Virgin Mobile are also included.

In the print runs, players place cards (stories) in front of them, one by one, and thus have a chance to select what stories they publish depending on their opponent's choices, and also affect the game with their Editor's Choices. Scoring is based on how many stories they have from the same set, if they have an exclusive of the news item, or if they were able to ruin another player's exclusive by also publishing a story from their set. The ads also score points. The player with the most points after the 4th print run wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Yacht Race
description:
Typical Edwardian children's race style board game based on yachting. Each player throws a six-sided dice and moves their counter (yacht) as many divisions as indicated on the dice. Penalties and privileges are paid on specific divisions that help and hinder the player getting to the finish line.
The first player to cross the finish line wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Il giuoco del Giro d'Italia
description: Italian cycling game from 1950 about the famous race Giro d'Italia. It contains 10 jetons (counters or tokens) with real famous cyclists from that time printed on them: Bartali, Coppi, Magni, Lazarides, Ortelli, Fornara, Dupont, Lauredi, Cerami & Bresci.

name: Original Monchhichi at the Fair
description:
Monchhichi at the Fair is a children's game for two to four players, featuring the same spin-and-move system used in Candy Land.

The object of the game is described on the box as follows:
Be the first to reach the ferris wheel [pictured on the game board]. With their own Monchhichi mover piece children can pretend they are taking a stroll through the fair, from the ticket booth, past the merry-go-round to the ferris wheel.
There is a shortcut of course but a backslide too! There are smiling Monchhichi to help you get there faster, but a crying Monchhichi will slow you down.
This is an easy game to learn and set-up and it's fun matching colours to move.

name: Under the Bed
description:
From the author: The stuffed animals, toy trucks, and action figures of your childhood did more for you than you remember. They were your guardians, advocates, and friends, putting their lives on the line for you. Do you have what it takes to be a toy?

Players receive two Characteristic cards (Agile, Faithful, Sad, Smart, and so on) from the included deck. Each player then picks a toy that bets fits their Characteristics. Players then collaboratively decide on a setting (back seat of the car, under the bed, etc.) and a source of conflict (older brother, dog, etc.), then the game begins.

One player, acting as Narrator, creates challenges for the players who then must stave off the conflict and vie to become the favorite toy. Players that don't do well become "lost toys" and are removed from the game. The last (or most popular) toy wins.

name: Thayaam
description:
This traditional game of ancient India is described by game historian R.C. Bell as a "square board race game." The game is played on a 5x5 grid which would have been marked out on the ground. The center space is the castle and the middle squares on each side of the board are serve as a player's palace. Each player uses four small sticks as their pieces. Four tamarind seeds marked with three white sides and three dark sides to function as dice.

The pieces start off the board. A "1" must be rolled to move a piece onto the board. The pieces first travel counterclockwise around the outside of the board and then travel through the inner nine squares in a clockwise spiral pattern until they reach the castle square at the center of the board. Once all four of a player's pieces have reached the central castle square, the player begins trying to bear them off the board. For each "1" rolled a player may remove one piece from the castle. The first player to remove all four pieces wins the game.

When a player moves onto a square containing the piece or pieces of an opposing player, the opponent's pieces are removed from the board and must start the journey again. However, this rule does not apply to the palace and castle spaces, which are safe havens. In addition, under certain circumstances a player may pair together two pieces as a "twin" which permits them to move together and which may only be sent off the board by another "twin" piece.

A more elaborate form of the game, known as The King's Thayaam, is played on a board double the size and uses eight tamarind seeds as dice instead of four.

This game is similar to the Indian games Saturankam and Ashta-Kashte.

name: Sanning eller Konsekvens
description: The old "truth or dare" game as a card game. No need to make the dares or the questions up anymore. In Swedish and very simple. Just truth or dare until everyone but the last person (the winner) have chickened out.

name: Drive, Chip, or Putt!
description:
From the box:

Drive, Chip, or Putt! is a sensational and challenging golf game for the entire family. Whether you are an advanced or novice golfer, you will enjoy the ultimate challenge of this game. Play on your own, or arrange tournaments among family or friends.

Drive, Chip, or Putt! offers a complete selection of clubs which include a driver, long and short irons, a sand wedge, a pitching wedge, and a putter. Just imagine the excitement and challenge of selecting the best club each stroke.

Drive, Chip, or Putt! contains 18 beautiful and challenging holes which provide 6981 yards of excitement. Experience the high and lows of the game as you attempt to match or break par 72. Be sure to avoid the sand traps, and the water. Select your club, roll and die, and let the challenge begin!

name: Salt Lake City: The Game Of Monogamy
description:
Salt Lake City - The Game of Monogamy is a Monopoly clone set in the Utah Capital. Squares on the board share names with landmarks from and areas of the city.

Unlike some other Utah based Monopoly-style games, this one makes many references to Mormon culture and less to Utah scenery/buildings. Players can land on squares such as "Go to Church," "Choose the Right," and "Tithing." Houses and Hotels are replaced with the ward houses and stake centers (names for Mormon church buildings). Also, all five playing pieces are directly related to Mormonism (CTR Ring, Bee of Deseret, Sunbeam Baby, Scripture Book, Brigham Young's Hat.)

One interesting aspect of the game is that there are nine squares on each side of the board instead of the usual ten.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Diligensrally
description:
This is a race around Sweden, with start and goal in Lycksele. You use a dice for movement. If you end up on the same space as a oponent, the openent is forced on a detour.

The game is published as an attachment to Julpost from Postverket in Sweden.

name: Sparleken
description:
The goal is to save money at your bank gaining interest on your savings, so you later can buy a tape recorder, a bicycle and a camera. The first one to buy all these wins. During the game one moves round a track, with use of a dice.

The game is published as an attachment to Julpost from Postbanken in Sweden.

name: Sparbingo
description:
This game is a type of Bingo, where some selections are allowed. During the game the players receive money to be used to buy things on the players board section. Winning points are received by being the first to fill one, two and three rows.

The game is published as an attachment to Julpost from Postbanken in Sweden.

name: Happy Highways
description:
Starting at home, following the happy highway, the goal is to be the first to reach the Last Resort at the shore of Lucky Lake. On the way you pass falling rocks, short cuts, Funny Forest, Dusty Town, Camp Gitchigouch, Moon Mountain, and of course Stuckey's.

Movement is done by a die, but impacted by cards.

The game was sold by the Stuckey's Convenience Markets.

name: War in the Gulf
description:
A simple board game, similar to Sorry! or Parchisi. Movement takes place with a roll of the dice.
The game comes in two phases. First, players progress through "Desert Shield", in which they collect cards that can later be used to defeat threats. Second, they move to "Desert Storm", in which they use their cards to overcome obstacles on the board. When a player reaches the middle of the board, they have won the game and liberated Kuwait.
If you encounter an obstacle that there is no card for, then you must restart Desert Storm. If this happens three times in a row, then Desert Shield must be repeated as well. There are also locations on the board that will send you back to the start.

name: Das große Gartenspiel
description: In this game the players collect packages of seeds and plant them in their garden until this area is full. They should harmonize together because the players get points for this. When a player succeeds in placing 16 to 24 plants in the garden the game is over. Who will become "Super-gardener"?

name: BRATZ Genie Magic:  As You Wish
description:
The Bratz™ girls are Genies in training. The players must use their newfound knowledge to visit all the fab fashion stores. The first person to get 3 wishes granted is the winner!

Includes:

5 Player Pieces
1 Game Board
1 Die
54 Cards
Features:

Cool Game Play
Become a Magical Bratz™ Genie
Based on World's Most Popular Fashion Doll Line

name: World War
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

"With the fall of the great nations came the growing of many more. The end of WW3 found the European continent once again blank and ripe for the taking. It is up to you and your band to retake and remake the land."

A game "fit for an almost unlimited number of players", up to the number of hexes on the mapsheet. Each player starts with one settlement and one army somewhere on the continent of Europe. Settlements abstractly provide the means to support existing armies and allow new armies to be built. Combat is resolved by a simple dice contest. The winner is the last player to have surviving units on the map.

name: Thomas Count Your Cars Game
description:
From the manufacturer's catalog:

A preschool counting and color matching game! Match the number of boxcars shown on the spinner to the colored cards in hand... then head for the roundhouse and pick up the matching color engine to haul those boxcars into your scoring pile. The player with the most boxcars wins!

For Ages 3 and up.

Includes 36 boxcar cards, game board, spinner, and 4 engine tokens.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Number, Trains

name: Zakochany w Warszawie
description: Historical game about Warsaw published by Warsaw City Hall. Game is about tourists sightseeing in the city. One of them gets lost and others are looking for him.

name: Chuz-It
description: Chuz-It allows players to choose what they want to do on their turn. With the Flashback process, players get to show off their skills in topics such as Math, Spelling and Geography as well as having fun making up words on a Word Jumble, singing lines from songs in Sing It, making up stories in Story Teller, seeing what you can draw in Blind Art, or trying not to get twisted up on a Tongue Twister and more! Board advancement (or the ability to send others backwards) is based on the difficulty of the chosen talent challenge. Contents of Chuz-It:game board, 240 playing cards, Doodle pad, Pencil, 4 playing pawns, 30 second timer, Instructions. 2 or more or teams, Ages 7 and up

name: Leszczynowa Zgraja
description: Players impersonate squirrels who are looking for food: fungi, nuts, pine cones, rowan-berries. Cards are put in one pile and revealed one by one while forming another pile. When someone uncovers a squirrel then he/she must say which kind of food his animal eats. Player takes every card in reject pile with food that he has chosen and lays those cards next to others with this food. The player who collects the most number of cards wins the game.

name: Don't Get In A Flap!
description:
A motorized match up game!
The unique disc-dealer spins, dispensing disc after disc. Each player has certain shapes on their quarter of the circular game board, and they must try and get all of the discs that fit there shapes before the other players to win.
A little like Perfection on a round board, with more strategy!

name: Pokey Joe
description:
Pokey Joe is a fast paced bluffing and wagering card game where you use your cards as the wager. The objective of the game is win all the cards.

Up to six players can play per pack or you can put multiple packs together for larger games (each additional pack allows you to add up to 6 additional players). There are two different color packs available, blue and red.

name: Fantasy RPG Checkers
description:
Fantasy RPG Checkers is the third in a series of compatible checkers variants where you adopt the role of a character. In Fantasy RPG Checkers, you can pick from 6 different characters, like "smart fighter" or "arcane mage." Your character gives you special powers that allow you to bend or break the normal rules of checkers.

Like normal checkers, your goal is to capture all of your opponent's pieces. Since this is Fantasy RPG Checkers, you gain class levels as you play, your checkers have hit points, and you may have to make saving throws. The mechanics keep these extra aspects rather simple.

Fantasy RPG Checkers is a game for two players. Fantasy RPG Checkers uses a standard checkers set, a six-sided die, and some pennies (or other small tokens). A two-player game takes about 25 minutes to play. Fantasy RPG Checkers is appropriate for Ages 11 and up
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Humor, Print & Play

name: The Farmer in the Dell
description: 4 games in 1 small box of cards. The Farmer in the Dell, Farm Memory Game, The Cheese Stands Alone Game, and the Sing Along Game. The Farmer in the Dell is similar to "Go Fish" but includes a variation for younger children. Farm Memory Game is a game of collecting matching pairs. In The Cheese Stands Alone Game the object is to be the last player with the cheese card in your hand. During the game players collect and play matching pairs from their hand. In The Sing Along Game the goal is to sing the song using the cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Singing, Storytelling

name: I Got It!
description:
I Got It! is the English version of the French game "Définimages".

It consists of various picture cards that players combine in order to answer riddles read aloud by the game host. The first to solve the riddle calls out "I got it!", hence the name of the game.

An included variant sees everyone trying to compose as many word combinations as they can in a specified time limit.

These two first variants are are for 2 to 12 players, "Mfg Suggested Ages: 12 and up".

The booklet also includes an other variant, "Mfg Suggested Ages: 5 and up".

name: Fångarna på fortet
description:
The goal of this game is to collect 4 keys and open the treasure chest and remove as much money as possible.

To get the keys you have to go in to dark cells in the fortress and solve the task given to you.

Contents:
1 board game
30 red keys
30 black keys
104 money
125 cards with riddles
4 blanc cards for your own riddles
1 card with father Foura
10 cards with tasks
1 box
2 dice
6 pieces
1 glass timer
1 chest
1 rulebook
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ormen Långe
description: Seemingly an old roll-and-move game of the Game of Goose style where you die if you land on space 95 and the like.

name: TOP GEAR: The Car's The Star
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to reach the finish space at the end of the board.
As you race around the board, a roll of the dice will reveal a little bit more of a car hidden in the clever hide and reveal unit in the centre of the board. The sooner you guess, the higher the possible points; but beware, once a guess has been made, that's it. A wrong guess scores nothing at all. Players have to decide whether to gamble for an early guess, or to hold fire and try to score extra points for having the correct country, body and engine type cards in their hand. This game includes over 70 large, beautifully photographed classic cars, old and modern. Launched by Top Gear, the hugely successful BBC TV programme.
Game components:
1 x playing board
1 x pack of 72 car cards in full colour
2 x packs of 50 cards comprising;
- Pit Stop,
- Engine Type, Body Type and Country of Origin.
6 x assorted coloured playing pawns
1 x hide and reveal mechanism
1 x 6-sided standard dice
1 x 6-sided coloured spot dice
1 x rules sheet
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bible Picture Lotto
description:
Bible Picture Lotto

This is a vintage (1950s era?) religion game.

"Learn Bible stories while you play"

Ages 5 - 10

"Beautiful full-color picture cards with over forty illustrations"

"Six Bible stories"

Includes 6 large picture boards and 36 small picture cards. The boards represent Bible characters like Daniel, Moses, Joseph, etc.

The cards feature objects from the Biblical character's life (Daniel/Lion, etc.) and players match the cards to the correct Bible story.

Warner Press No. T3841

name: Nummerett
description: 2 players roll dices and try to get their pawns out on the playing board. The two players have their own side of the board. When a pawn is out there it can be moved one line further, if the player is successful with the dices. The aim of the game is to manage to place all pawns on the line in the middle of the playing board.

name: Quinio
description:
This is an old 5 in a row game. In the box there is a playing field made of cardboard that fits nicely in the middle of the box. There are little plastic markers (like pins or nails) in 4 colours, that fit into holes in the playing board. A turn consists of putting one of your markers on a free spot on the board. You win if you are the first to get 5 in a row.

See also Go-Moku, 5 in a Row, Pegity.

name: Scrabble Keychain
description:
The classic crossword game, Scrabble, now on a key chain that features a magnetic game board surface, and 30 mini magnetic letter tiles! The mini magnetic Scrabble letters are stored in a secret drawer. Use your skills to cleverly connect letter tiles up, down and across the board.

This edition features a smaller board (11x11) and much fewer tiles (31) than standard Scrabble. Several letters are left out of the tile set completely including F, G, Q, Y, Z and more.

name: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, The Witch and the Wardrobe – The Epic Battle Between Good and Evil
description: This game with 108 playing cards appears to be a typical roll-and-move board game. Each player must move his or her four Pevensie children to their finish area while avoiding villains such as the Dwarf, the Minotaur, Maugrim, the Spectre, and the White Queen.
categories: Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: There's No Place Like Rome...and Oneida County
description:
There's No Place Like Rome ...and Onieda County

This is a monopoly-style game about Rome, New York and the surrounding region. It was produced by the City of Rome and the Rome Area Chamber Of Commerce.

Includes a colorful game board featuring local tourist attractions, 4 tokens, red plastic chips, play money, 2 dice, rules, business cards, deed cards, and a storage insert.

name: A Power Struggle
description: Roll to move your shuttles through four ALERT levels on your way to achieving PEACE. Use missiles and peace pawns to protect your shuttles from opponents as you move forward, engaging in the power struggle that comes with a quest for peace.

name: Gissa vad jag föreställer
description: Swedish charade type game. Aimed primarily at children. The title translates roughly into "Guess what I am supposed to be".

name: The Cost of Caring
description:
The Cost of Caring Game for 2-6 players is played on a 23" x 23" quad-fold playing board with players advancing their own pawn by die roll along the 121 spaces (there is one short cut that saves 7 spaces) until all eligible pawns reach "the party."

A player must draw a Care Card when landing on a Care Station. There are 60 different Care Cards, each describing the player meeting with a hypothetical person in some type of need. Each Care Card gives a player two choices: to hurry on to the party, or to go instead to a Cost Station, where the player randomly chooses one of two Cost Cards written specifically for the situation described on that Care Card. The Cost Card describes the player's resulting caring response and whether it gains the player a Meaning Card and whether it costs the player a Time Token. When all 6 of a player's Time Tokens are gone, the player is out of the game.

There are 50 different Meaning Cards (plus 5 blank cards) each with a short meaningful statement, such as "care without cost would be worthless."

"The game ends when all players [who still have Time Tokens] reach the party…. The object is to arrive at the party with the most meaning cards and be declared 'SAINT'." There can be only one.

name: Dice Of The Dead
description:
escape from the dead - make your way through the living dead infested grounds and reach the safety zone. If not... you will be devoured!

Roll the dice to make your player token move and reach the green-colored zone in the game board.

Game ends when any player's token reaches the green-colored zone part of the board, that player is considered winner.

Whenever a "dead" token is moved to an occupied square with a player's token, that player is considered out of the game and its token is removed from the game board.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Horror, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dig & Play Treasure Island
description:
Gameplay is composed of two phases.

Initially, the game parts must be physically dug out of a block of plaster. This takes the theme (digging for buried treasure) and puts players to the act of literally digging their way through to actual treasure. This is a one-time-event only, although it may take a few hours to fully accomplish.

Next, once the parts have been recovered, players use pieces to move around a pirate's treasure map. This is a basically simple map, and may only hold the attention of children if they have actually dug the pieces out themselves, and may then appreciate the effort involved.

name: Disney Pixar WALL-E Treasure Race Game
description:
Players are one of five characters; WALL-E, EVE, Auto, M-O, or GO-4. The goal of the game is to be the first player to reach the top of the treasure pile.

Game is downloadable from the Official WALL-E Treasure Race Game website at http://www.walle-game.com/. Players print and build the board, cards, and pieces. There is also a tie-in with the National Raisin Company which has specially packaged boxes of raisins that convert into the players tokens.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Sommalov med Mazetti
description:
With the theme of a summer vacation, the goal is to be the first to reach the goal. Movement is done by a dice. On the way things can happen that delay you or let you move forward.

The game is made for the Swedish company Mazetti.

name: Kalle Anka i Högertrafiken
description:
The game was made in Sweden at the time when driving was changed from the left to right side of the roads.

The theme is Donald Duck and his friends driving and passing traffic signs.

The goal is to be the first to reach the end. Movement is done by drawing coloured pieces from a bag, and moving to the next place with that colour. On the way things can happen that slow you down or let you move forward.

name: TID för alla-spelet
description:
In the game on the front side, the goal is to be the first to reach the star in the middle, with help of a dice.

On the other side a separate game is available. The goal there is to be the first to reach as many of the hours on the clock as possible. Movement is done around the clock by a dice.

The game was made for the Swedish clock selling company Stjärnurmakarna.

name: Great Fires
description:
New York: December 16-17, 1835
Chicago: October 8-10, 1871
Boston: November 9-10, 1872
Seattle: June 6, 1889
San Francisco: April 18-21, 1906

What do all these dates have in common? They mark some of the most catastrophic fires in U.S. history in which thousands and thousands of lives were lost, and enormous sections of these major metropolitans were reduced to little more than ash and amber.

Most city building games require construction from the ground up. But with 'Great Fires', players find out what happens when their beautiful city is, in its prime, under siege of fires raging out of control.

Great Fires is a fast paced game where the object is to be the least devastated of all players at the end of the game. Each player chooses one city (New York, Chicago, Boston, Seattle or San Francisco) and each game the fires begin in different districts. The mechanics for the spreading of fires can be fierce, luckily players are given some tools to help contain the fires--however the tools are limited, and will not be able to protect all of your city.

Prevent as many fatalities as possible, keep your city from burning completely to the ground, and you just might be able to come out on top!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order

name: Crummy Rummy
description:
The game deck consists of cards with one or two letters each. A round begins with one card in the middle of the table. Players then add cards to the starting letter one at a time so as to produce legitimate words at each step.

Points are scored by making words that no other player can steal, meaning that no other player can make another word just by adding one card to the beginning or end of it. Points might also be scored by playing your last card, although rules are unclear on this point. They simply say, "Ten points are given to the first player to declare 'Crummy Rummy'" but they do not elaborate on the circumstances under which a player is entitled to so declare.

name: Fun Ranching
description:
From the publisher's intro in the rules:

The Fun Ranching game was created by a 4-H leader of a live-stock club from Albany, Oregon. The details and format of the game were refined by kids from the city involved in her Livestock Club, some with learning abilities. Fun Ranching has three (3) levels to provide equal opportunity for all ages and learning abilities.

THEME: You are living with mom and dad on the OLD HOMESTEAD. They say it is time for you to try ranching on your own. They have authorized the bank to issue each of you $4,000. You may begin BUYING and SELLING Livestock and/or your ranch as soon as the game begins.

THE OBJECT: you are BUYING and SELLING livestock for profit to complete the ranch of your choice.

TO WIN: 1) Own all three (3) ranch properties that complete a ranch. 2) Own the required amount of Livestock to complete a ranch. 3) Have all your bank loans and debts paid in full.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Paradise Island: a Pirate Game
description:
This is a simple children's game with the theme of pirates collecting treasure from an island.
