Each player begins with an individual pirate game board. Players place the well illustrated treasure pieces and deck of pirate cards on the larger game board representing the island. Players take turns drawing a pirate card and following the instructions on the cards, if successful you get variable amounts of treasure as rewards for the tasks to add to your pirate hoard. When all treasure is collected from the island, the player who has collected the most treasure wins!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Pick-up and Deliver, Role Playing

name: Beat the Cops
description: The object of the game is to be the last player remaining, or the player with the most money after the agreed upon time limit. Players take turns venturing out from their homes driving around trying to make money while evading the cops that are always chasing them. Most of the game is spent avoiding fines and arrest from the cops.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Angry Monster Machine
description: This game is designed to help children find constructive ways to express anger. At the start of the game, each player creatures four monsters from Play-Doh modeling compound using the provided mold and places them at different locations: School, Community, Playground and Home. The players then roll dice and move plastic trucks around the board in an effort to capture the monsters and return them to the monster machine at the center of the board. When a player returns a monster to the machine, he or she talks about something from the monster's source that causes anger, then chooses a "Transformer Card" featuring an appropriate resolution to the anger. The card directs the player to reform the monster into another shape. The first player to transform all four of his or her monsters wins the game.
publishers: Center for Applied Psychology, Inc., Childswork Childsplay

name: Alaska Adventure
description: According to the box, a fun game that tours "The Land of the Midnight Sun." The object is to be the first player to reach Polar Bear Field. The components are a board, a die, and five translucent plastic tokens.

name: Hopshot
description:
Hopshot -- the Hip-Hoppin', Kangaroo-Jumpin', Basketball Game.

In this game players each take a Kangaroo of a certain color and attempt to flick small plastic balls into it's pouch. The lever for each kangaroo controls a baby kangaroo from which the balls are thrown into the pouch. Recommended for Ages 4 and up.

name: Finger Twister Game
description:
This is a game in Daiso's Joint Party Series of games.
Players place their figures on a small board according to the outcome of spinning a special spinner, which indicates a spscific colour and the finger which must be used to touch a spot with that colour on the board.
Players who are unable to do so lose.

This is a different game from the game called 'Finger Twister' in the BGG database. This game uses all five fingers (unlike Finger Twister) and the board has a different arrangement of spots and also includes special spots known as 'breathless points'.

The instruction under 'breathless point':
"You can touch whom you are interested in through the delicate balance position! Sometimes physical contact bring people together."

However, there's also a caution on the label: "Please note that this game doesn't always let boy meets girl."
categories: Action / Dexterity, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Conundrum
description:
The Mind-Bending Anagram Game

The mental work-out for grey matter! Part anagram puzzle, part charades contest, this game tests you and your team-mates as you seek to solve a tricky set of conundrums. Each player takes a turn, assisted where possible by other team members. All scores combine into a grand team total. Many hours of fun packed into a handy pencil box!

name: Home and Away
description:
From the box:
"Who broke the church windows? Who sank Alf's boat? Your friends at Summer Bay are being blamed for a series of nasty acts but they are innocent. Can you prove this?
Go around the game board as quickly as possible chatting with the Summer Bay characters. They know the facts that will help you solve the mysteries."
Based on the Australian Soap Home and Away this is a variation on the classic Clue(do) and The Mysteries of Peking.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Liebes-Spiel
description:
A Trivia-Game about Partnership, Fun, Tears and Happiness.
Join together with any other player to move faster to the Final Question. By using characters from your horoscope you have to know your partners very good.

name: Funny Fairways
description:
From the Publisher:

Test your golf knowledge and learn more about golf and golf history in this fun 9-hole quiz. You have to avoid the nasty obstacles on the way and at the same time check your opponent's progress on the fairway. Ages 15 and up 2-4 players. Only available in Danish.

name: Division Flash Cards
description:
The game consist of a number of double sided cards with mathematical division expressions. Each player shall in turn order solve the mathematical expressions. The first to get 10 correct answers wins.

Other games in the same series:
- Subtraction Flash Cards
- Multiplication Flash Cards

name: Tivy
description:
Game components include many wooden dice shaped pieces called "tivots" with differing numbers on each face. Tivots are moved on the plastic playing board to gain ground and complete equations. The game is scalable from basic addition to algebra with different templates.

From product description:

TIVY is a math board game invented by an Oklahoman. The game is designed to teach strategy and sportsmanship in addition to fundamental mathematics. Each board comes with "tivots" (the game pieces), score sheets, a rule book, and a variety of gamesheets for use from grades three through nine. During game play, players move their tivots, which are numbered, across the board and land in score goals. Each score goal is paired with a math problem that is missing a number. When a player lands a tivot in a score goal, they create a completed math problem by replacing the missing numbers with the number on their tivot. Phases of the game include strategy time, game play time (when the tivots are moved), calculate score time (when players solve the math problems they created), check opponent time (during which players check opponents' work), challenge time (when any disputes are settled), and agree time (when players agree on their final scores).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Dice, Educational, Math
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement

name: Eson korgool
description:
A mancala game.

From Mancala World:

http://mancala.wikia.com/index.php?title=Eson_Korgool

Eson Korgool ("nine balls"), also spelled Eson Khorgol (and even found, misspelled, as Eson Xorgol), is a mancala game, which is played by the Kazakh minority in the area of Bajan Ögij in north-western Mongolia. The game was first described in 1963. Usually the holes are dug into the earth, but wooden boards do also exist.

Rules

The game is played on a board that has two rows of five holes each, although it could be played on a circular board, as there are is he holes are shared.

At the start of the game each hole contains nine dung balls, hence the name of the game.

On his turn a player picks up the contents of any hole on either side of the board and then distributes its balls in a clockwise direction (known as the direction of the sun or the male direction in Central Asia) one by one into the following holes.

A move ends after a single lap.

If the last ball is dropped into a non-empty hole, the following hole is empty, the contents of the next hole are captured.

Captures can be effected on either side of the board.

The game ends when no balls can be captured anymore.

The player who captured more balls than his opponent is the winner.

name: Krur
description:
A manqala game.

From Wikimanqala:

http://www.wikimanqala.org/wiki/Krur

Krur (crur) is a game is played by Hassaniya (Moor) people. They are a mix of Arab Beduins and Tamazigh (Berber). Their language is mostly an Arab dialect with a strong Tamazigh influence.
Hassaniya-speaking people live in the western Sahara from Niger to Mauritania. They constitute the majority of the population in Mauritania and in the Saharian Arabic Democratic Republic. There are some in Southern Morocco, Algeria, northern Senegal, Mali, and also a few in Niger. This region is called Trab el Bidan, ie. land of white people, in contrast to Bilal al Sudan, or land of black people.
Krur is mostly played by children.
Usually the holes, which are called "houses", are dug in the sand

Rules:

The board is made of two rows of four holes.
At the beginning, there are four seeds in each hole.

Each player controls the holes on his side of the board.
On your turn you take all the seeds from any hole of your side of the board and sow them in an anticlockwise sense, one in each hole, starting in the next one.
If you end in an empty hole, it is the end of your turn
If the last seed lands in an occupied hole on the opponent's side, making a total of four seeds, you end your turn and this hole is captured by you. It is marked somehow.
If the last seed lands in an occupied hole all these seeds (the one just landed plus the ones that were already there) are taken up and you keep on sowing starting in the next hole.
You sow seeds in the holes you have captured but not in those captured by your opponent.
You cannot start a sowing from a captured hole.
The winner of the game is the one that, when there are no more seeds in play, has captured more than the opponent.

Usually you don't play just a game, but a match.
On the next game you start filling the holes with the captured seeds.
The winner fills all his holes with four seeds.
The looser fills all the holes he can with four seeds. If he has some remaining seeds, he puts them in another hole, but always an even number of them, so he can retain a single seed.
The empty holes on the loser's side of the board are refilled with sand or marked somehow. In the next game nobody plays in them.
If the looser has not enough holes to put his seeds, he reopens as many holes as he needs.
There is no fixed rule about the order to close or reopen the holes. Sometimes they are opened from left to right. However, it is not important to the game.
The winner of the match is the one who captures all the seeds and leaves the opponent with no holes on his side."

name: Pasu pondi
description:
A mancala game. From: http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Pasu_Pondi

"Pasu Pondi ("sweep four") is an old Indian indoor game mostly played by Tamil women in rural areas of Tamil Nadu, South India. Sometimes it is also played in the open as well. However, the game is usually not played at night. Play often continues for several hours and the players may be surrounded by many spectators who "observe, assist and enthuse" them.

The game was first described by Dr L. S. Saraswathi in 1995.

Rules:

The game is played on a two rows board. Each row has seven holes.

According to Saraswathi every hole usually contains five seeds at the beginning, although six may be used, too.

On his turn a player distributes the seeds from one of his holes in a clockwise direction into the following holes. When all seeds have been sown, the contents of the next hole are picked up and distributed in another lap.

The turn ends when the last seed falls into a hole which is succeeded by an empty one.

During sowing the contents of any hole that contains exactly four (pasu) seeds are immediately captured by the player who owns the hole.

If, after the turn was finished, the hole following the empty one is occupied, the contents of this hole are captured. This is called pondi ("sweep").

The game ends when all seeds are on one side of the board.

The remaining seeds are captured by the player who owns their holes.

The winner of a game is the one who captures more seeds.

Pasu Pondi is played in rounds. In the next game, the players fill their holes with the seeds they captured in the previous game. Again, there must be five seeds per hole. These holes which cannot be filled are closed. The play goes on until one of the players cannot fill even one pit.

name: Sat-gol
description:
A manqala game. From http://www.wikimanqala.org/wiki/Sat-gol:

"Sat-gol was described by Professor Hem Chandra Das Gupta. He was the first Indian full-time Professor of Geology at Presidency College, Founder of Geological, Mining and Metallurgical Society and Geological Institute.
The information about sat-gol comes from the village of Gosalpur, in the Jubbulpur district, Central Provinces.
Nowadays Gosalpur is in the Jabalpur district of Madhya Praddesh, in North Central India.
No cultural background is given.

Rules:

The board is made of seven circles (note that he doesn't say "holes" but "circles") arranged in a circle.
At the beginning, there are four stones in each circle.
On your turn you take all the pieces from any circle and sow them in an anticlockwise sense, one in each circle. When you have sown all the pieces on your hand, you take the ones in the next circle and keep on sowing with them.
The turn ends when the last stone is dropped in a circle which is followed by an empty one.
If the empty circle is followed by an occupied one, its contents are captured.
According to the original description it is not permitted to choose the hole from which the move begins. You must take the first non-empty hole after the hole where the opponent finished her last move. This would lead to a single game that would be played exactly the same all the time. Víktor Bautista i Roca therefore suggested:
You can choose from which hole the sowing is started.
The game ends when both players agree that it is impossible to capture more pieces and the remaining stones are not counted.
According to Murray's misinterpretation of Das Gupta's description "the player captures the contents of the hole beyond, or if there is a sequence of empty holes, the contents of the first loaded hole". Das Gupta says, clearly, "he will be in possession of the pieces lying within the circle immediately next to the latter".
The player who captures more pieces wins the game."

name: The Water Game
description: A game produced by the Public Information Unit of North West Water, a water supply company serving north west England. It was designed to teach children about the water cycle and the role of the water authorities.

name: Sullivan's Mountain
description: Players are explorers, climbing Sullivan's Mountain, seeking the treasure hidden at the topmost cave. As players collect the necessary items of kit to advance to the next level, they will have to avoid spiders, snakes, and other mountain beasties.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Mrs. Casey Wants to Know
description:
There are two sets of cards, one with a question and one with an answer. One player picks up a question card and reads it to the player on their left. The player on the left picks up an answer card and reads it out loud. All the other players, including the questioner, burst into laughter trying to make the player reading the answer to laugh. If that player does not laugh or smile, the questioner takes another question card and reads it to the same person repeating the same answer as to the first question. If the player answering the questioner succeeds in keeping a straight face on four cards (giving the same answer for each card) that player keeps their answer card. The same questioner then asks the second player on their left another four questions, etc.

As soon as a player laughs or smiles while being questioned, they forfeit their card and now they take up a question card and become the questioner. The game continues until all of the answer slips are gone.

The winner is the player having the greatest number of answer slips in front of them.

name: Familjen Anka
description: Help the duck family into the pond. The little ducklings want to take the plunge into the pond but they are very scared, so they'll need a small push from the players. The Duck Family is a fun game for young children that trains their color memory and dexterity.

name: States
description:
Each card represents a State of the USA; players compete to create a hand of four adjacent States or alternatively a hand of same colour States with the highest point value.

From the designer's site:

"In this colorful card game for children and adults, each card is a different state. You can't help but learn geography when playing STATES; instead of memorizing, you learn by understanding."

name: Dig & Play Dinosaurs World
description: Dig & Play Dinosaurs World is a kit which includes a block from which children can "excavate" dinosaurs, which then become the playing pieces in the roll-and-move board game.

name: Familie Mayer
description: Collection of four luck-based games around a family doing various kinds of sports. In the "main game", each player has several cards of one family member and has to get complete families doing the same sport by asking other players about their hand cards, much like in the German classic "Quartett".

name: Glich
description: Through the use of 'link' cards, players navigate the Internet (depicted as a web on the board) in order to visit hardware sites and purchase all the components needed for a computer system. Some parts of the Internet are password protected, and can only be traversed if you received an appropriate password via e-mail. But be warned, some sites and e-mail may cause a 'glich', which could cost you your valuable hardware.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Secret Service
description:
Description from the back of the card case:

"The world of spies and thrilling missions.

Take control of a spy organization of your own design. Use equipment cards to arm your agents with special powers and send them to exciting cities around the world. Let them battle your opponents and complete their mission to fulfill your goal...

There are four different basic decks [Asia, Europe, Russia, USA], each presorted to give you everything you need to start the game. You can easily build your own deck - choose a powerful group of cards - none of your opponents will know what he has to expect..."
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Mini Skittles
description:
Mini Skittles consists of 10 wooden pins, approximately 2.5 inches in height, and one wooden ball, approximately 1.25 inches in diameter. The pins are set up by hand on a smooth floor or low-pile carpet. The ball is used to knock them down. Instructions are included for three different games. The games can be played by 2-5 individuals or teams with an equal number of players.
Skittles uses nine pins in a diamond formation. Scoring is based on the number of pins knocked down within a given number of throws.

Ten-pin Bowling uses all ten pins in a traditional triangular pattern. Scoring is based on the number of pins knocked down within ten frames, with bonuses for spares and strikes.

Canadian Five-pin Bowling uses five pins in a vee formation.
publishers: House of Marbles, Hoyle Products, Reed Books, Ronald A/S, VEB Metaplast

name: Lirum Larum Essenspiel
description:
Players move around a market and pick up cards with various foodstuffs. They have to collect seven different types of food in order to win.
There are also rules for some other game ideas included.

name: Sportz Dice Cricket
description: Cricket with dice. Make lists of both teams, with names of all batters and bowlers. The opening bowler rolls the "bowling" dice, that is the dice with 1,2,3,4,6 & "HOWZAT" on it. The batting team scores 1,2,3,4 or 6 runs until "HOWZAT" is rolled. The batsban then rolls the "BATTING" dice to determine the result of the "appeal". One bowler rolls the bowling dice until one batsman is out. The next bowler rolls until the next batman is out. The next team takes their turn, and the winner is the team with most runs at end of 2 innings.

name: I Campionati del Mondo di Ciclismo
description:
Italian indoor cycling game published in August 1967.
Movement is not determined by dice but by counters although there is a die in the game but that is used to win counters instead of to advance on the track. There are three kind of counters: a red one for energy, a yellow one for sprint (they can only be played in the upper corners) and a blue one for a burst of speed. There are 4 different races in the game: Velocita (Sprint), Inseguimento (Pursuit), Traguardi (Points race) and Eliminazione (an elimination race).

name: Raleigh Burner Freestyle BMX Card Game
description:
Description from the box:

"BMX is one of the fastest growing sports today. Not everyone can get to race on a BMX track but with care and skill can learn many freestyle "tricks" almost anywhere. You don't even have to own a BMX bike to play this game, but if you do, playing it will show by "stop action" sequence: Wheelies, Endos, Pogos, Buckin' Broncos, Kickturns and lots more. The winner is the player who "performs" by collecting the most sets of freestyle "tricks".

The game is back by the people who should know - Raleigh and their BMX Factory Team. Get to know your Pogos from your Endos!"

name: Sune och ryska posten
description:
In the Sunes room there is the entry to the closet. While you're in there you will play a Russian postman who gives away dare, hugs or kisses, but you wont know to whom your giving it to.

Contents:
1 boardgame
10 tiles with persons on it
100 cards
5 playing pieces
1 dice
1 rule sheet

name: Inter Biss
description:
The game contains a playing board with four squares (countries!) depicted on it. Each country has 16 playing fields:

2 orange fields: an airport with international connections and a national airport
1 yellow field: holiday resort
9 red fields: pieces of land meant for the founding of companies
4 green fields: follow the instructions or directions

The game is similar to Monopoly.

name: Conquer: Home Island
description:
CONQUER, Home Island Hawaiian war card game.

From the Box

Ages 7 and up
2 to 4 players.

Example in photo shows an actual deck with some card examples. The game itself revolves around ancient Hawaii as players battle to control an island. Card types include warriors, chiefs, divine intervention, priests, and more. 50 cards per pack plus instruction cards in both English and Japanese.

The gameplay is basically a more strategic version of war, with special abilities and multiple battles resolved at once.

name: Arthur Art Board Game
description:
Players move around a small board based on drawn "go cards". When a player lands on an "action space", the player has to draw or otherwise respond to the activity depicted on the action card. If the response is correct, the player earns points.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Arthur Art Board Game was included in Wendy's Kids Meals in March of 2009.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die Wahl-Schlacht
description:
This is a game about politics in Germany in the second half of the 70's. The players are competing for election districts and control in the federal states of former Federal Republic of Germany. To win the game, a player has to control all districts in Germany.

On his turn, a player can play as many cards from his hand as he chooses. He can attack neighbouring election districts by playing a combination of a candidate card, a concept card and a team card. The current owner of the district has the chance to keep control by playing such a triple with a higher value or concede control to the attacker. Then the active player replaces two cards + one additional card for each federal state he controls.

The game is largely luck-based as players are subject to luck of the draw.

name: Chakra View
description:
Chakra View is played on a 7x7 board. Each player has 14 soldier pawns and 7 Mantri (officer) pawns. The object of the game is to be the player who has moved the most of their Mantri pawns to the opponent's baseline.

Soldier pawns may move forward only diagonally. Mantri pawns may move as soldier pawns, directly forward, or to either side. To eliminate opponents' pieces, pawns make two diagonal moves such that the target pawn is between the starting position and the ending position. The eliminated pawn is removed from the board. In addition, any soldier pawn which was on the space where the attacker rested between the two moves is injured and is returned to the opponent's home lines.

name: The One
description: A 2 or more player card game where players discuss who is "The One" that bests fits the personality trait on top most card. All players must agree as no one card can be shared. This process of revealing a card and then discussing which player best fits that personality trait is repeated until the stack is emptied. Scores are added and the player with the most points is the winner or "The One". There is no limit as to the amount of cards any one player can receive and cards are assigned positive and negative values depending on the personality trait depicted. The game itself is the size of regular deck of cards with cartoon images depicting the various personality traits. It is best played with 4 or more players to an average time of 30-45 minutes.

name: SAILWorthy
description:
"A game that tests your skill and knowledge of sailing and the sea."

From the Description of the game section of the rule book.

"The game board simulates an ocean course around a continent. Each player or crew tacks diagonally using sailboat tokens. The player rolls two special dice which have numbers 1-2-3. One hundred and fifty colored category and surprise squares are randomly placed around the board. Players answer questions about racing, history, nature, terminology, weather, navigation, and regional areas."

Many of the questions require relatively sophisticated knowledge of sailing and sea lore.

Components:
1 Game Board
1 Rule Booklet
2 Question & Answers Books
40 "Gilligan" Cards
2 custom dice (w/ numbers 1, 2, & 3)
6 Plastic Sailboat Player Tokens
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Behind the 8 Ball
description: An abstract game with a very bland, boring game board. The box cover alludes to the game of billiards but you wouldn't know it from the game.

name: Game of the World
description:
Players compete for the votes of the world's countries, in the hopes of becoming the "Secretary General of the Nations". Each player moves his pawn around the board, which depicts flags of the world. If he lands on an unclaimed country, he must provide one or more facts about it to claim that country's vote. The game includes a booklet with facts about the 184 countries (capitol, language, population, religion, currency, and geographic area), or you may use an almanac for other facts. The player who claims the largest number of votes wins.

Game components:
1 game board
1 booklet, including rules in English and Spanish, world map, and world facts
2 dice
4 pawns
~124 plastic chips in four colors

name: Orem Trivia Challenge
description:
Orem Trivia Challenge is a limited edition (only 1,000 copies printed) trivia game about the city of Orem, UT. Each player moves a peg around a colored circular grid and answers questions about Orem based on the color they landed on. If a question is answered successfully they get a ring of that color to put on the pawn. The first player to collect all six rings and return to the Orem Chamber of Commerce is the winner.

Questions range from Orem History and Geography (What lake does Orem Border) to Famous People in Orem (What is the name of Orem's Fire Prevention Clown? Cinderbritches.)

name: Meine liebsten Haustiere
description:
Meine liebsten Haustiere is another roll & move trivia game. The subject is pets and questions range from the average age of cats to the name of Mickey Mouse's dog. Three alternatives are provided to every question.

The goal of the game is to collect 8 different coloured disks by answering questions right.

name: Family Matters
description:
To play Family Matters (MSRP $24.99, for 2-6 players ages 7 and up) family members and/or good friends each select a colored peg and take a seat (by placing it) in the family car. Each player takes turns driving it through the town, responding to a host of funny, thought-provoking card and Playbook-based questions. Once everybody has driven, the car races toward the finish line (Weekend Wish) to see whose idea of family fun will soon come true.

Family Matters™ invites players aged 7+ to share stories, discover trivia, do funny things and creatively explore 140 make-believe, location-based issues ("Fake Family Crises") from totally new perspectives.

Herding your family into a single room is hard. Convincing them to talk plainly and calmly about personal or emotionally charged topics is next to impossible. As communication, or a lack thereof, has such serious consequences, effectively addressing this kind of stuff - sooner NOT later - matters a lot.

If only there was a way to playfully facilitate self-expression and encourage collaborative conversation...

Enter Family Matters, the game parents will wish their family played when they were kids. And if you’re a kid, you’ll be glad yours did.
Game Objective

Players pile into the family car, taking turns driving through town, responding to questions and/or tasks along the way. Once everyone has driven, the car races toward the finish line (Weekend Wish) to see whose idea of family fun will soon come true.

Quick Start Guide:

1. Players each write down their "Weekend wish" on Page 10 of the Playbook
2. Players select a peg and place it into the car by age - youngest first, please.
3. The driver parks the car at anyone one of the four possible starting points.
4. The driver rolls the cube to start the car and move it forward.
5. The driver does whatever the space suggests: (i) read/respond to a card that matches the space, (ii) move from one "Black Hole" to another or (iii) resolve, with other passengers, a location based Fake Family Crisis (found on pages 14-41 in the Playbook)
6. See page 6 of the Playbook for instruction on how to resolve a Fake Family Crisis.
7. Only after resolving a Fake Family Crisis is it time to change drivers (and car seats).
8. Once all players have driven, reach takes a turn rolling toward the board's center.
9. The first player to land upon the Weekend Wish space "wins" the game.
10. The entire family must grant the winning player's Weekend Wish.

name: Shoot The Moon
description: Board game from 1959, Monopoly based system. Uses roll and move mechanics, and users buy properties. When a color group is owned, player can, when landing on a launch site with sufficient cash, "launch" themselves on a separate upward track to the moon. First player to the moon wins the game! Cash has nothing to do with victory!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bella Sara Magical Adventure Game
description: The Bella Sara Magical Adventure Game will keep you on the edge of your seat with friends or family as you laugh, jump and ride your way through the countryside of North of North. So what are you waiting for? Play the Bella Sara Adventure board game during family game night! Included in this game are 6 toy horse playing pieces.

name: Hämeenlinna Peli
description:
A promotional item published and sold in support of a football club in the Finnish town of Hämeenlinna.

Each player is dealt a number of destination cards. Players start in the main bus station of Hämeenlinna and must visit each destination, then return to the bus station; the first one to return wins. On the way they may be helped or hindered by event cards, which are basically advertisements of local businesses.

name: Clear Round
description:
From the publisher:

Race against the clock!
A frantic family show jumping game where players set up a course, then race against the timer to complete the jumps with the fewest faults. Saddle up, watch out for the poles and try not to spook your horse!

The board is double sided - dressage and cross country - and the aim is to get your horse around the course as fast as possible (the round is timed by a sand timer) without picking up faults (represented by cards) at the obstacles along the way. The person closest to a "clear round" wins.

name: Sailing Captains
description:
"Sailing Captains - Aspiring sailors learn sailboat handling, sailing basics and jargon. Experienced sailors test their expertise with this game of skill and chance."

Game contains 4 sailing course game boards, 4 "yacht" (green cubes), 1 d6, 24 playing cards with 240 plus questions and answers.

Basically a roll and move game. Each Captain and/or 1st mate has to answer a sailing question. If right, they get to roll the dice and move on their individual game boards. There are a few special squres on the boards that can impact movement like lose a turn or move backwards because of some boat related events. The winner is the team to make the journey on the board and get back to the marina first.

name: Porrii-eks tiä?
description: Porrii eks-tion? is a spellbinding game of information to all beautiful cities interested. City street pattern based on the game board to move the dice throwing Church, City Hall and Town Hall angles. Pawns each get to choose who they would like the character: Duke, Pelle Hermann, Porin bears, known musician or stew shirt. During the game responds to questions and a picture-riddles and Pori pori kinds. Correct answers will take you speed ahead described in the center of the streets. The winner is the player who manages to collect the first 8 game characters!

name: Eläinystävät lammella
description: Cute little duck and the frog boy are swimming around the pond, trying to reach a large rock. If you throw a dice right color, you'll go to the next leaf. The first one to reach big rock wins. This can also be used as a memory game. Easy and fun to play the smallest family!

name: Norge quiz extreme
description: 2400 questions that interested community will love! Finally, ask a game that only raises the issue of what is important and interesting, namely the development in the Norwegian society after 1945. The new and exciting categories are tailored for those looking for a real challenge. The new categories are: Politics, Business, Norwegian ideas, Media, Norwegians abroad and Events and social development.

name: Crazy Business
description: An exciting and fun business games for the whole family where you can take risks in hazard games. If you like to buy and sell, your best bet is probably to obtain land and sites for building banks and casinos. If, on the other hand, you like to play on the casino, this may be your biggest source of income - you can be rich in a snap. Do not forget to think about how you invest your money - everything is possible when it comes Crazy Business.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Crag
description:
Why do people climb rockfaces - because they are there and because they can. Well you can if the conditions are right!

In Crag they are always right. Crag is a solo dice and card game that tries to simulate some of experience of rock climbing. A route is generated from deck of cards and then the player attempts to move up it. The longer the route, the harder the moves the more tired they become. Placing gear can help if you fall, but it won't stop you falling, and you only have so much gear.

The files for Crag can be found in the files section.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Sports

name: Fredi Mereseiklus
description:
On the nice sea expedition on the warm southern sea, Fredi happens to find small treasure - a pretty string of pearls and a beautiful ancient oil can from an old sunken shipwreck at the bottom of the sea. He is eager to tell his best friend Batonator about his find right away. But unfortunately Batonator had stayed basking on the palm island. The voyage to this faraway and secluded island is not easy. Compete with Fredi - the one who is the first to surprise Batonator with the treasure, will be the winner.
Second game in the set "Fredi ja Batonaatori seiklused" out of four.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Fredi ja Batonaator kosmoses
description:
In this game you will be astronaut who will be the first in the Universe to reach the periphery of Galaxy at billions of light years where no one has ever been. Be there first and win, but be careful, there are a lot obstacles in your way! Be clever and smart!
Final fourth game in the set of "Fredi aj Batonaatori seiklused".
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Space Exploration

name: Chavo-poly
description:
It's Monopoly with a chav twist. Spaces include - Scruffy Maisonette, Vandalise Bus Stop and V.D. Clinic - Apply cream twice a day.

Chav is a derogatory term applied to certain young people in the United Kingdom. The stereotypical "chav" is an aggressive teenager or young adult, who often engages in anti-social behaviour.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: RolaSoccer
description:
RolaSoccer is a game for all ages and is played as a team game - either between two or more players, or between two or more groups of players. Each group constituting a team. (from the rules)

RolaSoccer is a dice game with 6 dice.
3 dice are movement dice "cubes" (Forwards, Midfield, Backs)
3 dice are incident dice "cubes" (Striker, Tackle, Goalkeeper)

name: RolaTote
description:
RolaTote is a game for turf enthusiasts and can be played by up to 6 persons - each owning a horse (or horses) and sponsering a race in turn.
The object of the gaame is to win the race by jumping an agreed number of Fences e.g.
2 to 3 horse race: 5 Fences
5 to 6 horse race: 4 Fences
7 to 8 horse race: 3 Fences

RolaTote is a horseracing dice game with 8 dice called cubes.

one soild blue CALL OVER cube
one START Cube (No. 1)
one RACE Cube (No. 2)
one FENCE Cube (No. 3)
one BAULK Cube (No. 4)
one MISTAKE Cube (No. 5)
one soild red WEIGH-IN Cube
one soild black STEWARDS ENQUIRY cube.

name: Heritage
description:
Win: Reach the middle of the board and answer a question correctly.

Play: Players move forward the number shown by the thrown die. A question is asked from the category of the square they land on - Scenic, Kill, Waterhole, Soil Erosion, Drought, Fire, Flood or Hide. A penalty plastic disc is placed in the "Snake Pit" for a wrong answer. On the 3rd wrong answer the player moves directly to the "Snake Pit". Other penalty squares also exist.

When a corner square is landed on a "You have made a reservation" card is acquired. On the 5th corner square landing a player moves towards the middle of the board. The exact number must be thrown to land on the middle square.

Contents:
1 Game board
1 Die
500 question and answer cards
24 "You have now made a reservation*" cards. (* A wild-life reservation)
6 animal player tokens
12 plastic discs
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Heart to Heart
description:
Heart to Heart is a card game designed to help stimulate conversation between friends and family members. Each card has a a question printed on it which players have to answer. Some are very general and others are more personal such as "What attracts you to the opposite sex?" and "What was your most romantic moment? Did you initiate it, or did you receive it?" There are Mystery Cards which players can use to keep their answer a secret (to avoid revealing things they don't wish to).

A variation of the game requires you to answer the questions for the other player with the person who answers the most correctly being the winner.

name: På poängjakt i Bibeln: Gamla Testamentet
description: A swedish quiz game about the bible (the old testament). The players score points by collecting cards in different "families" and by answering questions about the bible.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Limoges
description: Limoges is the captital of the French region Haute-Vienne. With this version of Monopoly you can buy and sell in the city of Limoges.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Workout
description:
Board game for 2 to 6 players, in which pieces are moved on the board after rolling two die.

There are cards for going to the doctor, do an excercise, do a sporting activity. There are trophies that are won when the player's piece sits on a sporting activity box and rolling the two die results with at least one of the dice being a "1".

Doctor's card may slow you down by forcing a procedure or exam that might make you lose your next turn.

Slogan: "You just don't sit down and play. Have fun and excercise at the same time"

Cadaco game, No. 770

name: Godfrey Evans Cricket Game
description:
This Cricket game consits of five dice. The bat player tries to made most runs with the red and yellow dice. Unless the red die shows "appeal", the opposition throws the 3 green dice and the bat player can be out (finishes his turn) or with luck he can go on rolling for more runs.

-

Additional information:
Godfrey Evans was a was an English cricketer who played for Kent and England. He died in 1999.
publishers: Abbey Games Ltd, Belton Products, LTD

name: Monopoly: Transport en Logistiek
description: The famous Monopoly game. This version is made for the dutch organisation of road transfer and haulage. You can buy, sell and trade roads.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mein erstes Verkehrsspiel
description: Children move from home to school, as determined by dice. When they reach a field with a red dot, they have to answer a traffic-related question. When answering correctly, they may move forward one or more additional fields. The first player to reach the school is the winner.

name: Matemaatiline Doomino
description: Mathematical domino. There are unfinished mathematical operations on both sides of wooden domino-tiles like "..-5=5" & "..+25=30". Players must continue the next operation correctly. Winner is the player who plays his last tile.

name: Kint a bárány, bent a farkas
description: This is an abstract Hungarian game featuring wolves and sheep. The aim of the game is to get 9 sheep out of the 90 into the barn. The wolves, of course, try to hinder from getting into the barn.

name: Superschlag: Der Tennis Würfel
description: This game is played with a special D6 which is marked with 2 different markings per face for the 2 phases of the game. First you serve using the small words on the dice face. Rules are exactly like in Tennis. Hit "out" two times and your opponent gets the point. When service has been successful (you roll "in") the second phase kicks in. You and your opponent roll in turns, hitting Lobs, cross or Stop balls. That is as long as nobody hits a failure giving away a point to the opponent. Scoring is done in the typical tennis way, counting from 0(love), 15, 30, 40 to a point and with 3-5 sets of so many games as it takes to have one player at at least 4 points and 2 more than his opponent has.

name: Magnetic Pocket Travel Racing Game
description: Nothing special here. Just roll and move. The only feature it has are magnetic pieces so it can in theory be played in a moving vehicle, but anyone over the age of 5 will probably be bored with it.

name: Conquer the Galaxy
description:
A two player card driven wargame with a sci fi theme. Play cards from your hard to generate troops, make assaults or move your fleets. Four paths to victory. Hand management, point to point movement.

Inspired by the play mechanics of "Free at Last", you play cards to create. move and assault with your troops ( space craft fleets ). You are also trying to win a political conflict so need to maintain presence in all regions on the board. Fights are not just against the opposing players fleets but also for control of industrial sectors, resources and population.

Games home page : http://blackdogofdoom.blogspot.com/2010/09/conquer-galaxy.ht...
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Elvis Presley King Of Rock Game
description:
This game is marked: Copyright 1979. King of Rock Game Company.

The object of the game is to become the first player to enter the center of the gold record disc and become the "King of Rock". This is accomplished by the acquisition of record copyrights, thus obtaining a required gold record and therefore qualifying for entrance into the gold record disc."
The game has mansions, safe spaces, forfeit/collect spaces, buying copyrights, mortgages, and bankruptcy spaces, along with a gold record disc area. There are also Motion Pictures Cards, Recording Studios Cards, Concert Cards and Television Special Cards (you get to collect and pay points,.purchase Album Singles for points, etc.)

name: Uitstel van Executie
description:
Boardgame of the Dutch TV show. Players try to prevent their house has to be sold.
Each players get the debts and mortgages of debtors. With a team of professionels to get the highest price of their houses. But there is a time limit. The bank wants its money.

name: Combination
description:
From the rules: "Combination is a game based on the binary numbering system for 2 to 6 players. It is extremely fast moving and action packed. Anyone who can add and subtract will readily enjoy this high-tech game of the 21st century."

This game has a safecracking theme, but it consists mainly of racing to mentally convert decimal to binary, collecting cards with each race won in an attempt to match a predetermined pattern.

There's no strategy in this game; the person who has the most facility with mental subtraction has an edge, but ultimately the winner depends on the completely random draw of the cards.

name: The new game of Emulation: Designed for the Amusement of Youth of both Sexes and calculated to inspire their Minds with an Abhorrence of Vice and a Love of Virtue
description:
A race game of Moral Improvement. From No 1 Turnpike Gate to No 66, "Virtue is its Own Reward"!
It was marketed as a morality game designed to lead children to admire and adopt the virtues of Obedience, Truth, Honesty, Gentleness, Industry, Frugality, Forgiveness, Carefulness, Mercy, and Humility; and to view in their real colours the opposite vices of Obstinacy, Falsehood, Robbery, Passion, Sloth, Intemperance, Malice, Neglect, Cruelty and Pride.

name: Cookie Crunch
description: Cookie Monster loves his pretend peanut butter cookies. Play along with your kids and spin to see how many times each player can try to feed him a "cookie". If you're the first to feed all of your cookie tokens to Cookie Monster, you win the game!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Electronic

name: TexOpoly
description:
More fun than chasin' Armadillos!

TexOpoly is a big fun board game that truly captures the character and diversity of the Lone Star State. Anyone who loves Texas will be tickled half to death by this high-flyin' boot-stompin' journey across America's Greatest State.

Head out on a Cattle Drive, come face to face with a Six Shootin' Armadillo, Sit a Spell in the Pokey as you strive to become the wealthies Texan alive!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Old Maid: The Board Game
description: All players are dealt an equal number of tiles. Leftover tiles are out of play. Each player starts with a pawn on Start. Each player, in turn, will draw a tile from the player on the right. If the tile is a number tile, then the drawing player advances that number of spaces on the gameboard. If that tile is an Old Maid tile then that player takes possession of the Old Maid marker. A player may get the Old Maid marker anyway if one lands on an Old Maid space on the gameboard. If a player who is supposed take possession of the Old Maid marker already has it then that player may give the marker away to another player. The first player to reach Finish without having possesssion of the Old Maid marker is the winner.

name: Shocking Quiz
description: A fantastic challenge for shockaholics or quiz addicts, Shocking Quiz lets you test your general knowledge with this 4 player multiple choice quiz game. And if you don’t know the correct answer to one of the 600 questions your in for a shock....quite literally!

name: GolfEgo
description:
Taken from the official website:

Golf Board Game: GolfEgo™
...... a great way to play the game

GolfEgo is fun! It's easy to understand and play, whether you're a regular golfer or not.

Now everyone can play a round of golf, young and old and right at home. And just as exciting as the real game!

GolfEgo™ is an innovative board game based on golf. Like when you are playing outside on the green, this board game is a challenge to your Ego. Play 9, 18 or just a few holes. Create your own rules, or play one of the available games like stroke play, match play, skins or fun golf, a kind of Ludo...

The 4 pawns represent the players and have been designed just for this game, and so are the 4 dices which are the virtual clubs in your bag. So with GolfEgo™ you can decide which one to use. Playing safe or taking a risk, just like the real thing!

The game itself:
Much attention has been given to detail. Inside the colourful box there is a nicely designed board which covers 18 holes (9 holes each side). The board features ponds, bunkers and greens. It even has a clubhouse! Of course the box is delivered to you with dices, pawns and a notebook for writing down the scores.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Just Typical
description:
Just Typical is a party game where players controversial statements about men and women. Those who find themselves in agreement with the other players more often will win.

Each turn, the active player draws a card from the deck, which could be a Controversy Card or a Just Typical Card - which is which is marked on the back of the card. In either case, the active player chooses one of three statements on the card and reads it aloud.

Controversy Cards have statements that refer to women, men, or relationships, such as "Women make better diplomats.", or "More alcohol is consumed on a hen night than a stag night." Players then secretly vote, using voting cards, as to whether they Agree or Disagree with the statement.

Just Typical Cards describe behaviours or situations, such as "Shopping for things that are not needed." or "Putting an empty milk carton back in the fridge." Players secretly vote, this time voting for if they thing that trait is "Typically Male" or "Typically Female".

Once everyone has voted, the votes are revealed. The players in the majority score +1 point, those in the minority score -1 point (but never going below 0). In the case of a tie, the active player's choice is considered the majority for scoring purposes.

The first player to reach 14 points wins.

name: Giro d'Italia
description: Ialian cycling game from the 1950's. Comes with a board that depicts Italy with roads between cities. The players move their riders (by roling two wooden dice) on the road. The game starts in Milan; the first one to reach Rome is declared the winner.

name: Barbie: Go Shopping!
description:
Barbie is headed for some fun, but first she'll need to get her gear. Collect sets of three accesory cards by "borrowing" from other players, or "going shopping". The player who has the most sets when all the cards are gone wins.
This is a simple yet fun kids card game made in 1999 by Mattel. You basically are trying to make sets of 3 accesories for different activities that Barbie might do, such as items she would take to a bowling party, the ball, or going back to school. When the deck is used up the person with the most sets wins.

name: Pirate's Quest Game
description:
From box description:

This could be the end for Jack Sparrow and his pirate crew as they make the journey to World's End and prepare for the battle of their lives. Featuring your favourite characters, including Captain Jack Sparrow, Will Turner, Elizabeth Swann and Captain Barbossa, you'll sail the seven seas as you collect the pieces of your puzzle. Be the first to complete your character's scene and you'll be the triumphant winner, sending your opponents down to Davy Jones' Locker!

A basic roll and move round 3 multi-space rings in an endeavour to collect all 9 parts of a puzzle and complete the picture of your character. The spaces are simple instructions to collect, roll again, move on etc. Collect 3 pieces of your puzzle per track and then move to the next track when landing on the appropriate space. The winner is the first to complete his puzzle by collecting all 9 necessary pieces.
A lot of the fun for youngsters will be playing their actual characters from the films and being able to build the character's picture puzzle during the game.

name: The Game of Shopping at the Supermarket
description:
User Summary....

Move a shopping cart through the store in an attempt to pick up one food card from each department; the winner is the first player to collect six different cards, pass the cashier and go out.

Contents:

* spinner with instructions
* 24 food cards (4 of each food group)
* folding game board
* 4 plastic shopping carts
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Fibonacci's Trump
description:
Fibonacci's Trump is a basic trump/trick-taking card game.

Collect tricks through playing cards depending on the color that is led, using the trump color when able. Points are determined by the symbols on the cards: the number of the symbols that is the same as the Symbol Indicator collected determines how many points you are awarded each round.

Scoring uses Fibonacci's numbers... so the more symbols you collect, the better off you are.

First player to 144 wins.

name: Answerit
description:
This is a question and answer game with 6 large cards and 136 small ones. The large cards are filled in when a question on the small cards is answered correctly.

Published in England.

name: Mobay City
description: A promotional game with a somewhat contrived theme. A friend of the players' has been locked up in a seedy warehouse for unclear reasons. The players race across town using various means of transportation. Before reaching the warehouse each player must also acquire a cell phone with a Telia subscription (guess none of them thought that was worth having for any other reason) so they can receive an access code (from whom?). Once the friend has been sprung from captivity he must be brought back home, and during this stage players try to "steal" him from each other (can't they all just get along?).
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: På egen risk
description:
In this promotional board game by Swedish insurance company Skandia, players move around a Monopoly-style board, drawing various types of event cards. They will get the chance to invest in property like cars, houses or diamonds, hoping to sell them at a profit or else convert them to cash at the end of the game. They may also get to purchase tickets in an intermittently triggered lottery (because winning the lottery and speculating in diamonds are the two surest ways of getting rich, or something).

Everything and anything in the game is in danger of damage or accidents, although having the right insurance helps with this. Several of the risk vs. reward elements of the game are easily solvable and serve to encourage behaviour that is illegal or economically irrational in reality, like casino gambling or diamond smuggling, which seems a little odd considering the theme. The game is played for an arbitrary amount of time; the rules suggest playing until a point in time agreed upon in advance is reached, after which five more moves are played out. The player with the most money is then declared the winner.

name: Kelgukoerad: Kes tappis kirjakandja?
description:
From the publisher:
Detectives will get a call into suburbia, where there have happened a murder. An old lady who went after the very early morning newspaper found a dead mailman behind her fence. All signs show brutal murder. Very fast 4 suspects emerge and your job is to help detectives to find out who killed the mailman!!

New expansion to game "Kelgukoerad".

Content:
new case file
32 new vidence cards
8 "new blind luck" cards
envelope with an answer
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Kelgukoerad: Kuhu kadus karu?
description:
From the publisher:
Detectives get called to a zoo, where last night a little cup was robbed. Now it is up to you to find out who is responsible.

New expansion to game "Kelgukoerad". This one is for kids.

Content:
new case file
32 new vidence cards
8 "new blind luck" cards
envelope with an answer
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Mutual of Omaha Health and Safety Game
description: The game is a pure roll and move game printed on the back of a world map handed out to US schoolchildren in 1983/84 in a promotional tour for the program Mutual of Omaha's Wild Kingdom. The world map on the obverse side has a large inset advertising both the game and the program. Players move tokens in turn at the roll of a die (d6), neither tokens nor die being included, starting at a space marked "home" and ending at a square marked "beach". The health and safety theme is a bit heavy-handed in the directions on many of the spaces of the board. No directions are included but the winner is the first to reach the beach. The track of the board describes a schoolchild's possible day from leaving home until going to the beach after school.

name: Jubiléumsspelet Linköping 700 1987
description:
Players move pawns around a simple map of the Swedish town Linköping. Each space has a number that determines the difficulty level of the questions to answer. The harder the question, the higher the score.

The questions officially range from easy to very hard, but looking at the cards they seem to range from difficult to ludicrous (spoken by someone born and living in Linköping).

The game was produced for Linköping's 700th anniversary celebrations.

name: Do the Blue Recycling Game
description:
From the game instructions:

"Promote awareness and create enthusiasm for recycling waste products!

This game was developed through a partnership between Muncie Sanitary District; East Central Indiana Solid Waste District; and East Central Recycling.

Each player receives one of 14 cards representing different items to be recycled. The players then roll a die and move their game piece around the board attempting to collect all of the recycling cards and placing them into their blue recycling bag!

Don't recycle and get penalized. Get bumped by another player and lose some of your hard earned trash! Circle the board until someone recycles them all.

REMEMBER, EVERYONE WINS WHEN YOU RECYCLE!"

Game comes with the following components:
Instructions
Do the Blue board
6 player markers
1 6 sided dice
84 recyclables tiles (6 per each)
Collectible recycling can (CUTE!)

name: New Orleans-opoly
description:
How do you make a game about the city that care forgot? While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the N’awlins we could into this box. From Beignets and Gumbo to Street Cars and Mardi Gras, here’s a game about the most interesting city in the world!

Here’s a Quick Idea of How to Play...Buy your favorite New Orleans properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound Easy? Gumbo Ya Ya! Traffic jams, Rent Control and Parking Fines make it a little more difficult and a lot more fun!

SO CHOOSE YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GO N’AWLINS! You may soon be parading in Mardi Gras…or stuffed too full of Muffulettas. Whatever happens... Laissez les bon temps rouler! (Let the good times roll!)

This is New Orleans... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: St Louis-opoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

This is a re-themed version of Monopoly sporting St Louis Landmarks.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Health
description:
You start the game with 50% health. The object is to get to 100%, but the luring sides of life and the challenges are plentiful and you can easily fall into the pits that will give you lower health.

The Health game is a good mix of questions, brain trainers and - if you are up for it - physical exercises (can be played without if you choose)

There are two different categories of cards (questions and exercises) in the game:

F-cards contain questions about Food, Fitness & Family.

W-cards are challenges for your Will, Wit and Well-being. Some of these 'exercises' call for the use of the timer included in the game.

The more correctly you answer questions and solve your challenges, the healthier you become - at least in the game.

name: The Little Mermaid Secrets of the Sea
description:
In this game, the first player to find, collect and match three of the same color "treasures" hidden along the ocean floor to their Ariel mover, wins. If you land on a sea flower you get 1 attempt to find a treasure. If you land on a Flotsam or Ursula you must return one of your treasures. Try to remember what your opponent draws as it may be what you need. You can also move back 1 by spinning a Sebastian, or get 1 free treasure by spinning a Treasure.

Publisher's Website
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical, Novel-based
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Scravage
description:
Scravage is Gin Rummy, crossed with a word game, played with a Scroker deck. The entire alphabet is represented with the citrus suits, and the scrokers are completely wild (suit and letter). You can mix the chili pepper suit's vowels with the citrus letters in order to form your words. The animal suit, however, is sacred, and cannot be commingled with the other suits to form words. On the other hand, its words will be worth double points.

On your turn, you either acquire a card by drawing one from the deck, or by scravaging (scavenging) one from the discard or an opponent's entire four-letter word. Then, you play a word if you scravaged, or if you want to. Finally, you must discard if you didn't go out.

To add spice, there are numerous variants, as well.

name: Mega Express: Spelet om EU
description: A game made to encourage debate before the Swedish referendum in 1994 on joining the European Union. Players roll and move along the game board, triggering various events that include having to quickly look up answers in a book named Mega Express. Along the way they pick up votes to be used in the end game, which takes place after an arbitrary agreed-upon period of time (the rules suggest half an hour or an hour). Each player now casts their accumulated votes either for or against joining the EU, and the totals are added up to show the outcome; the rules envision several concurrent games, the votes from each session being added up to a grand total. It should be noted that the book required for proper use of the game was not packaged with it, may not accompany copies found in thrift shops, and may be difficult to obtain.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: Clue Jr.: The Case of the Missing Glasses
description:
This version of Clue Jr is in an "enhanced book" format. The book folds out make 5 different boards, each revolving around a difference case. The side piece on the side of the book has a spinner and a small pocket that snaps closed to keep the Clue sheets, cards, envelope, and player tokens in. The player tokens are reusable stickers.

Book is roughly 8X11 closed, board folds out to about 8X20 once opened. The laminated pages for the board are stiff, but not truly board stock.

Players use the spinner to roll and move around the board, gathering clue cards. Each board has a short paragraph describing the mystery for that page and has an illustrating of the room the mystery takes place in. The board is superimposed over the illustration and the locations are numbered.

Produced by Running Press Kids under a license from Hasbro.

name: Delma: Linnas
description:
From the box:

1)Start from the "HOP" square and play until you reach square "STOP". Winner is the one who manages to do this first.
2) Place the six tiles with dice symbols on to the table face down and shuffle them good. Before every move turn one over and move the number of steps. Then shuffle the tiles again.
3) When you reach the red square then move according to the arrow and step to the nearest orange square.
4) When you reach the yellow square with the man figure then do the following:
walking man - walk around the room
crawling man - crawl around the room
man standing on the chair - quickly stand on the chair
sleeping man - miss a turn and take a nap
leaning forward man - lean forward 3 times
crouching man - jump like a frog
jumping man - jump 4 times up into the air

This is the first game in the series of 4 games, that make together one mega Delma game.

Delma is a product here in Estonia and Baltic. The game was made as a part of a campaign of them.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Role Playing

name: States Race
description: User review: Starting at Washington D.C. and moving clockwise around the track, the place race to score points and return home. Certain spins force the player to answer a simple question about US geography. The game is designed to encourage children to learn about US geography.

name: WCW Superslam
description:
From the description on the back of the box:

"The Flying Knee Drop, the Sleeper or even the Scorpion Death Lock, use any of these favourite holds from genuine WCW Wrestlers to out fight you opponent in this exciting board game.
Watch the tension mount as you count down with the referee and try to recover from a Pindown, Submission or Knockout!

Use your team partner to tag an manoeuvre your opponent. However you play, you'll need all your wits plus a little luck to win some belts and ultimately the WCW Championship Cup."

Each player controls two wrestlers, one in and one outside the ring. Play Action Cards to manoeuvre around the ring, once your wrestlers are on the same square in the ring, you must challenge each other to a Pindown, Submission or Knockout. Whoever plays the highest Action Card wins the challenge! If it's a knockout, the loser gets 10 die rolls to get a six else he's counted out! If it's a pindown or a submission, the loser gets just three rolls to score a six. If you have to take two pindown/submission cards, you lose the bout! The winner takes a Championship Belt card.

The first player to three Championship Belts wins the Ultimate Championship cup.

The game includes several variants for making the game longer, including rules for tagging, double teaming and for a 4 player, 8 wrestler super size match.

Bizarrely, the game only has rules for two OR four player (NOT three).
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Sports

name: All Around Northern Virginia
description: All Around Northern Virginia is similar in play to monopoly, but with a few house rule differences. Taxes and fines are paid to the kitty where a player can collect on the Municipal Parking Lot space. The cost of "expansion" or upgrading monopolized property is listed on the board rather than printed on the cards.

name: Monopoly: Belfast Edition
description:
Description: The city of Belfast has long been one of the few destinations that is able to cater for all interests, with its rich heritage of naval connections, lively arts, great restaurants and bars. And now you can tour this amazing city and all its famous locations with the new Belfast Monopoly! From Donegall Square to the Titanic Quarter, and from the Belfast Waterfront to the historic Parliament Buildings at Stormont, it’s all up for grabs as you race around the board building a property empire to beat your opponents!

It's Monopoly.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Oktoberfest
description:
From the manufacturers description:

A regional Monopoly about the Oktoberfest. The 70 year old Monopoly is available in many regional versions.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Raus die Maus
description:
Educational pattern recognition game for young children. The cards have two sides. One side contains four pictures, the other side a written word.
The active player needs to find a hand card that differs from another played card by only one element; either one picture or one letter. His/her neighbor to the left looks for a card at the same time; if he/she is faster, he/she says "Raus die Maus" and it is his/her turn next. The goal is to get rid of one's cards.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Tennis: Das Millionenspiel
description:
From the back of the box:

The worldwide popularity of tennis has been boosted in recent years by the emergence of true super-stars earning fabulous dums [sic] in the form of prize money. As a board game for the entire family "TENNIS" brings all of the excitement of a hectic international tennis season to your living room table. You are the "pro" who has his ups and downs as one tournament succeeds another across the globe. Like the tennis stars themselves, you'll need both luck and skill in order to end up a big winner!

Each player will try to qualify for as many Tournaments as he can, win as many Exhibition Matches as possible, rise to the big-money hights [sic] of the World Rankings and make it to the finals of the Davis Cup. Above all each will try to accumulate the maximum prize money. The player who has earned the most at the end of the game is the season's winner.

name: Rally Athina
description:
"A rally with a difference, full of dangerous pitfalls and traps. Your guide is a reckless owl who leads you through the streets of Athens at top speed. Your aim is to reach the end, at the Acropolis, and be crowned the winner!" (Source: Back of the box)

"This game consists of a series of 63 squares. Each player chooses an owl-shaped pawn. The owl was the symbol of Athena, patron goddess of the city of Athens. All players in turn roll the dice. The player with the highest score goes first. The rest follow in turn. When a player falls on a square depicting an owl, he has the opportunity of moving his pawn a second time, for the same number of squares. If a player throws 9 (with a 6 and a 3) he moves to square 26 whereas if he brings 9 (with a 4 and a 5) he moves to square 53. The player to reach square 63 first, is the winner. But beware! There are traps on the way." (Source: Center of the board)

name: Monopoly: Isle of Arran Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The game has been redesigned with an Arran twist, featuring Arran villages and local businesses.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Lines of Fire
description:
In Lines of Fire you must protect your castle by sending Goblins, Swordsmen, Knights, Orcs, and Dragons into battle.

You will strategically form an army using vertical and horizontal lines of offense and defense. When battle starts, the more powerful unit will defeat the other. The first to reach, and destroy their opponents castle will win the game!

The gameplay is simple. Each player has a castle and a 20-sided die. The die is used as a counter to represent the amount of damage the castle can take before it's destroyed. In order to protect the castle, each player will draw cards. Players will draw creatures with powers of 1 through 5. The higher the number, the more powerful the creature. The creatures are strategically placed in lines using one of 4 horizontal positions in front of the castle. If at any point an "Attack" card is played, the front line of each players army will attack each other in a head to head battle. The creature with higher power will destroy the other. Unused power will be applied to the creature behind the defeated creature. If a player is eventually able to successfully deal damage to another player's castle, the castle takes damage. If a castle is brought to zero, that owner of that castle loses and the game is over.

name: Barry Norman's Extra Trivia: T.V. & Movies
description:
Trivia game, using the name of a famous film review show on British television. It is a stand alone game but was primarily aimed at Trivial Pursuit players looking for more questions/categories. Each card has 6 questions, each in a different category. A die is provided. The player rolls the die and answers the question allocated to the die roll. The 6 categories are;
Oscars
TV
Actors
Names
Actresses
Miscellaneous
The first player to get a correct answer in each of the 6 categories scores a bonus number of points and the game ends. The player with the highest score at that time, wins.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Professor Noggin's Hockey
description: Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions about ice hockey.

name: Towers of Illusion
description:
Look!... Now Look Again! What you see (or don't see) determines your path to the top! Science Art magic and philosophy are intertwined in the "seeing" of visual illusions. Towers of Illusion examines perception through dozens of visual oddities. The accompanying text carefully explains the dynamic of each illusion, so players are entertained and educated. With more than one way to play, this game delights children and adults.

Game Mechanics:

Roll the die and move your Jester accordingly. If you land on a step with a path symbol on it, take a card and read the question on the front of the card out loud. Answer the question. Depending upon what you see in the optical illusion at that moment, turn the card over and follow the directions based upon what you saw. Do the game when landing on a step with a key symbol. When you reach the top of the tower, you obtain a treasure coin. Obtain three treasure coins (one each of the three types of treasure coins) and win.

General Information:

It appears that the game was sold through the Museum of Fine Arts Boston, MA.

Contents:

Three Towers, Six Jester Player Pieces, One Die, 18 Treasure Coins, 198 Optical Illusion Cards and on the back side of these cards are the Key Cards (66) and Path Cards (132), 18 Lose a Turn Cards, 18 Extra Turn Cards, Eight Clips to Hold the Towers Together

name: Weave
description:
This game is played on a 10x10 square board.
On each turn,each player drops a friendly stone on an empty cell.
Goal:Wins the player that connects his edges with an orthogonal or a diagonal group of friendly stones.

name: Unistuste Agentuur
description:
From the rules:

Game is based on a TV show here in Estonia called "Unistuste Agnetuur" ("Dream Agency").
In it a story telling game in which each player must make a dream party for the customer.
In each turn one player is a customer and all other players are dream party makers.
Before customer takes a card from a theme deck, each player takes 1 card from 4 card piles (not the theme deck). On each of those card are 1 word. Now, the customer says the theme and each player now must put together a party idea for the customer using those 4 cards in their hand.
After which, customer will decide who had the best idea and went close to what he / she wanted.
Game goes on until everyone has been a customer.

You win the game if you have collected the most theme cards while making the best parties. If two or more players have equal number of cards, then they must count flowers on them. Each flower is a point and a level of difficulty (1-easy, 3 hard).
publishers: ProCard Baltic OÜ, Solaris, TV 3, WePlay

name: Monopoly: Worms
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Worms, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Il Grande Gioco del Giro d'Italia
description: Very simple roll & move cycling game published in July 1973. It was based on the Tour of Italy, on the board you start in Belgium , travel through Germany & Switzerland with the final and largest part of the race in Italy. The game comes with four cardboard riders and two dice.

name: Giro Ciclistico d'Italia
description: Italian cycling game from just after WWII about the Tour of Italy. It uses roll & move mechanics but technically it's not a race game because the winner is not the player who reaches the final square on the board first but the player scored the most of points on the track.

name: Juego Carreras de Ciclismo
