description: Spanish free downloadable cycling themed card game that works with movement and incident cards. The goal is to win the cycling race by tactical use of the cards.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Racing, Sports

name: Les Convois
description:
The aim of the game is to transport five jeeps one after another to the garage of the player's color. On the way players try to avoid traps and detours. Whoever brings his convoy of five jeeps to his garage first is the winner.

Les Convois (The Convoy) was the first game published by the French Miro Company. The 20 jeeps are made of lead.

name: Jeu de la vie et du hasard
description:
Each piece represents a character (Gangster, MP etc). Each character has permanent qualities ( represented by rings) as well as more short-lived qualities related to health and wealth (represented by pearls). In the game the pawns advance in the professional ladder that players choose according to the qualities they have learned. There are three levels of rules: beginners, veterans and champions.

Box contains:
- 1 with 4 tracks
- 40 boxes divided into eight groups of five representing a profession
- 8 numbered pawns
- 48 pearls
- 24 yellow rings
- 16 red rings
- 2 regular dice
- 1 special die (dice of destiny)
- 1 special die (dice luck)
- Small triangular sticks
- Rules

name: The IMPULSE Control Game
description:
The IMPULSE Control Game is a fun therapeutic and educational board game designed to help young people with ADD, ADHD, and other conditions involving impulse control problems. The game teaches seven specific skills that have been proven in the research literature to help impulsive children control their impulses, make good decisions, and avoid actions that are detrimental to themselves and others.

The skills learned in the game are:
-Accepting delayed gratification
-Reading social cues
-Understanding the benefits of impulse control
-Developing positive self talk
-Improving problem solving skills
-Understanding the consequences of impulsive actions
-Improving the ability to stop a behavior

In the game, players drive their cars, making their way through a maze of roads. At each intersection they have to make a decision regarding the best path. Some paths are shorter, but contain various hazards that are represented by road signs. In order to do well in the game, players are forced to delay decisions until the facts and consequences have been considered and to plan ahead. Players have a great time as they learn these impulse control skills and use them to plan and find the best route to their destination.

name: Strip Poker Dice Game
description:
Strip Poker Dice is an adult "strip" version of Poker Dice, where the losing player must remove an article of clothing. In addition to the standard poker dice, a sixth "action die" is included, which the winner of the hand rolls. This determines from where the clothing is to be removed (above / below the waist or choice).

The game can be played in multiple ways, including:

- Each player rolls the dice a number of times to construct the best hand. The player with the lowest scoring poker hand must remove an article of clothing as directed by the sixth die.

- The "liar's dice" variant where you are trying to convince the next player to accept a higher valued roll than the one you received. Eventually someone will be accused of lying. In the case of a lie, the "seller" removes an article of clothing as directed by the sixth die, while in the case of the truth it's the accuser who does so.
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Platz da für Kli-Kla-Klawitter
description: Each player get a family with 3 members (A,B and C) and tries to place them in the right order on a 8x8 grid in on row. On the grid there are number from 1 to 6. On your turn you roll a die and place on piece on a spot with that number. You can place one of your family members (only in one row) or a neutral (blocking) piece somewhere. Whoever has first his members in the right order in the grid wins.

name: Yago Pool Card Game
description:
The world's first see-through card game

The elements of Yago finger billiards pool combined in a clever card game for the whole family.

The card game includes 90 game cards, 10 wild cards, a game board, cardboard, 2 special dice, 5 red and 5 yellow chips and a rules in four languages (German, English, French and Italian).

The game idea is based on the same game system as Yago pool finger billiards. First, players gain cards. Each card has a 3x3 grid (like the holes on a Yago Pool board) of which 8 of the points are punched. The cards are stacked in the hand held (that is not fanned, like a traditional card game) so that the solid point on each card can be seen through the cards. Once a player has the right combination of cards and can create a row, players can then place a chip (red or yellow) on one of the corresponding points on the game board. If a player can cover all five points on the wild card, he may place his chip on any point on the board.

Scoring is via making rows on the main board. 1 point for a line of three chips or placing 5 chips on the board. Three points if the 5 chips makes 2 lines simultaneously.

name: Kampen om  Västerås
description:
From the publisher:
Kampen om Västeråsis a game about the Swedish city of Västerås. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and its history. Players move around a track on the board and acquire properties and answer trivia questions about the featured city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kampen om Lund
description:
From the publisher:
Kampen om Lundis a game about the Swedish city of Lund. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and its history. Players move around a track on the board and acquire properties and answer trivia questions about the featured city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kampen om Mariestad
description:
From the publisher:
Kampen om Mariestadis a game about the Swedish city of Mariestad. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and its history. Players move around a track on the board and acquire properties and answer trivia questions about the featured city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lokalspelet, Kampen om stan: Karlskoga
description:
This is a Monopoly clone. The publisher Lokalspelet i Skandinavien AB did a lot of these games as promotions for different cities in the 1990s.

In the middle of the board is a photo of the Karlskoga and around that is a lot of the stores in the city. You can buy stock in them, and you can get cards that ask you questions about the city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: UNO: John Deere Edition
description:
Test you mettle with the John Deere version of UNO!

112 Custom Cards featuring legendary John Deere equipment.

Same great UNO play PLUS the special Harvest card which forces your opponents to do some heavy lifting! When you play this card, select another another player to draw cards from the draw pile until he/she draws a green card which will allow them to complete the harvest (or until they draw 5 cards, whichever comes first.)

Remember to shout "UNO!" when your hand gets down to the last "crop"!

Comes in Collector's Tin.

name: Golden-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

GENTLE, INTELLIGENT, FRIENDLY, EAGER TO PLEASE
MEET THE GOLDEN!

With good reason, the Golden Retriever is one of the most popular breeds in the United States. They are loveable, well-mannered dogs with great charm and a striking golden coat, making them both beautiful and a joy to own. Originating in the Scottish Highlands in the late 1800s the Golden was used predominantly for hunting. Active and energetic, this breed can adapt to many different living situations but requires daily exercise. They are easily trained, always patient and gentle with children, and make wonderful canine companions.

GOLDEN-OPOLY IS A GAME OF TAIL-WAGGING FUN!
COLLECT YOUR FAVORITE GOLDENS AND PLAY HARD!

Increase your rent by buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet, get sent to the kennel!

GRAB YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GO GOLDENS!

Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show... or marching in the dog parade!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: The Family Affair Game
description: A children's spin-and-move game in which players move pieces representing four characters from the show in a race to find the doll Mrs. Beasley, which is pictured on one of eight face-down tiles scattered on the gameboard.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Portland-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

How do you make a game about a place like this?

While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Portland we could into this box. From a park too small for one person to the magnificent Mt. Hood backdrop and all the eclectic wonder in between, this is beautiful Portland, Oregon!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play...

Buy your favorite PORTLAND properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!

So choose our token and advance to taxi! You may soon be
the mayor of Portland... or you may be summiting Mt. Hood!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Monopoly: 2010 Fifa World Cup South Africa Edition
description: Version of Monopoly themed on the 2010 Fifa World Cup, including competing nations in place of the traditional coloured property sets, stadia in place of the stations and half time/full time cards instead of the chance/community chest cards.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Fulham FC Edition
description:
Version of Monopoly which replaces the traditional properties with players from Fulham FC past and present.

From the publisher's website:
A must for all Fulham fans, this new edition of Monopoly features current stars alongside the legends of the past, and is your chance to find out just who is the hottest property at the club!

Put together your own dream team by buying and selling players as you try to bankrupt your opponents.

Now's your chance to snap up the likes of Andy Johnson, Johnny Haynes, Alan Mullery, George Cohen and even Mohamed Al Fayed himself, as well as the famous stands of Craven Cottage as you race round the board and to victory!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Triple Tier
description:
A game very similar to Sorry. Players have 5 pieces of three types that they move from their start spaces on tier one, up to their home spaces on tier 3. Two pieces can only move around the board to the left, two can only move around to the right and one can move in either direction. Landing on certain spaces by exact count lets you move up to the next tier.

The game is played by rolling a single die and then picking which of your pieces to move in the direction they are allowed to go.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: HeadBangers Big Strike (Bowling)
description:
Experience the thrill of bowling a perfect game with the HEADBANGERS Big Strike. Adjust his hand to aim the ball and bang his head to bowl. This bowler comes with his own lane, bowling ball, 10 bowling pins and scoreboard.

(from 2008 press release)

name: ABC Bingo Game
description:
Product Description
Calling all super readers! Join Super Why, Alpha Pig, Princess Presto and Wonder Red in this ABC Bingo game where your child can practice letter identification and begin to read simple words. Featuring cards with letters that spell three letter words, the first player to cover three letters horizontally or vertically and calls out Super Duper wins!
For 2 to 4 players, ages 4 and up.
Contents: bingo cards, bingo chips, letter cards and instructions.

name: Super Speedway Strategies: The Racing Game
description: Roll and move racing game endorsed by Richard Petty. Players move their cars around the track for a predetermined number of laps, collecting "Petty Cash" (as well as Points and Laps). There are Pit, Wreck, and Pass cards that confer bonuses and penalties. The ultimate goal is to have the most cash at the end of the game, not necessarily to win the race itself (although that does bestow cash).

name: SAT Game for Dummies
description: SAT Game For Dummies is the trivia-style board game includes 500 questions which represent the 5 SAT categories. Each question is timed to train players to work at the SAT pace. Risks and rewards encourage players to answer opponents' questions and also help the other players. The winner is the first player to collect diplomas in all five SAT question categories and return to the START. Overall, an interesting and welcome twist to aid in preparing for the SAT.

name: Monopoly: Harrow School Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Edition of Monopoly with the traditional properties replaced by locations from Harrow School.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Girlguiding UK Edition
description: An edition of Monopoly released to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the founding of the Girl Guides movement. The game replaces the traditional Monopoly properties with items, locations and groups related to Girlguiding.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: California Centers Magazine Collector's Edition
description: An edition of Monopoly themed for shopping center professionals, featuring influential companies from across the real estate industry. California Centers Magazine is a trade publication for commercial builders in California.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Heim-Wintersport-Spiel: Abfahrt
description:
This game tries to simulate a downhill competition. The game board shows 6 spaces which each player has to pass. On each space the players roll a given set of special dice which add or subtract from their time. On two spaces a special 'risk' dice may be added, which shows better time-results than the normal time dice, but also bears the risk of falling and dropping out of the game.
After all players have rolled for their skiers on all six spaces, the cumulated time is added or subtracted from the par time of 2:00:00 and the player with the best time is the winner.

name: The Sign of Money
description:
A dice game where players try to roll more money than their opponents.

The game consists of six dice, three with math signs and numbers one to six, and three with monetary values (two with Euro cents and one with Euro).

On his turn, a player may roll the dice up to five times. After each roll, the player tries to match each sign dice with one money dice. After his rolls, the value shown on the money dice is multiplied with the sign dice (this is done three times - for every pair) and the result is the score for this turn.

After each player had five turns, the game is over and the winner is the player with the most money.

name: Rugby
description:
Subtitled "Ein amerikanisches Kampfspiel" ("an American combat game").

An abstract strategy game where you try to bring ten of your fourteen 'players' into the opponent's touchdown zone.

On your turn, you may move one of your field player gaming pieces forward one space - never backwards. You may jump over one enemy field player, thus not only moving one more space, but also gaining another turn. One of your pieces is called the goalie; he may only move sidewards and no other piece may jump over him. He is used to block enemy field players who want to enter your touchdown zone.

name: Multicards
description:
A collection of 6 card games playable with the same 52 card deck:

CLASSICAL PLAYING CARDS: use the cards as any other poker deck

CARD DICE: use the cards for any dice game you like

SOCCER TOTO: use the cards to determine the outcome of a soccer match (0 = draw, 1 = win home team, 2 = win away team)

LOTTO: use the cards to simulate a lottery with numbers from 1 to 49

ROULETTE: use the cards to simulate a spin on a roulette wheel with numbers from 0 to 36

SLOT MACHINE: use the cards to simulate a slot machine with cherries, lemons, $$$s, BARs, etc.

name: Boulder Greenbelt
description:
Boulder Greenbelt is a game themed around life in the city of Boulder, Colorado. Spaces on the game board resemble actual places within the city and each space does something for or to the player akin to its real life counterpart.
At the beginning of the game players roll a die twice to determine their starting bankroll. This bankroll is not denoted by any type of token and is instead to be remembered in the players head or on paper. This is important as any player may contest a players bankroll at any time in the game and if it is found to be faulty that player suffers a punishment. Once all players have their bankroll play beings and each player rolls a die to move the indicated number of spaces and take the actions on the space on which they land.
A player wins when they achieve "Nirvanna" which can be achieved by a number of different means as they pass the 9th street bridge space.

name: 101 Dalmatians
description:
Players spin the spinner and may follow 2 different paths. Longer path through Regent Park and shorter but harder path what passes Cruella de Vil's gates. There are special spaces where player advance additional spaces if he stops there.
Player must spin exact number to put him on finish and win.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
publishers: Alga, Chad Valley Co Ltd., Whitman

name: Wild Life
description:
44 cards depicting 11 different animals or birds.
Two games are in the rules, one for a variation on Pelmanism (sometimes called Pairs) and the other for a variation of Snap (the noisy children's game).
In Pelmanism, players have to use their memory, by turning over two cards. If they match, that player keeps both cards. The idea is to win a majority of the cards.
Snap is a traditional game where cards are turned over and if two match, you must call "Snap" and if you are the first to do so, you can keep the cards. The object is to take all the cards eventually.
The illustrations aren't by an artist as they usually are for this company, but they are photographs taken at a Wildlife Park, by Phillip Wayre.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Environmental

name: The Perishers
description: Card game using characters from a popular cartoon strip in the Daily Mirror newspaper. Players have to play to tricks in the usual way but only Old Boot (the dog in the strip) cards are important because they will earn you points and that is a bad thing, because the player with the lowest total, wins.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Daredevil Smith
description:
A game which starts the same way but then the board tiles shift and each game is now unique.
'For 2 to 4 Adventurers' say the rules. You are dealt 3 room Cards and it is your objective to 'dynamite' each room so named. If you do this first and exit the board, you win. Each tile has a two digit number. You roll the dice to move and you must move the full throw (if you can't, you forfeit the throw) and you are allowed to change direction once. After moving, you check the pips on both dice, and this will relate to two tiles. Example; You roll a 5 and a 3, this will relate to tile 53 or tile 35, your choice. If you roll doubles, only one tile will be available. The tile you choose is picked up and placed somewhere else. It can be anyway round and it must be adjacent to an existing tile.There are special tiles in the game, for example, the Start tile or The Misty Mists tile.

name: Little People Book of Board Games
description: A book with four games for very young children. A spinner is provided so no need for dice, the designer recommends a few buttons for playing pieces and you are then ready to play. All the games are simple, spin the spinner, move along a track and the first one to the end of the track wins. The four games are Charlie Clown's Game, Connie Cook's Game, Paddy Postman's Game and Sally Shopkeeper's Game.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Kevin Keegan Play Better Soccer
description:
The players must draw a pitch before play can start. There are two cards that instruct you as to how this might be done, and suggesting that it should be to scale (5 yards to the inch).
The other 52 cards relate to moving your ball towards your opponent's goal (whilst he is trying to do the same to you). It is only a card game so no equipment is provided (as in the pitch mentioned earlier and the designer suggests you use buttons for the ball).
The object is to be the first to score 4 goals. Scoring a goal usually refers to a move card being played that crosses the goal-line.
Every card has a Kevin Keegan football tip on it.
The box clearly states that the game is for 2 to 6 players, but the rules only suggest up to 4 players. Either way, it is really a 2 player game.

name: It's Dinner Time
description:
70 cards, each featuring an ingredient to a 'balanced' meal. Plus there are 28 Wild Cards with four different actions.
Players collect a meal which should be one card from the different coloured ingredients.
For example, you might try to collect a Green 1 (Mixed Vegetables), a Green 2 (Salad), a Green 3 (Corn on the Cob with Butter) and a Green 4 (Stirfry Vegetables). The publisher is a large organization that sells frozen food, so all the 20 different ingredients are things they would like to sell to you, so not every meal collected will be as healthy as the Green example (lots of chips and burgers!).
The Wild Cards are All Change (all players pass their hand to the player on their left), Lose Hand (a player has to discard his hand and start collecting again), Wild (can represent any ingredient card) and Go Shopping (you can draw one card from any player you choose).

name: Willo the Wisp
description: 44 cards, illustrated with characters that must come from a book or children's animated TV series, but I have never heard of it. Rules on the back of the box suggests 4 different games you could play with the cards, including old favourites like Snap and Happy Families. Cards are much thicker than usual.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Animals Animals Color Bingo Game
description: This children's game is based on the book Animals, Animals by Eric Carle and is designed to build language skills and visual acuity. Kids spin to move their way around the board and act out the sounds and/or behavior of five animals while collecting Colorforms Stick-Ons play pieces. The object is to form a Bingo line - straight across, down or corner-to-corner - to win. No reading is required.

name: Wordex
description:
52 cards. "The New Card Game of Skill", so says the box.
Each card has a letter. There are more cards for some letters than others. No rules I'm afraid but probably a crossword type game, made to compete with Lexicon, which was a big seller for Waddingtons at that time.

name: The Game of Fives
description:
A variant of games where you need to build a line of pieces to win. In this game you must be first to create a line of five pieces.
Each player starts with 20 discs in his own colour. Players alternate to place pieces on to the board. The game ends when any one player has a winning line. However, if no-one has a winning line after all 40 pieces are on the board, players must move one of their own pieces one square. If no-one wins after five such moves, it is a draw.
The pieces are circular discs with a vacant centre and a winning player scores as many points as printed on the board, which can easily be seen throught the middle of the piece. Scores are pegged on a sort of cribbage board.
Essentially a 2-player game, the rules suggests variants for more players, one of which is a Five Drive. This goes back to the fashion for Whist Drives, i.e. a number of tables playing side-by-side, maybe in a village hall or similar.

name: Dice Hockey
description:
From the Publisher*


1993 maked the 100th anniversary of the Stanley Cup. Viceroy has been a part of that history since the 1920's. We are proud to be the largest Canadian manufacturer of the hockey puck and the company that developed the NHL formula puck in conjunction with the National Hockey League. We are equally proud to present you with DICE HOCKEY, a game that will give you hours of enjoyment, a sense of competitiveness and the feeling of excitement that the game of ice hockey has to offer.


In Dice Hockey players roll a die to move one of their skaters towards their opponents goal and then follow the directions of the spot they land which usually involves rolling the die again to see if you score, pass, take a penalty or have a breakaway. Rolling the exact number to have your skater land exactly in the goal crease will score you a goal and end the period. The game board is set into the box bottom so you pop the top of the box and play in the box. The boards surrounding the ice surface are covered with advertising images straight form 1993 including Hubba Bubba bubble gum.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Super Speedway
description: Players roll dice to move their cars around an oval track. First player to the finish line wins. Part of a Family 12 Game Center box set.

name: Boxes
description: You have to jump your own pieces to capture your opponents pieces. When your opponent can't make a move, you win. Each player has eight pieces. You play by jumping over your own pieces to capture your opponents pieces, or by sliding one of your own pieces one space.

name: Jogo das Comemorações Coca-Cola
description:
This is a small promotion game in Brazil the works just like Top Trumps, composed of 32 cards.
Every player has a set of cards representing different ways to celebrate a Football Goal with points for creativity, beauty, joy, difficulty and irreverence. Every player see the top card of his deck and the star player choose a characteristic of his own card.
The player with most points in the characteristic wins and bring the looser's cards to his deck.
There is a trump ("Drink a Coke") that beats every card, except the card number 8, 16, 24 and 32.
When a player manage to take all 32 cards, he wins the game

name: Motor Race Game
description:
A children's game from the 70's I would guess. A curio because this game is just a version of the linen games from Victorian times. Each player spins a spinner, moves the number of squares indicated and follows the instructions if he lands on such a square. The first to complete three laps is the winner.
Contents:
1 board
Rules (on the box insert)
4 plastic racing cars (in four colours)
i Spinner on box insert (the spinner was broken when I got this game so that is why a dice and dice cup are in one of the images)

name: Let's Go to Town
description:
Party game.
The host places syllables all round the room. Players are instructed to find three syllables that make up the name of a British town; e.g. Ed-in-burgh. There are 33 towns listed on the host's Key Card, all made up of three syllables.
If you can make a town out of the syllables, you take it to the host who records you with 1 success and he will put the cards back in the box. Then the successful player goes back to the room to see if he can find another town.
After an agreed time, the player who found the most, wins.

name: Hulk Hogan's Rock 'n' Wrestling Card Game
description:
Hulk Hogan's Rock 'n' Wrestling Card Game is a game in which players try to improve their hand of cards by drawing the top card of either the face-down draw pile or the face-up discard pile, and discarding either that card or one of the four cards in their hand. Except for Flip cards, each card has a point value in the range of 3 to 10, or 0. If a player discards a Flip card when they do not have the advantage, then they take the advantage from the other player. Only the player with the advantage is able to call a Showdown, at which time both sides reveal their hands; the player with the highest point total wins the match.

The four-player game plays much like the two-player game, with the major difference being that the player who calls for a Showdown must beat the hands of both of his opponents.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: Kyogami
description:
Kyogami is a simple roll and move game, primarily educational.
The game mechanism is deliberately simple and the game focuses on the Kyoto Protocol.

Players are manufacturers, they manage and buy factories, trying to reduce their carbon emission levels and they trade some Carbon "quotas".
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Trading

name: Flash
description:
Party game for up to 20 players. They have to then complete their telegram.
Cards are scattered round the room where most guests will congregate. Each player gets a different Number 1 card. On the bottom right corner there will be another word and that is the next card they must find. And so on until they have found the 12 words that complete their telegram. The first to do so, wins.

name: Juxt a Push
description:
This is game #14 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

In this game, players try to either get their pieces into one contiguously connected group or reduce the number of enemy pieces to one. This game is a hybrid of Groups and Lines of Action, on a smaller board and utilizing shifting lines of pieces. As players shift pieces, they may end up pushing pieces of either player off the board, and out of play. This reducing of pieces is a double-edged sword, as it both weakens a player, but also pushes them closer to possibly winning the game.

name: Calciocart
description:
Calciocart is a game of simulated football with special cards that reproduce all the tactical and technical situations that may occur during a football game.
The cards are divided into three groups: Attack, Defense and Goalie.
The game is played between two players. Each choose 12 attack cards and 12 defense, which wants to use among the more than 100 that make up their decks, depending on choice of tactics.
The first player plays a card of attack (usually a passing) if the defender has a defense card that cancels that played by the opponent, he becomes the attacker, otherwise the first player may shoot at goal.
If an attempt on goal is saved the game will restart with the roles attacker / defender reversed, otherwise the attacking player has scored a goal.
After playing for 45 minutes, the first time end and pass on second.
After 90 minutes of play the player who has scored the most number of goals wins.

name: Race for the Checkered
description:
This is a game with cards that have phrases that relate to car racing. The cards give and take away points during several races (rounds). The winning player has the most points at the conclusion of the racing season (agreed upon number of rounds).

Card draws determine racing team designation and order of play. The player begins a turn by rolling a custom die to determine how many "race" cards to draw. The player must immediately use or discard all cards drawn. There are rules that determine hierarchy among the cards. There are no choices to make, simply follow the card text and hierarchy rules.

The "Black Flag" card causes a player to miss two turns. The "Go Behind the Wall" card causes a player to immediately discard all cards until a "Return from Behind the Wall" card is drawn. It is a fact that in car racing the "Black Flag" causes a car to withdraw from the race for any number of reasons. And a car goes behind the wall when it requires more repair than is allowed in a pit stop. It is rare for a car to return to the race and some leagues do not allow a car to return to the race.

The game comes in an appropriately sized box that is sturdy with attractive graphics. There is a box insert for the components, the finger holds allow 1/3 of the cards to be removed. The cards are made from 90 Lb paper and have neither linen content nor plastic coating. The 1 inch custom die has images that are printed on the surface. The instruction booklet is in the list format without reference numbers and the order of the rules is not in relation to game play.

name: Fur Out
description:
Developed by a real-life fur trapping couple, Fur Out was marketed as Canada's first "family wildlife game."

The game, not just a simple roll and move affair, features three different types of characters (Trappers, the Game Warden, & the Anti-Trapper). Trappers set traps and score points by catching & selling furs. As they accumulate wealth, trappers can buy and build cabins on the board to set trap-lines to make even more money. Trappers can also tamper with each others traps and even steal them. However, if the Game Warden (only one allowed per game) catches them they can end up in jail. The Game Warden is also a trapper, so he can cash in on any poached game he seizes, as well as set traps himself. (However, as a lawman the Game Warden can't tamper with other player's traps.) The Anti-Trapper (only one allowed per game) scores by stealing traps from the Trappers and generally making life miserable for them.

Players navigate the unusual snowshoe-shaped board by rolling 2 six-sided dice and traveling along the showshoe's webbing. Different spots on the board allow players to set up traps for various game animals. (These spots are always on the edges of diamond or hexagonal areas that frame the illustration of the animal to be trapped.) Some animal hides are virtually worthless (like the lowly Skunk) while others pay top dollar (like the mighty Grizzly Bear). Only one trap may be set per square. A player must return to the square by landing on it with an exact die roll to successfully make a catch. Unfortunately, other players that land on the square may "steal" a catch from the trap. However, the offending player may be sent to jail for poaching if the Game Warden lands on the spot while they're still there.

Initially trappers are restricted to the first level of the board, but when they successfully trap an animal, they may progress another level down the board, repeating the process as they bag bigger and better game. Cards from the Fur In deck (collected when traps catch animals) make movement, and therefore scoring, more predictable. Cards from the Fur Out deck (collected when larger traps catch bigger animals) allow players to slowly collect letters to spell out the names of the animals with the biggest ticket furs... and to eventually make top dollar. A deck of event cards, name Yellowhead Cards (after the nickname of a famous Iroquois trapper/trader named Pierre Bostonais) can significantly alter a player's turn. This deck is activated by landing on particular spaces spread around the board. (Interestingly, the Anti-Trapper player is instructed to interpret the Yellowhead Cards to the best of his ability from his perspective. Some Yellowhead Cards simply won't apply to the Anti-Trapper.)

Players are allowed to trade or sell any in-game items to each other. This even applies to things like players combining Fur Out cards so that they can divide up a big score.

As the game progresses, players can buy Cabins to effectively take over certain game spaces for themselves. However this becomes an attractive target for the Anti-Trapper who'll want to burn the cabin down (as long as he can stay out of reach of the Game Warden).

The game may be played to a time limit (Trapping Season) or to any other method of conclusion that they players can agree on. The winner is the player with highest cash value of combined resources (traps, cabins, and, of course, furs) when the game ends.

The game includes the following components:
- 1 Showshoe Playing Board
- 7 Colored Playing Tokens
- 6 Colored Sets of 50 Traps each
- 10 Wooden Trappers Cabins
- 1 Pair of Dice
- 3 Different Sets of Cards (Fur In, Fur Out, & Yellowhead)
- 1 Pad of FUR Out Scoresheets
- 1 FUR OUT Rules Booklet
- 1 FUR OUT Player Aid Sheet
categories: Animals, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Player Powers
publishers: The Fur Out Game Co. LTD.

name: You 'n' It
description:
The object of the game is to amass 100,000 units of gold and get back to your Solar System with your units of gold intact. When you do get to your Solar System, the winner of the game is the person with the most units of gold over 100,000.

You roll the dice, land on a space and do either what the text says or what the card that you draw says. There is a trading mechanism where you can trade cards with other players. Otherwise, it's a roll and move race game.

The game comes with a story titled "The Saga of the ITs from the Galaxy of Golar"

name: Bounce 'N' Boogie Boggle
description:
Wendy's kid's meal promotional version of boggle. Uses a set of cards with "magic window" protection for the letters and a red plastic screen to reveal the letters when the game is played.

As in regular boggle a player (or team) find as many connected words as possible from the face up letters resting in a 5 x 5 grid. Words can be formed by letters connected left, right, up, down or on diagonals. Each side has 1 minute to find a word of at least 3 letters, and then play passes to the other side. Whomever can't find a word after 1 minute is the loser.

name: Yahtzee Bowling
description:
Instead of dice, this game uses five bowling pins with the numbers 1 through 6 on its hexagon sides. Two players or teams take turns rolling the ball at the pins. As in standard Yahtzee, you can hold pins after your first roll to try to get the best combination possible in rolls two and three. The highest combination between the players or teams wins. No other score is kept.

This game was given as a Wendy's kids meal promotional item and is based on one of the games featured on Hub TV's "Family Game Night" game show.

name: TiddlyGolf
description: A variant of Tiddlywinks (as are all of this publisher's game). You get a green plastic target in which you have to tiddle your wink. Each attempt counts as a stroke and the player with the lowest strokes after 18 holes, wins.

name: Hexomino
description:
Hexomino is a logical game played on hex game board. The players place alternately six-colour plastic tiles on the board, so it matches at least two tiles on the board. Who can't place any tile onto the board, must draw three tiles. The player who first run out of tiles, is the winner.
There is a more complex variant of the game, in that every player place tiles on his/her own board, considering certain rules of simmetry of the tile's formations.

name: Monopoly: BBK Worldwide Clinical Research & Development Edition
description:
Themed Monopoly giveaway at the 2007 Drug Information Association (DIA) conference in Atlanta.

From Game Box:

Now, the world's foremost patient recruitment products, services, and technology company brings you a special edition of America's favorite board game!

With the MONOPOLY BBK Worldwide Clinical Research & Development Edition, now you can experience all the challenges and excitement of studying investigational treatments, enrolling clinical trials, and gaining the leading edge in the global clinical development marketplace. Build a study site on Investigator Avenue! Buy all four Study Phases! But watch out for your competitor's research centers on Patient Place and Blockbuster! It's lots of fun for the family, perfect for that office retreat, even gives new definition to your board meetings!

So, for all you to do help improve medicine and healthcare throughout the world, Advance to GO, Collect $200, and enjoy a hard-earned, exciting game of MONOPOLY with our compliments - from the innovative and fun-loving people at BBK Worldwide.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Global The Game
description:
A monopoly-like game where players roll-and-move around the board divided into countries instead of streets. Unlike Monopoly, players don't buy these countries but invest in them, consequently multiple players can own shares in the same country and all of them need to be paid off by a player landing on that country.

The games uses the Internet for its game mechanics: event cards ("News Flash") and conference cards that let players vote on a usually environmental issue and pay money to the majority voters are not drawn from a deck but are instead displayed on the website http://www.globalthegame.com where occasionally new cards will find their way into the game (an iPhone App is also available). The winner is the first player to own $1.000.000 in investment certificates or alternatively the last remaining player because there is no debt in Global The Game, anyone unable to pay is eliminated.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Basketball Deck Building Game
description: This is a 2 player deck building game that has player interaction, balance, and strategy as the primary focuses. Every game turn has both players taking actions. We have defense and offense represented, so you are not just at the mercy of the cards. You do not have to add to your deck each turn, so the size of your deck is up to you, and there for you are in control of how likely you are to draw the cards you need.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Alpine Rally Race
description: An old roll-and-move type game. Per the publisher ... "A fun packed rally race game over rugged alpine mountains".
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Forfeits
description: Party game. Players are asked trivia questions to score points but if they get an answer wrong, they must do a forfeit. The one who avoids the most forfeits, wins

name: Nochtschicht
description:
The players represent members of a band. After a concert, they try to spend their whole salary from the gig. The goal of the game is to spend all your earned money, accumulate 8 hours of time cards, and go to your apartment.

The game is played by moving your pawn over a mapboard, showing the city of Vienna, overlayed with a grid. On your turn, you may move your pawn one or two spaces by foot, or three or four spaces by taxi, the latter costs money. You try to visit event locations (like Rosie's Café, your band's rehearsal room, a hot dog booth and various others). On most spaces you have to draw cards, which will help you to spend money and acquire time cards.

The trick is to keep the right balance between spending money and acquiring time cards. You need at least 8 hours worth of time cards, then you can try to get to your apartment and win the game - but only if you have no money left.

This game's pawns represent members of a locally known band in Austria; the title is Viennese slang and translates to "night shift".

name: Taxifahrer
description:
Players represent taxi drivers and have to drive passengers through the city, earning money.

Every player starts with a passenger card, which gives him an address where to pick up a passenger, and a destination, where that passenger wants to go. He then rolls the dice and moves his taxi on the mapboard to the given locations. On grey colored spaces, he has to discard one of his four petrol cans; if he discards the last, it's time to visit the petrol station for refuelling. On his moves, a player has to obey all traffic regulations like road signs, speed limits, pedestrian crossings, and so on. If he violates a rule, any other player may point that out and the offender has to pay him a fine of 20.

After bringing a passenger to his destination, the player gets payed and draws another passenger card.

The taxi driver who first collects the sum of 400 fares wins the game.

name: Pferde und Ponys
description:
In English Horses and Ponies.
What you need to ride? Like a horse is kept? What you see in the horse show? With knowledge, some luck and a good memory players collect chips.

To win a chip player must be on any theme board, where the knob has posistioned so that the imaged symbol matches with symbol on one of the player's face-up picture card.

Player with the most chips at the end of the game is the winner.

Contents:

5 theme boards,
5 knobs,
30 picture cards,
26 chips,
1 pawn,
1 stand

name: Cunning Couplets
description:
Party game.
There are 12 Cunning Couplet cards and these feature couplets made up of two words that are not related. The 12 cards are placed around the room where players will be able to see them. Each player will have one word that is the first correct word to a couplet. They then look for another card that has a second correct word. For example, they know the word Turn, so they look around and evenutally find Coat, which makes Turn Coat. Now they must look for a word that goes with Coat and so on until they find a word that has Finish next to it. The first person to do this wins.

name: So Tantalising
description:
A box of three party games known as the Easy Chair Series of games.
In game 1 you have to try to follow a word square of 4 by 4 letters and so arranged they form the names of rivers. This type of game is similar in mechanic to Boggle.
Game 2 is Rhyming Pairs. You are given ten examples of question. The first information given is a word os short phrase. This is followed by a blank, then another blank and then a phrase again. You have to think of a word that goes into the first blank, thus forming two words 'with a close relationship'. Then you need to complete the second blank and make another word that links to the last phrase in your question. The trick is, the two blank words must rhyme. An example; A pool is the first word so the correct word to go with that is Lagoon. The last phrase is Very Light Ball and the correct answer is Balloon. Lagoon/Balloon is correct and rhymes.
Game 3 is a quick trivia game. You are given a grid of five by six boxes. Down the left hand side is a subject for each row, Countries, Professions, Flowers, Prominent People, Motor Cars and Boy's Names. You are given a letter and you must fill in as many boxes as you can with answers that begin with that letter.

name: Popular Pairs in Pictures
description:
Party game, another game in the publisher's Easy Chair Series.
Up to 12 guests are given a card and must write down any two things in the (rather nice graphics) picture. The two words must be related somehow. An example is given of Storm and Tempest being a close enough match. The guest with the most correct answers after time runs out, wins

name: Sexta
description:
Played on The Game of Y board

From website

Start: 6 stones for each player of their own color, arranged on the perimeter of the board as shown at left.
Play: Players take turns moving any one of their stones any distance along an unobstructed line, in any direction. Movement through a pentagon may follow either of the two forks that exit on the other side.

Goal: To be the first player to form a line of six adjacent stones. The line need not be straight as long as no stone has more than two neighbors.

name: Alphabet Land
description:
User Summary

Alphabet Land is a simple boardgame intended for young audiences (recommended ages 4-8). Players use a spinner to travel around the board collecting letters of the alphabet, which are associated with particular spaces. The spaces are shown as balloons. Landing on a space with a letter on it allows the player to collect that letter. Landing on a black balloon allows a player to take a letter from anywhere on the board. Landing on a purpler balloon allows the player to steal a letter from another player. A player is "stung" and must return a card to the board if he or she lands on a spot showing the Alpha-Bee.

The game ends when a player lands on the Finish spot with an exact spin. At that point all players count up there cards. The player with the most cards wins.

This title appears to take some inspiration from Candyland.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Television Grove Family
description: Party game, a simple trivia game about Britain's first TV soap opera. The guest with the most trivia facts about this programme, wins.

name: Ethics on the Job
description:
Ethics on the Job is a board game specifically designed to help students learn important information and concepts about ethical behavior in the workplace. Players learn standards for ethical behavior and how to discriminate ethical from unethical behavior. Ethical situations covered include relations with employers, co-workers, customers, and suppliers. Playing the game demonstrates to the students that unethical behavior can hurt other employees, the company, and themselves.

In the game, players are in the role of company presidents. They are responsible for the success of the company. Throughout the game problems are brought to them that involve the behavior of their employees. Players must decide (1) whether the fictitious employee's behavior was ethical or unethical, and (2) what punishment to give (if the behavior was unethical). The situations are designed so that they are not easy to decide. Players see that unethical employees prevent them from winning the game, and they take steps to move these employees out of their companies.

name: Quiz Ball
description:
Contents
1 Surface Area.
11 Red Bulb Covers.
11 Yellow Bulb Covers.
1 White Bulb Cover.
1 Question/Answer Booklet.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.

An electric (battery operated) quiz game, based on the early days of a BBC game show with this name. The questions are from General Knowledge categories.

The board shows various routes to the goal. The shorter the route taken means harder questions but you save a lot of time.Quiz Ball Game

The Game features 500 Questions - With real flashing lights and a buzzer noise!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Total verdreht!
description:
Objective: collect as many precious treasurers as possible & try to block other players
- moving by turns -
1. shuffle treasure cards and put 3 of them upside down on the board - place all the track tiles,too
2. roll the die - move your meeple into direction of a treasure
3. at the end of your turn you may turn a track tile at 90° degree to the left or right (blocking or preparing your route)
4. if you roll a 'wand' you may exchange one of your treasures for another player's one (different values)
5. if all treasures a collected count up the values printed on the tile

name: Face the Music
description:
English trivia game based on a rather highbrow TV show. All the questions relate to music, mainly classical music. Simple game, get the most questions right and you win.

Over 1,000 questions. Merit developed the game with the record company Decca, who is named on the box.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Wir Lernen Spielend Rechtschreibung
description:
Game designed to let children test their powers of the German language.

The cards are dealt out evenly (any number can play). In a turn, a player must ask another player to answer correctly the top card in one of three categories; Words that end in g or ch? Words that end in g or k? Words that end in s or z?

If a player answers with the correct spelling ending, he puts the card to his right. If he gets it wrong, it goes to his left. If a player runs out of cards, he must pick up all the cards to his left and play on. The game ends when one player has all his cards to the right and none in his hand.

name: Moth Eating Catz Destroyed My Broadband
description:
In Moth Eating Catz Destroyed My Broadband you are desperately trying to gain as much buzz as possible so people notice your spamchat and gain the win for the net, if only for your 15 seconds of fame.

Using advanced router technology you generate buzz but have to use moths and catz to deploy your assets to take down your fellow chatters. In this fast and fun game you will lolz, cry and win.

Remember its not the playing but the crushing your enemies that counts

This game is a random, light and chaotic game which contains- Moths, lolz Cats and random events as well as heavy dose of bad humour. The point of the game is to protect your router whilst generating buzz which in turn grants you Victory points. However you are limited in the actions you can take and will have to fight off the other players.

The game was inspired by random comments on the BGG chat feed for Essen 2011. It therefore is meant to evoke the random, bizarre and downright silly things that occur in chat feeds to live events when to many geeks gather together.

name: Who Goes There?
description: Party game. Each guest gets a card that informs them who they are for the evening. In addition, the card tells them which questions they might ask other guests about who they might be. All questions must be phrased so that the answer can only be "Yes" or "No". The winner is the guest who has the most correct answers when the host declares the game is over.

name: Kiddy Poker
description:
A poker game for kids! Four dogs are more than four cats and four frogs are more than two dogs, although the frog is the weakest animal.

Each player gets six animal cards and everyone is now trying to provide a valuable combination together as possible. The trading cards determines which players must swap cards with each other. After 12 rounds the game ends, the player with the most valuable combination wins.

name: Savanna Challenge
description:
Cardgame with African animals - elephant, lion, hyena, mouse.
In his turn player plays a card in the middle of the table so that it scares away the last card.

Mouse scares away the elephant,
Elephant scares away the lion,
Elephant or lion scares away the hyena,
Or, a lion or hyena scares away the mouse.

Object of the game is to play all of his card first.

name: Minnesota Trivia
description:
A trivia game focused around Minnesota, similar in style to Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition. Players roll dice to move around a map of Minnesota, and collect cards by answering questions correctly at starred cities. First player to six cards wins, although longer and shorter variants are suggested by collecting more or fewer cards.

Questions are separated into four categories: People, Places, Sports, and Potluck. All questions are related to Minnesota.

name: Jugando con Lulú
description:
[From the back of the box,translation of spanish]
Little Lulu, the friendly star of the TV show comes in this game destined to the children.The characters of the TV show compete in an obstacle race to reach the goal. A dynamic adventure in the wood with Lulu, Tubby, Alvin, Wilbur, Annie...

Players roll die and move their pawns triying to reach the last case of the board. Luck will say if they're able to avoid the obstacle who make them going back or they get to reach some squares who make them advance.


[De la parte trasera de la caja]
La Pequeña Lulú, la simpática protagonista de la serie de televisión, que tanto entusiasma a los niños con sus ingenuas travesuras, la ofrecemos en este precioso juego dirigido a complacer a los más pequeños. Los personajes de la serie compiten para llegar al lugar convenido, pasando por toda clase de obstáculos que hacen más difícil su labor. Un juego lleno de dinamismo a través de una divertida aventura por el bosque con Lulú, Toby, Fito, Anita, Pepe, Memo...
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Backpackers Motel
description:
7 backpack tourists are on their way to a motel. There is only one room available with a bath. Two rooms have a shower, two rooms have a tap, and the last two rooms doesn't have any water at all.

The backpackers try to do their best, to arrive as quick as possible at the motel, to get the best room available.

Players have to predict the order of arrival of the backpack tourists. They can manipulate this by rolling dice. The special orange die, gives the player the possibility to place a backpack tourist backwards on the track.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Villains!
description:
Ever wanted to be a super-villain? Now you can! Make a play for sectors of the city and be the big Boss... but that pesky Now, you can be the criminal mastermind an entire city fears and despises.

Villains! the Board Game is a unique and thrilling adventure where you play as one of four super-villains on their quest for city-wide domination.

Play as the Mad Genius, the Alien Emperor, the Crime Lord, or the Eccentric Sociopath! Your hand of cards is full of tools you can use to defeat your enemies -- Goods and Allies, Wicked Plots, and Loot that allows you to hire a dazzling array of Henchmen and have them battle for supremacy over sectors of the city.

But beware--the city is protected by the Hero, and he gets his own try at defeating the most powerful Villain. Can you lure the Hero into a Trap by using his Girlfriend or Sidekick as bait? Will the Hero fall prey to his own Weakness?

The game itself is one of Area Control, reaping benefits from each particular sector of the city while strategically using these benefits to procure what you need to win.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Celts
description:
A simple two player games based on Chess that makes use of the figurines included in the Celtic Life pewter figure set.

The first player places 1 figure at one end of the 10x4 gridded game board the second okays then places the remaining four figures at the opposite end of the board. Players alternate movement.

The first player to reach the opposite end of the board wins, there is no jumping or capturing.

name: Snookered
description:
This game is endorsed by the former world champion John Parrot.
The Game can be played by all ages and you need luck and knowledge.
First of all you set a winning points target or a time limit and then the first player to reach the target or scores the most points is the winner.
To score points you must land on a red block on the Board of which you score as in snooker 1 point, you then spin the dial to see what colour question you must answer (As in snooker you get 2 points for yellow,3 for Green,4 for Brown,5 for Blue,6 for pink and 7 for black) but, depending on the colour,
the questions you must answer get harder).
If you are correct you get another turn if not then it is up to the next player.

John Parrott (1964 - ), pictured on the box. He won the World Snooker Championship in 1991.

name: Railway Stations
description:
Party game. Each guest (or a team if more thasn eight want to play) is given a card with cryptic clues to the names of railway stations. For example;

They Man the Ship - the correct answer is Crewe

The first person or team to hand in a correct list of 24 stations, wins. Or the guest with the most answers once the host calls time, wins.

One interesting point. The illustration on the player cards shows a train with a striking similarity to a Thomas the Tank Engine illustration. Thomas debuted in 1946, 11 years after this game went on sale. Was this game an inspiration? It might have been.

name: Aggravating Rates
description:
Party game.

Each guest, or team of guests, is given a card with 36 clues to words that end in 'rate'. For example, 'An Aggravating Rate' would be a clue to 'Exasperate'.

First to hand in 36 correct answers or, if the host calls time, the individual or team that has the most correct answers by that time, wins.

name: Hidden Birds
description:
Party game for up to 10 guests or teams.

The solution to each question is name of a well-known bird. Example:

Question: To go about selling
Answer: Hawk

Each participant receives a card with 30 questions and should try to solve them during the evening. The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

One in a range of games named as The "Dainty" Series

name: A Horticultural Hotch-Potch
description:
Party game for up to 8 individuals or teams.

Each player is given a card with 23 clues, whose answer will be a Fruit, Flower, Tree, Vegetable or Herb. Example;

Clue: Two
Answer: Pear
Some of the clues are quite cryptic.

During the evening guests are encouraged to complete their card whils mingling with other guests. The individual or team who get the most correct answers, wins.

name: Grandstand
description:
A standard quiz game, a board and a book of 1,000 questions about the sports;
Boxing
Swimming
Sailing
Show Jumping
Gymnastics
Football

Correct answers advance you up the track on the board. First to reach the final space, wins.

At the time this was published, Grandstand was the most popular sports programme on BBC television. It aired on Saturday afternoons and covered a variety of sports but always ended with the football results (so listeners could check their Football Pools entry).
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Kikiriko
description:
Each player takes a set of 28 cards. All players chooses one animal they are course the game placing the card of this animal in front of him. The game begins.
All players turns around the top card of their deck. When two identical cards are on the table the owners of the cards must imitate the voice of the opponent's animal. The winner gives all his cards in front of him to the loser. Whenever a player draws a donkey, he must chancge his ainmal. The game continues until someone gets rid of all his cards. He is the winner.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Missing Words
description:
The guests are read a short story with blanks at certain points. The game is for the guests to fit in the correct words during the evening. The most right answers, wins.

The box also contains two more modest party games. Public Notices asks all participating guests to fill in the gaps on well known notices. And Change a Letter tests their knowledge of animals. Each player is given a list of words and they have to change just one letter to make it the name of an animal.

name: Ronnie Waldman's Puzzle Corner
description:
Standard trivia party game. Guests each get a card with six questions on it and then have to work out the answers until the host asks for them to be swapped around. Now you get new questions to answer, and so on. Guest with the most correct answers, wins.

Ronnie Waldman (1914 - 1978) hosted 'Monday Night at Eight', a long-running BBC radio show. One section of the show was 'Puzzle Corner', hence the name of this game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Sopranos Trivia in a Box Board Game
description:
This is the sequal to The Sopranos Trivia Game.

How well do you know Tony and the family? Yo, you betta know deez guys good if youz are gonna play. Now you and your friends can test your knowledge of the number one show on cable with The Sopranos Trivia Game. There are one thousand trivia questions that will challenge you on your knowledge of the program and "Mob Speak". Place bets on which questions you can answer correctly. Five levels of difficulty make it easy for even occasional viewers to play against dedicated fans of The Sopranos.

Game Includes: Vinyl Playing Surface 200 Trivia Cards Betting ChipsFor 2 or more adult players ages 18 and up.
categories: Bluffing, Mafia, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Pocket Shock-It
description:
Pocket Shock-It is a travel version of Shocking Roulette and Lightning Reaction.

All players touch electrically conductive pads that will shock one player, determined according to the game. In Shocking Roulette, the victim is random. In Lightning Reaction, the victim is the last to press their button after the music stops playing.

name: Uno: Patriots
description:
A series of UNO variants based on assorted baseball and football teams.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Acquisition" card, with a picture of a specific palyer from the team. Using this card means you take a card from your hand and declare what card you want. If any player has it, they must exchange it for the card you have offered.

name: L'histoire de France en un tour de cartes!
description:
Card game for children aged around 10 years old. There are rules to four games using the cards.

Game 1: Qui, quoi, quand?
A game for 2 players
The cards are shuffled and placed in a stack in the centre of the table. On a turn, the player takes the top card and looks at the picture and the text on the other side of the card. From this, he or she must guess the correct historical period for the card e.g. Léonard de Vinci would be a La Renaissance card. Then check the summary card. If correct, he scores a point. If not, the card is discarded and the opponent has a turn. When all the cards have been used, the one with the most points, wins.

Game 2: L'ordre chronologique
Cards are dealt out evenly. The remaing cards are placed in a stack. A card is revealed and the player must lay a card that goes immediately before the date on that card or just after it. If you cannot play a card, you must pass and take a card from the stack and add it to your hand. The first player to use all their cards, wins.

Game 3: Qui suis-je?
Stack all the cards with only the picture side showing. Each player, in turn, takes the top card and tries to name the event, person, etc. The card is then turned over to reveal the text. If the player is correct, he keeps the card. If not, it is discared. The player with the most cards when the stack is emptied, wins.

Game 4: 9 Familles
The cards are colour coded so a straightforward version of 7 Familles/Happy Families can be played. Each set collected is worth one point for every card in that set. When all the sets are played out, the winner is the one with the most points.

name: Les 1000 Bornes de l'Histoire
description:
A Mille Bornes variant in which players must score maximum points by bringing together the largest number of periods in the history of France and most of the possible themes of each period.

Draw a card to your hand, play or discard.

The game ends when one player has placed a series of six cards and he managed to shoot down six cards in his hand. The game also ends if no cards remaining in the deck is playable.
Each series reported scores up to 40 points, 10 bonus points triggering endgame, foul play by 10 points.
The winner is the first totaling 500 points after several parties.

name: Mic Mac Mots
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player or the first team to make a word of at least four letters from the letters earned during the tests.

Playing the game:
The player whose turn it is spins the arrow on the wheel, he draws a card corresponding to the area where the arrow has stopped. He reads the instruction corresponding to its level (aloud or in his head by category). Then he turns the hourglass and following the instructions. It shall reply orally.
Player must find words, rimes, make mimes, solve riddels etc.
If he wins his race, he draws a letter in the bag and the wheel goes to the next player. Otherwise, it passes the wheel to his left to draw no letter in the bag.
The first player to find the correct answer earns a letter also.

The game ends when one player has formed a word
of at least 4 letters.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Wheels Within
description:
Party game for wordsmiths.

Each guest is given a sheet with 16 clues. Each of the clues takes the form of one or two words. The clue contains the name of some vehicle or means of transport with wheels. The letters appear in their right order, but not necessarily consecutively. The number in brackets indicates the number of letters in the word answer. An example;

Revelation (3) = VAN

The first guest to hand in 16 correct answers, wins.

name: Nursery Jingles
description:
A party game for children.

Each guest is given a score-card, with 24 clues to different Nursery Rhyme character. The clues take the form of a rhyming couplet. An example;

Clue 2. Who was the girl who once had such a scare,
A big horrid spider, her seat wished to share?
Answer = Miss Muffet

The first child to return a correct score-card, wins.

One game in the Dainty Series by this publisher.

name: It's all on the Pictures
description:
18 cards are placed around a room where the guests can easily see them. The guests receive a score-card, on which they will write down their answer.

The cards have an illustration which is a kind of illustrated cryptic clue. Under the picture is the item that guests must write down in their related answer. Card examples:

Card 6. A close-up picture of a tree and the subject is 'Find the Misician'. Answer = Bach (suggested by the Bark of the tree)
Card 17. A picture of a Shell oil can and the subject is 'Find the Seagull'. Answer = Petrel (the visual clue is Petrol)

I told you they were cryptic!

The first player to answer all 18 cards correctly, wins.

name: Wickie und die starken Männer: Wickie und der Piratenschatz
description:
Objective: get as much as possible from the gold of 'The terrible Sven' or (as Sven) protect/get back your gold
- moving/acting by turn -
1. place gold coins on the island (typically 4x number of players) - starting point: each player's drake
2. 'Sven' gets one shark for each opponent (decelarates movement), each player gets a dolphin (in his/her own colour)
3. movement: 1d6 move horizontal or vertical - sharks and other players block you, ending on your own dolphin ==> use movment points for the second time; a '6' let you move a shark and a dolphin (free of choice) additionally... get to gold island and catch one gold coin & row back
4. end of turn ==> Sven's turn: 2d6; if he catches a player with a gold coin on the sea ==> player is sent back to starting positon & looses the coin; Sven gets the coin
5. if players/Sven get back to their drakes they can store the loot safely and continue the hunt
6. game ends after last coin was safed

content: board, 5 meeples, 5 boats, 60 gold coins, 4 dolphins, 4 sharks, 2 dice, rules
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: AJR Battle
description:
Promotional game by Flunch, a reastaurant chain in France.

It play like War in that you challenge each other in a turn and the most powerful card 'captures' the enemy card. There is a difference here in that a special die is also used. Every time you reveal a card, you roll a die and the value of the die rolled is added to the value on the card. So you can never be sure of a victory in any challenge.

The winner is the player who wins all the cards.

name: Stick Stacks
description:
A dexterity game in the mould of later games like Jenga. In this game players must build sticks on to a structure. As the sticks get higher, it becomes increasingly more difficult. The sticks are rounded like a straw which increases the difficulty level even higher.

Three dice decide which colours you need to take. Red sticks are the longest, blue sticks are medium length and green are the smallest.

Your turn is against the clock so you need to be pretty fast. If you knock down the stick tower, you lose that game. Play as many games as you want and the winner is the one with fewest losses.

name: Monopoly: Limburg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Limburg, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Défifoo violet
description:
Defifoo purple is a trick taking game that takes place in five innings. The object of the game and scoring conditions vary in each round by drawing card "challenges". The goal is to lose the fewest possible points after five rounds.

There are cards with five colors numbered 1 to 10 corresponding to five planets, some joker cards with two-colors that can change the planet and a Sun card.

At the beginning of the round the challenge-card is drawn what shows the scoring for that round.
Players play the cards following a suit. At the end of the turn, one that played the highest card wins the trick.

Each player starts the game with 1000 points. At the end of each round, we proceed to the number of points depending on the challenge of the round. The player who lost the least points after five rounds is the winner!

Contents:

64 cards,
a score book,
a little pencil,
a velvet bag

name: Ça m'intéresse
description:
Truo or False? 2000 unusual and surprising assertions await you in four areas and interesting news: science and technology, environment, health and curiosity.
Players must reach the boxes "Quiz" to be able to answer questions and win the corresponding rings. The first to win all 4 different "Quiz"-categories is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Fairytale Quest
description:
A wicked witch has cast her spell over the fairy-tale island and imprisioned the princess in a castle guarded by dragons. The way to the castle is full adventure and danger. Only the magic shell, with its 12 shining pearls can give the princess the power to shed her bonds and remove the spell from the island. The player whoo succees in bringing the shell to the princess, after overcoming the dangers on the way with the help of the fairies, elves and other magic, becomes the ruler of the island.

This is a roll and move game where, at various points you can collect pearls or be forced to give them up. At points along the way, the player draws a card from various piles. The cards can be beneficial (magic or more pearls) or harmful (the witch card forces the player to give up pearls). The winner is the one who collects 12 pearls and reaches the princess first.

name: S.P.E.R.M.S.
description:
S.P.E.R.M.S. is a card game in which players play squads of commando sperm trying to battle and race each other to overcome Egg Defenses and be the first to reach the egg.

Players are dealt Position cards which indicate their respective progress towards the egg. On each player's turn, he must attack the player ahead of him, using a modified rock/paper/scissors combat system, that can result in players drawing cards, killing enemy soldiers, or switching positions with the other player. Players in first place instead "attack" an Egg Defenses deck, which functions in a push-your-luck fashion to either reward or punish the leader, and will eventually give up the winning egg card (several decoys must be uncovered first).

The game is full of puns, innuendoes, and adult humour.

128 cards. 4 pages of rules. 43 illustrations in full colour.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Modern Warfare, Racing

name: Föreningsspel
description:
Swedish game about running a lokal athlete club, where you as a manager will have to deal with player salaries, national review boards, tax administration, sponsorships etc.

The game has borrowed a lot of mechanics from Monopoly, but instead of streets the board consists of a number of local business, local to different areas i Sweden. The game exists in a number of variants, similar as a game but with different local business on the board. The players make deals with the business (instead of buying the street) and build arinas and VIP-booths (instead of houses and hotels). There are random events on cards and you walk around the board using 2 dices. There are also charade cards (!) where you are awarded money if you manage to get the co-players to understand the charad. The one who has the larges fortune after a set time is declared the winner.

name: Wer bin ich? Das Promi-Rate-Spiel
description:
Objective:
be the fastest: you are collecting hints (up to ten) to make a correct guess finding out indentity of celebrity(ies)
- acting by turn -
move your (individual) meeple around and follow instructions due to space you end on...
more than 400 celebrities have to be guessed - you don't know the name, but you are (collecting) loaded with hints (max 10 per celebrility);
if your are the fastest one you score...

name: Skâândal
description:
Each player represents a political party and has 2 characters.
The six political tendencies are represented.
Using the 110 game cards, players must score popularity points possible for them or their allies.

There are multiple cards that allow attack their opponents and send them scandals, insider trading etc. If You will have the cards like lawyers, or bankers You can get out of chaos easier!

Once all the cards are played, each player adds up its popularity and the two winners in the second round goes to elections!
Add the two points of their allies and whoever is the most popular is declared the president.

name: J'achète
description:
Tactical board game where you have to shop as quickly as possible while managing its budget. Each player receives 12 euros and its shopping list.
In her turn player roll the dice and moves her pawn in the direction of her choice. Every time she lands on a colored box she can make a purchase in the store of the same color. She then roll the dice to determine Euros she may use. The amount sets her budget and she decides whether to buy. The winner is the first that comes out of the market with all purchases in her shopping list!

name: Sex Rated Charades
description: As the title says, Charades with all the subjects being rude, the ruder the better. Obviously aimed at the older 'market'. The winner is the team who gets most correct.

name: Romance
description:
