American game exclusively aimed at females - in fact, specifically 2 to 6 women can play, according to the publishers.

Virtually all luck driven. Players go round the board, looking for Love, Available Men, Holidays and Romance. The player with the best collection of these ambitions, wins.

name: Indoor Soccer
description:
A soccer (football) simulation from this publisher who only makes statistical sports games.

Teams are rated for attributes like Shooting, Defense, Assists (which is not a record kept in traditional football but must occur in serious indoor soccer) and so on. Dice are used to decide if a certain skill is successful or not. The most goals wins the match.

Includes two seasons worth of teams that play in the North American Indoor Soccer Leagues.

name: Sixtomania
description:
Trivia game about the nostalgic sixties. You can rediscover hippies, LSD, love beads and Vietnam. It is a simple trivia game that wasn't boxed.

According to an article in IN THESE TIMES SEPT 26-OCT 2. 1984, there is a board with a Peace Sign Layout that includes limbos like the Free Clinic or the Establishment or hell, a.k.a. Vietnam. It is very difficult to get out of Vietnam, the vertical bar in the peace-symbol shaped route. Most of the cards are Trivia cards, but some of them are "Karma Cards" which can send you to one of these limbos for several turns
There is a a Roll and Move component.

name: Star Trek Deep Space Nine
description:
Space station "Deep Space Nine" has been invaded by "Cardasians", and the mission is take them out. You should go to "OPS" where there are the main controls of the space station with enough attack counters to defeat "Cardasians". There you can drive it and all their systems. The winner become the Space station Commander.

Each player has a pawns and a set of "attack counters" of the same color that start at SA box at external ring. The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "OPS" at the center of the board.

Movement is controlled by dice. During movement you should get "attack counters" entering at "Cardasian Police" boxes. All players move around the three parts of the same board, so they may capture each others pawns. Captured pawns are returned to start box ("SA"). You can only move in the same direction until you enter in a "P" box (bridge boxes). From external ring, you should use "LR" box (runebounds shuttle boxes) to go to internal ring. Then, in order to go to central laberynth, you should enter at "P1" boxes with the exact number. Whether you fail, your pawn shuold come back by central gallery to "SA" start box, and you should start the attack again!

The winner is the first player to move his pawn to "OPS" box. He shall be shuttle Commander. The second one shall be the Captain and the third one the lieutenant. Both players shall meet a minimum attack counters (4 & 3 ones).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Orion
description:
Orion is a two player game in which the players first alternately place their spaceships on the intersections and when all ships have been placed, they move them along the grid lines.
One ship is moved at a time by a player. A spaceship can move from one end of an intersection to the next one, with the exception of the main spaceship (white for one player and black for the other) that can move two spaces.
Spaceships cannot jump over each other. If a spaceship is surrounded by others (enemy or own) in a way that it cannot move (no more free spaces next to it), then it is taken off the board. If more than one spaceship gets surrounded, all of them are taken off simultaneously. If the main spaceship is taken off, or there are only 2 spaceships left from the fleet, the player looses.

name: Supergrid
description:
The players alternate placing a sector former (i.e. wall) in a vertical or horizontal slot on the board. Following placement, the player inserts one of their colored tiles into all squared sectors (i.e. a square surrounded by four sectors) and receives points for each tile placed.

Several Supergrid variations exist. Please see the attached files for the complete set of game rules.

name: Das Hunde Quiz
description:
Questions about dogs - puppies, care, breeds, diseases, dog sports, origin, education, dog owners, breeding, and dog foods.

6 question on card with 3 answer choises for each question, the question is determined rolling the dice. Depending on the version you have to collect a small plate of each color or get rid of the flakes.

name: Where's Waldo Now? Colorforms Game
description: This is a simple game in which players spin A spinner to collect Colorform pieces that correspond to their player mat. The game comes with two sets of Colorforms that depict characters from the Where's Waldo Now book. The Colorforms are placed randomly on the spinner at the start of the game. Each turn, a player spins the spinner and can collect a Colorform from the quadrant of the spinner that the arrow points to provided the sticker matches their player mat. The first player to collect all four characters for their mat wins.

name: Block City
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Block City is a non-authorized version of Quoridor.




In this game, players are trying to move a pawn from one side of the board to the other. Each turn a player may move a pawn one space, and can add a wall piece to the board that blocks the progress between play areas. The winner of the game is the one that can first move his piece across the opponent's border.

name: The Game of Spoon and Egg Race
description: Energetic party game. Those who want to enter the race are given wooden 'spoons' and an egg-shaped playing piece. The host sets out a course around the room, 'to the left of that chair, round the back of the table', that sort of thing. The object is to complete the course first whilst balancing your 'egg' on your 'spoon'.

name: Off with His Head!
description:
"Off with his Head!" is a part of the "Tudor - Life in Times of Treason & Treachery" history kit which includes:
- History book
- Board game and dice
- Stickers
- Mini felt pens
- Colouring activity
- Press-out ship

Is it your unlucky day? Are you on the way to the block on Tower Green? Or will you be the one to get a Royal Pardon? Take it in turns to roll one dice, and obey the instructions on the board. When you get towards the end, you must roll the exact number to finish on 100. So if, for example, you're on square 97 and throw a 5, you go forward 3 spaces to 100, then 2 back and land on 98. When you throw the exact number, you've finished. The last (!) person to reach square 100 gets the Royal Pardon and wins!

name: Kombi Lotto
description:
Jigsaw puzzle with an educational value: 6 panels, each panel is shown in 6 designs, along with free fields for the matching image. On display is one place or activity - the train station, business, etc. - and the matching image must be placed.

The pictures on the blackboard and the pictures of this place are numbered alike.

Rules in the lid.

More detailed Information:
In this game it's important to observe. Each card show a person. This person can be a glazier, a gardener, a firefighter or another profession. These people find their place during the game on the white areas on the panels next to a representative exercise: the glazier replace broken glass, the gardener pour the flowers, the firefighter extinguish the burning house ...

In the first step a moderator is to be chosen. The moderator distribute the panels under the players and places the cards face down on a pile. Now he takes one card after another, shows the person and calls them by name. Each player looks now, whether the person fits to one of the pictures on his panel. If matching the player calls "for me", takes the card and places it in the appropriate space on the panel.

The first to complete all white boxes on his panel is the winner.

name: Arena
description:
Arena is a 65-card deck of gladiators and their equipment, including a hodgepodge of technology levels and genres. The game is played in a poker-like fashion, with ante, partial information reveal, and bids. However, the winner is determined by a combat round, in which players roll attacks and place special cards from hand to eliminate others.

From the game box:
2 to 7 players battle in the ARENA with Gladiators, Equipment and Action cards. Players use luck of the draw, dice rolling and individual strategies to defeat all other Gladiators in the Arena and win all wagers placed on them.

From the publisher's website:
Arena combines the advantages of a CCG, similar to poker, with the excitement of dice rolling and wagering – to achieve an extremely entertaining playing field... where a techno-armored Mean Ol' Bear© with a rocket pack could possibly defeat a flying fire-breathing dragon; (...where a flush could possibly beat a full house) winning the pot against impossible odds.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Mastery: A Game of Enlightenment
description:
Mastery is played in two phases. In the first phase, players roll a die to move around a wheel trying to get rid of hand cards which symbolize the negative qualities of hate, anger, deceit, greed, and attachment. They can get rid of their cards by landing on appropriate spaces; this may involve giving the cards to other players or discussing a time they used that quality in a situation.

Once a player has gotten rid of all hadga cards and crossed the Rainbow Bridge, the second phase of the game begins for that player. Now the player rolls the die to move around the Mastery Oval, which contains the letters of the word mastery. Each turn, the player has the chance to earn a letter of the word mastery by answering a trivia question. The first person to receive all seven letters of mastery wins the game.

name: Bike Route
description:
Bike Route is a game of bike safety. In Bike Route, each player takes on the role of a bicyclist traveling on a roadway which has many of the hazards and street signs that one would encounter in everyday bike travel. The winner is the first player to traverse the board and successfully return "home."

The game is played in turns; on a turn the active player rolls a die and advances her token the number of spaces indicated on the die. If the space has a road sign on it, the player must obey the instructions on the sign; if it has a "Bike Route" sign, the player must take a Bike Route card and follow the instructions on it.

name: Artaban, the Revolution of Dice
description:
Dice have rebel!
They don't want to be a mere accessory that can be rolled carelessly. They propose a game where they are the main characters. There will be two factions. Each faction will organize itself on one side of a chessboard. The number of the dice will be its strength, and it will change every time it's moved. The strong will eliminate the weak.

And the battle starts at the cry of "Alea non jacta est"


In Artaban, each player controls seven 6-sided dice and a Leader Die (Which is just another 6-sided dice, but bigger than the other ones), for a total of 8 dice. The game starts with each player placing his dice on their second nearest row of the chessboard. (The face-up number of a die is its "value". At the start of the game, sum of the values on the 8 dice must be 28). The objective is to move the dice to their last line of the board. To achieve so, players alternate turns where they have four available options:

1. Move a die left, right, or to the front by flipping the dice over (The top face ends being the left/right/front face respectively).
2. Turn a dice 90º to the left or the right (without changing the topmost face).
3. Capture an opposing die by placing a die (without turning/flipping it) on a square it could legally move to, but is occupied by an opposing die of less value (The Leader Die can capture dice of less and equal value, but can be captured just like any other die). [A variant allows dice to capture diagonally]
4. Sacrifice a die by "capturing" an opposing die of the same value (Leader Die cannot be sacrificed). The opposing die is not retired (This helps speeding the game).

Other Rules:
-No two dice can occupy the same square at the same time.
-A die cannot move back or diagonally (Except to capture an opposing die when using the variant).
-The game ends when no player can move any dice OR a player proposes a tie and it's accepted by the other.

At the end of the game, the face-up value of all dice at their last line is counted, and the player with the bigger score is the winner. If there is a tie, the player with most dice on his last line is the winner. If there still is a tie, the player with most dice on the board is the winner. If there is still a tie, then the game ends in a tie.

name: Eins? Zwei? Drei?
description:
Simple quiz game based on the true meaning of words.

Each player takes turns to be the Quizmaster. The Quizmaster asks the person to his right, if he knows the meaning of this word - he then reads out the word and the three definitions on his card. The answerer must choose a definition. If he is right, he wins a point and is asked about another word, and so on. If he is wrong, it is his turn to be the quizmaster and he gives a question to the person to his left. When the game ends, the winner is the one with the most points.

Contents
33 double sided cards, each side has two questions
1 Rules card

name: La Course du Vendée Globe
description:
Build a ship and race around antarctic answering the Trivia questions about sailing.
Rolling different numbers and answering questions correctly players first earns ship parts and then roll and move around antarctic.

name: Cue-Off
description:
From the rules booklet: "A minature game (like) snooker with a difference. A game designed for 2-4 players from 8yrs to adult. A game as thoughtful as chess played with the tenacity of skillful snooker players."

Game seems to be about shaking some dice and moving the cue ball until it strikes another ball. The rules are rather vague about what happens when a ball strikes multiple balls, either at the same time or in a chain reaction.

Contains:

Score Sheets
Pencils
Dice Cue Off Cards
Rules book and 24 balls

name: Grandmama's Arithmetical Game
description:
In 1887 the McLoughlin Brothers introduced a successful series of educational card games under the name "Grandmama's XXX Game." The series included card games on Arithmetic, Bible Studies, Geography, Riddles. and Useful Knowledge.

One player was designated the "preceptor" and the other players were "scholars." The preceptor would ask questions and go around the players until someone got the question right. Most right answers wins.

"Grandmama's Arithmetical Game" card game had 119 question cards, an instruction sheet, and an answer booklet which were packaged in a paper covered cardboard box.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Quick-Quiz: Fussball – EURO 2008 Edition
description:
108 game cards with 500 questions and 500 answers about Euro 2008 soccer cup.
The question is asked and the quickest player with correct answer gets a point. Who collect 25 points first wins the game.

Contents:

108 playing cards,
notepad and pencil

name: Destination Lune
description:
A children's game published in the French comic/magazine Francs Jeux.

The game has two boards. The first is a short Monopoly-style track. The aim is to land on squares featuring the six items that you need before you can try to fly to the moon. Movement is dictated by a die roll (you must supply your own die). The spaces you must land on to get these six things are:
T = Launching pad
F = Rocket
A = Apollo Capsule
L = Lunar landing module
J = Moon Buggy
E = Crew

When you have acquired these, you move to the second board. This is a traditional one track game (á la the Game of Geese). If you land on special spaces, you must obey the instructions. The first to get to the moon, wins.

name: Die wilden Fußballkerle  Verquizzt nochmal!
description:
Objective: gather most quiz cards finding correct answers
- acting by turn -
1. players come to an understanding which side to use (blue or red)
2. depending on no. of players each one is dealt 3-6 cards
3. active player asks first question - multiple choice (left neighbour); if wrong, next player's turn; if correct, second question is asked;
4. right? hand card over! wrong? next player may answer if he/she bets (an already won) card; wrong? give back risked card - questioned card is taken out, too.
5. game ends after all cards are played.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Party Game, Sports, Trivia

name: Dragespillet
description:
A simple and short game for young children.
"Get as high as you can and get the gold. But watch out - if you climb high it's a long fall."
Players climb up the dragon by rolling dies, and try to get gold pieces from the dragon. But if they get to high they fall down and have to start over again. When all the gold have been delt, the player with the most pieces wins.

name: Ordino Match
description: Two players have shaped pieces with varied numbering. The player rolls special dice then, according to the visible faces, groups them together to form a coherent logical order or sequence on the gameboard, eg: "3-s": "a vertical box" "2 squares horizontal" etc. for score points.

name: Das Wissens-Quiz
description: 1100 questions from eight areas of knowledge: arts and culture, history and politics, nature and environment, sports and games, general, technology and science, earth and sky, fairy tales and legends, you roll and pull, gets on the color fields a question from the corresponding Worth area, who answers correctly gets a chip and is to it again, who first collected a chip from every field of knowledge, wins.

name: Die drei ??? und das leere Grab
description:
Objective: Gain most victory points gaining sets (3 matching cards) and making corroct guess es about (3) hidden cards
- acting by turns -
Out of each three category groups (person, place, tool) a card is placed upon the table, uncovered. All other cards are distributed among players. Active player may drop a matching set (3 cards = 1 victory point) and/or ask another player to hand out a special card;
successful? - keep asking; wrong? - next player's turn; if player wants to make a guess regarding a hidden card: successful? +3 VP; wrong? -3VP
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery

name: Wasgij Spin & Shout
description:
Players place the picture board at the middle of the table.
In his turn player spins the spinner and if the arrow stops and points the letter all players look at the picture to search for something that starts with that letter.
First to points something and shouts it scores a point.

The ﬁrst player to reach the pre-agreed points wins the game!

name: Deutschland: Lernspiel für Jung und Alt
description: This is a small trivia game from Komet Verlag. It contains 92 cards, with questions about the Deutschland. When you answer the questions you can get plus or minus points.

name: Monopoly: Mallorca
description:
Monopoly set of Mallorca, a Spanish island in the Mediterranean Sea.
All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
remarks:
a German(!) edition, customised for German tourists/inhabitants.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sneeuwwitje
description: A simple children's game, where the players try to be the first to get all 7 dwarves to their table. On their turn, players spin a spinner which tells them to either place a new dwarf, steal a dwarf from others or discard one of their dwarves.

name: Red de Bagger
description:
Players explore the best ways to process dredging spoils. The game was created for the dutch ministry of water management by the dutch organization for applied research TNO.

On their turn, players place a tile on the board in Carcassonne fashion. However, to put a meeple on the tile, one has to answer a question about the dredging process. The player who scored the most points, and knows most about dredging, wins the game.

name: Sporting Challenge: The Game of Games
description:
For up to 8 players to complete a circuit of the board, by rolling the dice to move, progressing through four performance levels: Club, County, National, International, then to complete a lap of the stadium and to finish on the podium first, having obtained sufficient: Skill, Publicity, Funding, Success, on the way.

Route: The first player throws the die to start and moves forward the number of spaces indicated. When a player lands on a square that is marked "?", a question card is taken. The question that corresponds with the number rolled on the die to get there should be answered. If it is answered correctly, the player is to move on one space. If incorrectly answered, the player is to move back one space. When a player lands on a square that is marked “♯”, a stumble card is taken from the top of the pile and the instructions followed.

The first lap - completing the four performance levels: each to be attained during the first circuit of the stadium, which are in order as each player progresses around the track: First quarter is Club, Second quarter is County, Third quarter is National, Fourth quarter is International
Before reaching the podium, the player needs to achieve an Element of: Success, Publicity, Funding, Skill

One should be obtained during each performance level as follows: Club - skill, County - success, National - funding, International - publicity

The second lap - around the stadium
By the end of the international performance level, the player should have obtained skill, success, funding and publicity. Players should then complete a second circuit of the board, a lap around the stadium, in a race to the podium. The game continues as before with the number of squares moved on each go determined by rolling the die. As before, question cards should be answered if landed on, moving on a square if correctly answered and back a square if the answer is incorrect. Stumble cards are also taken if appropriate. If an Element of skill, success, funding or publicity is lost during the final lap, it should be regained as before. The winner is the first player to arrive at the podium with all four Elements.

name: Zahrada
description:
Cooperative game for 2-5 players about financial. For children in the second stage of primary schools and first year of secondary school. Players represent fairy-tale beings which live in an old sunken garden. Players are sending its volunteers to work. They work together to earn as much money as possible to win an auction so they can buy garden for themselves. During the game, an incidents and opportunities occur and players must work together to beat them.

---

Kooperativní hra pro týmy 2–5 hráčů o financích, práci a společném zájmu určená pro druhý stupeň základních škol a první ročníky středních škol. Hráči reprezentují bytosti – obyvatele zapadlé zahrady a mají za úkol posílat své brigádníky do práce tak, aby společně vydělali co nejvíce peněz na dražbu, ve které se má Zahrada za šest měsíců prodat. Během hry nastávají nahodilé události a příležitosti fi nančního rázu, které její průběh ovlivňují a nutí hráče k systémovému přístupu k fi nancím.

name: Game of Bull
description:
Very simple game that is total luck. Four or more can play. Divide up the available counters equally.

The first player chooses a design on the board, puts one counter on it, and spins the spinner. If it stops on his chosen design, he takes back his counter. If it doesn't, the counter stays on the board and the next player chooses a different design and places a counter on it. He spins the spinner and if either of the two designs with a counter on is spun, he takes both counters. If not, then his counter stays and the next player puts a counter on a different design. Now three designs have counters on them. He spins the spinner and if any of the three designs is indicated, he takes all three counters. If not, then that is 'Bull' and the next player takes the three counters for himself. He then starts another round by placing a counter on a design of his choice, and so on.

If a player should run out of counters, the game ends and the player with the most counters, wins.

name: Nevanco Woningbouw Spel
description: The game board consists of several numbered triangular spaces. On a turn, a player throws three dice and tries to create one of the numbers on the board, using simple arithmetic operations with the numbers he threw. A success will allow him to build on that space, gain him points. After a player fails to build five times in total he is out of the game.

name: Österreich: Lernspiel für Jung und Alt
description:
A small trivia game containing 98 questions about Austria.

Each card contains a question on the front and an answer on the backside (which is not the answer to the question on the other side of that card).

The cards are shuffled and evenly distributed to all players. One player asks a question from one of his cards; now all other players try to find the right answer on the backside of their cards. If a player has the card with the right answer he gets one point and is the next player to ask a question.

The winner is the player with the most points. The game also contains rules for solitaire play.

name: Dobbeljoker
description:
Try to score as many points as you can using a d4 and a d10 on a grid showing a cell for every card in a normal deck, 4 columns for the symbols, rows for the denominations. Score 3 points for collecting three columns and 10 points for collecting all four of a certain denomination. Connect series vertically and score bonus points.

Whoever has the most points after 20 turns wins.

Released as Spel!enkaart #0010 by dutch gaming club Ducosim.

Described also in the book 'Dobbelen!' by Leo van der Heijdt (Terra, Arnhem).

name: Speed-Way
description:
Speed-Way is the reality board game of car racing. It is a game for 2 - 6 players, and Ages 8 - Adult. The race arena is set in a 28" by 19" game board with its graphic details showing: Track lanes, Spectators, Maintenance Pits, Ticket windows, Parking lots, Repair garages, Safety fences, Race Flags, Food stores, Restrooms, and other elements of a sport racing arena.
The board game shows a 10 track lanes for a 10 laps race with both Start and Finish lines. But players can race for 20, 30, 40, 50, or even 100 or higher laps as they desire, just by lapping each lane by multiple of 2, 3, 4, 5, or more times over. The game fully implements all the rules and regulations of an official car racing, including the use of all the different racing flags.

name: KunstQuiz Tiere
description:
KunstQuiz Tiere is an exciting journey into the fascinating world of art. Get to know the most famous animal paintings and painters! And test Your knowledge of art at home, after visiting the museum or just so in between! In this jam-packed art quiz box you will find: 24 world-renowned painter, 24 selected paintings, 72 detailed image sections, 72 exciting issues, 72 annotated answers and 100 cards with detailed information about the artists, their art, life and work.

Correct answers scores a points. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Quizz'N Cook
description:
This is a Trivia game with questions about the kitchen. All questions have multiple choices.
Draw a card and ask! Who answers correctly scores a point.
Who has the most points is the winner.

200 cards, 13 topics: general culture, culinary knowledge, world cuisine, quotes, riddles recipes, fruits & vegetables, cheeses, confectionery, chocolate, wine & cocktails, coffee, tea, etc.

name: Clockman
description:
Objective: be the first collecting the key (01.01.2000) & reaching the centre of the board
- moving/acting by turns -
Each player moves according die roll with her/his hero, trying to make her/his way from the outer to the inner circles. During this path you move along spaces where you have to draw cards (action/events); collecting numbers/cyphers you are challenged/blocked by the so called 'Whytooky', a bad spirit. To master this spirit use your action cards.
remarks:
game was published short before millennium change - raising awareness for upcoming challenges. Game was produced by Ravensburger.

name: Ebenezer Scrooge's Eggnog Dash
description:
Ebenezer Scrooge's Eggnog Dash is a dice-rolling token collection game set in the world of Charles Dickens' Victorian England. The object of the game is to be the first player to collect all 6 eggnogs in your eggnog tray and retrieve the prize within the market shop (tin house).

Each player receives 18 game board pieces to build their path to the eggnog. It is up to each player to arrange the tiles in whatever order they would like. Each tile has a gold or silver
back. Flip a gold tile over to take (1) eggnog from any other player when landed on. Flip a silver tile over for a lose one-turn event when landed on. Players can have any number of
these gold or silver game pieces on the game board to vary the player experience. The more colored pieces played the more action during the game. The stealing of eggnog from other players gives the game more drama and fun.

Each player gets a market shop (tin house) to place at the end of the game pieces. The market shopis to be placed near the last tile leading to the eggnog stash. Place one Santa hat into each market shop. Players can also have someone place candy or even money in
one or more shops during the pregame setup, making sure no one sees which shop has the extra prizes. This leads to a fun surprise bonus if the winning player also has extra treats in their market shop.
Players move via a dice-rolling mechanic, while play is influenced by pre-play tile placement and tile-specific actions. Players also may take opportunities to steal other players' token during play.
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), C.W. Sexton Tabletop Studio

name: Franchise
description:
The object of the game is to become the wealthiest player by the buying and licensing of franchises. Genuine franchise companies are used in the game, such as Shakey's Pizza, Robo Car Wash, Wiener King, Lawn Doctor, Natural Cosmetics, and several others.

Each player starts with $110,000. Players roll dice and move their pawns around the board, and may purchase the franchise system depicted on the space they land on, if it is currently unowned. If another player lands on the same space, he must become a franchisee, and pays the system owner a royalty fee whenever he again lands on that space. Only two franchises of any type may be sold, so anyone else landing on that space becomes a customer and must pay a fee based on the number of franchises owned. Players may freely buy and trade franchises between themselves.

If a player cannot pay the required fee(s), he is declared bankrupt and is out of the game.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Quizkönig
description:
Objective: gain as many quiz-cards as possible giving correct answers; become 'Quizkönig' and gets the crown.
- acting by turns -
Active player draws a card asking clockwise - correct answer? hand card over.. - if not, try yourself finding correct answer; if unsuccessful - ask next player; round ends after each player had an active task. Open questions are collected by the quizmaster.
Next round: contraclockwise
Next round: random
new session

Remarks:
content ~ 500 different questions;
product code on box differs from game code printed lid inside: 611 5 001 3;
some questions are niddles; if the quizmaster collects more cards than anyone else he may name the team 'dullards'

name: Jumbo's Jolly Trunk Game
description:
Yery young children's game from the Playhour Annual, 1984.

All players begin on the eye illustration. You must thow a six to start and then it is the first to reach the end of the trunk (square number 40), wins.

name: Moron Trivia
description:
Trivia game full of questions with obvious answers. Example:

Q. In what straits is the Rock of Gibralter situated?
A. Straits of Gibralter

Play until you are all fed up and the one with the most right answers, wins.

name: Monopoly: Monaco
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the princedom of Monaco.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: 300 Pop Questions: 60's
description:
A simple quiz game with 4 variations. All the games described fundamentally are won by the player who scores the most points after a pre-agreed time.

In all the slightly different games, you get two points for a correct answer. If you cannot answer the question, it is offered to the next player for 1 bonus point. The questions relate to pop music in various decades depending on which box you bought.

name: Monopoly: Lausanne
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Lausanne, in Switzerland.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Unique Gaming Partners, Winning Moves France

name: Xmas Trivia
description:
The publisher released several packs of cards in their Top Hat Trivia series.

Each version has cards with six questions on each one. The form of the questions is that 3 possible answers are read out so even the youngest family member can have a blind guess with a 33% chance of success.

The starting player takes a card and rolls the die. The result indicates which question to be asked. He asks the question to the player on his left. If the correct answer is given, the answering player takes the card and now it is his turn to ask a question to the player on his left, and so on. If a question should be answered incorrectly, the player who gave the wrong answer takes the card, rolls the die and asks the player to his left a question. (which could be the same one of course).

The winner is the first player to secure four cards.

name: Monopoly: Danmark
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the country Denmark
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Mars edition
description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from a pet food company, located in Germany
remarks:
equipped with cute wooden meeples
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dino Daze
description:
Memory Matching Mayhem

Players capture dinosaur cards by turning over a card in the battle card deck. In order to capture the dinosaur, the drawn battle card must be equal to or of a greater value than the now overturned dinosaur card.

When and if all the dinosaurs are successfully captured, the player with the greatest combined point value of all captured dinosaurs win.

name: Connect with Pieces: Pacific Rim
description:
The game components are the (700) pieces of a jigsaw puzzle. Each piece has one of five symbols embossed on it. Solid-color pieces may be able to fit in more than one position in the puzzle, but other pieces will only have one valid position.

The players are all working to assemble the puzzle; using the main set of rules, one player plays for a minute at a time, with the others using this time to select pieces from the box. There are also "scramble" rules in which all players can select pieces and play them as they wish.

Regardless of the rules used, players score points for playing pieces, with more points being awarded for playing more pieces and for playing rows of three pieces with the same symbol or squares of pieces with four different symbols. Points are also awarded for correcting misplaced pieces.

Players can play for a given amount of time or until someone reaches a given score (or until the puzzle is finished).

name: Rupert's "Four Winds" Game
description:
Pre-school children's game from the Rupert Fun book.

Rules:
This game is played with a spinner (look at the foot of the page to see how it is made). Two, three or four players can take part, so choose which of the winds you’d like to be, set the spinner on the yellow centre of the blue circle and your game is ready.

Give each player a small counter, which should be placed on the circle marked 1 of the side he has chosen. The players then take turns to spin the arrow (it can be spun by the fingers or blown round). Before a player can start he must score number 6 on the blue circle. After that, any figure which he scores gives the number of circles he can move his counter. For example, if the arrow stops at 4, move the counter four circles, if it stops at 2, move two circles. The game goes on in this manner until one of the players reaches his circle marked 12 and is the winner.

name: Fußball Quiz in der Box
description:
Simple quiz game for German football fans. The host/hostess (probably Mum or Dad in this case) sets a time limit and the one with the most correct answers when time runs out, wins.

There are 50 cards with two questions per card and answers on the reverse. Questions aimed at kids so won't be too taxing.

name: Cityspiel Münster: Wer ist der cleverste Unternehmensgründer der Stadt?
description:
A city marketing game supported by the city of Münster featuring many of the city's companies. Intended to playfully get to know the city (and the companies).

According to the back cover, luck and tactics are decisive in this game.

Here is what the rules say about the goal of the game:

"Es wird der beste Unternehmensgründer in der Stadt gesucht. Dazu müssen Unternehmenslogos schnell und geschickt auf dem Stadtplan aufgebaut werden. Wer dabei seine gegründeten Unternehmen sinnvoll erweitert und vielleicht sogar fremde Unternehmen übernehmen kann, gehört zu den ersten Anwärtern auf den Sieg."

English translation:

We are looking for the best founder of companies in town. The logos of companies have to be quickly and cleverly built on the city map. He who expands his founded companies sensibly and maybe even takes over opponent's companies is among the first candidates for victory.

Additional information:

The game board is a map of the city of Münster. Players move based on which of four movement symbols they roll on a six-sided die (by foot, bike, car or bus). On the remaining two symbols, event cards are drawn. Players can expand or take over companies by reaching adjacent areas. In the end, they score victory points for the number and size of their companies and for the majority of companies in each of the four quadrants of the map.

name: Arrow Soccer
description:
Game published in the The F.A. Book for Boys 1954/55.

Rules:
All you need to play this football game are two counters and a die. Throw the die to see who kicks off first - highest begins. Then each player throws and moves in turn. When a player lands on the tail of an arrow he moves directly to the head of that arrow. The white arrows are good passes and take you more quickly to the goal. The black ones are free-kicks awarded against you and take you farther from the goal. If one player lands on top of another, this is a foul and he must go back 7 positions.

To score a goal, you must throw the exact number required to reach the ‘Goal’ circle. If a number is thrown that is too many, you must go backwards for the number left over and await your next turn before you can shoot again . . . and so on until you get the exact number to score.

Try seeing how many goals you can score against a friend in half-an-hour (you can, of course, make it longer if you like). You might also form a local league, but if so all games should be the same period. Whatever the time-limit, the most goals, wins.

name: Бригада
description:
Parody to a twilight zone life

The lack of libraries and other cultural centres gave rise to crime rate. It has increased almost that high it used to be in 90s at industry towns suburban.

Each player picks up a charismatic character whose goal is to become the toughest guy in the hood. Making temporary alliances will help them through this. Players should stick to the role on their characters in conversations and behaviour.

The game has 3 main stages:

1. Players get acquainted to the area and cooperate, evolving equally.

2. Two or three leaders get ahead of the others and obtain a chance to a quick victory.

3. Outsiders do their best to not to let the leaders succeed - and their efforts may take them to an unexpected conclusion.

The key feature of the game is its cooperation system: sharing resources, fair judgement and communicative skills will eventually make you the top guy on the block.

name: Palestina under Davidstjernen
description:
A 50s boardgame themed on the Jewish rights to settle in the promised land of Palestine ("Kanaans land", "Jews land"). Players move their token on a classical 50s map of Palestine, and scores points as they reach different cities and locations on the map. Winner is the player with highest score after 30 minutes.

Players move on the board from directions given by the David star; players spin the David star, mounted on a large paper clip, each turn, and move on the board accordingly, as the David star tells you both which direction to go, and how far you should go. The rule book states where this location is mentioned in the bible, and how many points you get from entering this location.

As a game published with a clearly political intension, it is quite ironic to find the 1948 UN map of Israel as a part of the rule book.

Advanced version is to point in what part of the bible this location is mentioned. The game is in Norwegian, published by Karmel.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monkey Dice
description:
From the publisher's website:

"Monkey Dice is a fun, "press your luck" dice rolling game for the whole family to enjoy.

Each player takes their dice and tries to roll the most monkeys. AVOID THE POOP! If a player rolls 3 poops, their turn is over and they get NO points for the monkeys they have collected.

Monkeys can be rewarded with bananas to clean up poop for you, increasing your chances of winning."

There are twelve identical dice in Monkey Dice. There are three results on each die: Monkey (3 sides), poop (2), and banana (1).

On a player's turn, they will roll three of the dice. After rolling they keep monkeys and poop, then decide what to do with the bananas: they can re-roll them during the next set or keep them. If a player keeps a total of three bananas they can eliminate one poop they have collected.

The player continues by rolling another three dice, or stopping their turn. When they stop, they count the total number of monkeys they have collected and add that to their score. If they rolled three poops, their turn is over and lose the points they currently collected.

When a player reaches 50 points, the current round is finished, and they player with the highest score wins.
publishers: Chaffee Shack Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Wer baut unser Haus?
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 130
- moving by turns -
Typical 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a red space follow instructions glued into the lid.

name: Monopoly: HP Supply Chain Edition-2005
description:
Monopoly with a Hewlett-Packard theme.

As you go around the board, you encouter the 22 steps in the Supply Chain. You'll build Pallets and Containers (houses and hotels). Tokens represent various industries, such as Automotive and Pharmaceutical.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Polite Pigs Playing Cards: A Game of Good Manners
description:
From the game itself:

"Polite Pigs will familiarize children with the etiquette of responding appropriately in a variety of social situations. It is also designed to reinforce and habituate these responses through verbal repetition. Parents should enjoy hearing their children repeatedly ask and give permission to proceed as the game is played. The object of the game is to capture the most situation cards with the appropriate polite responses."

Gameplay description:

Cards are dealt to each player (child). The remaining cards form a draw pile. The dealer turns cards over from the draw pile until s/he reaches a "situation" card. (Others are mixed back into the pile.)

The dealer announces the situation and the youngest player (presumably to help children learn politeness and pragmatics starting at a young age) figures out whether s/he has the appropriate response card. If so, s/he says so and takes the situation card as a matched pair with his/her response card.

Else, the player takes a draw card and further, the game's rules require the child state, "Now you try, please" and the next player or opponent to respond, "Thank you" as an additional method of reinforcing politeness. If the next player has the corresponding response card, s/he may claim the pair. Otherwise, s/he draws a card and play continues so on and so forth.

If a player is able to match a response card to a situation card, s/he become dealer. A series of formalistic polite exchanges must be had between the players and if any player forgets the appropriate phrase, such as, "May I give you a situation, please?" then the offending player must hand his opponent a response card or draw until he gets one to hand over.

The winner is the one with the most pairs.

Ultimately, this game focuses not only on physical game mechanics but social dynamics to reinforce its educational affect. The rules take into account that the players may fail to say required phrases, something akin to—but more complex than—the requirement in UNO to declare "¡Uno!" with one card left in hand.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Simulation

name: The Great American Drinking Game
description:
Players roll the dice and move around the board, using the spaces and cards available to try to outdrink their opponents and collect 10 Bottoms Up tokens.

Intended for those who are more free spirited and enjoy doing risque things, some of the tasks required in the game are to remove pieces of clothing, massage or kiss other players, and of course take a drink! Either the first player to collect 10 tokens or the last player conscious wins!

name: Tic Tac Shmo
description:
Back cover game description:

One false move and you're the Shmo!

Who's mind is more Powerful?

Feel the excitement! You played your first two cards well. They make their move - a mistake! You see it! You know you've got them where you want them! You feel your power. They can't escape. You play your next card and set the trap! They look for a move to make, but only panic sets in. they know they're a SHMO because their next move makes you the winner!

5 Minutes to play. Hours of fun!

name: Fracture
description:
(from DriveThruCards)

Players compete to place 5 cards in a row, before their opponents use Card powers or the power of their fracture cards to destroy their winning lines.

Each player makes a blind pick of a colored deck of fracture cards and then builds lines of cards upon their foundations. Players use their card powers to slow or stop their opponents while they complete a line of 5 cards all in the same direction.

Fracture cards allow a player to break an opponents line before they finish it, each player has 4 and when they are gone they are gone.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Take That

name: Make A Word
description:
Each player places their coloured pawn on the corner of the board that matches their colour. The dice is then thrown to decide which player is to start; other players follow in a clock¬wise direction. In their turn players throw the dice and move their pawn the number of spaces indicated by the dice. Moves may be made backwards or forwards around or across the diagonal paths. If the ‘pawn’ lands on a letter, the player takes a matching letter from the letter tiles. Should the pawn land on a Gold Star he may take any letter he wishes; but if the pawn lands on a Black Spot the player must return a vowel card from those he has won back to the general pile; if he has not yet gained a vowel, he must owe it and return it when he obtains one.
The object of the game is to form words from the tiles collected. For the younger child it can be to make simple three letter words such as CAT—MAT—COT—CUP and so on. It should be decided beforehand the number of words (say six) and the first to do so being the winner.

It is also a game which may be played with enjoyment by much older children. In this case a point value is given to the length of the word. 3 letter words, 5 points; 4 letter words, 10 points; 5 letter words, 15 points; 6 and over letter words, 20 points. In this case it must be decided beforehand the number of points to be played for (say 100); the first player to do so being the winner. Words already formed may be added to such as MAT to MATS or MATCH; but no word already laid may be re-arranged.

name: Colossal Cave Adventure: The Card Game
description:
Colossal Cave Adventure: The Card Game is based on the 350-point ADVENT computer game created by Will Crowther and expanded by Don Woods. As that game is in the public domain, this adaption is placed in the public domain as well.

The game captures the spirit of the first text adventure: the feel of exploring, mapping, and navigating a new world, while trying to find the items that will solve the puzzles.

To setup, you deal location cards face down to form 3 levels of the cave: each level is a 5 by 5 grid. The entrance chamber is placed in the center of the first level and players' pawns start there.

From a location card, players can only travel in directions indicated by the location, moving to one permitted adjacent card and exploring that location. Sometimes they encounter obstacles ("A fierce green snake bars the way!") and have to turn back unless they have the current item; typically they encounter new regions of the cave ("You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike. [Lose a turn!]"), some of which allow them to choose from an item deck ("There is a shiny brass lamp nearby"). The cave is confusing and complex - often you can't simply return to a location you recently left, but must plot a course through other regions or levels to get there. Magic words will take you up and down levels of the cave.

To win, players race to be the first to score 100 points in items collected and puzzles solved or solve the end game puzzle before anyone else.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Maze, Print & Play, Video Game Theme

name: Squirmy Wormy
description:
Object: Be the first player to put all of their spots on the worms.

Each player is given a number of spots (depending on the number of players). Players take turns spinning a spinner that indicates a color of worm. That player than places one of their spots on the indicated worms. The player that runs out of spots first wins.

This is a children's game produced in 1970 by Whitman. For kids ages 4 to 8.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trivia Louisville
description:
Trivia Louisville is a simple roll-and-move game featuring trivia about Louisville, Kentucky. Players move their tokens around the board answering questions from different categories. Once a player has a correct answer from each category they must pass the finish square to win the game.

From the back of the box:

What Louisville-born actor starred in the film series "Cannon" and "Jake and the Fatman?"

In 1941, Louisville was the world's largest producer of what man-made product?

Who was the first woman to ride in the Kentucky Derby?

The answers to these questions and MORE can be found inside Trivia Louisville! Trivia Louisville is an exciting new game about Louisville designed for all ages. You'll enjoy this entertaining way to discover the real intrigue inside Louisville!

name: Aladdin
description:
Dice-game for 2-4 players.

A roll and move game where you should be first to reach number 39. If you land on a number with a 2 or 6 then you have to move backwards 2 or 6 steps. If you land on number 10 you have to start all over again.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flip Flops
description: Flip over the cards to collect sets of non-matching gear to win. Sets of cards are created or added to by all players. To start a set, put down two cards from your hand or to add to a set, you may play one card. Cards played must be different in all of the three elements on the card, gear, number and color. You keep the set if you are the one to complete it. The player with the most sets wins.

name: The Channel Islands Game
description:
The Channel Islands Game is based on the real routes and itineries in the Channel Isles. In playing the game hazards and dangers are encountered similar to those experienced in real life. It is only by chance and skill that a player can win.

Object of the Game:

To complete a tour of all five islands marked on the board, using the travel tickets to St Peter Port having successfully visited and placed a counter on a cross on each of the five islands.

name: The All New Act One
description:
From box:

The all new Act One is the Exciting game where everyone gets to make a scene! In a race against the clock, players do almost anything to try and get their teammates to guess the titles of popular movies and TV shows. The sooner teams guess correctly, the more points are scored. But who cares who wins, when it's this much fun!

Simple to play: Guess the Movie or TV title correctly and score points. Player race against the clock (40 sec.) per card. Players must "act: (read) each scene on the card. Better acting will help. We suggest first to 20 points wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Lacour Colosseum
description:
User summary:

A dice-driven tournament style battle game. Each player picks 2 mages and 2 fighters to form 2 teams, and place them on the tournament grid. Each fight is performed by both sides rolling the number of dice specified by the fighter, trying to reach as high a total as possible. The mage in each team can use spells to affect the dice, and the fighter can in turn have abilities that help the mage. Game is won by combination of fighter-mage, skillful use of spells and some dice luck.

The player who finishes first in the tournament wins the game.

This game shares the same world view as Alchemist Atlier and Seven Force
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Bible Bafflers, Jr.
description:
Bible Bafflers, Jr. is a Bible trivia game with questions belonging to one of 5 different subjects: Old Testament, New Testament, People, History/Geography, and Other Bafflers. Correct answers are scored on a bingo type of scorecard.

Object of the game (quoted from the game rules):
"To win, a player must answer enough questions to complete a straight line of Bafflewinks across the Baffleboard in any direction -- horizontal, vertical or diagonal."

Each Bafflecard lists 5 numbered questions all of the same subject, with the correct answers given on the reverse side of the card. A numbered question is determined by flicking the spinner, and the player answers that question from the top card on the draw pile.

When a correct answer is given, the player places a Bafflewink on the same number in the column under its subject heading on his Baffleboard. If there is a Bafflewink already on that spot, the player must answer a question from the next card, otherwise play passes to the next player on the left.

A Baffleboard is basically a 5x5 bingo card, but only the player who answered the question correctly places a Bafflewink on his Baffleboard.

Components:
20 different Baffleboards
200 different Bafflecards- 40 each in one of 5 subjects
105 Bafflewinks (small red transparent discs)
1 spinner
1 set of rules

Bible Bafflers, Jr. may be played along with the original Bible Bafflers game. It is suggested that the younger players answer questions from the Bible Bafflers, Jr. cards, and the older players answer questions from the original game.

Team play is allowed.

Tenwinks is a variant for 2 experienced players. Each player plays with only 10 Bafflewinks. If a player answers a question correctly but all 10 Bafflewinks are already on the player's Baffleboard, then one of those Bafflewinks must be moved to the spot corresponding to the current correct answer.

The game was published in 1984 by Paraclete Press.

name: Renaissance Investments Monopoly
description:
Renaissance Investments Monopoly is a marketing/promotional board game created and distributed by USAopoly for Renaissance Investments (which is owned by CIBC Asset Management). It is a derivative of Monopoly and its game play is identical to Monopoly in most respects.

The primary difference is that the properties, utilities, cards, etc. are oriented to the Renaissance Investments corporation. Aside from this, using the roll-and-move mechanic, players buy properties, build houses and hotels, and collect rent from fellow players. The player who doesn't go bankrupt is the winner.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Toboggans of Doom: Promo Tile Set
description:
The feel of the wind on your face, the sight of the finish line just over the next snow bank… and the elation of rocket-jumping over evil trees while being chased by a phalanx of chainsaw-wielding snowmen! It’s the wild challenge of extreme downhill sledding against a hill of crazy, zany, fun obstacles in Toboggans of Doom!

Includes 3 Promo Tiles:

Presidential Co-Pilot Upgrade
Distracting Assistant Obstacle
Psychic Rat Obstacle

name: Collusion
description:
Collusion is a mobile-enhanced board game that mandates lying, stealing, cheating, and murdering in order to win. Players must work together while simultaneously plotting against each other in order to gain influence over the region. Selling out an ally to an enemy, blackmailing an opponent, or paying another agent to carry out an assassination on your behalf is all in a day's work.

You play as a Spy Master from one of several agencies. Your goal is to maximize your influence over the region at the expense of the other agencies. How you go about that is not important to your superiors - just don’t get exposed!

Using your advanced espionage device (your phone) you can secretly send messages to other players, hack into their devices, disrupt their gameplay, order assassinations on the black market. While an AI adapts the gameplay based on in-game allegiances, the cards in each player's hands and their current missions. All while managing your agents on the board to carry out your secret objectives and obtain intel.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Monopoly: Adelaide Crows
description:
This game is from about about the 2005 era and was a fundraiser for the Mcguiness Mcdermott Foundation. It features the Adelaide Crows AFL team, Adelaide, South Australia.

Not to be confused with Monopoly: 20 Years of Adelaide Crows
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Magic Path of Yoga
description:
From the Manufacturer:

The Magic Path of Yoga is a fun-filled game that introduces kids to the wonders of yoga, healthy nutrition & the environment. The game includes a fully illustrated, 85-page booklet with information about all of the poses & the benefits of yoga. Strike a pose. Roll the dice, pick a card and perform basic poses or answer questions about nutrition and the environment. Be the first player to reach "OM" and you win. Upside Down Games offer physical, social and intellectual benefits for players of all ages. Our products provide opportunities for social interaction and build positive self-esteem & confidence. Yoga and active game play enhance balance, coordination, core strength, focus and lots of laughter.

name: Leben in Dortmund
description:
Game published about the German City of Dortmund.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Dortmund. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: Digital Dilemma
description:
Create using the silhouettes on the display, digital numbers as close as possible to those indicated by two cards dealt at the beginning of each round of play.

Similar to 88: Digital Dramatic, but players play one at a time by declaring the move they want to do.

name: Monopoly: Redditch edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Redditch, in the United Kingdom. The game has been launched to mark the 50th anniversary of Redditch as a New Town.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Unstable Crane Game
description:
Crane...Claw...Rip-Off...Thief...it is known by many names throughout history, but the infamous game is still the same in concept: insert cash, use a joystick/buttons to move a metal hand or claw mechanism, then press another button to drop it to see if you snag a prize! Sadly, more times than not, that shiny new toy slips out of the fingers, or misses completely, leading the victim to try insert more cash and repeat these steps.

The Unstable Crane Game is an up to 4-player, simultaneous rendition of this traditional arcade game, where the players each place their "claw tokens" over the various prizes on the table and wait to see if they snag it. Each round, the players flip the top cards of their Player decks, and either get to move their claw, drop their target, or claim their prize according to their card. The first player to achieve a Prize collection worth at least 10 points will be declared the winner! Good luck...


Notes*


1. There are 3 kinds of cards in each player's deck for simulating their claw's behavior: "Not Yet" (they still have time and may move their claw over another prize.), "Oops! Unlucky!" (their claw snagged a prize, but dropped it while attempting to lift or carry it.), or "You Got It!"(the player's claw successfully claimed a Prize.)

2. Multiple players can try for the same prize. However, since the actions determined by each player flipping the card of their Player Deck occur at roughly the same time, should multiple players draw their "You got it" card in the same round and be over the same prize, their claws instead interfere with each other and play resumes as if they'd dropped the prize instead!

3. "Set collection" is also used lightly in this game. Should a player claim at each 3 prizes that share a type, that player is considered an "enthusiast" and each prize of that type in their collection is worth an additional point.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: Monopoly: Peugeot edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Peugeot, a car company.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Das große Shell Rennspiel
description:
This is a car racing game, so the first player to finish a certain number of turns, wins the game. The players use one die (not included in the game). If a player lands on a space with a star, he has to follow the instructions, printed on the game board. 16 collectible coins are used as playing pieces and are stored in recesses in the game board.

The game board and the coins were published as a merchandising tool by Shell in the 1970s. There is no box!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 3-Kaart Trio-Spel
description: 3-Kaart Trio-Spel contains actually two different games: one like Quartett and one like Memory. In both games sets of 3 cards should be collected. Each set forms a complete figure being one of the Dutch football players representing The Netherlands at the 1978 Football World Cup in Argentina. The game contains cards for completing 18 players.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Sports

name: Beastie Bash!
description:
Beastie Bash! isn’t just a card game for kids, it’s outside-the-box thinking -- in a box.

WHAT IS BEASTIE BASH
Beastie Bash! is a silly character creation game for 1-4 players. It’s 20 minutes of family fun created by children’s book author/illustrator, Eric Wight.

OBJECT OF THE GAME
Combine the highest scoring HEAD card with a BODY card to win the cards for that round. The game winner is the player who collects the most Beasties.

WHO IS BEASTIE BASH! FOR?
Beastie Bash! is for kids with wild imaginations. For families who prefer silly to serious. For parents & educators who think the world needs innovators, not fill-in-the-bubblers.

THE BIRTH OF BEASTIE BASH!
The concept for Beastie Bash! was inspired by Eric Wight’s experiences as both a parent and a children’s book author. His favorite hobby is playing games with his kids. So he thought it would be fun to create a game they could all play together. But that was just the beginning.

“This past year, my daughter was diagnosed with dyslexia. As I was designing Beastie Bash! I realized that this game could also be a fun tool to help her improve her reading and math skills. We can play it for hours and it doesn’t feel like homework to her. Plus, by mixing up the cards, the text is continually changing.”

As an author, Eric has the opportunity to travel around the world teaching kids what it’s like to create stories for a living. At these events, students brainstorm ideas for new adventures, which Eric illustrates on the spot.

“The kids always have so many cool ideas that it’s tough to choose just one. So I thought it would be fun to mash a few together. I could never have predicted how much it made the students and teachers laugh. I realized I was onto something, and set out to create a game that captured that same creative, unpredictable humor.”

RULES OF PLAY

SET UP
2 - 4 players. Shuffle the deck. Evenly divide the cards face down to each player. No peeking!

HOW TO PLAY
Each player draws 5 cards from their pile. Pair a HEAD and BODY combination to make the highest score possible and place it in front of you. A color match earns an additional +5 points, a MEGA-MATCH earns +10 points and a "TRUE MATCH" (i.e.: the original head and body combination) earns double points.

POWER PRIZES
Once everyone has revealed their Beastie, players may improve their chance of winning by using a POWER PRIZE card if they possess one. Begin with the player who has the lowest scoring Beastie and continue clockwise. The player with the highest scoring Beastie wins all of the Beasties from this round. Discard the used POWER PRIZE cards.

THE BOOM! CARD
The BOOM! card is very powerful and may be played at any time. When a player uses a BOOM! card, it scares away all of the Beasties. Everyone's cards are discarded no matter what their point value is or what POWER PRIZE cards are being used. Bummer!

TIE-BREAKER
If at the end of the round the score is tied, players may draw enough cards to refill their hand and play another Beastie. Repeat until the tie is broken.

NO PAIRS
If you are unable to make a pair with your cards, you must:

1. Discard 2 cards from your hand.

2a. Use the top 2 cards from your collected Beastie pile.

OR

2b. Draw 2 cards from your unused deck. If you draw two cards from your unused deck, you must discard all 5 cards AND lose your turn. At the beginning of the next round you may draw 5 new cards.

ENDING THE GAME
The game ends when the first player runs out of cards. Count how many Beasties you collected. The player with the most wins!

ALTERNATE GAME PLAY
1-player: Similar to a traditional match game. Place all the cards face down. The object is to find the Power Prizes before you find the Boom! cards. Turn them over two at a time to find Power Prizes. Once you find a character match, it can be removed from the board. If you flip over 4 Boom! cards, you lose.

LEVEL-UP WITH LEARNING
Beastie Bash! isn’t just fun to play, it’s also a great tool for learning both at home and in the classroom.

READING: Each card contains funny flavor text that brings the characters to life. With each new match, the text changes, creating countless new reading experiences.

MATH: Kids practice addition skills as they play each round of the game. Older kids can multiply instead of add to make the math more challenging.

WRITING: Create your own adventures using the mix-and-match cards as writing prompts.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Math, Memory, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Pick-up and Deliver, Storytelling, Take That

name: Mirrors
description:
From the Kickstarter description:
Mirrors is a fun and easy-to-master card game about the direct and infinite reflections found throughout existence. The inspiration for this project came to me from my childhood adoration for Pokémon cards,etc; and the minimalistic design and approach pay homage to Hanafuda’s beauty and simplistic brilliance.

...

Mirrors plays much like a game of Rock-Paper-Scissors in that there is a power hierarchy in which Triangle beats X, X beats Circle, and Circle beats Triangle. [...] Both players will flip their cards at the same time and who ever has the dominant Happening Symbol, wins, and is given the choice to either inflict damage upon their opponent or to use their card’s special effect. The amount of damage a card can inflict is indicated by a card’s Energy which is the whole number located under the symbol. In the case that both players play the same Happening symbol they are to look at the decimal number under the Energy. This number is the cards Gravity, and whoever has the highest Gravity, wins the that match. Players repeat this until one player’s Ego Points are reduced to zero.

name: Social Media Meltdown
description:
Object of the game is to have the most "Social Media friends" by the end of the day - represented by the game board. Each space represents one hour.

Players are given an agree and disagree card - and upon landing on a "Forum" space - are given the choice to vote on a series of statements. Players who match the vote gain more friends, those who are wrong LOSE friends. The landing player gains 15 friends for every correct match.

Other spaces include "At home or on the go", "At work", "Upgrade" and "Blog". These all gain or lose "friends".

The "Social Media Meltdown" loses all friends, and returns you back to the start...

From game description:

Pokes fun at our obsession with social media
Can you increase your facebook popularity or will you end up friendless
Full of hilarious facts on the world of social media

name: The Red Rover Game
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching target space
- moving by turns -
Story: A lonesome dog (Red Rover), who lives in the forest tries to catch children being on a race through the woods because he's seeking company.

Each player moves forward according die roll; simultaneously red rover is moved, too, starting from his 'lonesome lodge'. There are some spaces players are safe or must follow instructions; as soon as Red Rover ends on the same space a payer stands or has moved to he/she's caught for one round. Next turn player is going to escape joining the party again on the very last position.

name: Monopoly: V8 Supercars Australia Charity Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from
V8 Supercars, a touring car racing category based in Australia.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Geelong Football Club 2007 Premiership Charity Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Geelong Cats, an Australian Footballcub;limited Edition to raise money for McGuinness McDermott Foundation (now Little Heroes Foundation).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Trading

name: Autotest
description: The cars of the players (or teams) have to pass 9 different performance tests. For each test they get awarded points, which are determined by a spinner. A second car of the same color marks the points on the circle at the center of the game board. The player who gets the most points after 9 tests wins the game. So basically each player or team spins 9 times and whoever spins the most points wins.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mundial Goal
description:
A Trivial game about soccer and soccer-players. During your turn you have to draw 3 soccer-player counters from a draw pile of 72 and order them according to a random trait that could be: age, height, caps in the national team, caps in mundial, goal in the national team and goal in mundial.

Other players have to agree or disagrre to your decision.

All the players have also bet counter to use during the game.

name: Rapine, Pillage & Plunder
description:
Europe, c. 450 A.D. Barbarians are running amok, raiding villages for women (rapine), weapons (pillage) and gold (plunder). Will your tribe reign supreme in this savage contest for survival?

Game play alternates between the players. On your turn, you have a choice of three actions:


Rapine, pillage or plunder (RPP)
Move
Discard a card


The cards serve the three above purposes. Most of the time, players will move to villages and perform RPP. Sometimes, however, when a barbarian tribe gets a little cocky, a battle will occur between the players. These are settled smoothly using the symbols on the cards in hand, and rest assured--tribute will be paid by the loser!

I designed Rapine, Pillage & Plunder because I feel there's a dearth of fun, light, yet not-too-simple two-player games. I believe that this game helps fill that void. (Publishers take note). It's a simple game aimed at casual gamers but has enough in the way of tactics and choices to appeal to more seasoned gamers, as well.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Teel laulu- ja tantsupeole
description:
