Board game about Estonian Song Celebration and Dance Celebration

Game board is Estonian map and the objective is for players to gather all the singers and dancers to Tallinn Song Festival Grounds. Rolling the die the players move with their pawns on the board and answer the questions - The 3 topics are: The Song Celebration, The Dance Celebration and The Time.
If correctly the can move the nearby dancers/singers.

If all dancers/singers are reached to Tallinn the player with the most correct answers is the winner.

Players Mängijate ühine eesmärk on küsimustele vastates koguda Eestimaalt kõik laulu- ja tantsupeolised laulukaare alla
või tantsustaadionile. Küsimused jagunevad kolme teema vahel – laulupidu, tantsupidu ja aeg. Osalejaid laulu- või tantsupeole läkitades kogub iga mängija ka laulu- ja tantsupidude märke, mille alusel selgub pärast ühise eesmärgi täitmist, kes mängijatest teab kõige enam laulu- ja tantsupeo ajaloost. Vastuste leidmisel tulevad lisaks traditsioonilistele ajalooteadmistele kasuks ka nupukus, leidlikkus ning kõik laulu- ja tantsupidudel nähtud päikselised ja vihmased päevad.
SISU:
Eesti kaardiga mängulaud
küsimusteraamat (1000 küsimust ja vastust)
30 laulu- ja tantsupeolise nuppu
60 laulu-ja tantsupeo märgiga žetooni
6 mängunuppu
lauluväljak ja tantsuväljak
täring

name: Monopoly: Pasadena Centennial 1886-1986 (Pasanopoly)
description: This spin off of the classic game Monopoly celebrates the town of Pasadena's centennial.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Princess Ballet
description:
All the most beautiful Princesses have been invited to the Princess School of Ballet to learn how to dance one of the most famous Princess ballets. The Princess to learn and perform her ballet first is crowned the winner.

Each player must find and learn all 5 of their ballet dance poses that are shown – on the smaller pose cards – on their ballet card. These poses are found on the giant dance floor playing mat. When a correct matching pose is found, the Princess must perform that pose and then place the card face down on her ballet card. Being able to remember all the poses in the correct order is the challenge.

On each princesses turn, they must roll the foam dice to see what step they must take, will it be; a Footstep (move either 1, 2 or 3 steps depending on the amount indicated on the dice), a Lesson Symbol (a private dance lesson where you are allowed to peek at either 1 or 2 of the game cards that are laid face down) or the Shuffle Symbol(where you can swap 3 poses on the board to either help you or delay your opponents dance).

If you are the Princess who has collected all 5 of their ballet poses first, then you can perform your dance first to see if you have won. Turn your pose cards over and have a look – now hand the card to the other Princesses and recite the ballet dance in the order same order that the poses are shown on the card. Got them right? Then you are the winner!

Suitable for 2 – 4 players.

name: The Addams Family
description:
Weird is Relative ...
Creep on BOARD with the kookiest GAME around.
The aim of the Game is to be the first Addams to go round the Board avoiding the obstacles and land on the Tombstone.
publishers: BMA Toys and Games Limited, Brand Makers International

name: Monopoly: Lilly Pulitzer Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Another version of the classic Monopoly. This time the cases represent the company Lilly Pulitzer.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Ice Cold Ice Hockey: Junior Edition
description: Designed for younger gamers, this "junior" version of Ice Cold Ice Hockey has a simpler action-card deck and a much smaller (4-page) rules set. The cards serve multiple purposes, including passing, skating, shooting, defense, shot-blocking and goaltending. Naturally, realistic shots on goal and save percentages have been retained from the original version, and both young and older players will be able to complete a game in about 30 exciting minutes.

name: TwentyOne
description:
It's like Blackjack, with dice! Secretly roll for your hand, then press your luck to get closer to 21 and use your bluffing skills to score victory points each round.


Full Set has enough components for 2 players. For Four-Player games get the Full Set + Extras.

name: Recruiters
description:
In Recruiters, two players compete to recruit the best group of candidates for the armed forces of their nation Uber Superb. Players need to spend their recruiting power wisely, balancing their efforts for each of the four service branches: Army, Navy, Marines and Air Force. It’s an advantage to recruit the most people, and it’s an advantage to recruit the best people. But that’s just the beginning, since allocating your recruits to hotspots around the globe is even more important, and... there are two ways to play!

In the standard game, there are two decks: one with all the Recruiting Power cards plus two Special cards, and the other with all the Recruit cards. Each player gets a hand of Recruiting Power cards, which are used to sway (i.e., buy) recruits which are constantly coming and going throughout the peak recruiting season. After this first part of the game, 2 VPs are awarded to the player with the most recruits. Then, four further and crucial competitions between the players will take place, and the player who best allocates his/her recruits to the aforementioned hotspots will earn the most VPs and win the game.

The "friendly" version of the game is a lighter, press your luck design, with unfortunate results for a too-greedy player.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Bonntur
description: In this simple children's game players take their turn by drawing a coloured wink from a bag and moving a piggybank piece to the corresponding coloured field on the board. Drawing a wink of the same colour as the field the pig is already on triggers a payout for that player, which takes the form of matching winks accumulated in the pig to sets on drawn cards. The goal is to have the most cards when they run out. (It is not actually necessary to use the pig and board at all.)

name: Moshi Monsters: Monstro City Game
description:
Race around Monstro City collecting items from the shops and answering questions along the way. Once your collection is complete be the first to the centre of the board to answer the ultimate Moshi question and claim the Golden Iggy Trophy.

A simple roll and move quiz game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Golden Spike
description:
The United States of America, 1863-69. Two railroad lines, one starting in California and the other in Iowa, set out to create a seriously divided nation’s first transcontinental railroad. In The Golden Spike, two players take on the role of a railroad magnate, building half of this famous accomplishment in transportation. It’s a race, to be sure, and the first player to reach Promontory Summit, Utah gains prestige and bonus money. However, the winner of the game is the player who makes the most profit along the way, which requires a delicate balance of planning and cunning.

Players alternately select three-card stacks from a row of them, with only one of the three cards visible. These allow the players to perform various actions, such as hiring workers and buying materials, both needed in the construction of the railroad sections they'll need to complete to get to Promontory Summit... and sometimes men and materials may be hoarded and in short supply. If an Inspector appears when turning over a face-down card, a turn ends immediately and no actions are executed. Three terrain types present a quandary for both players: faster construction or greater profits.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Print & Play, Territory Building, Trains
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: Black Stories: Promostory Ärztlicher Rat
description:
Black Stories: Ärztlicher Rat is a promotional card celebrating the tenth anniversary of Game: Black Stories. The card was given out for free at SPIEL 2014 in Essen as an advance publication from Black Stories 11. However, Black Stories 11 ended up never being published afterwards, the publisher
moses. Verlag GmbH decided to call the next generic Black Stories edition after Black Stories 10 Black Stories 13.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: With All Do Respect: The Party Game With An Adventure
description:
With All Do Respect is the first ever party board game with a realistic adventure to it!

Just imagine asking your friends and family any question you want without getting into trouble! That's right! You can't get into trouble because you said "With All Do Respect!"

Tonight you and all your friends are going downtown for an exciting night out but tomorrow you have to get up early for work or school.

The object of the game is to move around town stopping at different locations to collect party points and then be the first player to make it back home.

You collect party points by answering fun questions about each other or anyone you decide is lucky enough to be on your Vip List. You also collect party points by singing at the Karaoke Club, dancing with all your friends at the Night Club, telling jokes and making up new rules to follow at the Comedy Club, gambling on all your favorite games at the Casino or stopping by the Tattoo Parlor to draw fun pictures of your friends, famous celebrities and much, much more! Along the way try avoiding the police because you could get arrested for driving suspiciously and have to spend time in Crook County Jail!

The first player to collect 12 party points and make it back home - Wins The Game!

name: Simple Soccer
description:
From the publisher's website

A hobby game for 2 players.

A simple, easy to play interpretation of Association Football (Soccer). The design of the playing pieces harks back to the early days of tabletop football games like Subbuteo, where the 2-dimensional card players were known as "flats". For the first time this game is supplied with 12 full teams!

User Summary

This is a game for two players where each player mans a team of eighteen players, eleven of which are on the pitch at any one time. Each team tries to score goals in the oppositions net. As with real football the game is split into two halves of 45 minutes with a break in between, with teams swapping ends at half time.

The game uses player piece positioning as well as D6 dice to create some randomness, in the form of "scattering" the ball a random direction. Players move their pieces up to a specified amount and if they are next to the piece with the ball may tackle.

Rules, tables and diagrams for throw-ins, dribbling, kicking, shooting and other football terms are included.

name: Big Nate's Detention Dash
description:
From the game box:
Based on the best selling Big Nate books, Detention Dash is a fun fast paced game! Join middle-schooler Nate and his friends as they run from classroom to classroom collecting detention cards. Along the way Coach John might surprise you! The player with the fewest detention and fail cards wins.

Further information: Players must roll and move through the spaces representing hallways and classrooms. Each player must collect a report card from each of six classrooms. Along the way, they may get Detention cards in various ways, such as being caught in the hall when the bell rings or being caught by good student Artur. Each player must also draw and play an action card each turn. Some cards allow extra moves, moving other players or discarding or taking extra detention cards. Others are "Coach John All Play" cards which require all players to complete a physical challenge (such a making and flying a paper airplane). First player to get all six report cards discards two detention cards and then total detention and "fail" report cards are counted, "pass" report cards are subtracted and the player with the lowest total wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Hunted: A Game of Medieval Magic, Mischief and Mayhem
description:
The Hunted is a game which takes place in Medieval Times when fear of the supernatural was rampant. What’s worse is that the supernatural could be hidden in any disguise a friend, a brother, a son. The community leaders would do just about anything to keep the seed of heresy from spreading in their communities. This incidentally, is where our “heroes” come in.

Players are normal townspeople who have been given magical powers and abilities from a Mystical Benefactor. They have been given one objective in return for their newfound power: Chaos.

They must take care however, if they are caught there are dire consequences for stepping outsided of society’s boundries. Even if they manage to evade the notice of the authorities, the community will react in greater force to the strange happenings, the inexplicable bad fortune that seems to have befallen the town and the disappearances. Can our troublemakers complete their mission of disrupting a community or will they be rooted out by the powers that be? Will they become the hunters or... The Hunted?

The Game:

Mystical Benefactors
There are currently 8 Mystical Benefactors to choose from for a given campaign. Each has their own special abilities and unique spells when they are active. This makes The Hunted have great replayability.

Avoid Suspicion
Players attempt to complete the objective, take down all three Authority Figures, while pretending to live a normal life. Players must pay taxes (10 Coins every Tuesday) and generally just stay out of trouble whilst carrying out their hazardous misdeeds.

Chaos
To grow stronger, players must commit disruptive acts upon the community to earn Chaos Points. Chaos Points are used to purchase Spells and Familiars (Animals bound to you by the Dark Benefactor that will obey your every order.) Chaos Points can be earned by:

Destroying property Converting villagers to join your cult Sacrificing Animals and villagers Taking down Authority Figures And other generally blasphemous thingsPlayers can work together or separately to gain Chaos Points. However, at the end of one week, the player who has earned the most Chaos points is rewarded greatly by the Dark Benefactor, while the player who earns the least is punished. This adds an element of competitiveness to the general cooperative spirit of the game.

Paranoia
Should a character be noticed doing something strange, they will gain Paranoia Points. Paranoia Points indicate how suspicious the villagers are of that player being a heretic. Players will have increasingly harsh sanctions set against them as their paranoia score rises, such as the townspeople watching them more closely or their house being searched for heretical paraphernalia, eventually ending in their execution for heresy. Players can reduce Paranoia by doing things that are expected of them, like going to church or being a nice person, these things usually come at the cost of Chaos Points, bringing a delicate balance of Paranoia and Chaos that players must manage. Typically, it is best to be able to not be noticed or to be able to talk your way out of a dicey situation.

Even if players do manage not to be noticed, villagers will begin to notice the unexplained happenings, the disappearances, and the downright spooky things that seem to be happening around them lately. The village itself has a Paranoia score that raises when something cannot be explained or something clearly supernatural happens. When this score rises, the Authority Figures become increasingly frantic to find and kill the heretics among them. Lowering the Town Paranoia can be difficult, so players must take care with their actions. If the Town Paranoia is too high, for too long, the village will be purged by the Church and the players lose the game.

name: 'Roid Miner
description:
Space, 2099. Interstellar, black market commerce is commonplace. In Sector Beta-3, the search is on for minerals among the asteroids (endearingly called 'roids by you and your fellow miners). Your small mining craft will move swiftly through sixteen sub-sectors and collect six types of minerals, as efficiently as possible. The planets in the sector have different demands for minerals, so you must plan your movements and schedule accordingly. Even in this day and age fuel is an issue, and you'll have to call in a supply ship and pay with one of your completed contracts or convert uranium ore into fuel. Other minerals can be used for other purposes as well, although it's usually better to deliver them for profit… and don’t forget to watch out for the Space Police!

'Roid Miner is a light game with minimal rules which can be played seriously or as a beer-and-pretzels game. How is this possible, you ask skeptically? Because the game's design and mechanics lend themselves to "planning/looking-ahead/what-if-he-does-that" play or "instinctive" play--or anything in-between. In other words, you can play 'Roid Miner in tournament mode or just for fun. Due to the random setup, every game will different. Sometimes you and your opponent will easily spot nice "chains" of pickup and delivery, and your scores will be high. In other games, both of you will struggle to make it into double digits. Sometimes you'll keep to yourselves and sometimes you'll "have at" each other. The best part is that no matter how the game unfolds, 'Roid Miner will always take only about a half-hour to play--and I'm betting you'll set it up for a second game every time.

name: Fair Go
description:
Played similarly to Monopoly, players use dice to move around a board and buy industries. The goal of the game is to have the best reputation for philanthropy and social justice.

As in Monopoly, any player landing on an industry space owned by another player must pay the owner. However, a player may become "the best in their industry" by giving up their move and paying 2,000 in currency to purchase a ring. When a player lands on an industry space with a ring, the owner of that industry must pay the active player. This represents the social responsibility of being the best in an industry.

To win the game, a player must have four rings on four different industries he owns. He also must land exactly on the Charity Shop space and pay 2,000 in currency.

name: Cards Against  Normality
description:
Each player have three illustrated idea cards. Each round, the Storyteller begins telling a story. It can be a familiar tale, an anecdote from real life, or something made up. When the Storyteller is finished, players choose one of their idea cards.

Each player re-tells the original story based on their chosen card. After hearing all of the version, the Storyteller chooses the best one and awards a Plot Point. That player becomes the Storyteller for the next round.

Included as a bonus in John August's Writer Emergency Pack.

name: Bibi & Tina: Voll Verhext – Das Spiel zum Film
description: The game is set during the costume party from the film Bibi & Tina: Voll Verhext. Characters from the movie are placed on areas of the board, and players are to deduce where the villian from the film (Hans Kakmann) is hiding. When the player correctly guesses where the villian is, they get a token. The player with the most tokens at the end of the game wins.

name: Monopoly: Seattle Seahawks
description:
From back of box:

The Seattle Seahawks and the most popular board game have teamed up to create the ultimate gridiron fantasy for fans of all ages. Buy, sell and trade the most valuable players in the history of the Seahawks, from Steve Largent and Dave Brown to Shaun Alexander and Dave Krieg.

What Seattle fan hasn't dreamed of owning and running the Seahawks? At the end of the game, only one Seahawks fan will remain standing and control the definitive Seahawks team of all time... Will it be you?
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Professional Game of Baseball
description: The game is played on a board showing a baseball field, and each player has four tokens representing his batsmen. It is a simple roll a dice and move game.

name: Monopoly: Charlotte Edition
description: The standard board game of Monopoly but re-themed for the great city of Charlotte, NC.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Fotbollsspelet
description:
Fotbollsspelet (“The Soccer Game”) is a two player game where your soccer knowledge decides the outcome. The rulebook also provides rules for playing the game with more players, in teams, making it a cooperative game.

You play as in real soccer, with passes, clinches, shots, penalties, and offside. Eventually you will discover how important cooperation between the single players are for teamwork. Dice rolling and event cards will bring in randomness, just like in a real game of soccer.

Situation cards with questions about soccer rules are an important part of the game. If you know the rules, it will give you advantages in the game. If you don’t, you will learn the rules playing Fotbollsspelet.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Sports, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Zombie Army: The bloody card game
description:
The goal as the name suggests is to form the largest army of zombies as possible, attacking your enemies and "zombifying" them.

First, each player must pick a card in the package identified as HUMAN, this is an open card depicting their character to start the game.

Then, players are distributed a package of 7 ACTION cards each. These are the cards that will enable them to attack or defend themselves against their opponents.

In Zombie Army, the player that is attacked by a zombie is considered out after three strikes, same as Baseball.
So in order to make a human become a zombie:
Zombie attack: Strike one
Neck, arm or leg bite: Strike two
Human infected: Strike tree, you're dead
In turn, clockwise, players must attack their opponents using strategy and luck in order to "zombify" the characters of their opponents and take possession of them.

The winner is the player who has the most HUMAN cards in their army.

It is extremely simple to play based on the principle of action reaction, it is "addictive". It combines strategy, luck, scheming and friendship and it is easy to carry and play everywhere. No board game, no dice, no pieces, no calculation or complicated numbers, only cards.

name: Monopoly: Rot-Weiss Essen
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Rot-Weiss Essen, a soccer club in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Wind 'n Find
description:
This is a children's board game printed on the reverse side of a Ritz Bits cracker box. It was published as a promotional item by Nabisco.

The background of the board is montage of symbols and physical objects. The players must provide tokens and a coin. Movement is based on the flip of the coin... one move for heads, two moves for tails. Players move along a winding pathway (hence the "wind" in the title) and attempt to locate (the "find" in the title) items related to summer vacation. For example, a player could land on a space requiring the kid to locate four flip-flop sandals. Other spaces require a child to discover the subtle differences between two nearly identical images.

The first player to reach the end of the pathway is declared the winner.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Animal Winner Family Board Game
description: The game comes with three decks of cards --- one easy, one medium, and one hard. Every card in each deck describes an animal. Each player in turn chooses a deck; another player draws a card from that deck and reads the description on the card. The listening player tries to guess the animal that is described. Correct Easy answers score 50 points, Medium 75 points, and Hard 100 points. A player must reach exactly 500 points to win.

name: Norrköping: spelet om din stad
description: Norrköping is a game intended to promote the eponymous city and its businesses. Mechanically it is a close Monopoly clone, where you move across the board, purchases pieces of property, build on them and hope to have your opponents land on them and go bankrupt. There is also a variant which distributes a few starting properties and shortens the game overall.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Aruba
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Aruba, a Caribbean island.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Port of Rotterdam
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Rotterdam, the largest port of Europe.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: OE Offshore Engineer
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements about offshore technonogies. Version is equipped with elements of the oil and gas industry, including tokens revamped to include a helicopter, drill bits, safety helmet, scuba diver and a remotely operated vehicle.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Ultimate Rhode Island Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Rhode Island in the US.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Task Force H.A.T.
description:
Task Force H.A.T. (Heroes Against Tyranny) was formed by the United Nations to combat dangers to the global community. Recruits are bonafide action heroes, like we might see in the movies. Task Force H.A.T. agents are deployed against dictators, drug lords, and the like, when diplomacy and attempts to bring suspects in quietly have failed. Agents are authorized to neutralize the threat by any means necessary. If they manage to collar the perpetrator in their operations, so much the better. Task Force H.A.T. is meant to be played as if it were an action movie. The player characters are the stars of this movie, as such they are protected by the power of the plot. The plot has certain demands on its stars though and if they hope to get better and continue upping the ante on the evil forces of the world they will have to strive to earn Action points. Task Force H.A.T. is intended for 2-4 players.

Players earn Action Points by killing bad guys, making cheesy action movie puns and just doing cool stuff in general. Action Points are used to avoid attacks and activate certain special abilities that give players an advantage against their foes.

The heroes must complete a series of missions to level up their characters and equipment. The better they do on each mission, the faster they are able to upgrade their special abilities and equipment!
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Kampen om Strängnäs
description: This belongs to a series of promotional Monopoly clones featuring local businesses and trivia, published around 1975-1986*. As in Monopoly you move around a board collecting "shares" and hope for others to land on your properties, although the specifics are slightly different. Obviously the trivia elements vary from game to game within the series, and there are also some small mechanical variations, e.g. in the composition of event cards and how rent is calculated.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Kampen om Eskilstuna
description: This belongs to a series of promotional Monopoly clones featuring local businesses and trivia, published around 1988-1992. As in Monopoly you move around a board collecting "shares" and hope for others to land on your properties, although the specifics are slightly different. Obviously the trivia elements vary from game to game within the series, and there are also some small mechanical variations, e.g. in the composition of event cards and how rent is calculated.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Kampen om Örebro
description: This belongs to a series of promotional Monopoly clones featuring local businesses and trivia, published around 1988-1992. As in Monopoly you move around a board collecting "shares" and hope for others to land on your properties, although the specifics are slightly different. Obviously the trivia elements vary from game to game within the series, and there are also some small mechanical variations, e.g. in the composition of event cards and how rent is calculated.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bratz: Puttin' It Together
description:
From the back of the box:

Cloe, Yasmin, Sasha, Jade and the rest of the Bratz Pack need your fashion help to become runway ready! Flip over the cards, three at a time - and see what cool mix 'n' match outfit you can put together. If you have the most completed outfits by the end you're the winner!

The game is a memory variant and part of the Bratz franchise. Includes rules for solo play.

name: Kattspelet
description: The game consists of a deck of 53 cards. On each card is a different cat breed, belonging to one of 17 different subgroups. Each player gets five cards from the start. Each round you get to ask one player for a certain cards that you need to complete a subgroup. If the other player has the card, you get it and can ask for another card. If the other player doesn't have the requested card, you have to take a card from the draw pile and it's the next player's turn. When you have a complete subgroup, you put it on the table. When the deck runs out, you count the score.

name: Orbital Mines
description:
A starship travelling through the farthest reaches of space has flown into a vast field of orbital mines. Its defense systems are more than capable of destroying the mines, yet the small devices are equipped with an A.I. module - now they are trying to surround and annihilate the starship. Which side shall prevail in this deadly duel?

Players will move tiles (starship for one and mines for the other) on a space map and they will try to compete in order to achieve their result: pass the orbital mines fields without any relevant damage or destroy the starship.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Schinderhannes: Die Räuberjagd
description:
Schinderhannes is a historical character similar to Robin Hood. He lived around 1800 in the region of Hunsrück, Taunus and Eifel (center of Western Germany).
Easy dice game. Players roll and move on a board of a network of spaces. One player is the "Schinderhannes" and tries to take as much loot as possible by landing on the appropriate space, the other players try to catch him. Who has the most loot after a couple of games wins.

name: Kelly Party Surprise
description:
It's Kelly's Birthday, but the presents have gotten all mixed up! Help Kelly match the presents to the friends who brought them. This game is part Memory and part set matching.

Includes 20 Friends Cards with the matching present shown in the corner; 20 Gifts for Kelly: 4 yellow stars, 4 pink hearts, 4 blue flowers and 4 purple squares with different gifts inside; 2 Kelly Cards; and instruction sheet.

Cards are dealt out evenly to players. If a player is dealt a Kelly card, she places it face up beside her and is dealt another card so that each player has the same number of Friends Cards.

The presents are turned upside down in the center. Players take turns turning over a present to see if it matches the present on one of the Friends cards she holds. If it does, she shows it to everyone along with the card and sets the two aside. If it does not, she shows the other players what is inside the present and turns it back over. If a player has a Kelly card, she can use it to turn over all the presents of one shape until she finds the present she is looking for. The Kelly card is then turned over and cannot be used again. The winner is the first to find all the presents matching their Friends cards.

A second way to play is to turn the presents upside down in the center and put the rest of the cards in a draw pile. Player turns one card over and tries to find the matching present. If the present matches the player takes the Friends card & present and sets them aside and turns over the next card. If the present does not match, the next player gets to turn over a present and try to match the card, continuing until a player matches the present to the card. If a Kelly card is turned over, the player turns the next Friends card over and uses the Kelly card to help her turn over the presents until she finds a match. Winner is the player with the most matches.

name: Ayakashi Soushi
description:
In あやかし草子 (Ayakashi Soushi), players want to get rid of the tiles in hand quicker than anyone else. Tiles are hexagonal with a figure in the middle, and they feature borders of either a single unique color or two colors split evenly around the tile.

On a turn, a player places a tile on the board, triggering the special effect of the depicted figure if the border of that tile matches an adjacent tile. The tiles with unique colors each have a special power that takes effect when placed.

name: War for the White House
description:
Launch a military style campaign to capture 270 Electoral College votes by using power and influence to sway the voters, turning hot-button political issues into weapons of mass destruction. Shock and awe your opponents with a devastating arsenal of lethal ordnance to capture Primary and Secondary Objectives and earn the 270 Electoral College Votes needed to win the White House.

Deck includes: 52 Playing Cards and 4 Intel Cards
2-4 Players
Kids 6+ / Adults

The object of the game is to WIN 2 CAMPAIGNS. There are 3 ways to win a campaign:


Capture 5 PRIMARY OBJECTIVES for 270 ELECTORAL VOTES.
Capture 5 SECONDARY OBJECTIVES for 269 ELECTORAL VOTES + 1 PRIMARY OBJECTIVE to exceed 270 ELECTORAL VOTES.
Fight a WAR OF ATTRITION until all but one player runs out of cards and drops out of the game.


PLAYING THE GAME (Basic Overview)

Shuffle and deal out all cards evenly to all players (players do not look at their cards but keep them in a stack FACE DOWN on the table). During each round, players take turns drawing and playing their top card. Cards are placed FACE UP on the table.
When a player draws a PRIMARY or SECONDARY OBJECTIVE, the player continues to turn over cards until an ORDNANCE card (a numbered card) is drawn. The player with the highest card wins and captures all cards in play.

name: Flaptacular
description: Flaptacular is a Disney Fairies themed card game, played with a deck of 36 cards numbered 1 to 9. Cards are dealt evenly to all players. Each player then places four cards face-down in a row in front of him- or herself. Remaining cards are kept face-down as a draw pile. Each player turns the top card of his or her draw-pile face up and places it in the center of the table. When the dealer says "go," players turn over the four cards in a row and try to place these number cards on any of the number cards placed in the center of the table. Cards must be placed in numerical sequence, either higher or lower. 1 and 9 can be played on one another. When a card is played, another card may be turned up from the draw pile and placed in the face-up row, so players may always have four cards face-up to play. If no player can play a card, each player turns another draw pile card face up onto the stacks of cards already played. The first player to play all the cards onto the middle stacks wins.

name: KOEkeloeren
description:
The following is a rough translation from the Dutch manual. Some terms just cannot be translated without loss of meaning, sorry about that.

KOEkeloeren is a Moohingly exciting (LOEIspanned) cardgame. Play along with Kittie Cow, Pleuntje kitten, Mistie mouse, Pepper pup, Gagger goat and Bibi piglet.
To help the play KOEkeloeren right, they have put on their glasses.

Contents:
72 playing cards (2*6 cards for each animal)
8 combination cards (showing how to score)
2 dice

Strictly, the box "contains" 5 games, that all use the cards in the box.
These five games are: KOEkeloeren [a8; p3-6], GABBERen [a5; p2-6], BIGgen ("pigletting") [a5; p3-6], Doe de PEPPER (Do the PEPPER) [a4; [3-6] en Pleuntjes Bluf! [a5; p2-6].
Per game, the minimum age and number of players variate slightly, I have added in square brackets after the name of the game, e.g.: [a5; p2-4] would mean ages 5 and up, number of players 2 through 4. Playing time also differences per game.

The manual and 8 combination cards are in Dutch, the playing card are language neutral.

name: Golf On Board
description:
The game consists of a board showing an 18 hole golf course which lists the par for each hole, 5 special 6 sided dice, one four sided die, four player tokens and four packs of 100 cards, one pack for each player.
Holes are either par 3, 4 or 5 and there is a unique die for each par which the player rolls first on a hole. Depending on their roll result they will then have to roll a second time/die and depending on this result, may have to roll yet another die.
Depending on the roll results players will select cards from their deck which record their scores.
After an agreed number of holes players add up their selected cards to determine their final score and the lowest wins.

name: Atomic the Card Game
description:
Atomic the card game is a "build and explode" game for 2-5 players, ages 10+. It's based on Chemistry, but don't worry, you won't learn anything.

Gather your Elements. Stick them together with Bonds. Trigger reactions with Catalysts! If your opponents try to stop you with Water, soak it up with a Sponge! Then throw a little Anti-Matter at them and change up the game with a devious Experiment or two!
mechanics: Action Points, Network and Route Building, Take That

name: Faerie Castles
description:
Faerie Castles is a Rummy based card game. Players compete to build castles in the lands of the fair-folk whilst trying to defend them against the various inhabitants roaming the faerie realm.

Players collect cards that form the structure of their castles, which they may play down in front of themselves. However when drawing new cards they may encounter the various creatures and peoples of the faerie realm who will try to attack and destroy the castles built there. If defeated these attackers are imprisoned in the dungeons of the castles and add to a players final score. Should they be victorious the castle is destroyed and the players work begins again.

Artwork is presented in a black and white style to allow children to colour the cards themselves, individualizing their own copy

Faerie Castles is an entry in the 2015 Children's Game Print and Play Contest.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Pondus: Terningen er Kastet
description:
The third Pondus boardgame in Norwegian, based on Norways most popular comic book Pondus. This is as the two other games, a trivia party game with question cards. The mechanics is slight different compared to the other two games. 990 new questions in 5 categories.

First dude around Pondus pub bar wins the game.

Published by Egmont/Litor.

Here's the norwegian text from the game box:
--

Pondus brettspill. Fotballspillere fra ulike obskure oldboys-lag og byens flotteste damer har funnet veien til Pondus Pub.
For de som har evnen til å legge sammen to og to øl, blir dette en hektisk aften. Det er nettopp der du kommer inn i bildet, for øl skal serveres, spørsmål skal besvares og bardisken skal erobres. Målet er nemlig å flytte raskest en hel runde rundt bardisken.
Belønningen for riktig svar er opptil tre flytt framover, og med de fem kategoribrikkene du har foran deg, kan du lettere fordele oppgavene slik du selv vil. Du kan satse alt på å flytte lengst og raskest, eller spille rolig og trygt, og håpe at du ikke møter deg selv i døra i neste runde. Til slutt kan sjansekortene snu opp/ned på alt når du minst aner det. Her hjelper det lite å ha en stødig serveringsarm og aldri søle en øl. Førstemann rundt bardisken vinner spillet og får straks tilbud om fast kveldsjobb i Pondus Pub. Inneholder 990 spørsmål i 5 emner.
Spillet er på norsk
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Memory, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Life: School Years
description: Life: School Years is a deck building game about real life! Everyone starts the game with only Mom and Dad to help them, but can acquire new friends and properties to help them defeat jerks and succeed in life. Milestone cards also add a press-your-luck mechanic and a way to remove unwanted cards from your deck. The player with the most success points at the end of the game is the winner at Life!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck

name: Life: Adult Years
description: Life: Adult Years is the sequel/expansion to Life: School Years. Players build a deck during the game by acquiring cards from a shared pool. This time around, the stakes are higher as players can get married, divorced, have a crummy office job, retire and finally, death. As before, the goal of the game is to have the most success points at the end and be the most successful at Life!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck

name: Cards Against Info Security
description:
Extra deck of cards for Cards Against IT with Security based cards.
Pomotion item from Varonis, an IT security company
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Mage's Supremacy
description:
Play as greedy sorcerers attempting to gain the most treasure. Summon monster from the nether and cast forbidden spell to fight for your rightful treasure. Gather and play your cards to gain supremacy.

The game is played by drawing from two decks, The Nether deck and the town deck. The Nether contains spells which can be played during a player's turn against other players and Monsters that claim treasure for their master.

Once the town deck has been drained the game ends and the player with the most treasure wins.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Print & Play

name: ¿Qué preferís?
description:
The game primary goal is to have fun, to ridicule and start conversations based on the questions "what would you choose?" to distend the social environment.
You must be the last player in game after eliminating the rest of the players. For that you should guess what would the group choose to do when faced up against fictional situations. If you don't guess then you "die" and become a "ghost". A ghost can keep playing by accomplishing ridicule challenges that would let him block the other players.

name: Opassande
description: Opassande is a party game. All the players hear the same statement, eg. "A perfect partner should have intelligence, humor and ____________." The players should then say a word that complete the statement, eg. "Cold sores" or "fleece". The player then vote on what was the funniest answer. And that player gets one point. The player with most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Jippijaja Quiz: Underhållning
description: Jippijaja Quiz: Underhållning is a party game with 550 questions about movie heroes and Eurovision Song Contest winners, classic TV moments and books.

name: High Seas ADDventure
description: High Seas ADDventure is a children's game. The player draw cards until the numbers on the cards is more the 10. He/she then sums how many cards there is and moves on the board (eg a 4 card and a 6 cards makes 2 cards, and the player moves 2 steps). The first player to the goal is the winner. The theme of the game is to sail the seas. Includes a board, 4 game markers and 56 cards. Game board measures 16” x 16”.

name: Texas Nexus
description:
Too many sheriffs have arrived in Rhymetown and there's only one way to find out who rhymes the best in the wild wild west.

Turn over a card and take it in turns saying words that rhyme with the one on the card. Can't think of a word? Play a sheriff card to put somebody else in the hot seat.

If you don't have a sheriff card left to play and can't think of a word, you're out. The last player standing becomes the sheriff of Rhymetown!

name: Sekai Kangoku karano Dasshutsu
description:
User summary
世界監獄からの脱出 (Sekai Kangoku karano Dasshutsu) means "Escape From The World Prison" in English.

In near future, the entire World was unified and outwardly peaceful, but there still were skirmishes among old nations.

Players take a role of an agent from various nations, and their goal is to let out prisoners of their own nation or their ally. In a prison (playfield), 20 prisoner cards are placed in a 5 x 4 square grid. Each turn, you may switch two prisoners following some rules.

Each prisoner has a nationality, and when three or more prisoners of the same nationality form a line, you take one of them out of the prison and gain victory points. But if you take out a prisoner of your enemy nation, you suffer negative victory points. Then a new prisoner fills the square.

The game ends shortly after the prisoner deck runs out, and the highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
世界が統一された近未来、表向きは平和な世界だが水面下では旧国家の小競り合いが続いていた。
プレイヤーそんな世界の諜報員となり、世界監獄に収監された仲間を救い出す任務に就きます。
監獄に見立てたカード上で、看守を操り、他プレイヤーの目を欺きながら自国の囚人を脱出させましょう。
3人以上同じ国家の囚人が隣接した場合、彼らは協力して自力で脱出していきます。
敵対国の囚人を逃がさぬように細心の注意を払いつつ、自国や友好国の囚人を多く逃がすことがゲームの目的です。
publishers: 758 Board Game Circle (758ボードゲーム会)

name: En rolig historia
description:
En rolig historia is a somewhat educational roll-and-move game published by the Swedish Tourist Association and printed on a large trifold sheet of stiff paper. The game is history-themed and the back of the board has three pages of historical overview.

To my knowledge playing pieces were not supplied and there is no stated player count. The rules are rudimentary and game events include the usual "lose a turn", "move X spaces forward/backward" and "take a detour" among others.

Published in 1980 or 1981.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tiddledy Winks: 5 Different Games Complete
description:
This 1935 publication from Milton Bradley was clearly issued to compete with Parker Bros. earlier Tiddledy Winks Bowling. In addition to the standard Tiddledy Winks game, there is a board inset in the box set up like a dartboard with 10 segments and values ranging from 5 to 15.

The game Spot Tiddledy Winks requires snapping winks onto the board and totalling the scores (highest wins), while the Game of Forty-Five requires snapping five winks on a turn, with the player getting closest to 45 without going over winning.

There also are two bowling games included. One involves setting up ten wooden pins in a standard bowling triangle on the table, with three snaps per turn and resetting the pins after each player turn. Players score one point per pin downed, and highest total after 10 turns wins.

In the other bowling game, the pins are set up on the board in the 10 segments around the cup. The score per pin downed depends on the board segment.

name: Bondegårdsspillet
description:
Bondegårdsspillet ("The Farm Game") is a game for the whole family about the animals of the farm. For 2-4 players aged 5 years up.

Players move their pawns around the track on the board and collect animals. When landing on a 'cat' or 'dog' space they draw a card and may then e.g. get or loose animals.

The first player to collect all six different animals is the winner.

name: Supply Line
description:
Supply Line is a 4X game which attempts to simulate and demonstrate the logistics problems of traditional ground warfare.

Suitable for 2 to 12 players, aged 14+, who have 90-240 minutes spare to enjoy a 4X game of logistical battle.

The game involves developing and maintaining a network of goods (fuel and metal is extracted from wells and mines) and military units which are built both to protect one's own network and also to attack opponent networks and sometimes even sieze them.

What makes this game significantly different to many other war games is that it concentrates upon maintaining a supply line at all times. Units that are cut off from headquarters ('the fortress') are disabled and destroyed.

The game ends when a player resigns or cannot pay off their debt at the beginning of a round - the remaining players are ranked based upon the size of their territory.

Similar to crayon-based games, Supply Line uses whiteboard markers to represent the network growth.

Each game starts with players concurrently developing their home area - this is quite fast, and takes about 30 minutes. Once basic networks have been developed, the game moves into turn-based rounds which concentrate on expansion, defence, and attack.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Line Drawing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pon Bola
description:
Pon Bola is a skill game for 2 to 4 players. You need nerves of steel, maximum concentration and a quiet hand.

How to play: The 16 small balls are placed in the tray of the base, dividing four balls for each player (8 if only two players). Each player either picks up his stick and tosses it into a small ball, then attempts to deposit it in the "nest" of the six large balls suspended in the air, ensuring that it does not open and drop them.

Two-player teams will be formed. Win the first team to get seven of their eight balls in the "nest".

name: Propeller frei! Das fesselnde Luftkampfspiel
description:
Each player has 10 playing pieces: 4 combat aircraft, 3 strategic bombers, 3 anti-aircraft artillery (Flak). The combat aircraft moves 4 spaces along straigt or curved lines the Bombers moves 3 spaces. The Flak moves 2 spaces only along straight lines. Only the planes are allowed to move over friendly playing pieces. Movement is permitted in all directions. Directions can be changed in mid-movement.

Enemy pieces are destroyed by moving onto spaces from where they can be hit by weapons fire. Firing range is the same as moving range. So an enemy plane is hit, if the attacker could reach the targets space in the next turn.

To win the game, a player has to move 3 of his pieces into the enemy base (Fliegerhorst) or destroy all enemy pieces.

The box cover shows a biplane with a swastika; but the use of biplanes suggest that there may be an earlier version, perhaps from World War I. The second biplane shows either a neutral or a british roundel.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Ooops!
description:
The Fun Family Race Game!

In Ooops!, players attempt to move their pawns from Start to Home in this Pachisi / Sorry! type game. Movement is determined by turning over a card from the draw pile, then following the instructions shown on the card.

Some of the main differences between Ooops! and Sorry! are:

Ooops! cards: Take one pawn from start and switch places with an opponent, bumping them back to their start OR move one pawn forward four spaces.
The "11" card: Move one pawn forward 11 spaces or switch places with any opponent.


Aside from those differences, gameplay nearly exactly the same.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Lion Guard: Gut gebrüllt, Kion!
description:
From the publisher:

An exciting race with the heroes from the TV series "The Guard of the Lions".

The little lion Kion is leader of the "Guard the Lion", they protect the sacred land. From his vantage point on the King's Rock, Kion discovers some wandering hyenas, which always cause trouble. With loud roar, he calls his friends for help! Who will win the exciting race and be the first at Kion?

name: Sexy Rendez vous
description:
"The Sex Romance Game for Two"

GAME RULES:
Shuffle the deck of 10 cards and place them face down. Players take turns rolling the die, moving around the board and carrying out actions based on the spaces he or she lands on.

To win you just have to reach the last spot: "The Sexy Rendez vous" first!

The game includes a 6 3/4 in. x 9 1/2 in. gameboard, 10 Rendez vous scenario cards, 2 game markers, a die, and easy-to-follow instructions.

name: Cunning Linguistics
description:
The party game where you kumquat, pussywillow, and shuttlecock your way to victory!

We ask you a question and give you a bunch of hand-selected amusing words, and you come up with a unique, hilarious, or sometimes ridiculous answer.

Everyone selects 9 cards, each with 5 words, made up of nouns, verbs, adjectives, etc. Each player also has a "free words" card, which includes connecting words to help players come up with their answers.

The reader, who changes each round, reads a topic card aloud. All players (including the reader) the cards in front of them (maximum one word per card with the exception of the free words, which are unlimited) to come up with an answer. The responses are written down and handed to the reader, who reads all answers aloud. Everyone votes on their favorite, and each vote counts for one point. The winner is the player who earns the number of points required to win (this differs based on the number of players).

You'll be amazed at what your friends come up with!

name: Magische Geschichten Würfel Piraten
description:
Roll all eight dice or roll them one at a time. Weave your pirate story together using the figures on each die. If you roll the red superpower symbol, you may add a special ability to your character.

Each player can tell a story just for fun, or take turns telling a story from the same dice, and vote for the best-told story. The game is designed primarily for language-learners.

Excitement, adventure and super powers: these dice bring fun into every story! Let them inspire you on a daring pirate adventure story. And with some luck, the dice even give your hero super powers!

There are no limits to your imagination ...

~~~~~

Spannung, Abenteuer und Super-Kräfte: Diese Würfel bringen Pepp in jede Geschichte! Lass dich von ihnen zu einer verwegenen Piraten-Abenteuer-Geschichte inspirieren. Und mit etwas Glück verleihen die Würfel deinem Helden sogar Super-Kräfte!

Deiner Phantasie sind keine Grenzen gesetzt ...
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Party Game, Pirates
publishers: Laurence King Publishing Ltd, moses. Verlag GmbH

name: Exposed: The Anti-Bullying Game
description: The card deck consists of 52 multiple-choice trivia cards and 52 bully or target cards. In rummy fashion, players draw from the deck and try to meld sets of three bully or target cards in which all the cards of a set are the same or all are different. If a trivia card is drawn, eg, "School bullies often target which type of Kids," a player may earn chips for a correct answer. Melds also grant chips, as does emptying your hand. The person with the most chips when someone empties his hand is the winner.

name: Monopoly: Alice in Wonderland Collector's Edition
description: This game is a version of Monopoly with the theme from the 2010 movie version of Alice in Wonderland directed by Tim Burton. This has different pieces with figures from the film, and the board has pictures from the movie. The box size is the same as most other collectable versions of Monopoly.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Nilgiris Biosphere: Spots & Stripes Edition Board Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Kaadoo: your nature safari on the go! Bring the charming, serene Nilgiris indoors!


Fun and educational wildlife safari board game for children and the whole family. Ideally suited for children aged 6 to 12 years
One-of-a-kind board game created by wildlife photographer and enthusiast Diinesh Kumble; approved and co-branded by the World Wildlife Fund [WWF] India
A game for everyone, offering hours of group play, driving through the jungle, discovering amazing wild beasts and facing the ups and downs of a safari
Offers quick set up and easy understanding for kids and yet involves strategic thinking on the use of cards to alter game status
Educates children on the flora and fauna and develops in them a taste for nature and wildlife
Makes a unique and outstanding gift

name: Grandma's Game of Useful Knowledge
description:
Players assume the role of Scholars and designate one participant to act as preceptor.
Scholars test their knowledge by answering questions posed on cards, and the preceptor confirms or corrects them after consulting companion book of answers.

name: Supérieur: Des Teufels Gebetbuch
description: In Supérieur: Des Teufels Gebetbuch, designed by author Markus Heitz, who wrote the mystery thriller Des Teufels Gebetbuch (The Devil's Prayer Book), players must adopt their best poker manner to play this bluffing game in which players have a and of only a single card. Each round, they must decide whether to leave, stay, or perhaps even raise the stakes. In the end, whoever has the highest card takes the pot — as long as they don't draw the card of death, which eliminates them from the round immediately.

name: Naturvetarna: Skogen
description:
The main title of the Naturvetarna series translates roughly to "those who know about nature", each individual entry covering a Swedish biome. For instance, the Skogen ("The Forest") box deals with species of plants, animals, mushrooms and lichen that can be found in various Swedish forests.

The game consists of a deck of 82 cards, with two cards to a species. One of these has an illustration on the front, the other a few sentences written in the first person listing characteristic traits or related facts; both have the name of the species on the back.

Several ways to use the cards are suggested, such as employing them in group exercises (e.g. sorting cards by categories or shared traits) or for a scoreless solo matching game. When played competitively, the rules suggest dividing an arbitrary number of participants (like a class of pupils) into two teams, potentially with a moderator (like a teacher) to read out clues from the text cards. The teams then try to collect pairs of cards either by identifying the species on a given picture card, gaining an additional point if they don't need any clues to do so, or by selecting the right picture card based on the clues from the corresponding text card.

In addition to Skogen, the series includes the entries Insjön (The Lake), Ängen (The Meadow), Havet (The Sea), Fjället (The Fell), and Staden (The City).

name: Who do you think you are?
description:
Prove your detective skills in this brain-teasing board game based on the BBC's hit show Who Do You Think You Are? Clues about celebrities’ family trees are hidden around the world. The first player to piece them together and uncover all of the ancestral secrets is crowned winner!

After hearing about the mysteries a celebrity wants to solve, move your aeroplane along the global flight paths. Every time you land, check the ancestry book for relevant clues. It’s your goal to combine information from several sources and use your powers of deduction to get the correct answers. With the roll of the dice you can even hide hints from the other players and get double clues to help you zoom ahead.

Whilst the celebrities are fictional, the history is accurate. Marvel at stories that are by turns funny, gruesome and exciting! Go back in time as you discover how our shared history has shaped the world.

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: What Are You Like?
description:
Who knows you better than your friends?

Let them answer questions about what you resemble and what's far from the truth. The players with the most popular answer gets to move forward. What are you like? is full of ridicoulus questions and funny content, perfect for any game night.

name: Who Nose?
description:
The hilarious race to guess your face! Players attach Face Cards to their nose and ask yes/no questions to try and figure out which Face Card they're wearing. Ask questions like, "Do I have a beard?" or "Am I an animal?" and get yes answers to avoid the Honker! The first player to correctly guess three Face Cards wins.

The Chimp Face Card. A chimp isn't a man. It isn't a woman. And it's not on the paddles! But if you guess it right, it gets shuffled back into the Face Card pile and you get nothing - except some laughs. Oooh that silly little chimp!

name: Festival Board Game
description:
Play in Teams, minimum 4 players travel around a festival site obtaining Back stage passes for different stages by following prompt cards, involving; dancing, music, singing/poetry/rap, improvisation... having a laugh.
Collecting camping supplies,minature bottles and meeting people, which all carry points...which are added up at the end of the game.
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Singing, Storytelling

name: Box Quiz: København
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Copenhagen'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about Copenhagen. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: Gravity Stones
description:
Day 1: It has been confirmed that what is now called "gravity stones" arose last night. Crystalline rock formations levitate in mid-air, resulting in a great decrease in the gravity around them.The potential benefits are enormous and the seven days we have to study them won't be wasted, be sure of it.

Gravity Stones is a development and optimization game with multiple choices in a brief playing time. The game plays over the course of seven rounds. Each round, a simultaneous first phase allows the players to play cards from their hand on the action side or on the resource side, also discarding one of them onto the central (company)

The second phase is individual, and starts with the first player, who uses their actions and resources (if needed) to establish a camp on the mountain, to study the stones, or to construct ZeroG tools from them. Once your actions are spent, you can either recover one of the cards left by the players or leave them; you will be punished or rewarded based on your choice.

With its intertwined actions and grant system, Gravity Stones allows you to augment your base actions with the stones you get back from the central board. The company that's hired you will also give you objectives to fulfill...or not.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Räkna riddare
description:
This very simple subtraction math game is called Räkna riddare ("Count Knights") on the box and "Minusleken" ("The Minus Game") in the rules.

Players are dealt a number of cards which come in two types, subtraction questions (e.g. "9-2" or "6-4") and results numbered 0-8. One player states a question from one of their cards, and the other players should call out the correct answer providing they hold a corresponding card. The rules contradict themselves on the subject of drawing cards and hand sizes, but basically you keep matching pairs and drawing. The rules are also inconsistent between languages when to end the game: either when all cards have been drawn, or until no more matches can be made between hands. At this point matching pairs in hand are added to pairs taken during play and the player with the most pairs wins.

—user summary

name: Supervillain
description:
Supervillain is a card & dice game where players, branded Villains by the corrupted Establishment, compete to expose the perverting influences on our institutions and governments; its up to YOU to expose the corruption!

Using Characters and Items to claim Capers, Villains put a spotlight on corruption - spreading information like modern-day Robin Hoods.

The Villain who Claims the most Caper points is crowned the Supervillain!

Compete to solve Capers and interfere with other Villains' plans using Shenanigans cards. Combat can ensue, as the Villain to your left may block your attempted Caper.

Villains play Character & Item cards with values that represent the number of dice they roll to solve that portion of the Caper; the Villain to your left rolls the number of dice on the Caper to "set the point" to match or beat.

Game length is adjustable depending on how many Capers players agree to play for at the beginning of the game, usually from 30-60 minutes. Solo play time is typically 20-30 minutes.

Each game comes with 54 high-quality, non-toxic cards made in the USA (8 Chessex dice - from the UK - included).

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Educational, Political, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Gone in 61 Seconds
description:
You've been boosting cars ever since you were a little kid. It was the "family business," so to speak. So, when you and your cronies stumble across a parking lot full of luxury, heavily modified rally cars, there is no freaking way you can pass up such a tasty cherry just waiting to be plucked. But, to steal them all, and not end up doing a nickel in the big house, you know you must be... gone in 61 seconds.

How To Play
Shuffle and arrange the "Car" and "Security Guard" cards in a 4x8 grid, face up on the playing surface. This is the "Parking Lot." Security Guards face the most expensive car between those in front of and behind it. Place the rest of the deck face down. The player to the left of the dealer has first turn.

For each turn a player draws 1 card and replaces a card in the Parking Lot with it, keeping the card removed. "Forward" cards replace any unblocked card to steal it by driving it away in forward gear. "Reverse" cards allow the opposite action. "Plus" cards steal a car in either direction and give the player an extra turn. Blank cards cover Security Guards to remove them. If a card can't be played, place it at the bottom of the deck and skip the turn. A turn ends when the drawn card is played.

A car cannot be stolen if another car or Security Guard is blocking the path out of the lot, or if the guard's flashlight is pointed directly at it. The game ends when all cards have been stolen.

The player who has stolen the greatest value of cars after all have been boosted, wins!
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Skralde-elgen Elvin
description: A game about moving through the forest collecting trash. Roll-and-move.

name: Dark Legacy: The Rising – Darkness vs Divine
description:
Welcome to world of Dark Legacy. A world ruled by the ruthless battle mage by the name of the Kaiser. The planet of Titan is at war. The Kaiser is bringing the world to its knees. This is a war where anything is possible and anyone can become a legend. It is here where your journey begins.

Dark Legacy is a unique strategy game that mixes the best elements of campaign-style adventure games and tactical customizable card games and wraps them all up into an in-depth sci-fi/fantasy story. In Dark Legacy, players are no longer bystanders of the battle, they get to be part of it as a war general within one of six different factions. With the unique and various weapons, armor, and relics, that a player can equip themselves with, players can become whomever they imagine themselves to be.

In Dark Legacy, it is the players objective to destroy their opponents and their armies, by building a deck of magic spells that no one can withstand, rolling the d20 in their favor and strategically summoning their army to be the strongest. Just like in a real battle you will have to anticipate the probability of the unexpected. Don't make choices too hastily for they may be the demise of your army and yourself.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Nils Karlsson Pyssling
description:
Children's game based on a 1990 film which in turn is based on Astrid Lindgren's story about Bertil, a boy who befriends Nils, a diminutive person living in a rat's nest under the floor (the previous rat occupant being Nils's landlady and the antagonist of the film).

In the game, players take on the role of different instances of Bertil, tasked with collecting doll's house furniture, scraps of food, and matches for firewood in order to furnish Nils's home. This is done by rolling dice or turning over tiles. Hazards include the rat appearing to collect rent (in food), and the neighbour distracting Bertil with games of Pachisi.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Politician
description:
Experience the no holds barred world of power politics as you wheel and deal your way to the top. Scandal, blackmail, crisis and leadership contests. These and other political pitfalls and opportunities are encountered as the game develops to challenge players wit and skill.

Play the political cards you acquire. Run with your luck to race through the board to No 10. Alternatively lay in wait and use your cards to defeat opponents before stealing to No 10 - if you can. The choice of strategy is yours when you play this exciting game of political ambition and intrigue.

From the back of the box

name: So Ded
description:
So Ded is a fast-paced game of survival for 5-24* players (2-4 player rules available), ages 12+, with a 30 minutes playtime

The world has ended by gene slicing bees with humans!! Or maybe it's zombies or something else! On top of that, everyone left alive is out to get you. With random maps, weapons, armor, supplies and other unique gear, you will collect as much loot as you can while fighting anyone that gets in your way! You start with a few knives, leather vests, supplies and ability to Hide. You gain more powerful equipment by visiting locations but you can also get loot from any opponent's deck when you defeat them

Everyone selects (or chooses randomly) a character to play. There is the Truck Driver, Clown, Hoarder, Surgeon, Cat Lover, etc.. each character has their own unique abilities. The game is broken down into 3 phases: Move, Battle/Loot, Apocalypse/Refresh. BE WARNED: People will be eliminated at a fast pace! Only one will survive. So if you pull out a victory in this game, you should be praised in all of it's glory as it will be rare indeed
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: The Follyfoot Save a Pony Game
description: A roll and move game based on the Follyfoot TV series and licensed to Whitman publishing by ITV. Players circuit a board making payments and occassionally compete in the gymkana subgame in the centre of the board.
categories: Animals, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Catch It!
description:
In Catch It!, each player has a basket on their head, and to start the game the two players throw the twenty balls in the air, trying to catch as many white balls as possible. As the balls land, both players try to grab them, throwing the white balls (underhanded) into their own basket and the red balls (again, underhanded) in their opponent's basket. Feel free to dodge those unwanted balls! Once all the balls have placed in the nets, or the players collapse from exhaustion, players tally their scores — number of white balls minus number of red — to see who wins.

With more than two players, each pairing of players competes once to see who wins the most rounds.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game
